A bit disappointed that the USB connection requires tipping a wall-mounted TV out on its mount "kickstands" to plug-in a flash drive. Still...it's a gorgeous beast and I've had it and used it long enough to recommend it completely and still give it 5-stars.

Reviews.Title: Easy as pie!
Reviews.Author: Christopher Kuhn "Christopher Kuhn"
Reviews.Content: If you want the short version skip the first paragraph.Ok so many of the previous reviews already say tons of great things, but i do have one personal thing to add. I like to do a lot of research before i give 1k away and that is exactly what i did. I actually purchased a DLP rear projection tv and then a plasma and another plasma to replace an old dying Panasonic 42in plasma from there S class. I must say when i received this tv i was shocked and aweeeeeed! It took me and my wife to carefully get it out of the box. After the unboxing i screwed in the pedestal and set it were my 42 was and i realized i needed to make room..... shortly after i had it set up i turned it on and not expecting much was completely blown away by the quality of the picture. Oh My GOSH it looks great.-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Video 9 (for experts that are videophiles 8) out of 10.This is because i am using a PS3 and a HTPC with blu ray drive to test and some Mkv files. It just looks so vibrant and for the average user will be the best thing since sliced bread!Audio 10 of 10.I was really surprised by how great it sounds outside of my 1500 watt 7.1 surround sound. I use my surround sound to watch everything and swear by it... even the news!!! i have 7.1, Now sometimes i actually switch it to the tv to save electricity and am happy it sounds so great.Brand/Company 9 of 10. I did have one issue, the remote did not work at all upon receipt!! i called vizio and was promptly asked to run some tests and after 15 mins of annoying power cycles was instructed a new remote was on the way! received it and it works perfect.Overall 9 of 10. Taking a move from a huge company like Panasonic was a big step for me, i have always stuck with the big guys when it comes to spending alot of money. I am really glad i stepped out of my comfort zone and gave it a shot. I am thoroughly pleased and will report back if i have any more to say.Thanks for reading.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding!
Reviews.Author: Bargain Hunter
Reviews.Content: I've read a lot of reviews before deciding on this HDTV.This HDTV offers a superb value for anyone looking for a Smart TV that has solid picture quality for 299.00.There are a lot of 32 inch TVs with neither.I included a review from David Katzmaier Senior Editor from CNET that has reviewed this TV.Type CNET and enter E320i-A0 in the search bar and enjoy the review[...] and I included more information from VIZIO. Type VIZIO and enter  E320i-A0 in the search bar and enjoy[...]. Even though it's a 32 inch TV you'll get a lot more screen real estate than you realize.Personally anyone can spend more,but why.I wasn't looking for a 1080P 3DTV and at 299.00 I am able to afford it.

Reviews.Title: Vizio 60" Razor LED HDTV - Great Buy!
Reviews.Author: DWatkins
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV from Sam's club for slightly less than what it is listed for on Amazon.  The biggest headache with this TV was installing the wall mount to my wall (which has nothing to do with the TV).  I was pleased to find that the screws to install the wall mount were already included with the TV, since the TV is really thin in profile.  They worked perfect.  So far, this TV is awesome!  There was a little worry, at first, when I initially connected my cable box as I could only get 720p resolution.  I was not pleased with the picture.  Very disappointed, in fact.  Then, I did some research and got my settings to send 1080i HD from my box... TA-DA!  Picture is great!  It was easy to get the wifi connected in the guide setup.  Started using Netflix, YouTube, etc. immediately.  The picture is even better when watching videos from the net apps.... YES, even better!  I was stunned by the clarity of the app videos, and how well it streams media.  I did have to change the smoothing to Medium, as Harry Potter Deathly Hallows looked like a dark soap opera. That was the only setting that I needed to change from factory.  And the sound (w/o) external theatre sound was satisfactory.  I watched a TNF game and I had to turn around and look behind me as the built-in surround made the announcer in the stadium sound as if he were behind me (across the room from the TV).  The apps are intuitive and easy to use.  The remote control is great... the full qwerty keyboard on the reverse side saves you from pointing to letters and clicking on each one. The ability to type in your email, search term, etc. removes any annoyances from the experience.  Lastly, for the price, you cannot find a better LED TV this size.  So far, I am beyond pleased with my purchase.  I can only imagine when I connect the external sound system to it.  I am recommending this TV for ANYONE looking to purchase a TV.  Right now, it is THE best bang for the buck.  You absolutely WILL enjoy this entertainment experience.

Reviews.Title: Smart TV focusing on Internet Apps and external videos
Reviews.Author: Jen H.
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this TV to anyone looking for a smart TV on a budget. We don't currently have cable so we purchased it mostly for its internet apps. They work very well. The biggest downfall using the apps is the TV remote. Since it is not a full QWERTY keyboard, typing in what you would like to watch can be annoying. We use the YouTube app a lot but searching can be a pain without the full keyboard. Luckily, we downloaded the YouTube remote controller app and are able to set up playlists from our phone once we have the YouTube app up and running on our TV. Great solution! We also use the Netflix app and have had some problems with it. Every once in a while the show we are watching freezes up and then after a few seconds our TV turns itself off. We think it is just the NetFlix app itself because we haven't encountered this problem when watching it through our Wii or Xbox. Other than those few problems the apps work fast and well. I will be looking into getting Amazon Prime soon so I am able to access their streaming videos as well. We have also tried using a USB drive to load movies and shows onto our screen as well. Tips for anyone doing this, the video files that this TV can read are avi. and mp4. You need to have the TV turned off when plugging in your USB drive in order for the TV to recognize the device, as well as turning it off before removing it. Plays videos well; we ended up purchasing a USB drive specifically for watching videos and movies on the TV. This TV does not recognize large external hard drives. We tried using our 1.5 TB hard drive but it was not registering on our TV.The picture quality is great, no complaints at all. I particularly love how thin the frame of the TV is around the screen; it gives you the most screen space possible. It is a bit bulkier in the back, not super thin as some TV's but it doesn't make a difference to me since no one is going to be looking at it from behind. All the hook ups are on the back and can be easily concealed. Power button, volume buttons and all other TV control buttons can be found on the left side of the TV. It took no time to install and set up our TV and it looks great! This TV really packs a punch with all it has to offer for it's price. We've had our TV now for 2 months with little to no complaints and love it. Many other smart TVs go for hundreds more and this one has it all for a much smaller price.  I love Visio products and would definitely purchase from them again.

Reviews.Title: Blown away !
Reviews.Author: Prabir Das "PD"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV after extensive research from Costco during the Black Friday sale and was initially a little skeptical about buying a Vizio. I have always been a Panasonic fan - have 3 plasmas that have great picture and have served me well over the years. The Vizio is the most affordable among the 70 inchers and when I compared the Sharp that happened to be right next to it at Costco, I did not see any noticeable difference. Bought the Vizio and could not be happier. I have been reading reviews and realize that folks have complained about lip-sync issues and washed out picture which probably means there are some quality issues. I bought the extended warranty from Costco just to be sure. But I must say, after calibrating it and playing with the settings, I am blown away. For $1500, you cannot beat it. I have a PS3 for my blu-rays and DVDs and Dish Network and have not found any faults with PQ. Believe me, I have looked hard and long and could not find anything to complain about. If you don't want to spend 2 grand or more on a 70 inch and still want great quality, this is the TV for you.

Reviews.Title: New tv for the holidays - great set, especially for the price.
Reviews.Author: Alex Chanfeld
Reviews.Content: These are first day impressions. Haven't spent too much time with this set. I was upgrading from a 6 year old 42" Hitachi Plasma set. The Hitatchi still looked pretty great, but I've been convinced for months, obsessing over waiting for the right deal. I was sure that I needed an LG or a Samsung; the two top dogs (imo) with a great selection of mid-high range sets within my budget ($1500) There were plenty of similar prices for quality sets; anything 55" + TV set within the last year, some nice frills to boot was on the table.The timing of this set's release was just too perfect. I wasn't even considering a vizio, but all the sets by Samsung and LG are already 6+months behind). And Vizio deserves credit for really stepping it up. I saw the review on cnet and gizmodo and was quickly sold. It looks and feels like a spiffy new high-end television. Also going from 42" to 60" is more impressive than it may sound. The set itself also damn thin and not too heavy. Especially compared to the smaller hitachi.It's worth repeating, I had a negative connotation with Vizio as low end, bargain TV's from walmart. But I'm truly impressed with the feature set.... loads of inputs, wi-fi capabilities, netflix and amazon prime apps  (total snap to set it all up)... i'm still discovering more eatures as I play with it. As soon as I threw the set on I fired up the on the Step Brothers blu-ray it was noticably crisper than my old 1080i set.Now I have some minor nitpicking to do. Not dealbreakers, but just thoughts. For one, he stand does not swivel. My Hitachi had this swiveling stand, and it was a great feature depending on how many people were viewing. Also I hate the smooth motion settings. It just looks strange to me, like everything turns into a daytime soap. Thankfully I can turn it off. I can see it being nice for sports games, but movies and most tv shows throw me off with the movement. My buddy was saying he likes it better, so I guess that's gonna be a personal thing. I keep it set off. Also, the remote is not backlit. For all those buttons on there, it would have been great to make it easy on the eyes when all the lights are out.Menus themselves are rather deep with settings and features, yet intuitive to get to the simple stuff. I love that you can browse amazon prime on the sidebar without entering an app. This means whatever else you're watching changes aspect ratio and continutes to play, while you freely browse new content. I was a little overwhelmed with the amount of features and settings, but it's not difficult to change some basic picture settings and keep it simple.There's no other set at this price point, this solid, this new and with so many features. It's worth looking at, and I predict it will be a big seller in the holidays.I'll update my review again as I play around more. Still figuring stuff out.I can't believe I spent over $2300 on a 42" plasma and only 5-6 years later, sets like these are not only better but like half price. Also i was jazzed this tv was 30% under my budget. This set is a steal for $1000. Great timing Vizio.***updates***one week later - still happy as can be. no buyers remorse. several friends are considering purchasing the same exact set. i am convinced this product will keep me happy years down the road.some questions to other ppl who bought this set (sound off in the comments) : - any thoughts on using a soundbar? gizmodo [...] just ran an article on top four under $300 and the top choice was a vizio soundbar for $225... worth it? speakers are pretty good as is, just want psuedo surround... i still have a sony receiver and 5 pc speaker with 5.1 dolby setup but honestly it's just a little cumbersome these days.- any previous vizio owners; do they update the built in apps often? would love to have HBO Go on here ;)- what defines HD on the netflix streaming? this might just be off topic, as it's probably relative to the netflix app more than the set... it looks pretty good, but i definitely see some rough pixels here and there. pressing info just says "XHD"- is there a way to lock the settings? my son keeps on turning real motion to mess with me and it's the worst.

Reviews.Title: Broke in less than a week!
Reviews.Author: Jorge Carral
Reviews.Content: Watch out with this TV, you can see from other reviews that some of these just black out. Mine lasted 6 days. I have now been waiting for 4 weeks for the replacement

Reviews.Title: Must have for the Bedroom
Reviews.Author: Poppa
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for our bedroom with a wall mount.  I mounted this about 2 inches down from the ceiling, which gives it about 6' 4" of clearance under it on a standard 7' 10" ceiling hight.... perfect as the tallest person is me at 6'.... put a downward angle on the screen.  Perfect for watch late night in bed.  The TV has are great picture, remember on a smaller TV 720p is just great, anything more and you're waisting your money.  The 60Hz refresh rate is also fine on a smaller TV.  The benifit of this TV, which is hard to find in this size, is its fully WiFi enabled with all of the apps that are good for me (Netflix, Amazon Prime Streaming, Vudu and Hulu Plus...... there are 24 pages of internet programming that can be installed.  The only two that I use that are lacking are HBO to Go and Starz to Go.... This is a really nice purchase for the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: Have Received 2 and sent both back within the first day of use
Reviews.Author: Lynne
Reviews.Content: I have had a horrible time with this TV. My first one came to me, the first time plugging it in, the screen was cracked internally and wouldn't show anything. Okay, not such a big deal, definitely a fluke. So I call and order a new one. The new one come, turns on, no problem. I am watching the TV a total of maybe 3 hours, and the screen goes completely black and will show nothing or no sound. I have to send this one back as well, and now amazon is telling me they can return it, but I can't get another TV. On top of all of those issues, I was talked very rudely too by the customer service manager, where he actually yelled at me. And then proceeded to be very rude and sarcastic with me. I am not very pleased with this purchase nor amazon customer service.

Reviews.Title: First Experience Review
Reviews.Author: B. Marshall "Bronco Fan"
Reviews.Content: Just got this baby less than 24 hours ago.  So this review covers initial impressions, ease of setup, etc.OK, I use this for a bedroom TV, using OTA (over the air) tv signal.  I also have the VIA (Vizio Internet Apps) functioning via WIFI.Packaging - box weighs about 15 lb, so this is light weight.  This can be good or bad, we will see.  Being light weight helps ensure safe shipping, so that is good.  Arrived from Amazon, via UPS, in good shape.Open to watching TV was probably 45 minutes - this included changing antennas (requiring 2 scans).  I pulled off foam blocks, removed from plastic bag, located the base and attaching screw.  The base is held on with a single screw, Allen wrench included.  Easy peasy.  Set on stand, attach power cord, put batteries in remote, connect antenna.On power up, asks for either home use, or store demo, what type of signal (cable or antenna), and then scans for channels.  The bedroom is on the second floor, and the antenna is a Mohu Leaf - so I was able to pull in plenty of stations, with very good signal quality.Next I setup Netflix, and Amazon Prime - this probably takes 15 minutes for both.  Typing in the passwords with the remote is tedious, but that is the same with all remotes, and long passwords.Initial impression of picture/sound quality - this is a 720p TV, so that considered, very good.  sound is fine, and allows external speakers.Price is very good, and overall value is high.  Vizio makes a great consumer level product, and this is no exception.I generally only give 5 stars to truly outstanding products, so you may find my 4 star rating a bit low.  Easy to recommend, especially given the price.

Reviews.Title: GREAT IN EVERY WAY !!
Reviews.Author: Monu
Reviews.Content: In general - if you want quality - you usually don't get it cheap. But with VIZIO - specially with this specific model - it's great in every way, and still priced REALLY LOW - specially considering all the features included!I have always bought higher end TVs - by Samsung & Sony. They do deliver quality - but their prices are also on the much higher side. I needed to buy another TV - for my basement den/office. I did not want to spend much - as my primary TVs were in the living room & bedroom - both LEDs - one by Sony, one by Samsung. After checking out a lot of reviews - and even going to Wallmart / Bestbuy etc to actually watch this VIZIO playing side by side with other TVs, I decided to go for this TV.Well, to keep it short, this TV has EVERYTHING :- Superb Picture Quality.- Really pure Whites : Almost none of the low/medium price TVs are able to deliver proper whites. But this one produces really accurate whites.- Really deep blacks. OK - perhaps not AS deep as those high end LEDs with local dimming, but no casual viewer can tell the difference. I actually do look very carefully - but even I will not be able to casually notice the difference. Infact, when blacks are REALLY deep - there is a problem too - details in the dark areas of the picture are rendered completely black too - destroying picture details ....so I actually prefer a level of darkness not intensely black.- SMART TV Options : It has them all ! ....Netflix, Youtube, Amazon Prime, etc etc. The SMART OPTIONs INTERFACE is slightly slow to maneuver, but once the videos are started - they play flawlessly. Connecting to my wireless network was easy.- REMOTE : Well, if you are going to be extensively using the smart feature - for using with Youtube / Netflix etc - you may want to buy a remote which comes with a QWERTY keyboard on the reverse side. These are available really cheap - on Amazon or eBay. I bought a used one for just over $10 - and it works perfectly. The remote included has everything - but lacks the QWERTY keyboard.- SOUND : Sound is good - loud & clear - vocals are clearly heard. However, if you are seriously into great sound quality - you may want to buy & connect an additional sound-bar, or an external sound system.I set the picture to VIVID - with GAME MODE enabled. That got me the best picture quality as per my taste. You will have to play around with the settings for a while to get the right picture quality. Out-of-the-box settings are not optimum.120Hz is claimed - though it is not a true 120hz. I have SAMSUNG'S high end 120hz TV - and though there is a little difference in very fast motion - but you have to actually look for it to notice it.Overall - for approx $400 (including shipping!) - this is a SUPERB DEAL & a SUPERB TV ! Specially as your secondary TV, or TV for the kid's room.

Reviews.Title: HDMI ports do not work on two different TVS
Reviews.Author: C. Smith
Reviews.Content: On the  first TV i recieved, neither HDMI 1 or HDMI 2 would work correctly (no picture and/or no sound).  We decided this was okay and just used HDMI 3 and 4 for our cable box and playstation.  However, on these ports it would frequently loose signal for a couple of seconds at a time.  Okay, called amazon and they were very helpful in returning that TV and sending a new one next day air.  Set up the second one and bought new HDMI cables just to be sure, but it is giving us the exact same problem!  Unfortunately, we will have to return this unit as well.  I will not be buying anymore Vizio products as after much research online I am finding that this HDMI problem is very common in their sets.

Reviews.Title: Really nice for a small set
Reviews.Author: Helen Scott
Reviews.Content: The picture is amazing, it's lightweight and narrow, and having the Smart Apps (Hulu, Netflix, and Amazon are my favorites) make me feel like I have finally caught up to the future in terms of technology. It's like having a Roku Player built right into the set!This TV is a great price for what you get. I'm saving up to buy a larger one of the same brand for my livingroom.

Reviews.Title: Sound problem
Reviews.Author: David Coleman
Reviews.Content: Picture was okay, however it is nothing compared to the Panasonic Viera. The sound volume would go up and down, apparently a common problem, which requires you to disable an advertised feature to fix it. Good LED TV for the price, but for a little more ($100) I found the panasonic viera 55" a much better television with a picture quality that is unmatched by vizio

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Picture!
Reviews.Author: R53
Reviews.Content: The quality of the picture can't be beat at this price or several hundred dollars more.The apps are great and the config was very easy.These are the picture settings I used.Before you can adjust the "Backlight" setting go to*Advanced Picture submenu* and turn off "Ambient light sensor"*Picture settings menu*Picture Mode: MovieBacklight: 85 - Before you can adjust this setting go to *Advanced Picture submenu* and turn off "Ambient light sensor"Brightness: 43Contrast: 50Color: 55Tint: 0Sharpness: 6*Color Temperature submenu*Color temperature: CustomRed Gain: 45Green Gain: 48Blue gain: 50Red offset: 49Green offset: 48Blue offset: 50*Advanced Picture submenu*Noise Reduction: OffMPEG NR: OffColor Enhancement: OffAdaptive Luma: MediumFilm Mode: AutoSmart Dimming: OnAmbient Light sensor: Off

Reviews.Title: I love this TV
Reviews.Author: Pamela Johnson
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for a month.  Here's why I love this TV.  It is the lowest priced smart tv.  It offers a lot of bang for your buck. I can download movies from Amazon Prime for free as a prime member and also can watch You Tube videos or Netflix and there are several other Apps.  My husband and I were having a hard time finding something to watch on TV before even though we subscribe to ATT Uverse 300 but now since we both like movies our choices are much less limited.  The picture quality ot the TV is good.  It was really easy to set up even by an older person like me who is not that tech savvy.

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a great price
Reviews.Author: David J. Roberts "Doc"
Reviews.Content: The price and features can't be beat. I have a 60" Sony in the living room but the Vizio matches it for color, sound (with the Vizio 5.1 Soundbar), and performance.

Reviews.Title: Wow!
Reviews.Author: workwiser
Reviews.Content: We've had a 50 inch Vizio Plasma for 6 years and have finally decided to upgrade. When we saw this TV on sale, it was the perfect opportunity. Everything about this TV is BIG (in a good way). When we tried to load the TV, there was a brief moment where I thought the TV might not fit our mini-van. But it fit perfectly (barely) lying flat down. Also, considering the TV is 70 inches, it's not as heavy as it could have been. It does weigh in at about 80 some pounds. It was actually lighter than my 50 inch plasma TV. Once the TV was set up, the first thing that everyone says is "Wow, it's big!". The picture quality itself is excellent with good contrast. The Smooth Motion feature does make the picture have a "soap opera look". However, if you turn that feature off, the picture looks very good. The wi-fi feature was also good. At first, my wi-fi signal was not strong enough so the apps were slow. But I purchased a Netgear range extender and now reception is excellent. The apps all run fast and streaming video is very good. The only downside I see is there's no web browser. But overall, excellent TV given the price, size, picture quality, and wi-fi feature. Would highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Best Value in a Big Screen TV
Reviews.Author: Ronald H. Lickson "megafrog"
Reviews.Content: First of all, I have to give kudos to the "white glove" delivery team for being on time and for carrying my new big screen upstairs, then unpacking, installing and testing its basic operation, and for taking my old tv to my garage.  Great service.  The Vizio has a very, very good picture even before tweaking.  I have seen no picture defects of any kind.  I only had to tweak the backlight, contrast, etc. to my liking.  I have ordered a set of Logitech Z-623 2.1 speakers to enhance regular operation, as my wife doesn't turn the Sony home theater receiver on except for DVD movies.  I can highly recommend the Logitech speaker system as I have the same model installed on my new Sony KDL55HX850 that I got from Sony to replace my old defective SXRD tv.  The picture is better on the Sony, but that model retails for about $2000 and is only 55" in size.  The Vizio is far larger and produces an amazing picture at a lower price.  All in all, I am very happy with my purchase and would recommend this Vizio big screen to anyone who wants a larger screen tv that can produce a great picture on all types of video, including movies from DVD, sports programming, etc.  One last thought, if you live in earthquake territory as I do and you do not wall mount this tv, then you should tie down the set to ensure that it won't tip over in the next "big one"!  There are several screws on the back of the tv that can be used to secure the tv using wire or plumber's tape (used to secure water heaters).

Reviews.Title: VIZIO E500i-A1 50-inch 1080P 120Hz LED Smart HDTV
Reviews.Author: KhmerMike
Reviews.Content: Bought my VIZIO E500i-A1 50-inch 1080P 120Hz LED Smart HDTV from Amazon.This LCD panel is exceptional quality. The design is simple and stylish, the bevel makes it great for wall mounting. Not to thick so as to distract you from the display itself, and not so thin you can't distinguish the image from the wall.Price wise it was a bargain. For the settings, 1080P and 120Hz, its worth it.My only issues with this item was the remote and the streaming/load times for the Smart HDTV features. Out of the box there is an initial setup that requires your name, wireless router connection, password input. The remote was not designed for this at all. There's a pop up keyboard that you have to use the remote to navigate, not fun.As for the Smart HDTV features a little on the slow side. Not streaming wise, but loading wise. Example: You click on HuluPlus/Netflix, it asks you if you'd like to start the application, and then it takes 30-45 seconds to load, once in the actual application responses are slow, the icons for various shows take time to load up, moving to another category takes time. Don't even attempt to use a "Search" option with the stock remote (lol). Once you find the movie you want it's great! It streams wonderfully (depending on your internet speed), the time you spend to get to that movie, not so wonderful.Now mind you. If you're buying this TV. You're still getting a GREAT, and I'm not kidding when I say GREAT, HDTV. If you seem like the person who's going to definitely want to utilize Smart HDTV features on a regular basis, consider seeing the item first and testing it out.Just to give everyone a reference point of where I'm coming from, and why I'm so critical of the Smart HDTV features. I from the beginning was planning to connect this HDTV to my PC as a 5th monitor. It takes 30-45 seconds to load up the Smart HDTV applications, my PC takes 8-16 seconds to boot up.With that being said though as an additional monitor, this thing PERFORMS. It exceeded my expectations flawlessly. I literally watched. The Avengers, Iron Man, and Iron Man 2, and I couldn't ask for more. Connected to a cable box, a bluray device, or better yet a game console, I can only imagine.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value
Reviews.Author: John Hamlett
Reviews.Content: I ordered this HDTV through Amazon and it arrived several days before the posted delivery time.  The "white gloves" delivery service was excellent as well.Now, after 10 days of using the TV the only thing I can find to complain about is the physical size of the remote.  I'm an Olde Farte and have trouble seeing small print in dim light and using things with small keys.  The remote on this TV is one of the smallest I've ever seen and even has a full keyboard on the reverse side.  It is virtually impossible for me to read the labels over the buttons or use the keyboard but for younger users I don't think this would be a problem.Setup was a piece of cake and even network connections worked right out of the box.  I was able to connect and stream a Netflix movie and watched the entire thing without a single dropped frame or freeze.  I have 7mb DSL internet service.The picture is awesome.  Unfortunately, the Blu-ray player I ordered was caught up in Superstorm Sandy and hasn't yet arrived but HD picture quality over-the-air is almost 3D-like and does not fade or wash out in a bright room.A major surprise was the sound.  Most HDTV's seem to cheap out on the sound but this one seems much better than most.  I have it sitting on its stand on a wooden console and can hear the sound, crisp and clean, from 15 feet away.  I have the digital output connected to my A/V receiver but the additional sound quality comes mostly from the two woofers attached to that system.And that raises the only engineering complaint I have and would be true with the majority of HDTV's and that is the placement of the downward-facing connections.  The unit is so thin that connecting the optical output and HDMI inputs is difficult.  And seeing the various connections is almost impossible when the unit is placed on its stand.Overall I consider this unit an excellent value for the money (just under $1,000) and would recommend it highly.  My son was so impressed he ordered one for himself.

Reviews.Title: review of the 60"
Reviews.Author: matthew a reichert
Reviews.Content: Overall, you do get a lot for your dollar in this set. I chose the 60" size at a great price that beat competitors in the same segment. You get an unadorned relatively thin black bezel without the overuse of logos as you will find. The depth is pretty shallow. The HDMI inputs face down making wall mounting not a hassle. You're able to have the power LED indicator turn off while viewing so there's less distraction. Video games are very responsive to input with little to no lag (Playing Call of Duty: Ghosts currently on it). Picture quality is pretty good to the non-videophile (me) after some tweaking...especially the brightness levels which are initially blindingly bright. I do not regret my purchase.Now on to what most people reading these reviews is looking for: The negatives.panel uniformity is atrocious. This is to mean, on a black screen...the back-lit patches of light that will show through like dark grey splotches. This is something you won't notice unless you're watching a very dark movie/TV show. This varies from panel to panel, even among the same line of TV...I just happened to get what I got. At this price point, you will have some no matter what.The Apps are sorta hit or miss. Netflix works well enough and I have only encountered a few app freezes in a few months. Amazon GO app could use quite a bit of work as browsing movie titles is an exercise in reading very small print (App doesn't go fullscreen like Netflix). The other apps included are fluff for my uses. Could use a Spotify app like the Samsung units, and HBO GO! but that's nit picky.3-stars were given due to panel uniformity, medium picture quality, and Apps that work but aren't polished.I had to choose between screen size, price, and picture quality. I chose low price and large screen size and went with this unit and I do not regret my purchase. I have had 0 mechanical issues with this set.

Reviews.Title: Best Value TV Out There
Reviews.Author: conscientious consumer
Reviews.Content: I purchased the 47" model in March and I can honestly say I've been nothing but pleased with this TV. The Smart Apps work great and it makes watching Netflix, Hulu, and Youtube on your TV a great experience. My favorite feature of the TV is the slim frame design. I makes the TV look like it's a window that you're looking through. I haven't had any major issues with the sound or picture, as a matter of fact the sound is pretty good for stock factory speakers. The one minor issue I had was that the remote sometimes becomes unresponsive. I've had this problem twice in the last 5+ months and a simple restart of the TV corrected the problem right away. Another good experience from Vizio (I upgraded from an LCD model that's been in my family for over 6 years now and still going strong) and I would absolutely recommend this TV to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Good little TV
Reviews.Author: John T "John T"
Reviews.Content: This makes a great bedroom TV where I dont have cable. Its a 10lbs 29" TV with built-in WiFi and all the streaming services you could ask for. This is the best feature built TV money can buy IMHO. You can even put video files on USB flash drive and plug them into the USB in the back and it has a great media player. So far has played many different media types successfully for me.As others have mentioned, the size is a little odd when it comes to wall mounts. I bought a mount that was listed for 10"-24" TV's. As long as the mount is VESA 100x100 and under the specified weight limit then you're good. And since this TV is so light, it works just fine.

Reviews.Title: RAZOR ROCKS!!! Vizio  is great!
Reviews.Author: reed
Reviews.Content: I own a Panasonic plasma, Vizio LCD, & the new Vizio LED Razor. Wow the picture on the new Razor is totally color poping, the yellows are so brilliant! Smart TV is function to play with! And movies stream effortlessly! RAZOR IS THE BEST OF MY 3 TV'S! Best price anywhere, Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Defective product, search Google for "Vizio TV randomly reboots" before buying.
Reviews.Author: April
Reviews.Content: Not happy with this TV and not happy with Vizio. My mom bought this TV for us on August 31st. Approximately one month later, it would start to just randomly shut itself off then restart. I did some googling and discovered that this is a common issue for Vizio TVs. (We'll be sitting here watching Netflix or regular TV and all of a sudden the screen will go black then the "V" logo will appear and it will be on regular TV. It even logs me out of Netflix completely.) I tried unplugging the TV and holding down the power button and then plugging it into a different outlet. That didn't correct the problem. On October 26th, I sent an email to Vizio to request that they fix or replace the TV. They suggested doing the same thing I had already done (unplug, hold power button down, etc.). I tried that again and the TV went a whole 2 days without restarting.So I emailed them again on November 14th and they gave me a customer service number to call. I called that number today and the guy on the phone told me that it would take about 5-6 days to repair and they would send someone out. Then he realized that the TV would have to be sent in and was going to schedule that. So basically they wanted me to send in this defective TV and then sit here with no TV for the next two weeks while they fix it (one week for shipping back and forth, one week for repairs.) This isn't acceptable, especially for a product that apparently has this problem a lot and is clearly defective. It's a $250 TV. Shipping and repairing it would cost that much. I just want the stupid thing replaced. Why should we have to sit here and go two weeks without out when the problem is on their end? I can get my car repaired in less time than that.Bottom line: don't buy this as your main or only TV unless you're prepared to spend a couple of weeks without it so it can be repaired.

Reviews.Title: Pleasantly surprised at the capability.
Reviews.Author: Metaldoc
Reviews.Content: First experience with a 'smart' TV.  I don't have normal TV, either over the air, cable or dish.  I wanted something a little bigger tha a laptop to watch movies on and this fills the bill.  I use it mainly with Netflix but it can also be used for other internet applications like Facebook, eBay, news and weather, etc.  Set up was easy (or I couldn't have done it).  Picture is clear and bright and sound is more than adequate.  The only reason I gave it four stars instead of five is entering info with the remote is awkward and slow.  Otherwise it is a winner.

Reviews.Title: Can't go wrong with a Vizio!
Reviews.Author: MiniSugar
Reviews.Content: This is the 7th Vizio TV I have purchased in 4 years, and it is just as wonderful as all of the others. I will never purchase another brand of tvs. The picture is clear and crisp, and it connects to hulu, netflix, amazon, ect. like a dream :-)

Reviews.Title: apps for netflix, amazon prime, hulu+ work great!
Reviews.Author: exhausted_homeowner "exhausted_homeowner"
Reviews.Content: This is a great choice for an internet-ready TV -- the built in apps for Netflix, Amazon Prime Instant Video, Hulu+, and many other services work very well.  You can find older models from Vizio that offer the features and picture quality at a lower price, but those sets are very "sluggish" in running internet apps.  For example, launching Netflix on this set takes about 3 seconds, on the older line it takes about 30 seconds.

Reviews.Title: Solid TV, Great Value, Beautiful Picture... but NO Skype.
Reviews.Author: Just Living "Beau"
Reviews.Content: PROS:  -Overall, the TV is working very well. Beautiful picture, no on/off issues, no buzzing... looks great and has solid connectivity (I've tried wired/wireless and both work just as well- however wireless strength decreases quickly at longer range).  I agree that it's the best deal out there for a 60 inch right now.  I love how light weight it is, and the "razor thin" screen edge/back.  The inputs/outputs are very nice.  This TV even has analog audio output (and dedicated digital audio and pc audio), with variable/fixed settings for those with older A/V Rcvr or stereo setups, and you can choose stereo, Dolby 5.1, etc.  I haven't tested all the sound capability however, but obviously you won't get HDMI sound quality without a newer A/V Rcvr, etc.  Having 4 HDMI ports is really nice with this setup.  -The HD picture quality is directly related to your broadband quality- no surprise.  Using the on board wireless connection with Amazon streaming for example, I have 1.5 MB DSL coming in- and the movie plays in a narrower "widescreen" format because my broadband quality is not high enough for pure HD.  However, if I hook up my Roku, the Amazon video plays across the entire/full screen.  It's still not pure HD quality, but I like the larger picture. I also prefer the Roku format for movies, etc. It offers more functionality/choice.  The VIA apps on the Vizio are nice, don't get me wrong, I just prefer the Roku for movies/choice. I really like the Vizio VIA Accuweather app with weather radar view and a few others.  Until I purchased the TV I did not realize that most of the VIA apps are based on the Yahoo Connected TV platform.  Take a look at that if you're curious, seems like a good strategy for Yahoo- but we'll see how they do over time.  -I really like the ability to go through the VIA apps on the left side of the screen while still watching TV- makes it great for games, etc.  The picture quality is easily configurable, and I'm still tweaking-  overall very satisfied with the picture.  Some folks say that fast-action sports can blur- but it has not been noticeable for our family- picture, games, etc are just fine.  -DLNA:  I haven't used it yet, but Vizio says "Yes" it is there- once you make your computer available for DLNA, it will show up in the Media Player App. I have used the Media Player app for USB pictures and video- that's pretty nice!  - Picture/Screen in Bright Room:  One of my criteria was a bright picture based on lots of windows/sunlight, etc.  This picture does very well in a brightly lit room, and has a matt screen with low reflectivity.  Even at night, the screen doesn't reflect much ambient lighting.  - Gaming: Have connected Wii through Component video/rca audio and works fantastic. Must have the component cable for the Wii, for example: eForCity HDTV / EDTV High Definition 480p Component AV Cable for Nintendo Wii .  Be sure to change the Wii settings for screen resolution.CONS:  -Before purchasing this TV I spoke with Vizio and was told that "Yes, it has Skype" as the advertisements imply.  But after I got it home, I found there is no Skype VIA app.  After setting up the TV, I then contacted Vizio once again- and the rep tried to again tell me it was functional with Skype- all I had to do was purchase the Vizio Skype Cam.  I told the rep he was wrong...and asked him to contact Tech Support because "There is NO Skype VIA app."  He finally found out that his information was wrong, and that Vizio is still working on compatibility issues with this model TV and Skype, and anticipates a Firmware update "sometime in the future."  I said that could mean a year or more- do they have an estimate?  The answer is "No."  -If, and when, Vizio does come out with Skype- you must also use their camera only- it's not because they are trying to prevent other cameras; rather, there are specific compatibility criteria with Skype and particular TV's.  Your other option for Skype is to purchase the Vizio CoStar (Roku-like device), or a Skype compatible Blu-ray player, hook it up to your computer, etc.  For me however, Skype is a huge criteria, and I wanted it integrated into the TV.  Hence, I'm considering returning the TV, and their advertising is misleading.  I'm not convinced they will update the Firmware with Skype.  -VIA Apps:  While I like the VIA apps/flexibility, it's not easy to switch back and forth when you're fully IN a specific app to get back to tv, and then back to the App again.  In other words, say you are watching You Tube, and want to check the game on TV, you must select Input, then the TV or another port.  But then to get BACK to the VIA app, you have to go all the way through the apps again to load it- very time consuming.  You can't "pause" that YouTube video, check TV for the game, and then come back again to that same YouTube or the VIA app again quickly.  Perhaps I'm too picky... but it's a usability issue for switching back and forth easily while "remembering" your place on the VIA apps.  I would also love it if you could "save favorites" on the VIA apps individually, but again, I'm probably asking for too much at this point for a sub $1K HDTV.  - TV doesn't swivel, but that has not been an issue- it's light enough to move if you need to.  Viewing angles are fine throughout room anyway.

Reviews.Title: Fast death
Reviews.Author: Kyle Marsh
Reviews.Content: Update after 6 monthsVizio did repair the TV. I watched the repair folks replace 3 boards before the found the fault. Now, a few months later the set is failing again. Now there are blue lines running vertically across the entire display. Looks like another round of repairs are needed.Lasted two months of light use and now has to be replaced. No picture, No Menu. Nothing. Vizio will replace the set, but it takes AT LEAST a month before they will provide the replacement.

Reviews.Title: Lip sync problems
Reviews.Author: Kiran Patel
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is good - though not as good as my 50 inch Panasonic plasma. But I am constantly having lip sync problems when connecting the TV with cablevision cable box using Hdmi cable. The audio and video start out in sync, but after a few minutes, the audio starts to lag. The lip sync settting with the tv does not seem to make any difference. Called Vizio many times, but no solution. After many hours of trouble shooting on the phone, the rep said that PCM setting in the cable box needs to be turned on. But the Cablevision box does not have such setting. If I use a component cable, there is no problem, but I can notice a visible difference in picture quality. Also, if you switch channels, or turn the tv off and on, the problem disappears temporarily, only to show up in a few minutes. I have switched cable boxes, and hdmi cables, but problem continues. I will be returning the TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV - Needs adjustments out of the box though
Reviews.Author: Benjamin R. Rodgers
Reviews.Content: This is a great tv. I'm really happy with it, especially at it's price point. Out of the box it looks great displaying regular TV shows, but at first watching Football I was really disappointed/scared that I made a bad purchase. Have no worries though, once you make the proper adjustments (credit to "Kris's" review for all but 1 of the settings below) it's an amazing TV. YOU MUST TURN OFF MOTION SMOOTHING - see settings below!I couldn't be happier. Netflix is beyond what I thought TV could display (I've never seen blu-ray, but I imagine this was close to it on Netflix).The delivery guys were courteous, pleasant and even installed the base while I signed the paperwork, just provide a phillips screwdriver for them.I won't review audio in depth as in my opinion TV's are made for video and not audio. It's fine out of the box. I will eventually upgrade to a simple soundbar as I live in a duplex and cannot/will not subject my neighbors upstairs to surround sound.My settings (again huge credit to "Kris" for his settings as the only thing different on mine is a slightly higher "color" setting - his is 51, mine is 54).---Picture settings menu---Picture Mode: MovieBacklight: 53Brightness: 50Contrast: 75Color: 54Tint: 0Sharpness: 0---Size & Position submenu---[no change]---Color Temperature submenu---Colour temperature: NormalRed Gain: 104Green Gain: 115Blue gain: 130Red offset: 129Green offset: 130Blue offset: 132--Advanced Picture submenu---Smooth motion effect: OffReal Cinema Mode: Smooth [grayed out]Noise Reduction: OffMPEG NR: OffColor Enhancement: OffAdaptive Luma: OffFilm Mode: AutoBacklight Control: OffAmbient Light sensor: Off* Again, all credit to Kris here. Thanks Kris!

Reviews.Title: Small wifi enabled TV at a very nice price
Reviews.Author: Terry "tcinsatx@yahoodotcom"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for a guest room in our second home. It's the first wifi enabled TV I've ever owned and but since I have minimal cable line-up there, I knew I'd be depending heavily on video streaming from Netflix and Amazon. Also, since there is only one HDMI port on this model, I wanted the wifi feature so I could use the HDMI port for a game system rather than a Roku.This is a slim profile television and the stand is one that attaches from the back rather than underneath so it only needs 14 1/2" headroom. It measures slightly over 22" wide and about  6 1/2" deep with the stand attached.The ports on the back of the TV include 1 HDMI port, 1 USB port, 1 RF port, 1 RGB PC port for connecting to a computer or laptop, Composite and Component ports, 1 Ethernet port, a coax cable port, a headphone jack and a 5.1 digital optical jack.It features 1080p resolution and is 60Hz. It has an LED screen and is plenty bright. The picture is crisp and the colors vibrant. It's a little slow changing channels and even slower using the internet apps but I'm not surprised given the price. The menu system is well done and easy to navigate.The remote is of the short and wide variety, which I like, and is comfortable in your hand. It had dedicated Amazon, Netflix and M-GO buttons also. Unlike larger versions of this TV, there is no keyboard on this remote. Instead, an onscreen keyboard pops up during setup for things like entering your wireless network name, passwords, etc. There is no back lighting on the remote.There is no users manual included. Instead there is a Quickstart Guide which walks you thru basic setup and then directs you to the onscreen users manual. I usually prefer a printed owners manual but this actually makes sense as you can't lose it.Vizio has it's own streaming video apps called VIA, just as Roku has "channels". There is a VIA button in the center of the remote which brings up an onscreen dock with all the pre-installed apps. You can also add more apps by opening the Yahoo! Connected TV Store App.I believe this TV would be best suited to a bedroom, office or kitchen with a wireless network available and and would be a great solution where there is not much space and no cable television service. My only disappointments are that it only has one HDMI port and it's slow to respond to the remote, although that's not a huge issue to me considering the price. It suits my needs and I'm happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, great value, awkward stand and viewing angle
Reviews.Author: Daniel W.
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a great TV for a great value. 1080p and integrated Netflix streaming are the key differentiating features in this market segment, and having both for under $200 makes it a great deal.  I would recommend this TV to anyone, so long as they are aware of two key possible shortcomings:1) The viewing angle.  Rather than the traditional pedestal stand, this TV stands more like a picture frame, and rests on a triangular foot attached to the back.  The configuration causes the TV lean back a few degrees, rather than being perpendicular to the table top.  This causes no issues if the TV is viewed at eye level or below, but when the TV is above eye level the angle causes a very significant degradation of perceived image quality.  In my case, I purchased it for the bedroom, and with the TV just a few inches above the bed, the image quality was terrible due to the angle.  My solution was to purchases a $20 tilting wall mount to compensate.2) Only one HDMI input.

Reviews.Title: Good Except for Wireless
Reviews.Author: metalheadjc
Reviews.Content: I will start with the good and work my way down:-Style:  This is one of the more stylish small TVs I have come across.  The frame is very thin around the screen, as you can see in photos, so it looks pretty nice.  It is not the thinnest TV ever, but it is still pretty thin and the connections on the back are vertically positioned, so you can place it back against a wall easily.-Built-in web apps:  There are quite a few to choose from, though for me the most important are Netflix, Amazon Video, Youtube, and Pandora.  There are a host of other random things that I have little use for.  The functionality is pretty much the same as I have seen on Roku, and it is nice to have all of that built into one device and on one controller.-Sound:  The speakers are surprisingly loud for such a small TV.  They are relatively clear as well.  Don't mistake this to mean that there's exceptional bass or highs or that it simulates surround well, or anything magical, it simply produces loud and clear stereo that is more than sufficient for a large bedroom, which is all I needed.-Picture:  Clear and bright, although there are a few jagged edges at times and the color depth does not quite compare to my Sumsung 50A550 50" Plasma.  Then again, not much does.  Perhaps with some tweaking I can make it a bit better.  Overall, unless you're pretty picky and have a high-end TV to compare to, I don't think you will be disappointed.  It is sharp and overall looks good.-Tuner:  Seems to pick up most of the channels in my area (over the air) but does not pick up as well as my Samsung.  They both use the same rooftop antenna and the same signal booster and actually the Samsung's cable run is longer and goes through more devices but it does a better job of picking up weak channels.  However, only the very weakest channels (40 miles away) are dropped, so I'm relatively pleased.Now for the reason that it gets a 4 and not a 5:-Wireless connectivity:  This TV has built-in wireless.  If you look at the instructions that come along with the TV though, you are basically informed that it is preferred to use a wired connection.  I had no problem going through and setting up the TV to connect wirelessly to my router, and it seemed to connect just fine.  I pulled up Netflix and browsed through and everything was fine.  But I discovered that after 10-20 minutes of watching anything on Netflix or Youtube, the connection would drop and the built-in wireless would crash.  It would not come back until I turned the TV off and back on again, sometimes not even coming back until I had unplugged and replugged the power cable.  Pretty annoying.  Not sure if its a problem with firmware or hardware.  Certainly not a problem on my end.  I run an Asus RT-N66U router and a Cisco DPC3010 modem, neither of which gives me any trouble (as they shouldn't, they are both pretty expensive devices) and all of my other devices (PS3, two laptops, two phones, and a wireless printer) are all maintaining perfect connections.  So I ended up having to use a spare router as a wireless bridge and hook the TV to it with a cable, and now everything works great, but it was a pain to set up.My overall impression is that this is a good TV.  For the price, you simply cannot beat the features, but if all of the features do not work, are you getting the best deal?  For me it was fixable with what I had at home, but if this is a problem with all of these units, you may not have all of the features you are promised.  I can only hope this is an isolated issue.  If it isn't a risk you are willing to take, you may consider getting a similar, less expensive Vizio TV with none of the internet apps and internet connectivity features and just spend 50 bucks on a low-end Roku.

Reviews.Title: Awesomeness!
Reviews.Author: B. Carr
Reviews.Content: I got got this tv for the bedroom.  Setting it up was pretty easy, but I cannot connect to the Internet.  The picture on it is very good, and everything works like it should, with the exception of the Internet.My other choices are to hard wire ( not very practical as the router is in another part of the house) or send it back.  Maybe I can just buy another Roku.Gave it 5 for the picture, 3 1/2 for sound and 3 for everything else.UPDATE: 04/21/13Ok, I have had this TV for about 4 days now.  I had a bit of time to play with it yesterday and today.  I fiddled around with the sound and have it much more acceptable.  I also have messed with the color and have it pretty much right on.  But the biggest thing I corrected was the internet settings.To get the TV to login to your router, you need to change your router settings.  Instead of WPA2, set the settings toWPA-PSK [TKIP] + WPA2-PSK [AES].  If you change it to just WPA-PSK, it will not use the full speed of the router.Once I made the changes to the router I went into network settings on the TV and I had to manually input the router name (SSID) but then the rest was easy and it connected quickly to the VIA interface.I also changed my ratings on the TV to 4 stars total.  I would have given it 5 stars but they do not explain to you in the setup process about the router.UPDATE: 05/05/13I have had this TV for about 3 weeks now and am very impressed by it.  Color and picture is as good as any I have seen in the big box stores.  Only complaint I might have is the remote, but Amazon sells qwerty keyboard remotes for $20 or less and I might try one of those.As far as complaints from others about how long it takes to turn on,I have a 6 or 7 year old Sharp and it takes about that amount of time to come on as well.And complaints about the Internet connectivity, I think a lot of that comes down to your ISP feed speed and router.  Mine is fairly fast and once I am connected to Netflix or Amazon (or YouTube for that matter) it runs better than my laptop (which cost about $400 more).  Am I satisfied?  Heck yea, I'm gonna buy another when I can afford it!

Reviews.Title: Best little TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Jason P
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV to hang on the wall in the kitchen using VideoSecu Articulating TV Wall Mount, Full Motion Tilt Swivel and Rotate Articulating Arm for Most 15" 17" 19" 20" 22" 23" 24" 26" 27" LCD LED TV Monitor Flat Panel Screen with VESA 100 ML11B A63. Great picture, convenient having Netflix & Amazon Prime Instant Video one click away. A big plus is that it's 1080p--able to use as a full HD computer monitor via HDMI as well, whereas just about everything else in this size is 720p, and usually well above this price point. I would definitely purchase again.

Reviews.Title: NICE FEATURES AND PICTURE, BUT NOT WORTH THE FAILURE RATE...
Reviews.Author: Jason Legg
Reviews.Content: The same thing happened to me like "S. P. Linke" customer review stated, I had it under a month, the screen went blank (but the backlighting and sound still worked). I read many other reviews about the same thing happening to many other users and physically drove and talked to the store associate at Walmart, he said that he has seen many other Vizio's come back with the same issues or another within the last month. Decided on all the information that I gathered that the higher percentage rates of failure for this brand was not worth "the hassle that many other users have gone through in the past". Due diligence to yourself and read what others have gone through, and find the best deals of TV's that WILL LAST LONGER. I returned my unit to Walmart and read good reviews on a Panasonic that they had displayed for "around" the same price. Went to Sams Club were they had the same TV for $100.00 off and included a 3 year warranty for only $60.00 (paid for by the money that was saved). The Panasonic only has a 2% failure rate instead of Vizio's 4%. Plus Panasonic makes there own parts instead of buying them from a major label and only buying enough for a production run like Vizio does. All TV manufacters will have problems here and there but look for the ones that have the least amount of issues that will also not give you the run around if you did for future reference.  Consumer Reports data indicates that most major brand flat panel sets have a 2-5% failure rate within the first 3 years, but the overwelming amount of set failures do occur before the factory warranty ends. So if you spend a small amount of time educating yourself before you buy, you might just save yourself a couple of hours, days and/or weeks of getting the run around from companys that only focus on the bottom dollar and not the consumers money and dedication to there brand (like so many commited users have found through long waited discriminating experiences). I think you might have bought a TV for the purpose of entertainment, not the negative opposite of waiting for a replacement, repair or run around from the brand that was supposed to last with your hard earned money. Below are links that might help guide your decisions towards a worthwhile solution. Good luck and Happy shopping![...][...]

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV
Reviews.Author: Lawrence Bauer
Reviews.Content: WOW!!!  Incredible HD, crystal clear picture, easy to connect, great color.  Hard to explain-- the picture is so good that it almost seems 3D.  Price is terrific. This is the greatest value ever.  Samsung, Sony, etc have nothing on this VIZIO.

Reviews.Title: MP4 support through DLNA is lacking
Reviews.Author: paulk124
Reviews.Content: I just bought this HDTV from our local Costco. I selected this model because it is the cheapest LCD TV I could find that has DLNA support. For DLNA support, the specifications for this TV simply list "Yes". When I got this TV home, I tried accessing some MP4 videos through DLNA. My DLNA server is a Windows 7 PC running Windows Media Center. When I select the MP4 video, I get the messages "Video codec not support" and "Audio codec not support".  My Samsung HDTV is able to access the MP4 videos through DLNA without any problem. In fact, if I copy the MP4 video onto a USB memory stick, I can then play the video on the Vizio TV through its USB port. It baffles me as to why Vizio would support MP4 video playing through the USB port but not DLNA.Anyway, I was tempted to return the TV but decided to keep it. It can still stream MPEG2 videos over DLNA. I haven't tried any other video formats. Besides the MP4 DLNA problem, the TV works great. The built-in wireless network adapter worked perfectly and the tuner channel setup was easy. The wired network connection also works perfectly. I didn't try any of the other VIA apps.

Reviews.Title: Solid bedroom TV
Reviews.Author: Karl
Reviews.Content: This TV is great for bedrooms and smaller rooms.  We replaced an awful Panasonic VIERA TC-L32C5.  In the end this TV was $40 more but provides good colors (with minimal adjustments), pretty good black levels, great sound and a ton of extra features - like Netflix, Amazon Prime, etc.Wow, this TV is light and bright.  No fuss with the set up of the base or putting it up on a shelf.  It fires up quickly and without drama.  We plugged in our HDMI components and were off in no time.  One downside, while naming the inputs we had to use a slow onscreen keyboard.  The worst - some genius set up the keyboard alphabetically.  Really?  Why do some manufactures insist on doing something so illogical when most of us use QWERTY all day long?Other than the typing the set up was quick and painless.  Getting online was also easy.  We love that we can even connect to our Plex Media Server using a Vizio widget.  Overall the widgets and their layout are not as smooth as our ROKU2 XS for online materials but if one is really disinclined to shifting to a different input it'll work.Remote's a mishmash of buttons.  Seems like an engineer designed it and did not consult with anyone about ergonomics.  No backlighting, mostly uniform button design = obnoxious in the dark.  The most annoying thing...no sleep button?  Come on, a TV this small is really going mostly in bedrooms so why can't the designer be considerate and put sleep right there or make it really easy to access?  Overall it'll work but we're going to get another Harmony for the room so we can use the Directv, Roku and this TV easily on one remote.More important, to me, than the online/widgets, would be the crisp, clear sound.  At a volume setting of only 10-11 the TV's sound is bright and nothing is muddled (unlike that horrendous Panasonic).  Ah, good sound reproduction for such a cheapo TV.The picture quality also seems several notches above the Panasonic.  We needed very little fiddling to get to a nice image with deep blacks.  Still, as this is a cheap TV, the blacks aren't as dark as I would prefer.  This'll do as it's a bedroom TV.  From various angles the TV image still works nicely.Overall, I'd suggest this TV in a second.  Yep, it was $40 more than the Panasonic (both purchased at a warehouse store with a generous return policy), but so worth it.

Reviews.Title: Incredible value for a 70"
Reviews.Author: Anthony P. Moody
Reviews.Content: I've been fence sitting for a large flat screen for my home literally for years. Every year as prices drift lower we get closer and closer to CES, new (better) sets, etc.  And so the cycle repeats. I always eyed the top of the line (eg VT Panny plasmas, Sony HX, and more recently the 70" Elite). I even (pre)ordered a few before getting cold feet. I always found it tough to spend $5000 or more for a set with notable flaws, and which were soon to be replaced. Nature of the beast, but so be it.This time around though, with prices on 70" and 80" sets drifting down into crazy land, I felt more compelled than ever. Then the 60" version of this set got a solid review on CNet. And then the 70" was discounted for Black Friday. I couldn't hold out any more. I pulled the trigger and am very happy that I did.Delivery did not go as expected. Only one guy showed up so I had to help him carry it in, etc.  Amazon gave me a credit to make up for this.  Next, 2 of the 3 screw holes used to attach the base seemed out of plumb, and unfinished. It took a LOT of patience and elbow grease to get it attached without stripping the screws. Once done though, no issues. I'd probably recommend wall mounting but I have a nice stand and reasonably well behaved kids!I started with the CNet settings and tweaked from there using the Disney WOW blu ray. The picture quality was exactly as expected: very very good.  Short of state of the art, especially wrt black levels and off axis viewing (compared to the Elite and VT50) however I paid 1/3 the current price of the Elite and 1/2 the current price of the VT50.I then had to gently rub the screen to help alleviate the uneven backlighting. Do so at your own risk of course. I used a micro fiber and it worked surprisingly well. I still have a touch of unevenness but it's not at all noticeable with regular content on the screen. Only on a full back screen, or occasionally in extremely dark movie scenes.This set is an incredible value. I don't care about 3D, I don't care about the streaming apps (I use a PS3 for that), I don't care about the built in speakers, and I solved the lip sync issues (see the AVS forum thread...) using the delay on my receiver.All in all an incredible value. I'd prefer to give it 4.5 stars but Amazon won't let me. I can't give it 5 simply because there are sets that outperform it. But for the money it's nothing short of amazing.EDIT 5/3: I ultimately returned this set and got a 75" Samsung. The Samsung does produce a better picture overall than the Vizio, as it should for > 2X the price. But I traded up primarily because I wanted a somewhat bigger screen. I would still recommend the Vizio at its price.

Reviews.Title: BAM
Reviews.Author: Wade H. Millward "World Traveler"
Reviews.Content: Great 60 for the price, in fact best 60 for the price.  After calling up vizio to get some help with the settings the picture is perfect, extremely clear. No noticeable pixels, clear when watching sports or fast moving shows, very thin frame and TV, controller is great has a keyboard on back.  Hooked up to wifi which works very well for hulu and Netflix, great HD pic on both services. Got it Costco for $979 with automatic 2 yr warranty.  Don't get me wrong I buy most things on amazon just didn't want to wait.  Highly recommended TV.  It replaced my 37 in Magnavox LCD. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: Great value for the price, but below average sound quality
Reviews.Author: Gerry Tenebruso
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for and with this model you get plenty. Te size is great, the minimalist form factor is refreshing and the picture is above average. The weakest point to the unit is definitely the sound. Since the speakers are rear mounted due to the thinness of the unit and minimal form factor, their is something to be desired regarding the sound. This can be remedied with a Vizio sound bar or an equivalent which will pump um the sound and base. But unfortunately that comes with an extra cost. Overall no buyers remorse and very pleased with the value delivered for the price. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: V. Vachula "@mycrappyhouse"
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for a few days now and I think I really like it. For the price, it's fantastic. I've had no issues watching any of the online content. I love that there's a button for Netflix right on the remote. There's a lot of extra channels of online content to watch - youtube, tmz, etc. Not major network channels (boo!), but still a decent amount of stuff to watch. When I first set it up, I thought it was broken because it kept getting dim and bright randomly. Turns out this is a power saving setting for the backlight. I switched it off and no more issue. The only downside I can see is that there looks like what I would describe as light leak on black screens when viewed from an angle. It's not enough to bother me and I only notice it on a completely black screen. One bit of advice - if you get a wall mount, get the one that is a square plate that attaches to the tv, not the vertical bar type. I googled this model and it said it was compatible with that vertical bar type, but it wasn't. I had to cut the bars down with a hack saw so they didn't block all of the input jacks.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Jonathan L
Reviews.Content: This is actually my first online review of a product. I've never been pissed off enough to write one but this whole incident is outrageous.This will be my first, last, and only Vizio. I hate to condemn a company based on a single item, but this television's flaws are absurd. Why bother to manufacture a set with such a large panel and not do it properly? It's just a waste of components. Here are the issues I had:- Horrible light bleeding, not only from the edges (somewhat common with LCDs), but a huge section of the middle. Watching anything remotely dark looked awful.- Audio out of sync. Watching digital video from netflix or via my home network wasn't a possibility because of a very noticeable delay between the dialogue and lips of the actors. I use a home theater for my audio which worked perfectly with the previous TV and once again functions just fine with that set without any changes. I spent time in the menu attempting to correct the issue through setting adjustments but it is not possible. You'll see others had the same issue in other reviews. I wish I had read them before I bought it on Black Friday.- I re-adjusted the stand twice, ensuring that it was secured tightly and properly. The tv still leans back at an angle, which I believe was straining the panel and would eventually warp it.I use a PS3 for my streaming but I should mention to potential buyers that the "smart apps" are incredibly sluggish. A dollar store android tablet moves more fluidly than the app menus on this TV.The only positive I take from this experience is my new-found appreciation for my old Sony Bravia. Dynamic contrast ratio is a meaningless statistic. This tv claims to have a 1,000,000:1 DCR while my 3 year old Sony has 100,000:1. Comparing the contrast and black levels between the two is a joke. I realize how fantastic the Sony actually looks now that I spent a week trying to watch the Vizio.Those planning to order ANY TV from Amazon should read the following:I have to comment on the delivery carrier CEVA Logistics, which Amazon employs to deliver TVs. This is the most unprofessional company I have ever had the misfortune of dealing with. I stayed home all day waiting for delivery and as the 5pm window passed, I called the company to confirm that the set would still be coming. I was informed that the driver was running a little behind and should make it to my home by 10PM. He did not and the following day I received a phone call from my grandparents whom he had contacted after finding their number in the local phone book. In the process of accepting and attempting to return this TV, I have corrected both Amazon and CEVA on the phone number at least four times. When I finally spoke to the driver, I had to give him step by step directions to my house as if we were executing a CraigsList deal. I later asked CEVA if the drivers have GPS and was told that they ordinarily do not, unless the driver chooses to buy their own or use a smartphone. THIS IS A DELIVERY COMPANY THAT DOES NOT EQUIP THEIR DRIVERS WITH GPS! Are you serious??After setting up the Vizio and learning of all its defects and shortcomings, I initiated a return with Amazon on December 17th, 2012. As of January 2, the TV still sits in the box at my home and I'm awaiting a return phone call on the 4th to schedule a pickup thankfully via another carrier. CEVA has scheduled a return pickup 3 TIMES and not only failed to show up, but let me wait for them without so much as a phone call to inform me they weren't coming. Each time I call, it's as if they have no database to retrieve my information and are sifting through paperwork. It's a complete joke of a company and I will never buy a large item through Amazon again if I have to deal with CEVA.Bottom line: Yes it would be great to have a 60" TV, but if you have $1K to spend on a set, go with a slightly smaller Sony, Samsung, Panasonic or LG. You get what you pay for. Do not buy a TV from any online store that does not have a physical location near your home. I've learned my lesson. Yes, you may save money on shipping, but you had better hope that the TV works flawlessly and you never have to return it. If you have to deal with CEVA it could be an absolute nightmare. Also, make sure you have someone in your family who is free to sit at your house and needlessly spend 3-4 days waiting on them to show up.

Reviews.Title: Get 'Smart' about the missing qwerty remote before you buy
Reviews.Author: Librarius42
Reviews.Content: I bought the 24" version (VIZIO E-Series E241i-A1) of this TV, and while it is good value for the money, there are some serious drawbacks you need to be aware of. First, the sound quality is pitiful. The speakers are smaller than most tweeters, and the sound they produce is hollow and tinny. There is no bass volume whatsoever. If you want full sound, plan to hook up a receiver or a set of computer speakers and make sure they have an optical connector for digital sound. Secondly, there is both missing information and misinformation on the Amazon page regarding the remote control. The remote control has NO qwerty keyboard. This was a big deal for me. I bought this TV specifically to use Netflix, and guess what? When I tried to login to my Netflix account I could input my user name, but I couldn't input my password because there was no on-screen keyboard. I was dead in the water.When I contacted tech support on the Vizio website, they repeated said that an on-screen keyboard would pop up. It didn't. When I asked if there was a qwerty remote I could buy, they said "There is NO qwerty remote for this TV." I was about ready to send the TV back when I decided to try one more time. Being a puzzle solver, I went back to the Netflix screen and reversed the sequence. I put the password in first and the user name second. It worked. I got an on-screen keyboard both times. Lastly, there ARE qwerty remote controls offered on Amazon for this TV. So my question to Vizio is why on earth would you offer an 'smart' internet ready TV with loads of APPs that require qwerty input, but not include a qwerty remote? That is just plain cheap and dumb marketing. And why would you deny that such remotes exist when they are for sale on Amazon? Wake up! You not only lose a star from me, but probably a lot of return customers.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal - Great TV
Reviews.Author: Hoss Peterson
Reviews.Content: I started by joking with my wife that I wanted a 70" TV.  It was ludicrous, we thought.  Then I started looking at LCD TV's.  I knew I didn't want/need 3D, so that eliminated a bunch, and I knew I wanted at least 60".  I looked at Sharp, Samsung and others, but not at Vizio.  I'd been warned that they were "cheap" and didn't look as good.Then, the joking got serious, and I started honestly looking for a 70" TV.  When I realized my mounting area was exactly the size for a 70", we went for it.  The only choices were Sharp and Vizio.  Sharp had four different models, all of varying reviews.  Didn't want 3D, didn't need this, didn't want that - and the prices were all $2K or more.  Still a steep jump for us.  Then there was this Vizio...I started reading more and more reviews - Vizio was stacking up well against Sharp.  And the price was $500 less!!  Finally, we jumped and went for the Vizio.  Ordered it from Amazon and a week later, two very polite guys showed up in a truck and carried it into my living room.  I used the mount I purchased off Amazon and with the help of a buddy, hung it on the wall and hooked it up to the Yamaha surround system I also got on Amazon.  BOOM!!  Instant home theater (and the biggest one on the block) for under $2K.  (Thanks, tax return!)I am an audio visual person by profession - and I must say I have been very impressed by the picture of the Vizio.  Looks great!!  Easy to use - easy to navigate.  I wish the remote had backlighting, but for the price I paid, I'm not going to complain.  I got the 5 year warranty for another $150 or so and I am confident that I'll have 5 years of great viewing ahead of me.  Love the TV - picture is crisp and clear and the HD is awesome.  The price is doubley awesome.  I paid as much for my 70" as my buddy did for his 42" three years ago.GREAT DEAL!!  GREAT PICTURE!!  GREAT TV!!

Reviews.Title: fantastic tv
Reviews.Author: jr
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt this is the best value in large screen smart tvs on the market.However as other reviews have mentioned,its important to put in the correctSettings to get the tremendous picture its capable of producing.when I first setit up I tried several of the settings people have posted here on amazon and whileThey were fine they didn't give me that "pop"I was looking for.it seems many reviewers don't like the ultra crisp realistic look that led tvs providebut I actually love it!it makes every movie and Tv show come alive in a way never seenbefore so even when watching a movie seen many times before it will seem completelyFresh and new.after much tweaking i found settings that make this effect really shine inthis set so I thought id share them for you guys to try..VividBacklight 86brightness 36Contrast 82Color 53Tint 0Sharpness 8Color temperature customRed gain 113Green gain 132Blue gain 129Red offset 128Green offset 127Blue offset 128Smooth effect lowReal cinema precisionNr lowMpeg nr lowColor richAdaptive luma strongFilm autoBacklight control offAmbient light sensor offEnjoy this beautiful Tv!

Reviews.Title: Cant beat it!
Reviews.Author: Npizz
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tv from SAMs club since amazon didn't have any in stock. My girlfriend was pist at me for wanting to buy it until she saw it in person! This tv is amazing for the price! With a little tweaking, the picture is perfect and the slim frame makes it look like the picture just spills into the wall. I have a really bright room so I was debating the smaller, less expensive LCD 55" vizio E552VLE model but after seeing the two next to each other they don't even compare. There is alittle reflection on the tv from the windows but its a lot less than expected. The Internet apps are very easy to use and navigate although the interface they used is very basic and not as flashy as more expensive tvs. The best part is that my girlfriend has not stopped talking about the picture and how amazing the tv looks! Definitely a great tv if ur looking for size and price! Hope this helped!

Reviews.Title: excellent tv. great price
Reviews.Author: nebraskafan1
