Reviews.Content: bought this tv for my bedroom and it works awesome. picture quality is very good and all the apps work flawlessly. very reasonable price would recommend this product to anyone looking for a smaller tv with all the extras.

Reviews.Title: Slick TV with many features
Reviews.Author: luker02
Reviews.Content: I have LITTLE to complain about this TV.First the price:For a smart TV, you cant get a much better deal. This thing is 60 inches, hugs the wall, and packs WIFI and Apps into the package for under a grand.Some features:YouTube is great. I'm hooked up to WIFI with the router across the house, but I can search for any video I want to stream in full 1080p. --(still YouTube's flash HD - I'm picky, but it still looks very very good)Other apps - I do not have a streaming Netflix account anymore due to it's selection, but it and the other apps look promising. Being a WIFI television I was hoping to stream my music, videos and pictures through DLNA. I have not tried this yet but after looking through the Vizio apps, it looks very possible.Speakers - I have a 321 Bose 2.1 System outputting through the Vizio's optical port. But when I was first setting up the television, I did notice that the built-in speakers were adequate. I would not be disappointed.The remote...works.  This is the only thing I'm going to complain about. Using the qwerty remote on the backside takes some getting used to. It's a little laggy when typing and in my short experience, it has to be pointed the right way at the TV to get any reception.User-Interface - In no way is this a 4ghz PC with 8 gigs of RAM. It's a TV. The menu's and apps are big graphical animations and are a little jittery moving around the screen, but they are again adequate. This is not something that would drive me away from a purchase but something just to note.The size - I have quite a big mantle above the fireplace so I decided to mount it above -- it was the right decision. I found a low-profile, 12-degree wall mount also on Amazon that hugs this thing to the wall. The most it sticks out is about 3-4 inches for a 60in TV. It really looks slick.All-in-all the picture is great. I did noticed a bit of that soap-opera effect that I almost can't get used to.This effect comes with any 120-240hz TV anymore and it can likely be turned off.The price and features are too much to take away any stars from my rating.Hope this helped your flat screen shopping!

Reviews.Title: Video failed after 1 Month of use
Reviews.Author: Robert E Seter
Reviews.Content: I bought this same model TV from Walmart on Black Friday.  I started noticing the video and audio would be out of sink sometimes, but it seemed to be certain channels.  Then on December 27th the video just went out.  Tried unplugging the HDMI cable and reconnecting, nothing but sound still. I tried 2 other HDMI cables that worked fine on 2 other TVs I have and the same result.  After doing some reseach on the problem one of the boards has gone bad.  I am disappointed with Vizio for putting their name on this product.  I know I am not the only one that had this problem.  The only good thing I have to say about this experience is that Customer Service at my local Walmart did not give me a hassle about returning it on January 3rd.  If you bought one of these TVs throught Walmart between November 1st 2012 and December 24th 2012 and you are not wanting to deal with the warantee, you have until January 10th 2013 to return it to Walmart for a full refund or exchange (view Walmarts policy on returns online).

Reviews.Title: Great deal for a great TV.
Reviews.Author: nwest
Reviews.Content: This TV is a steal for the money. It's HUGE! I love the smart apps. I was a little worried about getting a Vizio, but it's under $1000, and I decided to go for it. I haven't been disappointed.  It's not perfect, but I knew I wouldn't find a perfect 60in LED with smart apps for under $1000.Pros:It's BIG!It's cheap!Extremely light for such a big TVSmall bezelExtremely thinEdge-lit LEDSmart apps, including Netflix, Hulu, Amazon, etc. (app bar is accessible without interrupting the show)Built in WiFi (easy to setup)Exhaustive, easy-to-use color settingsFull keyboard on back of the remote (for web apps)Amazing HD picture over HDMIGreat soundLots of inputsCons: (These are ALL of the minor annoyances I've found, but I still don't regret my choice)Noise artifacts over component cable (720P) - just switch to HDMI to fix thisTakes 8-10 seconds to turn onRemote is not back-lit.  Can be hard to use in a dark room.Minor uniformity issues.Base does not swivel.Black levels can't compete with the higher end models, but still better than my older Samsung.No built-in calibration toolsSmoothing makes movies look like soap operas.  Luckily, this can be reduced or turned off.All in all, I love the TV.  I made a great purchase decision.  With an extra $500, I may have been able to find a Samsung with the same feature set, but then it probably would have its own list of annoyances too.  Not worth it.  Just get this one.

Reviews.Title: Great picture. Easy setup.  All the bells and whistles.  Also, using it as the world's largest computer monitor.
Reviews.Author: T. Fanning "Byte606"
Reviews.Content: We purchased the Vizio E701i-A3 six months ago.  We are very pleased with the whole experience from Amazon's delivery (which was free under Amazon Prime and deferred the entire annual cost of the program), the easy setup, TV features and picture quality.  Setup took less than half an hour, about one fourth the time it took me to assemble my artificial Christmas tree (Reviewer warning: I lack any mechanical instincts whatsoever). Poking around in the manual and exploring a blizzard of features can become a hobby if one wants to go that route.  I'm no expert on resolution and picture quality, but we also have an expensive Samsung 46" TV, which is now in the bedroom believe it or not, and the Vizio compares favorably to that one.  I think this obsession with pitcture quality on newer HDTVs is overblown given that these debates are focused on differences undetectable by the human eye, or at least these old eyes.  Also, you can just program in whatever display settings you want using Vizio's predefined settings or expert profiles available on the web.  If you want purple people or orange leaves, go right ahead.  The apps and wireless connection are idiotproof, but we use them less that other folks because of our desktop/Vizio connection (see below).My wife and I were a little leery of getting such a large TV (70") given the size of our family room.  Turns out the TV viewing from 9' away is quite enjoyable.  My wife views the TV from the side and at a 30 degree angle and the picture is fine. The matt finish performs well diffusing normal household reflections.One unique thing about our setup is that I have the Vizio connected to our Windows desktop computer in another room.  Consequently, we use the Vizio as the world's largest computer display.  We have remote computer speakers and a wireless keyboard/trackpad in the family room and surf the web from the couch to our hearts content.  The Windows graphics adapter in the desktop computer drives the Vizio TV in HD mode so streaming TV shows and movies look and sound great.  Consequently, we don't really use the Vizio apps much since we access Netflix, Amazon Prime, Pandora, HBOGO, NBC/CBS/ABC/TNT TV sites, etc via the Windows machine and Internet Explorer in the other room.  This setup works very well.  We hardly have use for the DVR.  Also, browsing the internet on a 70" screen is a trip!All in all, the Vizio E701i-A3 is an easy to use,  high-quality, fully featured and versatile TV.

Reviews.Title: Yes, yes, yes, YES!
Reviews.Author: Charles Dickens
Reviews.Content: Based on the extremely positive reviews here, I returned a Samsung UN55ES7500 for this and I am extremely glad I did - 5" bigger and less than half the price.- Installing the stand required the use of a power screwdriver, because the screws were very hard to turn after about half way in.  For some reason the delivery guys refused to help me with this (I thought that was part of the deal with buying a large TV from Amazon?).  However, the TV is relatively light so I managed to do it single-handed.  Without the power screwdriver it could have been a problem though.- Setup was a breeze, as pointed out, choose "HOME" not "STORE" on the very first screen.- I made some adjustments to the TV settings, turning off smooth motion as suggested in other reviews here, then played with the colors until they were to my liking.  I can't see any difference in quality to the Samsung UN55ES7500 I returned.  Viewing is perfectly fine too, at wide angles.  Perfectly fine for any normal family basement/living room!- The remote is brilliant because it has a QWERTY keyboard on the back.  Unlike some other reviewers, I had no problems with the angle it was pointed at, the TV always could receive signals from it (despite it being IR, not Bluetooth).  This makes such a difference when entering user names, searching for things etc.- DNLA works like a charm!  I was able to watch videos and view photos from my Windows 7 PC via the "media" app.  My only gripes are (1) you are limited to the video and audio codecs that the TV has, with no opportunity to install your own (2) it does not start a video where you left off, and (3) you are limited to fast forwarding at an annoyingly slow speed, so restarting half-way through is a real pain.  (Side note: after I added some new media to my Windows PC the TV wasn't listing it, I thought it was because the TV did not have the required codecs, but that was not the case, it was actually a problem with Win7 - search Google for "DLNA in Windows 7 64 bit - newly added files not available on devices" to find the solution - I did what it said there, and the media showed up!).  After a couple of weeks of use, I decided to invest in a Roku and the free Plex app to stream my media to my TV - this means that the video/audio is decoded on the PC and therefore any media at all can be played on the TV.- The CNET review mentioned the basicness of the UI, but I actually really like it and find it far more sensibly laid out than the Samsung I returned, which I found to be too busy and confused.  I like the way that you can browse Amazon Instant Video while watching TV.  There is a dedicated button on the remote for Amazon and Netflix which is nice, and one for "M-Go", which I will never use and in fact uninstalled. I wish that could have been reprogrammed for the "Media" app.  The Facebook and Twitter apps also operate while allowing you to watch TV (note if you have apps turned off in Facebook you won't be able to log in from the TV - took me two TVs and a long time to figure that out).- I have not noticed any lip sync issues yet (either from cable TV, or from DNLA) but the TV does allow you to adjust the synchronicity, haven't used it so can't comment on its effectiveness.  ** UPDATE ** after a few weeks of usage, I am now starting to notice the dreaded lip sync issue, both from cable TV and while watching my Roku.  Switching inputs seems to reset it again.- Startup does take about 10 seconds (minor annoyance in my opinion)- Sound is a little bit tinny, I have invested in a sound bar to complement it.- I read some concerns somewhere about the stand not being wide enough, and the possibility of the TV tipping over.  It does not require much leverage applied to the top of the TV to pull it over, and I do think that a small child could achieve this if they were set on doing it, or tried to climb up it/hang off the front.  Whether or not it's heavy enough to seriously injure them though is a different question - it is so much lighter than CRTs were, or even older LCDs, so I suspect not, but obviously it all depends on what hits where.The bottom line is that I think it's a better value for money to spend less on the TV and then buy a $50-$150 media streaming app which is much more cost effective to replace down the line if something better comes along, than replacing a whole TV.Google "Vizio E601-A3 Owners Thread" for some other useful info by people who have purchased (or who want to purchase) this TV.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Wilson x4
Reviews.Content: I purchased this t.v. yesterday from Costco for 979.99. It looked awesome for the Charger game on Sunday! I highly recommend the tv! Cant beat the price for the size. The flip remote is a little weird and will take some getting used to. I used the qwerty keyboard for the initial set up and liked it a lot. I had people viewing from all angles and they said it looked great.

Reviews.Title: Avoid Vizio
Reviews.Author: stanleydelzim
Reviews.Content: This television has suffered from chip failure in a group of serial numbers (for example, LFTRNWAN 4520400) causing the screen to go blank while the sound continues and the back light remains.  It is a non-recoverable failure.  Vizio is aware of the problem and will replace or repair your television IF it is still under the one-year warranty; however, the process can take two or more weeks and relies on a third party company called Square Trade for a replacement or a local repair service if you chose that option.  Delivery is coordinated  by another firm called Manna Distribution Services who then farms out local delivery to yet another (local to your area) company....if this sounds likely to cause problems for you, it does!  My television failed in less than 11 months and I spent a significant amount of time trying to get the replacement delivered.  While Vizio had contact information for many of their customers of this unit, they made no attempt to inform them or replace the television and simply waited until they failed and the customer contacted them.  Obviously, purchase some other television (preferably not a Vizio) unless you enjoy endless hours on the telephone and waiting for delivery people.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Ryan Knights
Reviews.Content: I ordered this product, got it in 2 days, then set up took about 15 minutes. I had all my accounts linked and was able to personalize my tv to the things I use most. Perfect smart TV and a great price. The picture is great and the streaming works flawlessly. There are plenty of HDMI ports and even a USB port for use with any type of electronic. I would definitely recommend this product to anyone. Great Price, Great TV

Reviews.Title: Good HDTV
Reviews.Author: D. Harris "DH"
Reviews.Content: This TV is awesome!!!! I love the bulit in Wi-Fi feature and Netflix application.  It allows my son to stream kid programs directly to his room. The setup was easy and the picture is great.  Only wish it had more than one HDMI port.

Reviews.Title: If you've read about the failures, read this
Reviews.Author: Stephen A. Brown
Reviews.Content: It's as good as all the positive reviews say. I use it mostly for my Xbox, which looks phenomenal, and regular TV/movie watching. Picture quality depends on the source, but it's been good for me so far. If you've read the negative reviews, here's what you really want to know:Vizio has acknowledged the problem with sets dying after 500 hours/6 months of regular use. The problem lies with a certain batch of chipsets, and within that batch there's a small chance of failure. If your TV's serial number falls within LFTRNWAN3800001 to LFTRNWAN4805300, yours has a chance of failing. They've extended their warranty from 1 year to 2 years after the date of purchase. It'll be an inconvenience to ship it back and wait for another, but it's better than dropping $1000 or more on a similar quality display.Source: [...]If you're on the fence about buying one because you're afraid of screen failure, Vizio has probably done away with the affected sets already and you're probably safe to buy one.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding HD Picture For the Price
Reviews.Author: Mike F.
Reviews.Content: Great value and outstanding HD picture. Also love this TV because of its slim (razor) profile.  Only reason I give this 4 stars instead of 5 because the first one I bought the picture went out after 4 weeks.  I was able to return it and bought an LG 60LS5700 and after viewing for a week returned it and bought the Vizio E601I-A3 again because the HD was much better with the Vizio.  I bought it at COSTCO and had no troubles due to their excellent return policy. The HD quality on this set ranks with the best but I would purchase an extended warranty (if available) as the picture issue seems to be a common defect.

Reviews.Title: Missed the mark...
Reviews.Author: Terry L. Kaeseberg
Reviews.Content: Visio 60" LED 1080P 120Hz smart HDTV, Model E601i-A3Picture and sound are up to par and seem adequate. keypad side of of remote is almost useless. Has great picture. No wow here.Two hugh disappointments are: One; the internet connectivity is through a Yahoo interface except for Netflix. This means all the great content now available on the internet is funneled through Yahoo. You might say so what. Well use this Yahoo interface for a short time and you'll discover that it's extremely difficult to use. Why? The strongest negative is the fact that it's only displayed on the left third of the screen which makes it cumbersome to to view. Now don't forget this is a 60" TV and it's still unacceptable to me to utilize only 33% of the screen. What was Visio thinking. At least give an option to expand the Yahoo interface size. Try viewing Amazon Prime videos like that and when you do Yahoo/Visio does not allow you to view your "watchlist" to play your pre-chosen video... REALLY!! I find that I will no longer use the Yahoo interface. As stated earlier Netflix views full screen because it does not view through the Yahoo portal. The whole Yahoo interface makes the Wifi almost worthless!!!Now the second disappointment; When Visio does a software update, (which it does automatically and you can't stop it) it wipes out all your settings.... Yes It wipes all your wireless internet settings, all your Yahoo interface settings and Netflix password settings. All your passwords for each individual app and Wifi settings will be lost. It took me over an hour to re-install all the passwords. This sucks and I just won't do it again! Why would you design an HDTV that wipes all your setting every time a software update is done. This is not new technology and one would think they would have field tested this HDTV. Guess not. Then while you are using the keypad side of the remote to speed re-entry up you will find the darn thing is rather intermittent and you have to sit right in front of the TV to get it to work somewhat.I have two Visio HDTV's and don't think I will be buying another. Buy the way this is my second 60" as the first lasted 5 months and had to be replaced. Visio was very good to work with.Just my 2 cents worth. Hope this helps someone.

Reviews.Title: Good Picture. Firmware/Apps could use some more work.
Reviews.Author: Carl Clark
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV to wall-mount in a place that it could be used for our dining area and Kitchen. Cannot speak to the quality of the mount that came with the TV.....not a huge fan of the look of it from an Engineering standpoint...but it does help the form factor of the TV itself..Used in Conjunction with a mount from MonoPrice, Since this TV was at the small range that the mount was intended for, the huge mounting plate covers up several of the inputs on the back of the TV........If these inputs were important to me, I could probably use a Hacksaw on the mount, but it isn't worth it at this point.Impressed with the Picture quality on this TV.  Good colors, fluid motion,  no Soap Opera effect that I seem to get from any other LED.Not impressed at all with the WIFI - Probably okay for the small weather widgets etc., but Netlix and Pandora were glitchy and froze often. This TV also seems to forget all the Apps that I installed from the marketplace, and I have to go digging around for them....In the end, I just rely on my Seagate Media player for the Apps.I can't speak to the tuning quality of the TV, I use Media Center Extender from an Xbox 360 to watch TV.For an LED/LCD TV, I am not completely ashamed of the speakers.  Not Bass heavy, but for its purpose, the speakers are plenty good....If I need true Cinema quality sound...I'll go to the mancave for 7.1...All in all, I likely should have just purchased a more basic-non-smart TV and saved money since I was unimpressed by the Apps. They would likely work better in a wired Ethernet connection...but that port is blocked by the mounting plate...  Not exactly Vizio or Amazon's problem...but it factors in to my rating. May end up swapping this TV out with a different one so I can take advantage of the apps with a wired Ethernet connection.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I was looking for
Reviews.Author: Donald Sensing
Reviews.Content: I like to go to our back deck and watch TV in the evening, especially baseball games. Having a Monsoon Vulkano Vulkano Flow Mobile Device for Viewing TV on the Go, I have long been streaming TV to my notebook computer, but I wanted a larger screen. I also use a Toshiba Thrive tablet Toshiba Thrive 10.1-Inch 32 GB Android Tablet AT105-T1032 Black, which has a full-size HDMI output and streams the Vulkano, too.The Vizio is ideal for my back-deck viewing. I hook it to the Thrive and get a great picture in HD in the perfect size for my purposes. And I can use my notebook as a computer at the same time instead of just a viewer. This size TV is perfect for portability into and out of the house, too.I opted for the internet-connected Vizio only because it was only $20 more than the non-internet model. Obviously, I thought, I can get all the Vizio apps and Netflix, etc, on the tablet, so would not really need the TV's connectivity. While this is true, I still use the Vizio's connection and apps for non-TV viewing. There are also some useful other apps such as the Wall Street Journals's financial app and other news feeds.Setup, including in internet and apps, was super simple. I have nothing but compliments for this product.

Reviews.Title: Vizio E601i-A3 60-inch TV: Great picture, until it died...
Reviews.Author: MMREDSOX "BUFF Nav"
Reviews.Content: I had this TV for about 3 months - purchased 14 Dec 2012 - and the picture died while watching the NCAA basketball conference playoffs - not a good time to die when you're a sports enthusiast. Sound was still on and there was dim backlight, but no picture. I did some quick research and noted numerous complaints regarding this model experiencing the same problem -- seems to happen to a lot of these TVs bought over the 2012 holidays.I contacted Vizio the next day and found out they have a customer support team specifically set up to handle this now well-known problem -- pretty much admitting it is something they expect. When I explained what happened they immediately offered a choice of maintenance support in 3-5 days, or they would ship a new one in 8-14 days. No questions asked. I didn't want to go through this again in a few months so I asked how they are addressing the problem on the newer models now, specifically the one they would send us. They said they have changed out the questionable boards on this model so I opted for a new replacement to be delivered and am currently awaiting shipment.As for the TV itself, when it was working prior to the failure, set up was easy and the picture was excellent, except for some pixelation during fast action. I'm not sure if some of that was due to the board or if that is common with this TV. The sound is adequate only, so I connected it through a receiver so I get surround sound watching movies or playing video games.  BluRay video with the surround sound is awesome -- Avatar was visually amazing on this unit.Bottomline: Wonderful picture and easy set up -- would've been great if it hadn't died.I will update this posting when I receive the replacement and take some time to evaluate quality and reliability. It has history against it, but I will try to keep an open mind...

Reviews.Title: You cannot do better for under 1K
Reviews.Author: carpe_noctum
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic TV for an unreal price. Everything looks great and sounds horrible (more on that later).Pros:- Its incredibly thin and light- Fantastic apps that let you connect to Hulu Plus, Netflix and Amazon. Also apps for Weather and Facebook, but I havent used those. Also a bunch of Yahoo apps, I don't know anyone who uses yahoo anymore.- Picture is beautiful. I did not have any of the problems the others seem to haveI'm a bit of a 'con-man' (har har!), but the ones below are all minor and I really like this TV overall.Cons:- The wifi setup was a little hokey and failed for me a few times. But like everything else, I restarted the TV and sure enough it worked like a charm.- Sound is horrible. Really we're talking 80's atari here. As a I understand most of these  super thin TVs have poor sound, I would at-least get a sound bar to go with it.- Remote is awkward. While I applaud the effort to put in a full keyboard, it just feels funny when you hold it in your hand. Also I kept putting my fingers in the front when typing on the keyboard, which blocks the IR signal.- There are 3 buttons at the top of the remote Amazon, Netflix (all good), and M-go. The M-go app does not work, and even their website does not say much. Why stick a button if its not ready?

Reviews.Title: Just what I wanted.
Reviews.Author: T. Christensen
Reviews.Content: First, thanks to all the great reviews here, they helped me make what I feel is the best purchase for my needs. I'm adding to the reviews because I wanted to praise the ease of set up. 30 minutes from box to watching Big Bang Theory. Had the wifi set up, the tv set up, speakers and getting the hang of the remote and settings.It will take some time to figure out all the smart features, but I don't think it will take much. Already Netflix and Amazon set up. I'm hoping I'll be able to add Pandora easily.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture, Meh Sound
Reviews.Author: cjwend
Reviews.Content: I had higher expectations from the other reviews of this model. It's great for the price picture wise but the sound is lacking.  I feel like I am constantly turning it up and trying new equalizer combinations, only to find that it sounds like it's coming from far away.  So if you are using separate speakers this would not matter.  It is a Smart TV with built in access to Netflix, Hulu Plus etc, which is why I bought it.  I'm not sure if this is the fault of Hulu or the TV but I have to say using Netflix has been seamless, using Hulu has not been so seamless.  I have had bad connections, choppy sound and video.  Constantly turning it off and on again to try to get it to work, sometimes it does and sometimes it doesn't.  I bought this model  to take advantage of the wifi capabilities because my router is far from the TV, so I know I could move it and plug it in directly and maybe that would alleviate the issues, but I'm not convinced and that would defeat the point of having wifi.

Reviews.Title: The BEST value in TV's...period
Reviews.Author: Brad
Reviews.Content: I am extremely happy with this TV.  I did extensive online research and found that this TV has everything that I want and the price cannot be beat.  The delivery service used by Amazon was fantastic.  They set up the TV, tested it, and left with a smile.  It was an all-around fantastic experience.TV reviews go into a lot of detail about specs that the average viewer will never experience or understand.  All you need to know is that the picture is amazing and this TV is almost certainly better than your current TV.  I watched a weekend worth of football, racing, and Blu-Ray movies.  Everything was a HUGE step up from my previous HDTV.  My previous TV also was 1080P and 120 Hz, yet this Vizio blows it away.  Even my wife, who could not care less, commented that the picture was an amazing change from the previous TV.Picture:  Very clear and crisp.  I am amazed at how the picture gives depth.  It almost looks 3D.  Very impressive.  My commented that she could now see all of the detail in people's faces.  It is that clear.  Blu-Ray was amazing.  Sports (football and racing) was very smooth action and crystal clear.  The picture is crisp, all the way to the edge.Connections:  We are using HDMI.Form:  Very thin bezel, which looks very nice.  The stand is basic, but looks nice.  I also appreciate that they do not use a bright "power on" light on the TV.  It is just a very dim white light in the lower left corner.  The TV is also very thin.Sound:  I cannot comment on the sound, as I use a surround sound system and I turn the TV speakers off.Remote:  The remote is very cool.  It has a QWERTY keyboard on the flip side, for use with the Smart features.As you can tell, I am extremely happy with the TV, Amazon's service, the price, and the delivery.

Reviews.Title: Great bang for your buck.
Reviews.Author: PCBRain
Reviews.Content: Got this TV in Walmart on Black Friday (actually Thursday night) sale, I was looking for something that's about 65" but the price for this one was a thousand (700 off MSRP) it was too good to pass up. They had only 4 in stock and I was lucky enough to be the 4th person in line and I got this after 2 hours of waiting.I've read the reviews on both CNET and here on Amazon before I made this purchase and it is living up to the hype, on CNET this is rated in the top 10 of TVs above 60" in 1080P, counting the fact that list includes also Plasma TVs, this is the best bang for your buck. There are already plenty of reviews here on this TV so I won't make another repeat except for the fact that I love it. One thing I do want to mention is that at first I've experienced a slight lag in response time during gaming, a fraction of a second delay to when I press the buttons on the controller to when actions do happen on screen, it was pretty frustrating till I messed around with the settings, turns out all I had to do is turn on the "game mode" and the lag goes away completely. There are videos on youtube where people talk about this problem and some say you have to set the picture mode to "gaming" which isn't really necessary, just flip the TV to "game mode" and problem solved.This is the first Vizio I own, coming from a bulky 51" LCD projection TV this is a huge upgrade, I know TVs these days are getting bigger and cheaper and not made to last, but hopefully this one would last me as long as the previous one did for 9 years.

Reviews.Title: Very good for the money but Amazon Video app is HORRIBLE, esp if you have Amazon Prime
Reviews.Author: Gardening Girl
Reviews.Content: Good tv with slim edge outline, with pretty good color and quality although difficult to really fine-tune the tint. Excellent for the money. Netflix app is very good. But if you have Amazon Prime and expect to be able to use your Watchlist with the app, think again. It is horrendous to try to search over and over for things you were watching, even just to resume a program you stopped in the middle of. The Amazon Video button is right on the remote, but it lacks even the most basic of functions. To properly use Amazon Prime on any Vizio TV, you're going to have to buy a box such as Roku. Be forewarned: Amazon and Vizio have no plans to make the app better. A great failing.

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a great price.
Reviews.Author: HRKC
Reviews.Content: This is our second Vizio. We have a 21" in our bedroom. The picture of this 70" is wonderful. This coupled with our surround sound system makes watching television even more enjoyable. The controls on the remote are easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful.  CNET was right.
Reviews.Author: PedroD "PedroD"
Reviews.Content: CNET voted it best value for it's size.  I bought a used model that was obviously used as a display in a store somewhere.  It came without a remote and was stuck in "demo mode".  Don't care about the remote, I can use the menu button on the side to change settings and my Fios remote to control the TV for normal operation, right?  Wrong. Demo mode disables the TV side buttons and is IMPOSSIBLE to change WITHOUT the remote (trust me, I checked with Vizio).The TV also came without a power cord (which wasn't listed as missing).  No problem, any old LED TV power cord works.So I buy a remote and a power cord to get the TV working.  Still giving the TV 5 stars because it's awesome and Amazon gave me credit to pay for the TV and remote.  Amazon's customer support was incredibly prompt and courteous.  Can't say enough about how awesome Amazon is.

Reviews.Title: Looks fantastic for the price (I'd say it's visually just as good as the more expensive brands)
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This TV looks great and the sound is good - it cut cable and stream everything else through Netflix, Hulu, Prime, and Vudu. I wish I could give 4.5 stars cus the ONLY thing missing from this SmartTV is a web browser. I looked through all the downloadable apps but that's not offered. However, I have my computer connected to it if I want to use it for browsing (just would've been nice to have it integrated so I don't have to turn my PC on)

Reviews.Title: Own it, but prefer Toshiba 32 ClearScan 120Hz picture
Reviews.Author: James W. Goetsch "Data Architect"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Visio 32" smart tv almost a year ago.  It is working fine in my remodeled kitchen on the wall.  My initial complaint is the cheap remote control, worst remote I've had in a long time.  I also have a 42" LG Plasma 720 and Panasonic 50" 1080 Plasma 3D tv in my home to compare to.  Now I just purchased a Toshiba 32 Inch 720p LED HDTV ClearScan 120Hz (32L2300)to replace the last tube tv in  my home.  The picture on the Toshiba is MUCH clearer then this Visio (I had them next to each other).  Now, the Toshiba isn't a smart tv, but its picture is beautiful and I got it on a 1-day sale for just $199.  I would have paid $309 for it like I did for this Visio.

Reviews.Title: Great Tv At first
Reviews.Author: Nicholas Iannelli
Reviews.Content: Ok I am a huge fan of buying electronics on Amazon. For the price and a 50 inch tv it is great. The features you get for the value like built in wifi is also great. Picture quality is good. Sound quality sucks. Well then again no flat screen has ggod sound lol so no complaint there. The only real downside to this tv for the first 7 months is the warm-up time. You can take a nap waiting for the tv to turn on. Again this was all acceptable for the price.Now for the disaster. Ive owned this tv for 9 months now. One month ago the Tv began Flickering and having lines going through it bad. Like 50% of the screen. Not all the time. It has its moods. Some days normal. Other days when im already in a bad mood it is as well. You all can relate to that. Anyways I monitored it for a week and then called Vizio as Im under there standard warranty for purchaseing a tv. Well first they make me check this and that power cord etc and nothing worked. Then they went on to the cable box being the issue. So I say my dvd player does it as well. Either way that phone call went no where. Followed there steps being re-assured everything would be ok if we just did things step by step. So I did the cable box and even went as far as to have my cable tech speak with them over the phone while he was here.After finally admitting that it could be one of many different problems like main board, this circuit or that....blah blah it was basically a defect in there tv. So they tell me they will fix it for free. Well heres the real kicker. I have to MAIL the tv back to them. Now two problems. One I live in a small house so i was unable to save the tv box it was shipped in. And two I have to pay to SHIP the tv to them. That is not the kind of service I expect from a company that I just spent 750.00 on one of there products. And if most of you are like me a hard working blue collar person, well you know we can afford a tv of this purchase once every 7 or 8 years. So for now I'm stuck with a tv that flickers whenever it feels like.So please be weary of this Tv or any of vizios tv with that kind of customer support. You may be buying a feature rich tv but at what cost? Hope this helps the next person

Reviews.Title: 24" LED HDTV  It's ok but.
Reviews.Author: MarcFTL "MarcFTL"
Reviews.Content: Update,  I returned the defective 24" for the 29".After about a week, the audio stated getting higher and lower and I would get 3 "Siren" Sounds.The set would then reset. I am done with this Vizio Junk.  It is going back to Amazon.I just setup and installed a VIZIO E-Series E241i-A1 24-Inch 1080p 60Hz LEDThe Pros:The unit is very light and slim.Good sharp image with Dish, Netflix and Amazon.The MGO Service is not working yet but it says "Coming Soon"The Cons:Horrible tinny sound.  Definitely needs external speakers.The A/C power and RJ-45 Ethernet inputs are directly in line with the wall mounting holes in the back so when I put the brackets on, the two ports are blocked. This was just down-right way freaking stupid to design this way.I had to do a some "engineering" to get the brackets in the right position so I could still wall mount it and not block the ports.For the price its an OK TV especially with the included internet Apps.  I had a ROKU box attached to my old LCD TV and now I can move that to another room. If it was not for the Apps, I would probably returned this item for a unit with better sound.BTW,  This is my second unit.  The first was damaged by UPS and one corner was bashed hard enough to flatten a corner, split the Styrofoam and do some damage to the corner edge of the TV.I do have to say that Amazon overnight-ed me a new set and sent a UPS Call Tag for the damaged unit.  This is a main reason that I do so much business with Amazon.Update!The unit has rebooted twice in the last 10 minutes.  Had enough. sending this back.. I am going to try the 29" and see if it is any better operationally and sound wise.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful TV with a great value
Reviews.Author: Joshua Scott "lesmis"
Reviews.Content: It's a great TV.  Amazing quality for the price.  Are there better quality TV's out there?  Sure.  Are there better quality TV's out there for this price and size?  Not even close.  You would need to almost double the price to find something comparable.  There are about 9 varieties of the sharp 70" TV's out there right now.  And you would need to purchase near the top of the line 70" Sharp with quattron technology to get the same picture quality.  That TV, the LC-70LE845U, is selling for $2,600 right now.  Sure it has 3D, but who cares about that anymore.  And keep in mind that the $2,600 TV is not better in quality, just the cheapest thing you can get with similar picture quality.This TV looks amazing.  It's the best bang for your buck out there.  Does that mean you have to sacrifice your amazing picture quality blu-ray movie nights?  NO.  Not at all.  This TV delivers amazing quality while still being very affordable.  It really is wine quality on a beer budget.I also own a top of the line Samsung with 9 million : 1 contrast ratio with full array LED.  Does it have better picture quality? yeah, it does.  It also cost me $5,500.  So if you have the cash and are looking for the best TV out there, go with OLED 4K Television.  If you are like the rest of us and would like to get amazing quality without breaking the bank, buy this TV!!

Reviews.Title: Vizio rocks!
Reviews.Author: Frank Thomas
Reviews.Content: One word for this TV. Fantastic! Out of the box and running in no time. The base attaches easily, the one-time setup for wi-fi is simple. I've had it for a little over a week now, and love the picture quality and screen size. And the price was right. I passed on the third-party warranty; sounded bogus from the reviews I read.

Reviews.Title: Customer Service is Great
Reviews.Author: R. wells
Reviews.Content: I bought this item from Amazon and used their delivery service. The product was good until day 65 .......it broke (picture disappeared, but the sound remained). Luckily, that was within the 90 day warranty period, so Vizio replaced it for free, including delivery and pickup of the broken one. The customer service was great, but it took nearly 20 days to arrive. It was over the holidays, so there were limited business days.I would rate higher considering the good picture and great value, but it broke so soon and the warranty is so short, I am nervous.

Reviews.Title: Very good value
Reviews.Author: Jody Mandel
Reviews.Content: The wifi set up was great.  The tv found y network immediately.The rest of the setup was easy.The picture is very good.I would recommend this tv.It has a narrower frame than some other TVA this size, so it is mostly tv.  You get a lot of tv in a small space.

Reviews.Title: Great When It Works 2/25/13 UPDATE!!!!!
Reviews.Author: V. Jones
Reviews.Content: ok i brought TWO of these sexy tv's from WalMart on Black Friday for 688.00. i give one to my mom for Christmas and i kept one. as of today my mom t is working just fine. but my tv is a different story. after hooking it up to Dirtectv HD it worked just fine for about 5 hours, then the left side of the screen went dark. (see my pictures up top)i turned it off and back on the next day and it played just fine with no issues. but i don't want to take no chances so i called Vizio and they will be replacing it in 8-13 days with a new one.when it works its worth 5 stars. but i will update this once i get the new one and use it for a while.UPDATE 02/25/2013 its been a few weeks since the switch out and the tv works GREAT!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Impressive at first blush, then tragedy down the rabbit hole
Reviews.Author: R Rated "Keeping it real"
Reviews.Content: First, let me state I am NOT a tech geek.  I'd like to be but those cards weren't dealt my way so allow me to go boldly forward with a consumer review from one not gifted with electronic wizardly traits.  The Vizio has replaced my old rear projection Mitsubishi 65" model that bit the big one after about 10 years of service.  I chose the 70" Vizio as I choose most of my major purchases and that is, which can provide me the most bang for the buck?  (See UPDATE below that explains a flaw in this purchase and thinking).  Also, UPDATE #2 is most telling.After checking out the marketplace, it came down to the following manufacturers:  Panasonic, Samsung, Sharp and Vizio.  I gave $1600 for the Vizio, or $400 less than the Sharp and over a thousand under the 65" offerings of Panasonic and Samsung.  Still, I wanted to be sure the Vizio would hold up, offer up an excellent picture and be easy to use.  (See Update #2)Setting up the Vizio was relatively easy or should I say, without frustration.  As was the case with the Panasonics, I had to calibrate the picture settings to my liking right away.  The standard setting picture on the Vizio was weak and washed out in my view but this was quickly corrected by going through and adjusting the various settings for color temp, picture preference (I choose VIVID), reds, greens, blues and many other settings.  I experimented until I got exactly what I wanted: A picture that POPPED off the screen to the point where it looks as if you're looking through an open window at the offerings.I was also able to tie the Vizio into my home wireless network and checked it out through one of the loaded internet sites, YouTube in this case, and was rewarded with good access.  I was a little miffed that the Vizio failed to come with a web browser installed, nor did it have Skype loaded in but no big deal.  Still, those would have been nice to have.  Getting my Directv remote synched with the Vizio was also easy and without drama.  The true test will be over time but for now, I have a MAJOR ISSUE with this TV!  (See update #2)8 MONTH UPDATE:There's an annoying and repeating problem of sorts with the TV in that it fails to consistently hold a signal or picture consistently.  It doesn't happen all that often but will blink at you every hour of viewing a few times, that is, the picture freezes-goes black-then returns all within a second or two.  The Vizio is set up just like my other 3 TVs in the house which include two Panasonics and a Samsung.  None of the other TVs has this issue so it leaves me with the opinion that there's something defective in the inner workings of the Vizio, perhaps inferior video boards or wiring?  Other than that, the picture is first rate, and the TV grabs onto wireless offerings such as Netflix without issues MOST of the time.I say MOST, because I find myself having to re-set the access code to my home wifi every 4-6 weeks with the Vizio.  Given a choice again, based on my experience, I'd probably go with a different brand and pay $500+ for the honor.  The Vizio is an 'OK' TV but the others like the Panasonics and Samsung in my home have set the quality bar too high for the Vizio to match.  Be advised.UPDATE #2:I'm now sadly convinced that buying this TV was a mistake!  It won't hold a signal, continually turns itself off and sometimes takes 5-10 minutes before it will turn back on.  I've re-set the TV per instructions by unplugging it, holding the power button on the TV to the on position for 30 seconds, plugging it back in and thus re-setting it to manufacturer's specs which works for a short time before reverting back to its unceremoniously secession of power trick.  The Vizio tech reps run away from you when pressed for an answer on this or any other issue, so what I have is a very expensive boat anchor.I don't expect Vizio to be in the marketplace much longer or, to re-brand itself with another name in order to continue their fleecing of the consumer buying public.  Be advised.

Reviews.Title: WOW, i cannot believe the quality of this TV.
Reviews.Author: Johnathan Bringmann
Reviews.Content: This TV is amazing!!!  Setup was super easy, just 3 screws for the stand.Picture setting out of the box is a little bad. but that's expected of factory settings.  Found these settings off of cnet.com for a dimly lit room and the picture looks spot on now! Well worth the money spent.http://forums.cnet.com/7723-19410_102-574831/vizio-e601i-a3-picture-settings/---Picture settings menu---Picture Mode: MovieBacklight: 53Brightness: 50Contrast: 75Color: 51Tint: 0Sharpness: 0---Size & Position submenu---[no change]---Color Temperature submenu---Colour temperature: NormalRed Gain: 104Green Gain: 115Blue gain: 130Red offset: 129Green offset: 130Blue offset: 132--Advanced Picture submenu---Smooth motion effect: OffReal Cinema Mode: Smooth [grayed out]Noise Reduction: OffMPEG NR: OffColor Enhancement: OffAdaptive Luma: OffFilm Mode: AutoBacklight Control: OffAmbient Light sensor: Off

Reviews.Title: Great for price.  Take time to adjust picture.
Reviews.Author: greeneptune7
Reviews.Content: I removed one star only because the picture has a slight tint (greenish) that must be corrected through some effort.  I noticed this in the store when I was comparing it with others, but still thought this had better overall picture quality than other top brands in the same price range.Take the time to make the picture meet your needs... it make take up to an hour or several days of tinkering.  But overall, the picture is clear, bright, and more than satisfactory.  My TV has one dead (black) pixel in the lower left, but I got over it since it's barely noticeable.Other things to note:-Has option to turn off the annoying smart dimmer and ambient light sensor (bad features in my opinion)-No headphone jack, as TVs this size usually don't.-Does not have separate composite and component inputs in back.  The green component cable input doubles as the yellow video composite input.-Has one audio RCA stereo output (red/white connectors)-Has wifi which is nice especially for netflix, which is also built in.-Many LED backlit tvs can't get a perfect light spread and might show bleeding on the edges.  This tv has very slight bleeding,almost unnoticeable.-TV Start-up time is about 10seconds-Limited apps that can be installed, and browsing through app menus is sometimes time consuming.Overall, I am happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Perfect For Me
Reviews.Author: Anne Heath
Reviews.Content: The TV was delivered in less than 48 hours, with not a scratch. Initial hook up with my basic cable DVR had a minor glitch. I had to run the channel scan 4 times to get the "signal". To be honest I did call Vizio support. Very nice and polite young man calmed me down and said run the scan again (4th time) Bam! sound and vision have arrived. Tech support is I think in the USA, which is great. I have a bit of a hearing problem and if the person has an accent I have a hard time understanding directions. Ok  I am going to get a new cable box with a HDMI connection because I want HD. But the regular picture is really good. As mentioned I don't hear well and the sound on the TV was just fine for me at level 22. I'm very happy with the TV. Can't beat it for the price and of course Amazon is super with delivery time and tracking info. Happy Mothers Day To Me

Reviews.Title: Incredible Vizio led tv
Reviews.Author: Brian J. Topping
Reviews.Content: , The first tv arrived with a cracked screen. Amazon was understanding and fast in having me return it and without hesitation sent a replacement immediately. The tv is astonishing. Beautiful, clear, vibrant colors, incredible detailed images, fast 120Hz recovery speed. Fast Wi-Fi and component set up. A pure bargain. Don't buy anything more expensive in this size. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great picture and great price!
Reviews.Author: Lesley Taylor
Reviews.Content: We love it. It's a fantastic TV--the picture quality is just as good, if not better, than some other big name TVs but without the inflated price. The sound is actually good too. We did not need to buy a separate sound bar. We have Netflix, so I love the idea of being able to watch streaming movies to this TV without the Wii attached to it. Also, the super slim frame is killer. This was a great buy!!! We are very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Ditto: Best 60" LED TV you can find for the price
Reviews.Author: Veese
Reviews.Content: Yep, buy it. Very happy with this TV purchase and Amazon's delivery service. Better than average HD LED picture in this price range. You can find better quality LED TVs but not one this size for the cost. I also own a 50" Samsung LED set and love it as well but this large 60" screen will blow you away. Wifi setup is easy and works without any hitch. I can easily stream digital content from Netflix and Amazon's Video service.Amazon's delivery service is fabulous. Second time I've had a TV delivered by them and very happy with the care and knowledge my delivery guy demonstrated.Recommended this set highly!My tips:You can download a full user manual PDF from Vizio's website. Helpful if you want to tweak your TV settings deeper than listed in the setup guide. Manual is nicely setup and easy to use.Delete any apps on the bottom screen main menu once you decide which ones you are not likely to use. Will make it easier to scroll through any favorites. Manual will show you how.I did also use the picture settings another reviewer has kindly listed here. While they are good, I still like to set the picture quality to "VIVID" which makes the image brighter and sharper. Which is what makes an LED set so great...in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Television!!!
Reviews.Author: BradyFeldhaus
Reviews.Content: When i bought this television it was only 1000 bucks... a 60 inch for a 1000 bucks with a great picture, clear cinematics, and gamer mode for my xbox and ps3... Yes, and thank you!On a side note it also has 4 hdmi inputs... which is 1 extra then you'll usually use. This is a "badass" television for it's price... but I would recommend the 4 year warranty plan just because it's good to have peace of mind.

Reviews.Title: BEWARE!!! WIFI WORTHLESS & UI is JUNK!!!
Reviews.Author: Ian D. Smith "ENERDROID"
Reviews.Content: SHORT AND SWEET!For people looking at this TV for the two features I did be warned.  Initially I was trying to choose between a better 32 inch Samsung + Roku 3 or the Vizio Smart TV with VIA.  The two important features for me in this decision were WIFI and UI.  BOTH of which the Vizio COMPLETELY fails at.WIFI:Even when it works it sucks.  Don't even try blaming my home network router or anything else.  I have dozens of different wifi capable devices that all run FLAWLESSLY on my wifi.  I have a very high end wireless network and the Vizio WIFI is complete garbage.  This is a regular complaint.  Search for yourself.UI:WOW!!! where to even start.  How bout with how slow and unresponsive the UI is in general.  The apps are as basic as they could be with little to no information about programs, previous episodes or anything.  Seriously, VIA is complete junk.  There is no comparison between the app quality of VIA compared to apps on platforms like Xbox, PS3 or ROKU.  They are LIGHT YEARS behind.Quality of product in general stinks.  My unit has shown to be defective after just one evening of use.  My only huge regret beside buying the tv in the first place is not buying it from Amazon.Should have gone with my initial gut feeling and spent $50 more and purchased a NON smart Samsung TV and the ROKU 3.  I was lured by the idea of having an all in one solution and it was a terrible mistake.

Reviews.Title: Panel failure before 60 days
Reviews.Author: Hoover
Reviews.Content: I bought this T.V. in October for 999.00$ then a month later it was everywhere for 690.00$. If that wasn't frustrating enough after about 40 days my T.V.  picture went out.I was out of the thirty day return window to Amazon so I contacted Vizio, to there credit there customer service was good and they sent me another T.V.The delivery company they used were much better than Amazons they actually came in set up the T.V. and took the old one away.The company Amazon used sent only one guy and he was trying to carry the box by himself up my stairs so I gave him a hand and he seemed like he was in a rush but atleast he helped me get the T.V. out the box before he left.T.V. REVIEWThe T.V. out of the box didn't have the greatest picture the colors were kinda off and they didn't seem naturalThere was significant back lighting bleed through during start-up but it wasn't noticeable while watching programs except very slightly during real dark scenes.I also had the lip synch issue which was really bad on certain channels. I bought a AVR ( receiver) and ran everything to my receiver then from the receiver to the T.V. . This seemed to have improved/fixed the lip sync issue but this isn't practical for everyone.I decided to try some picture settings I found on AVS FORUM after a little adjusting I was satisfied with the picture quality.BOTTOM LINEIt is unacceptable for a T.V. to fail within 40 days, Lip synch issues are unacceptable, bad internet apps/ processing slow. It is a new model T.V and the complaints are just starting to role in on the picture failure many are experiencing, I have a feeling this is gonna be a widespread problem and even though they gave me a new T.V. I'm just not comfortable with what to expect from a reliability standpoint.

Reviews.Title: Worked fine for a few months
Reviews.Author: A Music Addict "Rory"
Reviews.Content: I had no issue with this TV until a few weeks ago, when it started shutting itself off at random times, and it is making a popping noise when it turns off, like the speaker popping, or perhaps some kind of electrical short.This has nothing to do with overheating or anything like that, the TV could be off the whole day, I come home from work, turn it on, and it happens 5 minutes later.I unplugged the TV because I'm concerned it might cause a fire, and I am currently waiting for a response from Vizio for my RMA.

Reviews.Title: Decent TV, nothing spectacular
Reviews.Author: Jeremy Stewart
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in the market for a new TV and looking to replace a 32" VIZIO LCD that we had in the bedroom that was slowly dying ( we did have it for about 7 years, so I felt that was fairly acceptable for a TV I spent $300 and change on ). I wanted something that supported DLNA as I have a media server with rips of our DVDs & Blu-ray purchases.Overall the TV is very nice.  The presets aren't too bad, and once you turn off the adaptive backlight control the picture can be really nice.  The one place where this panel can struggle is in really dark scenes, where even with all the noise & artifact reduction set to the max, you'll still see the noise in the background.  It's definitely more noticeable compared to the Samsung 47" LCD we have in the living room.  It doesn't make it unwatchable and after about 2 weeks with the TV I am noticing it less, but likely only because I'm getting used to it.  In bright colorful scenes, this TV is absolutely gorgeous and you'll be pleased to have it, when watching dark shows like The Following, there will be scenes that are hit or miss.  Sound is actually pretty decent for these super thin TVs coming out now.  There does seem to be MORE sound directed BEHIND the television than in front, but it seems to direct it in front fairly well.  A sound bar would likely be a worthy investment for this TV ( or most ANY thin TVs now ), but it's not required ( just makes sure it's not against a shared wall if you're watching TV really loudly :) ).The three places where this TV kind of falls short are: DLNA Video format support, overall interface & the remote.  I think most everyone here has touched on the interface so I won't go too much into it, but it is slow & clunky to deal with.  Sometimes it is so slow it's difficult to know if it responded to your last input.  DLNA video support is very limited.  MP4 playback is non-existent, MKV also fails, and very few AVis actually play.  I updated my twonky server ( runs on a WD MyBook Live ) and it finally started to play some of the AVIs better.  I then updated the firmware on the TV and I had Amazon streaming too which is nice, but the UI is far from ideal.Finally, the remote.  The remote is terribly weak, where it has to be pointed DIRECTLY at the lower left corner of the TV for the commands to register, and if there's even the slightest blockage forget anything working.Overall, I don't reget the purchase, and getting it for $479 + tax is definitely a steal for a "Smart" TV of this size.  While it's not perfect it will more than suffice for watching TV before bed.

Reviews.Title: Good Buy
Reviews.Author: hen803
Reviews.Content: When I first started looking for a tv for my bedroom, I wasn't considering a smart tv. After researching several tvs that were not smart tvs I came across a review of the Vizio 32" smart tv. The price was just a little more and after considering everthing it made sense to purchase the Vizio smart tv. Tv was delivered 3 days earlier than estimated.  Set up was a breeze. Picture is ok, sometimes the picture is a little dark and colors are a little washed out. Adjusting the picture and color was easy. I'm satisfied with my purchase. I also purchased a blue ray player but I haven't tried it yet. I exect the picture playing videos to be find. Yes I would recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: Awesome tv
Reviews.Author: Sports fan
Reviews.Content: I am not one to write reviews on products but I am so impressed by this tv that I had to share my thoughts on how great this tv was! I'm a big movie and sports buff, so you can assume that I am very picky on the color and color accuracy on anything I watch. I just like the thought of knowing that I can watch football and see that the field is green and not some dark algae color like on some tvs. I read some reviews on cnet stating that the color isn't as accurate on panasonic brands and sharps which have a higher price tag. While that is somewhat true, if you read the reviews from others, if you set the color right, then you won't have to worry about the color. Just follow what one reviewer put on here or go to cnet for the color accuracy. The profile for this tv is so thin and the bezel is almost non existent! My friend was wary that I went away from the samsung and lg tvs. I have read reviews from all over and they all say it is a good value and I must say that it's true! You not only get a quality HDTV but a bargain! I already have a friend thinking of buying one now becausehe saw how beautiful the picture was once we set the color following cnets settings! Can't recommend this tv more! If you're in the market for a tv at the one grand price range then I say go for it! Just know that spending too much on an HDTV now would be foolish anyways because the new wave of tvs like 4k or oled dispays are going to be the new generation of tvs. Of course since I do not have 27000 dollars for a 4k tv, spending a grand on this one with all it's features and picture quality, is a steal!! I hope this review helps

Reviews.Title: Straight badass TV
Reviews.Author: Srfnjoe
Reviews.Content: I purchase this tv at Sam because amazon was out at the time. Best TV for the price!! I had a 42 inch LCD before and this 60 inch LED Vizio blows it out of the water. Everyone that has seen it is in aah. The picture is amazing, and the look of the tv is stunning. My buddy that is all about electronics is jealous to the max. He has a 55 inch 3d sharp. After seeing my tv he is now in the market for a 65-70 inch tv.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Donna Watkins
Reviews.Content: This TV replaced a 62" Toshiba.  The setup was so easy!  As soon as you turn it on and select Home setup it takes you through all the steps to connect to your internet and cable or satellite.  We had a HDMI cord so it was simply a matter of plugging one end to the TV and the other to the satellite box.  We also have WiFi internet so as soon as we put our password in it connected to the wireless router.  The TV picture is wonderful.  This TV is watched mainly by my husband and he is VERY pleased with his Christmas.  Also, it was scheduled to be delivered New Year's Eve day, but they delivered it on the 26th after calling us.  We were thrilled to get it a week earlier.

Reviews.Title: Fail for Netflix users
Reviews.Author: JB
Reviews.Content: Great TV so far if you don't expect to use Netflix. Like many, many others, my Netflix app refuses to work.  The very first screen loads OK with the listing of the top half dozen or so most popular movies playing, but when I click the on-screen button to connect to Netflix the TV immediately provides a connection error and recommends me to Netflix's website slash tvhelp.  I've tried every recommendation on Vizio's website and the internet at large, including resetting the TV, the Yahoo apps, some CEC or something enabling/disabling. DNS changes, etc. Everything is a fail.  Since Netflix was one of the reasons I purchased the TV, this is a DOA issue for me. Kind of like having working sound on a TV. If it's advertised as doing it, but it doesn't, then it's unfit for its intended purpose.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Value and well rounded features
Reviews.Author: S. Bhaidasna
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV as a replacement for my Panasonic Viera TC-P54VT25 plasma that my 3 year cracked it few months back.I think people don't think Vizio brand as high end as Samsung or Sony but believe me this TV is just amazing.I bought it through Amazon and the delivery service was great.Pros and cons:Pros:Everything, this TV can be customized to your heart's content. And it is a Smart TV. The colors are very accurate and very very good in bright room. The TV works great right outside the box but tweaking is needed for better picture quality. The QWERTY keyboard is heaven sent feature that all remotes should have it. It is so much easier to type things on screen when needed. This remote uses infrared to signal the TV, so you have to keep its sensor towards the TV but i was able to type perfectly fine from 14 feet away regardless of viewing angles, as long as you are pointed in its general direction.The best feature I love about this TV is its ability to play media via DLNA servers. As long as you are on the same network (Wifi or hard wired) you can listen to your music from your computer. This TV is definitely DLNA compatible.To make this feature work for you, i used Windows Media Player as Media Server and I was able to conveniently add music or save movies or videos to my computer's library, and watch & listen them on the Vizio.  All I have to do is Via Button>Media>and up pops the Computer's Library (DLNA 1) to use. I can also put .mkv or .mp4 movies/videos on USB flash drivers and it will play via its USB port but will not playback .avi files.Cons:1) This TV cannot match the black-level performance of Plasma, but definitely comes close to it after tweaking.2) Out-of-box needs tweaking for better picture quality3) You can download the Skype app, but will not work as this TV does not support Skype Camera of anytime.4)  There is a slight lag on the apps to cycle thought but not a deal breaker. But there is no way to configure the keys of the remote to your favorite apps.5) No 3D, but definitely not a deal breaker for me, my previous TV was 3D but IMHO i watched 3 3D movies in 3 years.6) The sound quality is awful from this TV so I definitely recommend using external sound source like surround sound systems.Here are my settings for the TV but you may change according to your liking:Hint: all picture settings can be changed, and there are lot of different settings in built.Picture Mode = CustomBacklight = 70 to 80Brightness = 54Contrast = 65Color = 49Tint = 0Sharpness = 3Color Temp = CustomRed Gain = 104Green Gain = 128Blue Gain = 0Red Offset = 129Green Offset = 128Blue Offset = 134Smooth Motion Effect = LowReal Cinema Mode = OffNoise Reduction = OffMPEG NR = OffColor Enhancement = OffAdaptive Luma = LowBacklight Control = OffAmbient Light Sensor = OffRemember, this is LED and not a plasma. If you want the best quality because you are videophile then go with plasma.Summary:Black Levels: Good but not great like plasmasColor Accuracy: Very accurate minor discolorationVideo Processing: Most of the movies are rendered 1080p/24 for its cadence. The Vizio has two settings that affect cadence/smoothness, named Smooth Motion Effect (SME) and Real Cinema Mode (RCM), and each has three positions. Among the possible combinations, the only one that rendered behavior as described above was Off/Off for both.The other SME settings introduce some level of artificial-looking smoothing/dejudder to film-based sources. As usual the Low/Medium/High options got progressively smoother. Meanwhile Real Cinema Mode (RCM) -- disabled when you turn off SME -- has Precision, Smooth, and Off settings of its own. Off introduced the least smoothing but did show that stuttering cadence; while Precision and Smooth, which introduced excessive smoothing again, looked basically the same to my eyes.Bright Light: It has matte finish, so no reflection, Works really good. But wish there as a glass in the front to protect the LED screen.Overall, this TV serves the purpose I wanted, cheap, superb picture quality with few compromises. I would say don't dismiss this TV because its a Vizio.

Reviews.Title: Amazing, beautiful, right-out-of-the-box picture!  Network capability a boon, too
Reviews.Author: William W. Davis "famousdavis"
Reviews.Content: QUICK SUMMARY:  This is my first Vizio anything.  I was surprised by the lightweight build of this HDTV, but very pleasantly surprised at how beautifully it renders a picture, even right out-of-the-box.  I haven't fiddled with any of the color adjustments because to me, the picture is pretty darn good as-is.  The Internet applications (Netflix, Amazon Prime) work as expected, although I used a wired connection rather than WiFi because the WiFi signal seemed poor.  Recommended!BACKGROUND:  My six-year-old Samsung 37" TV died, and I wanted a new TV for the upcoming 2014 Olympics.  Frustrated by a Samsung product that was used very lightly over the last six years and that I paid over $1000 for that TV, I opted to try another brand.  I thought about getting an LG, but I read a user review about a horrible LG product failure and subsequent warranty experience, so I moved to try Vizio instead (I understand that every brand has 5-star and 1-star experiences alike, including Vizio).  In my home, I hook-up the TV to my stereo for sound, so I don't care about the sound from the TV itself.  I don't use cable or satellite, but I do watch HD sports programs over-the-air.  My family likes streaming movies from Netflix and Amazon Prime, so the "smart" part of the TV was an important feature (good-bye Roku, you served us fairly well....).WHAT I LIKE:- Gorgeous picture, right out of the box.  Blacks are black/very dark, whites are brilliant white, color depth is great, contrast was great.- The viewing angles are all very good for where we have the TV placed; they are notably better than our six-year-old Samsung TV this TV is replacing.- The "smart" TV functions work well, are fairly easy to use (searching is a little difficult given the remote control's lack of a QWERTY keyboard).  We've streamed Netflix and Amazon Prime movies without a problem using those built-in apps.- It was very light to pick-up and move around- The slender, 42" diagonal profile barely fits into my existing entertainment armoire (where six years ago, only a 37" TV would fit because of the bulkier designs back then)- It has 3 HDMI inputs, which for my needs, is sufficient- It has component input for our Wii- It has an RCA audio output for easy connection to our stereo (an optical audio output, too, for when we upgrade our home sound system)WHAT COULD BE BETTER:- I miss the swivel base of our old Samsung TV; this base doesn't swivel, but it's easy enough to reposition if you need to (tip: place felt underneath the TV stand to make it easier to move- The Wifi signal it received from our router seemed weaker than what our Roku could obtain, so I switched it to a wired connection instead- The remote control doesn't have back-lit keysCONCLUSION:  Visually, I'm very pleased with this TV.  I bought a 4-year Square Trade warranty, though, so I don't have to buy another TV anytime soon.  Recommended!

Reviews.Title: Wow
Reviews.Author: DuctTape
Reviews.Content: Ok, I may not get out much. And with this TV I don't think I'm going out much either.Maybe 20 minutes opening box to getting mounted on the (existing) wall bracket to getting set up and on. And I am blow away. First movie playing was Transformers, which I wouldn't normally watch if it was free. I found I couldn't turn away! It was the Kramer of experiences for me.The colors were incredible. I didn't know eyes could be so blue. The depth just jumped. My wife kept asking if I had made a mistake and bought 3D. Some folks complained about the sound. We have a small bedroom and the sound was booming.Look, I'm sure there are better and newer and certainly bigger. We got the 42". But for the mid $400s, delivered next day by Amazon, I am one totally happy camper.If that isn't a lot of money to you, just spring for it. If you really labor over your bucks, feel comfortable with this purchase. Zero buyers remorse. Plenty of happiness and excitement.Five Stars. And then some.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the money...love the connection to wireless
Reviews.Author: Michelle Ross
Reviews.Content: Great picture and sound for the money and love not having to use any other connections to get to Netflix

Reviews.Title: This is by far the best TV we've ever had.
Reviews.Author: The Carfanman "Be more concerned with your ch...
Reviews.Content: So far, great picture and apps for the price.  We purchased the 70 inch version of this TV and after two weeks we are very very happy with it.  We got the tv because my wife's eyesite is a bit limited and our old 42 inch TV was tough for her to see across our living room.  Now she has zero problem seeing the TV and even said she feels like she's in a movie theather when watching the new Vizio.  Personally I am impressed aslo by the picture quality and the apps and how well sorted most of the user interfaces of the apps are.  The TV stand that came with the set seems fine and we mounted our TV on it and then on top of a tv cart/stand.  We might mount it on the wall later but for now we are happy with it being on it's stand.  This is by far the best TV we've ever had.

Reviews.Title: Best value-added purchase I've made for a TV in a long time :)
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: Worked straight out of the box.  Connected wirelessly to my WEP-enabled router.  Didn't pick up the WPA2-enabled router - not a biggie.Room doesn't have cable outlet (not a problem since I don't subscribe to cable), so wifi internet is a must-have.  Previously I had a Roku connected to the smaller, older TV.  This VIZIO with built-in internet capability replaces two items now.The Amazon and Netflix setup was simple and we were watching movies in no time.Haven't tried the "free" digital on-air signals since I won't invest in one of those signal converters.Purchased this using my Amazon Prime account so I got a discount on shipping and having this delivered in 2 days was very nice.The paperwork states lifetime tech support so that's good to have.  The price is very good and I'd recommend this item.If I run into any issues I'll come back and update this review.

Reviews.Title: Not a stable stand
Reviews.Author: honesty counts
Reviews.Content: Sorry but I had to send this back.  The back piece would not attach correctly, and, it seemed to be very unstable when I put in deeper screws that held it in more securely.  For me, this was a deal breaker, because the warranty did not cover accidental coverage and it seemed highly plausible that this TV would eventually fall over at some point.

Reviews.Title: Great deal on a quality television
Reviews.Author: S. Ullrich
Reviews.Content: First one was dead on arrival with a broken screen but Amazon sent another one immediately and provided me with free return shipping.  The second unit arrived overnight.  It was very easy to set up and configure for network access, picture size/quality, apps, etc.  The picture is great.  The built in speakers, like nearly all flat screens, point down and don't fill a room with theater quality sound but they do provide a very clean/clear sound.  I don't bother to turn on the home theater system for news, etc... and have forgotten about turning it on for programs I'm watching until I'm halfway through them.  Quick access to Amazon Instant Video, Pandora, Facebook, etc. through the apps buttons.  Great deal on a quality television.

Reviews.Title: Plenty of features along with excellent picture quality make this a very good value.
Reviews.Author: G
Reviews.Content: A fantastic HDTV at a very good price. The set seems smaller that 39", but its just the way it appears. I love the very low profile, small frame around the outer edges. The picture is bright and incredibly detailed. It's nice to have Netflix and Amazon apps built into it. The outer box shows a Youtube app, unfortunately it doesn't have one built in. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: So far very happy
Reviews.Author: Justin D. Cofer
Reviews.Content: Very light, pretty easy set-up and very good picture. great for wall mount. Very happy for the price and I Will rereview it in a month.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful 1080p screen
Reviews.Author: William Robertson II "WRob"
Reviews.Content: I got this TV refurbished on the cheap a few months ago, and I love it. It's 1080p, so the clarity is fantastic, the refresh rate leaves nothing to be desired, and the internet connectivity and apps (although not TOO terribly useful) are fun and occasionally handy.Picture quality is great, dynamic contrast is solid, colors look good, and sound is...well, it's built-in, so it won't "wow" you, but it's fine. It has two NICs, so it can connect wirelessly or over Ethernet, which is nice. All the inputs are listed above, and they're easily accessible...for the most part. I found that connecting coaxial input was a bit difficult, but it's a one-time thing, anyway.I don't use the internet apps much, but I do sometimes use YouTube, which makes for a very nice viewing experience. I would complain about the inefficiency of using the remote to search for videos, but it's trivial enough to use another device (e.g. a smartphone) to control your TV (if you don't know how, the YouTube app on the TV gives instructions and even a useful QR code).Fantastic buy, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy - defective units still exist - Vizio avoids replacing
Reviews.Author: Jon Langevin
Reviews.Content: The E701i-A3 model (70") from Vizio *still* has defects causing the screen to go black during playback.The backlight is completely off when this happens (so complete black), yet the audio continues. Waiting several minutes results in the picture coming back, or alternatively bringing the TV system menu up brings the picture back.This has been observed across multiple devices connected via HDMI, and all HDMI cables have been replaced, yet the problem persists, with the common appliance being the TV each time.The problem is intermittent/randomly occurring, yet I've had it occur on 3 E701i-A3 models now (after the first model from Amazon, two replacement subsequently arrived from Vizio, both new, both exhibiting same issue). I've been dealing with this problem since May 2013...Vizio refuses to actually resolve the issue, so all I can say is, don't buy this tv.It's a great TV otherwise, but until Vizio gets their act together, it's not worth the pain & hassle that you'll suffer dealing with Vizio on this issue.I've notified Amazon as well if the ongoing problems with this model TV, which they're now investigating.

Reviews.Title: Great for an inexpensive TV
Reviews.Author: Phoenix AZ
Reviews.Content: This TV is not flashy looking and has a bulky/cheap feel to it, but it is extremely light and has some great features for a lower end TV.  It only has 2 HDMI inputs so I ended up using the Component video input for my media player to avoid constantly swapping cables.  The built in WiFi worked fine for me although since it is only about 10 ft from my router I decided to run an Ethernet cable for a better connection.  I use Hulu and Amazon Instant Video regularly with no issues.  My biggest complaint is the lack of support for playing MP4 files from my DLNA NAS.  The product description say DLNA is supported and didn't mention which file types were supported (at least not that I saw).  It will play AVI files at least.  Another reviewer mentioned it will play MP4 files from a USB attached device which seems odd.  Another issue is that I use the 23" model in this product line for my computer monitor in the same room.  I hadn't really considered the fact that they would also use the same remote on the same frequency... oops, I had to cover the sensor on my monitor with electrical tape.  Overall it was a great purchase for the price as a secondary TV.  We bought a larger model in this product line for my mother-in-law for her birthday as well.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Quality, Performance and Price
Reviews.Author: IssysDad
Reviews.Content: Great TV and features!  I sat in line for 6 hours on Black Friday 2012 and was 6th out of 20 to get this TV.
