I got it home, out of the box and setup and was wowed by the impressive video quality.  At 52.5lbs, removal from the box is definitely a two person job.  The video quality is comparable to other units that I've paid thousands for.  True blacks, vivid colors and bright whites make watching my movie collection a blast!  With a thin flat glossy bezel that matches the base, the TV is ready for stand or wall-mount.  While on the base, the TV doesn't Pivot, which, in most scenarios isn't much of a loss.The built-in apps are just okay in my opinion, with some stutter or lag in the interface.  The apps are accessed by pressing the Vizio Internet Apps (VIA) button in the middle of the remote.  YouTube searches return a limited number of results with no option to load more.  Netflix and Hulu apps work okay, but I prefer the apps on my XBox 360 or Roku.  Netflix, Hulu, Amazon, and YouTube videos tend to buffer quite a bit using the built-in SmartApps.  Facebook and news apps also work well.  The Yahoo Widgets and available apps for download could use some diversity.  You also have a limited number of widgets/apps that can be installed at one time.  A built in USB media player works well for displaying photos and HD video loops or screensavers, or even movies (WMA/WMV/and some AVI/MPG).  I currently have this unit setup wired, but I've tried wireless as well.  Performance for me is basically the same on both.The built-in audio quality is quite good for a TV.  Two rear and two side HDMI ports, two USB ports and side located component/composite video inputs plus ethernet port, analog and digital audio inputs and VGA input provide plenty of connection options.  The remote control is a one-piece two sided unit that could use some improvement.  One side is a standard remote, while the flip-side is a QWERTY keyboard for typing text.  It feels solid and well built, however the small rubber buttons are not very sensitive, and aren't backlit.Getting the settings perfect for my environment and preferences took about 20-30 minutes with some HD source reference material.  Once set, the contrast and brightness work well and the colors are rich and vivid.  The 1920X1080 resolution and 120Hz refresh rate ensures optimal video and game quality.  Peripheral or off-axis viewing is also better than many comparable units.  This unit doesn't support 3D, but for us it's not really a big loss.When playing Video games, I noticed a perceptible "lag" where I would press my joystick and there would be small delay before my on-screen character moved.  I was dismayed and was worried that I'd have to take the TV back.  After some digging I found the solution to the problem.  First:  Switch to the input that the game console is located on.  2.  Press Menu >Picture> Picture Mode and change from 'standard' to 'game'.  3rd.  Press menu, choose the gear icon for 'settings'.  Move down to "Game Mode" selection and change from 'off' to 'On'.  Lag problem fixed.  It took me a few hours on forums to find out this undocumented fix.  Totally happy now!

Reviews.Title: A good, but not perfect TV
Reviews.Author: Jamie
Reviews.Content: The first TV I ordered had a problem. Every so often when I turned it on, the image would flicker, regardless of what input it was on. I returned it and very promptly received a new one. I am really impressed with it.Pros:Great picture. I'm no expert, but things looks great.Good sound. I'm used to HDTVs sounding awful, but this one had pretty good speakers.Internet features. I honestly don't use these, but I can see them being useful to someone.Value. This is a great TV for the price point.Cons:The only problem I have so far is that every so often, I'll try to turn it on, and it just won't. I end up having to unplug it and plug it back in. This is a pretty rare problem.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy!
Reviews.Author: A. Beverley
Reviews.Content: Love the tv! The slim border really makes the picture look great. The image quality is something you would expect in a higher priced item. The Netflix button is also awesome/ convienant. Great buy- already recommended this tv to my parents.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price.
Reviews.Author: R. Webb
Reviews.Content: Have had the TV for about a month. Amazon's delivery service worked as advertised.  I had no problem with the setup and the picture has been great.  Can't beat the price, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice.
Reviews.Author: D Hurley
Reviews.Content: My eyesight is failing and for the first time in a long while I can sit in my chair and see any writing they have on the screen. It arrived before the estimated date, was easy to unpack, everything was there, was easy to set up for cable and everything works fine.

Reviews.Title: Best cheap 60 inch gaming HDTV out there right now!
Reviews.Author: Brae L. Hulery "Braehole"
Reviews.Content: Not sure how many twitch gamers are looking at this TV but input lag time matters for FPS and online fighting games. This TV is the lowest (so far)for a 1k 60 inch HDTV in the great category at 31ms. Bad input lag means you or your kid will get shot before he sees it on the screen. Not fun for gaming if you have bad input lag, so if you or your kids play lots of games online check out these two sites to find a TV for both movies and gaming. Who wants buy a TV and not be able to use it for everything? Hope this helps you get your best bang for the buck! If you want an excellent category gaming TV get the Sony 55" KDL-55W802A at 17ms.With the new consoles coming towards the end of the year, marketing low input lag TVs and their gaming advantages could be a smart opportunity for a savvy TV manufacturer. I wonder if any manufacturer company guys look at these comments....http://www.displaylag.com/display-database/#participants-listhttp://www.hdtvtest.co.uk/news/input-lag

Reviews.Title: Great TV, but a little trick to set it up
Reviews.Author: David Lindbergh
Reviews.Content: Great TV.To get low-latency (low-lag) mode, set the INPUT to "GAME" mode.Setting the "PICTURE" to "GAME" mode does nothing except fiddle the colors a little.You must set the INPUT to "GAME" mode - that sets it in low-lag mode.Confusing, I know.  I almost returned it.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO E701i-A3 70-inch 1080p 120Hz Razor LED Smart HDTV
Reviews.Content: Here is a great (semi-great) YouTube Review [...]So I Unboxed this thing as per usual with any bigger flatscreen... upside-down do that the base can easily be attached without any Herculean antics trying to throw around a big-a$$ TV and balancing it on your couch with two people while surgically attaching the base...  Just turn the box over and take the bottom off and the base and all the screws and the remote packages are right there... attach the base... *then* turn over and lift off the box and Voila!So when you get the thing on the Stand or on the wall... make sure if you are hooking it up to a Home Theater Sound Amplifier that you use the HDMI input that says HDMI arc... also - if you are going to have wired internet ... now is the time to attach that... *before* you power on the TV...The other possibility is that you are using a sound bar and cable from the wall? Just screw that into the back of the TV and hook up your SoundBar now, otherwise, just use the TV's sound and hook up a better sound System later...Now it's time to put the batteries in the Remote and hit the on button of the remote... follow the on-screen instructions... if you have WiFi - your TV will Ask you to give it your (WiFi SSID identifier and Password) and some other Info...Anyway - after I got done with all that stuff myself... and got my picture i was blown away... I was hooked up through my Onkyo Receiver Amplifier w/5-1 Sound and I have a PS-3 in my system hooked to the Onkyo via HDMI, which I use for Games & Blu-Ray... A Philips DVD Player (HDMI) which also plays MP3 Discs for me... ... I also (via HDMI) have an HTPC (Home Theatre Personal Computer) a Dell tower hooked up that I can used with a really cool IOGear Bluetooth Keyboard ([...]) There is a guy here on Amazon in one of the Reviews who did all of the following work for the picture setup tweaking which I shall *not* take credit for but which I use... and these settings work to perfection hence:Picture Mode: MovieBacklight 60Brightness 50Contrast 72Color: 49tint 0Sharpness +2Color temperature NormalRed Gain: 106Green gain: 107Blue gain: 116Red offset: 128Green offset: 128Blue offset: 128Smooth motion effect: LowReal cinema mode: SmoothNoise reduction: offmpeg fr: offColor enhancement: offAdaptive Luma: MediumFilm mode: autoBacklight control: offAmbient Light sensor: offMy Picture is so realistic I am stunned... for the first time my Blu-ray's go full screen with none of those black bars on top & bottom... I don't know why... The viewing angles (off-angles) are *GreaT* unlike what some of the naysayers have said...  My Living Room Viewing distance is about 12-feet. What a Computer Monitor this makes! OMG!Questions?

Reviews.Title: VIZIO E-Series E241i-A1 24-Inch 1080p 60Hz LED Smart HDTV
Reviews.Author: Real Dreams
Reviews.Content: Loving this tv.I relocated into a smaller place and have internet.The WIFI and this tv are about 10 feet away from each other.With the APPS on the tv in addition to the veryverynice picturequality, I am in techno video heaven !I mean I can bring up the YOUTUBE APP and launch the appand search for anything thats on you tube !You Tube alone and the tv picture quality would do  it 4 me,but you add in AMAZON PRIME VIDEOS, etc !!!!! incredible.Thank You to all involved, really, I am enjoying this tv.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO E-Series E241i-A1 24-inch 1080p LED Smart HDTV
Reviews.Author: kenhigdon
Reviews.Content: Shipped quicker than stated and arrived in good shape.  Was easy to attach stand (I needed it to stand on a shelf instead of a wall mount) TV was easy to setup and I had it hooked to U-Verse via HDMI cable so it could be used within minutes.  The TV was easy to get on my home WIFI so the internet features would work.  It seems to be as sensitive in receiving WIFI as my I-Phone.  The sound is not as good as a large TV but is better than an older VIZIO model M221NV that I have on a kitchen wall. I have not tried the digital receiver as I did not have an antenna handy in the basement location I placed the TV.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding TV!!!
Reviews.Author: Lovin the ecodrive
Reviews.Content: If you're hesitant to get a Vizio, don't be. Their panels are vibrant, bright, and vivid.If you're hesitant to buy from Amazon, don't be. Shipping from Ceva was a breeze. They called before the arrival time and they only leave it if someone is there to sign.If you're doubt you're enjoy this TV, don't be and here is why.It's that good. I'm replacing my 105'' HD projector with Stewart Firehawk screen (yes that's a $3000 screen) with this 70'' LED TV. The colors are amazing from this Vizio and at first I hated the downsize, and now wonder how I lived without this TV. Size is perfect, brightness and color perfect, and mounted to the wall it looks perfect. Colors rival the best Samsung and it's a no brainer.Get it.

Reviews.Title: major short coming in Internet usage
Reviews.Author: Billerica50
Reviews.Content: I just installed this TV and I found one major issue.  All web based applications are opened in 25% of the screen making it very difficult to read anything unless very close to the set.  There is a blue button on the remote that is supposed to expand the web window to full screen , but it does not work.  I called support and after much back and forth they first said not all applications will expand, when I asked for any application that would expand, they went off line then came back and said they did not know of any.  In applications like Netflicks, after a movie is selected for play it does expand, but using anything like face book, or news feeds etc. all stay scrunched on the left.Visio support blamed the issue on Yahoo, saying they just did the hardware, Yahoo did the FW/SW.  I reminded them Yahoo did this work under contract to them and on their behalf.  It is a Visio's user manual that defined the operation of the blue button which does not work.  Support even said there are lots of buttons on remotes that do not function.  I reminded them that this blue button was the only one that did not work even though their manual specifically explained what it does.  What is even worse is that support said this used to work on older models.  Given it's critical importance to a smaller screen set, I can't believe they would allow such a change.  FINALLY they agreed to escalate the issue to engineering, stay tuned.

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: Melvin Johnson "Paladin721"
Reviews.Content: I have been enjoying my little addition to home entertainment. Now, a few years back I fawned over 55 inch LCD manufactured under the Vizio Brand. Now Vizio doesn't own several divisions that manufacture the components of their sets. They assemble them and they sell them. That being said, it is not a negative thing. Your automobile is much the same way. It actually gives Vizio an advantage, which it uses to bring good quality HDTV to market, at a very favorable price to the consumer. In the jist of it all, I couldn't really see all that much difference between brands. I have read reviews, and depending on how a HDTV is set up, those "blacker blacks" and "sharper picture" tend to be negated. You sometimes find yourself looking at sets, using 1080p feeds, tweaked to produce colors not occurring in nature but are found only in knitting yarns. I have so far never been plagued with a pixel problem or other failure, knock on wood. I owe that to Vizio. This set is as good as any I have seen. In this size, it is a bargain and even is $100. lower than I paid (Thank you Amazon for your low price guarantee). I would, well I am recommending this set and without hesitation. I hooked it up to a over the air antenna. It is stunning. Cable signals vary, but little or none of it is 1080p or even 720p. It is compressed to 480i generally. The aspect ratio might get you 1080i on some programs but we are plagued by it. That's why in stores they generally have loop DVD signal in 1080p to impress you. You scratch your head and slowly convenience yourself it's better. Gaming, there are HD games, and here is where it is put to the test. Fantastic. Handled everything threw at it without an artifact. Xbox, PS3, and Nintendo were great. The Razor edge LED appeared to provide solid performance, just a bit brighter and sharper than the Vizio 55 LCD. The viewing angles seemed slightly larger perhaps attributed to the Razor edge LEDs. No ghosting, fades, or bands on any of the Vizios I own. I would have liked to have seen a full LED array for a comparison.That covered, why. It's big. Big is good, bigger is even better. This set, is approximately $110. less than my 55  inch sold for. I moved it to a bedroom, and then the trickle down theory of HDTV's occurs. I would love it if some day the speakers on a TV surpass your wildest expectations. They are okay, not better than the system Bose they are hooked to. That's the only draw back they have, and they are far from being alone in that category.If you want a set that is a good value for it's size, here you go. If you are a videophile, you are considerably better at judging this under varying parameters for which I haven't the slightest clue. But when people come over, and we turn on the HDTV for the game, games or movies. Everyone is quite taken by what they seen and the highest complement one can hear is the surprise after naming the brand and their comments regarding the quality of the picture, and now size. I had people who were amazed at the  55 LCD. They have heard of Vizio. They cannot abandon the brands they have known for so long. These are affordable, well made and  most likely will meet or exceed your expectations. Did I mention it was big?  I love it. I think you will too.

Reviews.Title: Awesome product for an awesome price!
Reviews.Author: K. Burton "KMC Burton"
Reviews.Content: We added this for use on our screened in porch. With the wifi connection, we are able to stream from the home network with no problem.  It's a perfect addition and easy to use!

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I needed!
Reviews.Author: D. Jaehrling
Reviews.Content: I looked long and hard for a smaller tv with the same wifi conductivity as the "big" set in the living room. There are a lot of bedroom-sized tvs out there, but the pickings are slim if you want a smart/wifi model. As a workaround, I was about to order a Roku to pair with a smaller tv, when I came across this newly listed set—seriously, when I ordered, it only had 2 reviews! I was a little nervous about ordering something without more feedback, but both reviews were positive and it met all of my criteria, so took the plunge. Boy, am I glad I did! I'm REALLY happy with this tv. The picture and sound are top-notch and setup was really easy. The wifi feature has worked perfectly for me—even with the signal coming from another area of the house. One weird thing is that it seems to take a little longer than expected to power up when you push the "on" button—like extra seconds, so not anything major. Overall, I'm really happy with this purchase!

Reviews.Title: Great deal for the $
Reviews.Author: H. Rappaport
Reviews.Content: I had been keeping my eye on this tv for some time. I watched the reviews pour in which were mostly good so I decided to take the plunge. Set up was quite easy even if you are a novice at this. Several things to note. It's a little chintzy of Vizio not to include a remote with a keyboard. As one other reviewer noted, you can buy one that works with this tv and I did. I took my not so old Vizio this replaced to my vacation home. Compared to that one, this tv take about 20 seconds to boot up from first being turned on. That is quite a long time. Lastly, I tried settings that one other reviewer mentioned and the color reproduction was awful. Everything was somewhat iridescent (like dayglo colors). After two weeks of messing around I finally found the key. The default backlight setting is at 80. Another setting allows you to turn off this fixed setting and lowering it finally made the color reproduction to lifelike as well as eliminating pixelization along high contrast edges. I have it for a month so reliability is still open but otherwise I am very happy with the high bang for this buck tv.

Reviews.Title: Lots of extras; good value.
Reviews.Author: One Opinion
Reviews.Content: Totally satisfied considering the size and cost.  I doubt with the size of the screen you would be able to see a difference between 720p and 1080p or whether it's lit with LEDs or florescent lights.  A plus is the internet applications (Netflix, Pandora, Amazon etc) that make this TV "Smart".  A minus is the tinny audio, but this is a bedroom TV that I use to watch the news and talk shows until I fall asleep.  Also, I found the remote took some time to get used to because the layout and buttons are not as logical as others I have used.  Cnet has posted the optimal video settings for this model if you want to adjust the picture yourself.

Reviews.Title: GREAT!!
Reviews.Author: vivekbl
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time looking for a small HDTV (1080 p) and found it in this set with a great price, and some wi-fi capabilities.  Perfect!

Reviews.Title: Really good TV
Reviews.Author: Darkchylde "qdf1977"
Reviews.Content: After doing a lot of research to get a new TV for my living room, my choices came down to the Panasonic 60" Plasma and the Vizio 60" LED-LCD TV. I chose this television. This review is based on my initial assessment of the television, as I've only had it for a day. I will update the review after some long term use.I chose the Vizio due to the fact that, even though the Panasonic was rated higher in terms of picture quality, unfortunately it only had 2 HDMI inputs. The Vizio has 4. Everything in my living room runs on HDMI (XBOX 360, Cable, and Blu-Ray), so that was a deal-breaker for me for the Panasonic. I read a lot of reviews for this Vizio and I bumped into a lot of complaints about the remote control failing and the screen going black after minimal use. Most of these reviews came from people who purchased earlier models. Vizio addressed this issue and let people know that models that had serial numbers "....WAN100... through ...WAN-800..." were susceptibe to failing, so when I purchased mine (at BJs Wholesale) I checked to see if the serial number was printed on the box. It was! I chose the television with the highest batch/serial number AWAY from the faulty ones, so I ended up getting a serial number in the range "...WAP300..." so I am confident I will not have a problem.Out of the box, I was quite impressed with how thin the set was, but I was also concerned at how small the base was. After installing the base, I found that it's pretty sturdy. It wobbles a bit when jumping around (I have the Kinect for the 360), but nothing that would have me concerned that it would tip over. The frame/bezel of the television is really thin, giving you more television screen (60.04" measured diagonally), but the downside to that is the speakers for the television are in back of the set. So if you don't have a surround sound system, the television sound will sound pretty cheesy. But I imagine that anyone in the market for a 60" TV probably has a good system in place.After connecting my cable, Xbox and Blu-Ray, I turned the TV on and it walks you through the setup which is really simple. MAKE SURE YOU CHOOSE "HOME USE" WHEN IT ASKS YOU. Your other choice is "Store". This tweaks all of the settings to give you the recommended store settings, which could be way too bright and sharp for your tastes. Choose home use and tweak your audio/video settings yourself. You can register your TV if you are connected to the internet via wi-fi or hard-wire. It was cool to use the QWERTY keyboard on the back of the remote control. There are a couple of bad things about the remote; The keyboard on the back of the remote doesn't include numbers, so if you have an email address and/or password with a mix of alpha-numeric characters, you'll get a little annoyed having to keep flipping the remote over to type in letters on one side, and numbers on the other. The other downside to the remote, is when you're using the keyboard you have to be careful because it's not bluetooth, and if you hold the remote too perpendicular to your body, it doesn't register your key presses. Not a huge deal, but it can be annoying for those who would do searches on the apps that come with/can be installed on the TV.Once the setup was done, and after some tweaking of the visuals, I must say that I was impressed. The picture quality was noticeably better than my 52" Sharp AQUOS LCD that it replaced. I wanted to see for myself about this "Soap Opera Effect" that is so polarizing with people. I turned on the Smoothing effect and turned it to the highest setting. I thought that it would be more annoying than it was. It did, in fact look like I was watching a soap opera on some shows, but my wife and I thought that it was pretty cool. To each his own. The good news is, you can turn it off if you prefer. We tested our Blu-Ray with a few different movies; Avatar, The Avengers and Finding Nemo. I must admit that, when watching Avatar, due to the smoothness of the motion and some of the shaky camera action, it was a little disorienting, but after a couple of minutes I got used to it. My wife even yelled, "Well, there. look. Sigourney Weaver is in my living room!" We tried The Avengers and Finding nemo afterwards and we were not disappointed. Absolutely beautiful. I'm sure that that there are TVs with a better picture quality, but not at this price-point and features.Some of you may have to adjust and/or your picture horizontally or vertically, which can be done in the menus, because the viewing area of the TV is larger than what the channel is projecting, so you may see a staticky digital bar on the edge(s) of your screen. Simple fix though, so don't panick.My only complaint about this TV is that you can notice some uniformity issues during pure black periods of viewing, like in between commercials, a pitch black room in a movie, etc. Certain areas of the screen look like a lighter shade of black than other areas. It doesn't bother me, but if you're used to plasma TVs and their near-perfect black levels, you'll probably find it a bother.Aside from a few little things, this TV is absolutely perfect for the price.

Reviews.Title: Love this T.V.
Reviews.Author: Grandma
Reviews.Content: It took us a long time to decide on a big screen TV but finally after much research we purchased the 60” VIZIO.  We held back writing this review just to be sure, so now after three months of use we are ready to say without hesitation  we would recommend this unit. Out of the box the picture quality is excellent but for the meticulous, just about every aspect of the picture and the audio can be customized.  One of the reviews on Amazon recommends the factory settings be changed for an even better viewing and listening experience. We have listed them here and would recommend you make the changes as well. The TV is light weight and has a very thin profile making it very easy to wall mount.  It has built in wireless and lots of apps. You can spend hours exploring all the applications, and you can add more. The remote has a full keyboard making surfing very easy.  Explore making the changes and you’ll see and hear the difference.  You can easily reset it back to the factory default settings if you want.PICTURE SETTINGS MENUPicture Mode - MovieBacklight -  53Brightness - 50Contrast - 75Color - 51Tint - 0Sharpness - 0SIZE & POSITION SUBMENUNo ChangeCOLOR TEMPERATURE SUBMENUColor temperature -  NormalRed Gain - 104Green Gain - 115Blue Gain - 130Red Offset - 129Green Offset - 130Blue Offset - 132ADVANCED PICTURE SUBMENUSmooth motion effect - OffReal Cinema Mode - Smooth [grayed out]Noise Reduction - OffMPEG NR - OffColor Enhancement - OffAdaptive Luma - OffFilm Mode - AutoBacklight Control - OffAmbient Light sensor - Off

Reviews.Title: So far I love it.
Reviews.Author: Augustisburning
Reviews.Content: I had a Vizio 32' LCD tv and I've been wanting to get something a little bigger since I have Astigmatism and sometimes the tv looked a little blurry to me. A friend who knows a lot about tv's recommended maybe buying an LED tv since the backlighting is different and it can sometimes be easier for people such as myself to make out certain details. So I gave it a try and ordered this one because it was a decent price. So far, I love it. I played BioShock Infinite on it and right away, I could tell the difference in the details between this tv and my LCD. I also like the wifi streaming for Netflix because now I can watch Netflix in peace without having to be bombarded by game invites from friends on PS3.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price but...
Reviews.Author: James R. Robison "Ray Robison"
Reviews.Content: Love the TV but the navigation and interface on the web software is terrible. My Roku has much better software. For instance, Amazon video has no way to save the shows I watch. I have to use the search function every time I want to go to a series I watch. Also, would it kill Vizio to allow us to label channels? My cable does not come with a cable box, and the channels are not labelled. It should take very little effort to put in a function so I can name channels. Throw us a software update Vizio. When you use the smart TV it creates a new temporary input. So if I am watching Hulu, for instance, and I switch to my xbox, that temporary internet input goes away. So you have to go through the entire system to restart an internet video. Also, the HDMI inputs on the back are recessed with a ledge opposite the opening that makes them very difficult to plug in to. And the remote has to be pointed lake a laser at the receiver on the bottom left corner of the TV. Seriously, if you just point it at the center of the TV it won't work. A minor annoyance but I don't understand how this got past testing. Overall, for the money, it's a great buy and most problems can be fixed with a software update if customers complain enough.

Reviews.Title: A best buy in the 32 inch flat panel class
Reviews.Author: C. L. Boyd
Reviews.Content: This TV has superb picture quality, despite only being a 720p model (and on a 31.5 inch screen, 1080p would probably be overkill), and is hands-down the most compact 32 inch flat panel TV I have been able to find, being just under 29 inches wide and just over 19 inches high with the stand attached. It fits with room to spare in my 30 inch wide wall units in my small (12 by 20) living room. It is so much smaller than the former Sansui 32 inch CRT it replaced that I bought a one drawer glossy black modular storage drawer unit and put it under the TV to store DVDs, remotes, manuals, etc. The narrow edge design is probably the reason why it is not as wide as other competitor's sets or even other Vizio models with a 31.5 inch screen size. Setup took all of 25 minutes, including doing two scans for digital off-air channels (I assume scanning for cable channels without a box would be similar). I was able to connect my digital HD cable TV converter box (required by my Bright House service for its HD channels and premium channels) using one of the TV's two HDMI ports, then connected my DVD player via the composite RCA female jacks and my amplified off-air antenna to the female coaxial cable/TV port (hence a 32 channel "backup" in case the cable goes out). There is also a USB port that allows inserting a flash drive so that you can view photos on the TV. I will be buying a second HDMI cable so that I can connect my HP Pavilion multimedia notebook with a HDMI port to view movies, etc. In addition, this is a Smart HDTV and has several Internet apps already configured, and more can be downloaded. The TV established a connection with my encrypted wireless g/n home network with a "hidden" ID without a hitch -- just type in the network name and the WEP key, wait a few seconds, and you are connected for Hulu, Netflix, etc. (no Roku box required). If you want one of these, I suggest you act fast ... I think this model will soon be retired or replaced, and for well less than $300.00, this is clearly an outstanding set for the price.

Reviews.Title: Best 1599 i ever spent.
Reviews.Author: Nardonir
Reviews.Content: I got this from amazon for 1599 shipped with no tax. It is thinner and lighter than my 55 inch full array 3D. The picture is excelent after you play with the settings a little. For the price you absolutely can not beat this TV. I like the picture better than the 70" sharp and it is a ton cheaper. The smooth motion works almost too good sometimes. If the price ever drops down that cheap again, jump at the opportunity. That is all.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price, but. . .
Reviews.Author: Cameron Gordon
Reviews.Content: This is the third Vizio I have purchased and never had a problem until now.I purchased this item just before the Super Bowl for a spectacular price and could hardly wait the 3 days until it was arrived. It was delivered on time, for free, and the drivers were helpful and professional. They informed me I would be unable to test my new TV until it came up to room temperature (3-5 hours)as it was winter in Chicago and the cold truck was below the ideal operating temperature. After a brief Google search I discovered that, sadly, they were right and I would have to wait to use it. Even powered off the TV looks great. Slim, sleek and shiny.When it finally came time, I turned on the screen and after a few minor adjustments, I was amazed by the picture quality. (A personal suggestion, turn off the "smooth motion setting" it creates a bizarre soap opera effect on everything.) Set-up was a breeze. Wi-Fi, digital cable, PlayStation and receiver were working together in no time. The included apps (Netflix, Amazon, etc.) run a little less smoothly than they do on my PS3 but they're not terrible and the included QWERTY keypad on the back of the remote makes the interface more enjoyable. There are 4 HDMI ports (more than most other 60') and you can name each of them on the TV so switching between inputs is super easy. The menu is not as intuitive as I would like but after you get used to it, navigating the settings is simple enough.There was one MAJOR problem, however. Once a day, at random intervals, the TV would just power down. It would always turn back on from the remote but, obviously, it was a nuisance. It happened across every type of use. Cable, PlayStation, native applications, everything. I tried a factory reset, changed outlets, surge protectors, and any settings having to do with power. No dice. I searched the internet and discovered that, although this was not a common problem, it was not unheard of. Many people had theories as to why this was happening, and suggestions on how to fix it, none of which worked.Realizing I was going to be unable to solve this problem myself, I emailed Vizio directly with a description of the problem. The next day they told me to contact Customer Service by phone. That annoyed me because I hate talking on the phone but, whatever. I called and spoke to an unbelievably friendly and helpful woman named Sandy who was in South Dakota. It was refreshing to speak with someone who not only spoke English but was pleasant and knowledgeable as well. I honestly cannot remember the last time I enjoyed dealing with a Customer Service Representative. She apologized, told me that Vizio was aware of the problem and that they would FedEx a new board to a local repair shop who would contact me to set up an in home appointment and take care of the problem.To my surprise, I was contacted that night by the repairman and informed that the service request was made and the part should arrive in 2 days. As promised he called back when he had the part and scheduled a time the very next day to stop by. The repair man arrived within the scheduled window, was polite and professional and in 15 minutes he was done.Since then, 2 weeks ago, I have had zero issues with my TV. I could not be more impressed with the way Vizio and the people they used, handled the situation. Although, obviously, I wish I had never encountered the problem in the first place, Vizio really showed me that they are a reliable company who stands behind their product and I will certainly buy from them again, when the time comes.

Reviews.Title: good performance for price
Reviews.Author: Robin M "robin_M"
Reviews.Content: I want to reiterate some findings other have mentioned.I have had this TV for about three months having bought it from Costco for their Black Friday deal. Satisfied with the purchase. It is a large TV - for the price I paid of fifteen hundred plus tax and ninety nine for Costco extended warranty I cannot really complain about a few shortcomings:The black/grey level across the screen is not uniform, likely from the edge lit technology, it's not distracting 99% of the time. If you watch sci-fi where there are a lot of space panning scenes you might notice it more. My TV is in the family room and not for critical movie watching. My wife, kids and friends have not commented on it at all.I also was excited to have the Skype app (which was on the product specs at the time of purchase) but found out to date that Vizio is still working with Skype to get their camera certified. I look forward to this in the upcoming few months.Off angle viewing does reduce contrast very quickly, I have Plasma TV in the adjacent room which has fantastic off angle viewing so this was noticeable to me on the Vizio.TV is quite heavy. Please make sure you get a good wall mount and you will need two people to unbox and hang this TV.Minor lip sync issues initially but I think that a firmware fixed this.  I used a receiver to route HDMI signal and that had some corrective delay that fixed this for me.Other than the above I am very happy with this TV, the PQ is great, colors are really nice. The TV has a thin bezel. There are quite a few apps. Overall the HD picture looks great.btw - there is a suggested set up on CNET you might want to try for home calibration which is basically the settings I use.

Reviews.Title: great screen
Reviews.Author: Nilufar Baratova "Nina"
Reviews.Content: I simply love that TV. The delivery was fast, no damage. Great picture quality and sound. You will not regret the money you spent.

Reviews.Title: This TV rocks
Reviews.Author: BRUCE G OWENS JR
Reviews.Content: I am thrilled to write this review, the Smart HDTV Vizio E60 60 inch LED TV is a powerhouse of a television.Built for the teckie in mind the TV is rich in features and apps. The Yahoo driven app platform gives the user a host of streaming internet content to enjoy.Let us start with the picture quality. The Vizio Smart HDTV E60 60 inch LED TV delivers a crisp display with vibrant colors and deep blacks. The 120Hz effective refresh rate and "smooth motion" projects a lifelike picture. Media from Netflix, Xfinity and played via the TV's USB port all looked stunning.The Vizio Smart HDTV E60 has Netflix, Hulu, YouTube and Crackle build in among other apps. If you are looking to deliver content to the Vizio Smart HDTV E60 via other methods it is more than easy.The Vizio Smart HDTV E60 is loaded with input options, four HDMI inputs, a component input for you old school folks, a VGA input for your PC and 2 USB ports. The USB ports automatically recognize music, photo, and movie media.  As I said earlier, playing a movie from a thumb drive looked spectacular. Even Netflix delivered from my Motorola Droid via mini HDMI cable looked decent. There is also an ethernet input allowing you to connect to your home network, a lightning fast wireless connection is also an option.The sound on the Vizio Smart HDTV E60 is not mind-blowing. While it is good enough for sports and TV shows, I found it lacking for concert video and music. There is a companion sound bar available for just under $200, though it really is not necessary. I would imagine anyone buying a 60-inch TV would be pairing it with a home theater system. The Vizio Smart HDTV E60 connects to your theater system via digital audio out (SPDIF) or analog RCA.The Vizio Smart HDTV E60 is becoming the number one purchased television in America. It is feature rich and smartly priced - I see this TV being a consumer favorite for years to come.

Reviews.Title: Blown Away!!!!
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: I am completely blown away by this television! I purchased it yesterday from Best Buy for $899 and I have been more than pleased with my purchase. The television looks even better at home than it does in the store. While at Best Buy I spent a lot of time going back and forth between the Vizio, Samsung, and the Sharp and the Vizio seemed to offer the best reviews as well as the cheapest price. While the Samsung smart tv might be appealing to the eye, it had the poorest reviews which is surprising for a television that costs $3k and up.I bought my first Vizio 32" about 6 years ago and still have it in one of my guest bedrooms. It still work the same as the day I opened it, so I decided to consider the same brand when looking for a 60". Overall I would have to say that I am more than satisfied with this tv.As far as screen quality and adjustments, I utilized the review provided on here by Kris and the picture quality is amazing. I however like that "soap opera" look so I do leave that feature on. Easy to turn off though.Also, make sure that your cable box is set to 1080p or 1080i. I forgot to check this until the next day and now the picture is even better!!The only con that I have found with this tv as of now is that the MGo feature does not work. Not sure really what it even is for, but a little obnoxious that there is a permanent button on the remote that will not do anything for who knows how long.And one more thing, I am pretty disappointed that the remote cannot be paired with any of my other devices such as my home theater system or even my cable box. So unfortunately, unless you want to lose the Qwerty remote, you gave to get used to using two or more different remotes. Of course it could be worse, but in my opinion a simple fix that they could have made in order for the customer to be completely satisfied with their purchase.Overall I would definitely recommend this television to anyone!

Reviews.Title: TV vastly exceeded expectations
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: We spent a long time deciding on a TV.  Ideally, we wanted a 65" 3D LED, but decided that the LED was the most important of these 3 and bought this at half the cost of a 65" 3D LED.  We figured we were primarily buying a size upgrade, but not much in the way of features.  This TV vastly exceeded my expectations.  With animated blurays like Harry Potter, Brave, or Lion King, my wife at first did not believe that the TV was not 3D even without glasses.  Even broadcast TV seems to have more depth.  Sometimes it feels like we are in the scene.  I am certainly not a videophile, but we are very happy with this decision.

Reviews.Title: I Love It!
Reviews.Author: Michael F. "Audio Guy"
Reviews.Content: UPDATE 04/08/2013:I'm updating my review to 5-Stars because the issues I describe below seem to have subsided... every once in a while I think the A/V is slightly out of sync, but simply power cycling the television seems to fix it.AT the end of the day, I can't say enough. I could not have afforded a 60" LED Smart TV were it not for this Vizio... I really do love it.---------------------------------------------------Original Review (December, 2012):I really like this TV overall; for the price, it's tough to beat.However, there is an issue with audio and video getting out of sync by as much as a full second.  I called Vizio tech support and was told that this is a known issue for which they are releasing a firmware update."Great, how can I get this update?" I ask."We're pushing it out in batches of 1,000 at a time so as not to crash the server.  But we sold over 100,000 units on Black Friday alone, so I can't tell you how long it will be before you get it.""Oh, ok," I said.  "Can I just download the update via your website and install it myself?""No, sorry; it's not available that way."So, basically, Vizio knows there is an issue (a pretty major one, too), but they won't even make the firmware update available for manual install.  The TV will go to five-stars when this issue is corrected, but who knows how long that will take.

Reviews.Title: Very Sharp
Reviews.Author: jlcapt
Reviews.Content: Nice picture, Good apps. If it had a web browser I would give it 5 stars.Super light weight. Easy to move around like outside if I want to.

Reviews.Title: Very Satisfied
Reviews.Author: poison
Reviews.Content: Purchased this TV about a month ago.  Everything worked fine out of the box, easy setup.  I should note that I'm not a major cinephile or audiophile, just an average user who watches about 2 hours a day between me and the wife...but for us the picture is great.I used some picture settings from CNET that I found online and they seem to make a really good picture.  If you were inclined to use a video tuning DVD you could probably get it down to near perfect, but honestly I can't really tell that much of a difference anyway and it isn't worth my time.  When it turns on, it shows a black screen with the Vizio logo...from that screen you see that the blacks aren't 100% uniform, but I still think the picture is fine and my wife gave me a crazy look when I pointed it out.We use it for cable television, netflix, and dvds mostly. We just moved into a new house and wanted a bigger television for the living room. The Netflix app works great for us over a standard wifi connection with WPA2.  The youtube app works fine as well.  We don't really use the other apps that came with it so I can't really comment.  The remote with QWERTY keyboard works very well and is useful for searching movies and clips on youtube.We use an LG speakerbar with a wireless sub, so I can't really comment on the speakers at-length, but they seemed fine for a normal size living room when compared to other built-in speakers I've used.  If you're an average user who wants a good quality 60 inch TV at a reasonable price with built in netflix, amazon prime, and youtube you won't be disappointed.  If you're the over-the-top home theater keeping-up-with-the-Jones' type who wants a picture that is top of the line and has 3000 pixels per molecule, then this obviously isn't for you.  For our uses we are very happy with this purchase and would purchase it again.  I think it is a great smart television for the average user and sits at a nice price point.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Dennis L. Lundy "Running Man"
Reviews.Content: TV arrived super fast (3-days).  Easily setup and connect to WiFi.  Picture quality is at good as my Sony, LG and Samsung flat screens. Extremely small border.  Sound is acceptable.  I am satisfied with the purchase

Reviews.Title: Great 60 inch TV but not perfect...
Reviews.Author: TripMaker
Reviews.Content: So the TV arrived as scheduled, two delivery folks un boxed it, plugged it in and we made sure it turned on and the remote worked, that's pretty much all they will do. So the TV has a very good picture once you make the adjustments some other reviewer posted here. Wifi setup was pretty easy and seems to stay connected.. Netfix, Amazon Prime and You Tube seem to work quite well, but for some reason Hulu playback will stutter at times, not sure whats up with that, the Roku box and PS3 which are right next to the TV on the same wifi network never stutter on Hulu. The other issue I ran into was lip sync issue .. audio would get out of sync after about 2 hrs or so .. if you changed the channel and came back it was ok again for 1-2 hrs.. I was getting ready to send it back then decided to take the TWC DVR box off of it and use one of my other TWC HD boxes on it.. strangely the lip sync issue seems to have stopped.Currently I purchased a TIVo Premiere box and have not seen the lip sync issue so I have decided to keep it, but I see I have till Jan 31 st 2013 to return it, just in case.One more thing if you are watching the tv pretty much straight on the picture like I said is very good, but as you start viewing it from an angle the picture starts looking washed out, it does not have even remotely as good side view as the Plasma it replaced.. so something to keep in mind.I was not one of the lucky ones to get it at the Black Friday price, but it was 949.00 for  like two hours and did get it at that price, which compared to other smart 60 inch TV's is a pretty good price.

Reviews.Title: disappointed
Reviews.Author: Marion Strong
Reviews.Content: recieved on 12-05-2012................hooked up 12-07-2012....................Quit working 12-27-2012. I have older tv's that are 20 yrs old that still work. What a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: This TV is AWESOME!
Reviews.Author: Nikki
Reviews.Content: Movies, Games, and TV all look GREAT on this fine piece of technology! I'd buy another one in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: Best Amazon Purchase of the Year
Reviews.Author: Brandon F.
Reviews.Content: I am incredibly pleased with this television and use it as a monitor for a docked Macbook Pro, an Xbox 360, and occasionally a Raspberry Pi. The smart applications work brilliantly and the wifi connected without any pains - surprising since I am a story up from my router and through several walls. I am very happy with this purchase and expect you will be too. One small note - the headphone output produces rather awful sound quality on my unit. This wouldn't be an issue for many users, but I was surprised by it. Found an easy workaround though, so no complaints! Buy this Television! You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: Recommend
Reviews.Author: Jerry Z.
Reviews.Content: I personally do not agree with any bad reviews on this tv so far, even when when the first TV that was sent and got damaged in transit before it even got delivered to me. They sent another one in place of it and I am totally impressed, because it is way better then I expected. My note to everyone that reads reviews in general, read the bad and good with an open mind before you make your decision. I didn't believe all the bad on this one and I was right so far.

Reviews.Title: Slow Start  Now happy
Reviews.Author: Charles Grandpa
Reviews.Content: Opened the  box and found that the TV was not damaged and that I needed a HDMI cord (not included).Ok off to the store to buy one. Plugged in the TV to my DIRECT TV cable box, read the manual and choseall the proper options. Tried to get the apps to work ; no luck. Called VIZIO service. Very nice young ladysaid I needed a software update downloaded to make the apps work. Ten minutes later all the apps worked ok.Sound quality was not a problem. No need for a sound bar. Volume filled my  20 x 35 great room. I read 120refresh was a problem  but action sports and movies were good quality. Most of the problems I see are becausenot all programs are broadcast in 1080p. I would recommend this TV to anyone. Price is right

Reviews.Title: Satisfied
Reviews.Author: JeffreyL
Reviews.Content: Very happy with thisFor the price it's greatWhat you want to know:Cons:There's nothing in the manual that tells you how to activate the keyboard so you will probably get stuck during setup.Just go to then area you need text in and press the ok button then your onscreen keyboard will appear. A bit confusing and I'm a tech.Audio: very good for the small speakers it hasVideo: looks great, but blacks are eg. Contrast ratio are not real black. But, the screen when off shows how black the black will get so don't expect them to get darker when on. But I'm picky, you probably won't notice it much. I'm also a photographer and notice everything when it comes to on screen flaws be it photo or video.Digital smoothing it not great but I think that's still a limitation of technology. You basically have a choice between some pickax tigon or a plastic type look. Hard to get it just right. I expect to see it go away when technology doubles the HD resolution.1080 Hd shows will look good but if not HD don't expect the best picture.  This is just a technology limitation as well.Takes about 60 seconds for the TV to actually turn onThe Vizio apps are fun but the interface and and technology behind them are make me feel like I'm using the button controls of the old cell phones from 10 years ago. They should take a look at the Apple TV interface to improve it. It's just clumsyYES. I would buy this again. For the price I believe it's the best available with built in wifiVery good quality but not great

Reviews.Title: went out ,but fast replacment
Reviews.Author: tracey edwards
Reviews.Content: bought the tv on black friday ,and on jan 20 the video just went out,called vizio and they said it was a light or something went out,so they swapped it out for a brand new one in less then a week,i love the tv i think for the price its great picture,and sounds good to im not a big tv guru so my standards are probly not the same as a tv fanatic but for the avgerage person this tv is good.just hoping not to have it go out again ,only downfall to my experiance ,scents i have had a vizio 42 720 plasma thats 6 years old and never had one problem.

Reviews.Title: Great Value and Features for the Price
Reviews.Author: richard
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV at a higher price point and I would say its still a great value for the money. I was able to compare it side by side with other 70 TV's by Sharp and Samsung at Costco when I purchased mine. Given the price differential of the other TV's it was very easy to spring for this Vizio. This comes from someone who would never have considered purchasing a Vizio before.Picture quality out of the box is close to optimal with presets and custom slot that are easily accessed and modifiable. There's the basic controls and then Advanced controls that allow you alter Size/Position Color Temp and more Advanced Picture options that effect performance. Watching BluRay movies - WowNow the viewing angle .. it is very impressive straight on to about 30 degrees. At 45 degrees off center the picture begins to lighten slightly. It's subtle but its there. At 70 degrees its noticeably lighter. This becomes more obvious in dark scenes less so in balanced lit scenes.Amazon and Netflix ready for Streaming videoI setup my Amazon account to stream video using a wired connection and setup was straight forward. TV shows or movies purchased appear within a few menu selections and you simply cue what you want to watch and play - the pause rewind, fast fwd on the remote control playback.All the featured Web sites are easy to set upTwitter, YouTube: watched my uploaded videos at 70" was nice. Facebook was less like the PC experience - I wasn't able to see a feed of my friends status updates but I was able to access my picture albums and update my status.Can't say enough about the 4 HDMI connections.A port for Ethernet Cable for direct connection to the Internet (My TV's firmware was already updated once so far). Digital Audio out or RCA outs as well as components and coaxial connector. Two USB ports round it out.Sound is adequate but nothing to spend too much time writing about.The base this TV attaches to shouldn't be considered as a long term solution. The sheer weight of the TV makes it easy to rock on the base. I could see a good enough bump or quake easily damaging the base possibly leading to the TV damaging or possibly breaking the mount.ProsEasy to navigate on screen menu system1 button press Amazon/Netflix/Web sites and it's real easy to setup accountsTV remote has a keyboard on the back for entering info on Web pages - there is an onscreen keyboard as wellWiFi or Wired connectionPrice vs. other brandsConsViewing angle varies when viewed greater than 30 degrees off centerYou need to Download PDF manual as only a quick start manual is includedThe provided stand is not the sturdiestOther notesPicture control settings are good, but it may require some experimenting to get just the right balance. This TV replaces a 6 year old 50" Plasma Panasonic Viera. Given the off center viewing was perfect on the Panasonic, that is the only feature it has over this Vizio. No 3D support and I could care less - I'm glad that TV manufacturers can keep costs low by eliminating features few people actually use.

Reviews.Title: WAY BEYOND MY EXPECTATIONS!
Reviews.Author: Jonnatan
Reviews.Content: I cannot stop congratulating myself for buying this Vizio TV.  When I made that decision, I did not know that it has internal WIFI capability, it was easy to set up and even easier to navigate the menu.  The applications are awesome!, and the image quality is incredible, clear, brilliant colors.  I own a Sony 46" LCD and a Samsung Smart TV 42", and VIZIO is literally rocking their boat.  I recommended, as a matter of fact I want to buy another one.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Tiffany Hertzler
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I preordered this product before it even shipped to Amazon, and got it ten days after we ordered it. The picture quality is unbelievable, along with the fantastic sound quality. The movement is very fluid and can take some getting used to because the quality is so brilliant. It even brings to life movies that were made decades ago. Blu-Ray looks beautiful, as well. The remote is very cool, and I love how you can just pop up Netflix whenever you feel like it. The edges of the TV are razor sharp and clean. Our living room has a lot of natural light and the picture adjusts beautifully...no glare. All in all, it's a beautiful TV and great entertainment piece. It even has a feature that isn't even available yet!

Reviews.Title: Exceptional value and quality
Reviews.Author: Pharmboy
Reviews.Content: This is the first TV I've every bought without looking at it first.  Walmart had for the same price but added sales tax and took two weeks.  Bought via Amazon Prime, so paid $0 shipping and received it 3 biz days after ordering.  We picked it up at the docks, since they can only give you a "range" for delivery, and that will vary depending on local truck line delivering, which isn't Amazon's fault.  I own two 42" Vizio TVs so trusted the brand enough to order sight unseen.  I use it 60% as a computer monitor in the LR, the rest for watching cable TV.The picture quality if flat out amazing.  Blacks are blacker than regular LCD, the color depth and saturation was perfect out of the box.  Works great with Amazon Prime free videos and Netflicks with easy setup.  DVDs look real like you are a part of the picture, with lifelike color and brightness.  The only think I noticed is that you see more artifacts with YouTube videos simple because the screen is so large, so flaws in the video are more obvious.Remote is quite good, with a keyboard on the back that doesn't get in the way.  Much more intuitive than previous remotes.  Setup and menu functions are WAY more intuitive.  Renaming the HDMI inputs as "Cable TV" and "PC" were simple and fast.  The whole menu system is an overlay to the TV, significantly faster and easier than just a couple years ago.  From the time I plugged it in to the time I was watching TV and using the computer was literally just a couple of minutes.  Using HDMI for both the cable box and the PC.  Speakers in the TV are much better than the 42" Vizio TVs I currently have, much broader output, less tinny.  Not great, but good and anyone that is an audiophile will have a full audio system anyway.  All and all, an exceptional value for the money.Follow up:Had for a while now, still love it as much as I did the first day.  The image quality is simply amazing.  Much easier to use menus, image quality is like looking through a window at the actual people.  Very happy I made this purchase.  Built in Netflix and Amazon Prime is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Good TV at amazing price
Reviews.Author: dsamuel
Reviews.Content: I got this TV from amazon. If you are looking for a Tv at great price, this is the TV for you. The display is really nice. Follow the CNET TV setting, you would get stunning picture. The apps are really good. It has DLNA, to play your home video content from your laptop or desktop wirelessly. The uniformity might be a small issue with this TV for some people, but understand that its a Edge-lit TV.

Reviews.Title: I like it! I like it!
Reviews.Author: kingbarnaby
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for a few weeks now. No complaints so far. Just about anything would have been an improvement from my 15 year old, 19" tube. I think I made the right choice though. Has all the features I wanted. For the price, you can't beat it. It's energy efficient and should save me some $. Amazon instant videos, however, will probably put me in more debt.

Reviews.Title: Lipsync issues, then stopped turning on within a week
Reviews.Author: Jason Stokes
Reviews.Content: We purchased this a couple weeks ago, and got it from the excellent Ceva delivery service Amazon uses. After unboxing it and setting it up on the wall - very nice TV. It had great picture quality, little light bleed, and the imbedded Netflix app worked very well. The sound is a problem - constant lipsync issues with Time Warner cable and Netflix both - these are fixed by the lip sync timing function on the TV, but it's very frustrating to have to do that a couple times a week.Worse, less than a week after setup, it has stopped working and will not turn on at all. We've tried plugging and unplugging it multiple times, different wall sockets, the remote and the physical buttons, and it just wouldn't work. It's going back now.Pros:- Great picture quality, good blacks, little light bleed, etc. I was impressed, especially for the price.- Imbedded Netflix and Amazon apps work well- Thin bezel along with a thin TV gives it a stellar look against the wall. Very happy with that.Cons:- Lipsync issues. Ugh, I've never had this problem with a TV before and it was remarkably annoying. I'm very sensitive to this and it bothered me a lot.- No options for other apps to download- Weak DLNA function crashed frequently when grabbing items from my NAS. It couldn't handle the hundreds of videos on there, it seems.- Worst, it broke within a week. I have no desire to work with Vizio tech support to try to get it fixed - we went and got another TV instead.

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: Amature Plumber
Reviews.Content: Just a great tv so far.  It was worth the wait.  Have not had it for very long yet so need more time to evaluate it.  But would recommend it as it is a great value compared to other brands.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO......Yes!!!
Reviews.Author: Vermont Grandma
Reviews.Content: Decided to (finally) upgrade to larger flat panel tv.  Chose Vizio on our techno-son's recommendation:  "Best product for the money."  Even our son is amazed with this model!  I purchased as b'day gift for my husband and he's glad he got his gift early!  Decided on the 47" and the picture is wonderful!  The "E" series has a narrow "picture frame" and it makes the picture seem to float in space.  The LED illumination of the picture is not only a savings on power usage, but the picture is bright, bright, bright.  Some reviews I read critiqued the TV's light changing feature (in relation to room environment), but we can't notice anything at all.We highly recommend this Vizio model:  me, my very-grateful husband, and our son who set the whole thing up.

Reviews.Title: Same problem....
Reviews.Author: Jessica M. Otteson
Reviews.Content: Sadly we have had our tv just over a month and are now experiencing the same problems many other reviewers have reported.Turned the tv on today and the backlight and sound work but there is NO picture.  We live in a very rural area and have a warranty through squaretrade I will be inquiring upon tomorrow.  I will update as soon as I know what is happening.  I would definitely consider the negative reviews before purchasing this TV.We did enjoy the size and the picture was decent.  I did not like how slow the remote was with the tv apps.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for very little money!
Reviews.Author: Brandon Lord
Reviews.Content: I was deciding between this Vizio at 50" and a 46" Samsung for around the same price, but did not have the SmartTV features. After seeing a friends Vizio E601, I decided to go with Vizio. I am very pleased with my decision. The picture is amazing, and for $649, a 50" TV with built in WiFi and apps is a great deal. This TV is located in my bedroom, which is at the opposite end of the house from my wireless router. Please note, I am still using a WRT54g. Despite the distance, the TV still has decent signal strength and can stream in HD without a hiccup. The TV start up takes a little longer than expected, and the apps are not incredibly fast either, but these are such minor complaints that are made up for in the fantastic picture quality at a bargain price.For those of you that have seen the E601 in person, this TV's picture looks entirely different.  Despite it being 120hz, the E500 does not have the same "soap opera effect" (SOE) as the E601. This was a major plus for me, as I dislike the unnatural motion/jumpiness displayed by the E601.Overall I am very pleased with my purchase and highly recommend it to anyone looking for a big TV with a great picture at the bargain price!

Reviews.Title: VIZIO E320i-A0 32-inch 720p 60Hz LED Smart HDTV is a great TV for the price, but be aware its only 720p.
Reviews.Author: Christopher J. Cowen
Reviews.Content: VIZIO makes a nice TV and the fact that this TV is only $288.00 with free shipping is pretty awesome.  So first off I would definitely recommend this TV one for the price, second for the technology within the TV, and third for the fact I don't have to fight people in the stores for it.  But I will tell there a few things to be aware of.  This is only a "720p" and not the standard "1080p" definition most TV's are today.  The second thing I noticed while reviewing this TV it that it only has to 2 HDMI outputs.  This could be an issue for you if you will have alot of things plugging into it.  But with all that said I have had some great looking 720p TV's and this TV is under $300 dollars.  So I still would recommend it.2 years ago you could not even dream about getting a 32 inch LED Smart TV for under $300 dollars, times have definitely changed.  This review will act as a guide as well as a review for this VIZIO.One thing that I have found with TV's that its very important to actually look at the TV in person. Now when you look at the TV's, go to a place like Walmart to see them, because many times specialty stores like Best Buy play with the lighting controls on the TV and in the store to skew the image to there advantage. Once you look at the TV simply look and decide which one looks better to youNow first thing when a TV says its LED that is very similar to LCD.  The main difference with this type of TV is the way the lighting within the TV is done.  LED is back-lit better so that their are no dark spots on the screen.  The term SMART TV means this TV has the ability to directly connect to the internet.  But what makes a TV a smart TV is its ability to connect all of your devices together.  The Smart TV is the train conductor that can push content from your DVD's, game systems, and other devices to the TV.The next step is to look at the features that are offered with the TV. Here are some offered by this VIZIO Smart TV:SMART TV Internet Apps this TV has built-in Wi-Fi which allows you to watch internet content like Netflix, rent movies through the TV.  Pretty much whatever you can do on your computer you can do on this TV.- With LED backlighting the pops with rich color and vivid details.- This LED HDTV is up to 50% more energy efficient than conventional LCD HDTVs to save money.- The slim frame design for this VIZIO lets you maximize your space, allowing you to fit a bigger screen size TV in the same space.- Here is the input/Output layout: 2 HDMI, 1 Component, 1 Composite (shared with component), RF Connector for Internal Tuner, 1 Ethernet, and 1 USB 2.0.Thank you for reading my review, if you have any questions feel free to email me, I would be happy to help you with any questions you have.

Reviews.Title: BROKE
Reviews.Author: John E. Bonesteel "old conservative"
Reviews.Content: Received TV on 10/21/2013 about noon, set up, connected, operating fine at 5:30 PM.Early morning of 10/21/2013 TV would not turn on. Called Directv to make sure everything was alright on their end. No problem there. Called VIZIO got a young woman on the phone told her what the problem was. She put me through a work out of shutting it down, holding the off button etc. to no avail. She asked me for serial number. Gave her the number on the set and the box it came (both the same). She said no such number. I would have to take a picture and send it to her. Enough of her. ( Ah to be young again and not care about anyone but me) Went up the ladder to supervisor Steve, went through the process again with him, gave him the serial number, he told me he would order the parts, when they came in a repair person would call me and set up an appointment, also said it would take 5-6 business days. Does this sound like a common problem  now? Talk with a guy for about 4 minutes who is about 2,000 miles from me and he is going to order parts? Repair contractor called me on 11/01/2013 said they would be the ones to repair the TV when the parts came in and who the repair person  would be and they would call before coming.  Now it is 11/12/2013n nothing yet, still have a useless TV. Have had it for 23 days, it worked six. A bit past the 5-6 working days. Called repair contractor, lo and be hold they are sending repair person  tomorrow for repairs. Should have sent it back and replaced, would have been quicker. I think this will be 13 business days. Must be using the presidents math. Amazon has always been great to deal with so doubt if there would have been a problem  Advice for all.

Reviews.Title: Crappy built in wifi
Reviews.Author: j.harvey
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for the wifi smart features. The built in wifi on this TV SUCKS! It will not stream anything without cutting in and out. We have Roku's on other TVs that are further from the wireless router and they will stream just fine without lagging. We have a dual band N router, and road runner extreme internet through Time Warner. This TV should have no problems streaming netflix or Hulu.Don't waste your money. Spend the extra money and get a nicer Smart TV or just get a Roku. I now have to buy a Roku to add to this not so smart TV.

Reviews.Title: NOT DEAF FRIENDLY
Reviews.Author: Bond, James Bond
Reviews.Content: This is our first HD TV and we are freaking loving it! The main points are that we use Netflix as a TV provider instead of cable or satellite, so having a Netflix app and a Netflix button is too cool. I am not a tech guru so i can't say too much about the technical stuff but I do know that LED is the way to go, 120Hz is the latest and greatest and wifi connectivity means I can cut out one device. The thin frame should be standard on every tv, it makes this 47" seem larger.stuff I'm unhappy with- no browser and no Pandora. It does however have rhapsody but I don;t have a rhapsody account because Pandora is free. And one more row of RC inputs would have been nice but I understand they're not as en vogue as they used to be.*update, one month in- ah shucks the list of stuff I'm unhappy with has grown  Amazon app does support captioning ( big mad judgmental look going to amazon for that one)  The remote has to be pointed DIRECTLY at the lower left hand corner of the tv. Changing batteries on the remote to a higher quality battery has helped, however its not the free ranging point wherever stuff of old.  And last of  all, when you start viewing a show and when you skip the image takes a few seconds to come to. It gives a strange pixilation that one might mistake for a few beers too many vision. Not the worst stuff in the world, just minor annoyances. But it still shows  great picture right out of the box! Nothing major to gripe about which means that this TV is holding its own!*** Update 10 months in Pretty ticked about the continued lack of captioning support particularly from one of the quick app buttons. Thats costing you stars since Amazon says that its Vizio's fault and vizio won't respond.

Reviews.Title: Very nice tv, but is it really 120Hz?
Reviews.Author: jimstix99
Reviews.Content: This tv has great picture, especially for slow-moving camera movements.  But when the camera is panning left-to-right or right-to-left, there is some ticking and image ghosting.  I have a hard time believing that this TV actually has a refresh rate of 120Hz as advertised.  My sister has a different VIZIO, the M470SL, which is also 120Hz, and her picture is much clearer.  I'm honestly considering sending this one back.

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a Great Price!
Reviews.Author: H.Carvalho
Reviews.Content: We love Vizio TVs; we bought a 55" a couple of years ago when we moved into a bigger place. During our PCS, our bedroom TV was damaged, so we needed to replace it. Found this one and it fits perfectly above our fireplace. Picture is great, sound quality is good for the size of the TV and being able to connect to Netflix without having to use the PS3 or Wii has been much easier! We couldn't be happier with this TV!

Reviews.Title: Great 60" LED TV except the 26 lines going across the top of the screen
Reviews.Author: T.M. Tolkien
Reviews.Content: I love Vizio LCD-LED TVs. I have two of them now, a 42" and 47" and they work great for dvd, gaming and pc office work. When I saw this 60" for under $1,000.00 I thought great!  I got it through Walmart as Amazon was out of it at the time.  I brought it home set it all up and it had a great picture and everything worked great.  Unfortunately, there where 26 thin lines going across the top part of the screen.  No matter if I was watching from my dvd player or computer they were there.  I kept it on for awhile thinking they might disappear, but they did not.  I turned on and off  several times thinking they might disappear, but no. I returned it to Walmart with a heavy heart. I might have just gotten a bad unit. I think I'll wait to see more reviews before trying to get another one.

Reviews.Title: Third Time's The Charm (UPDATED AGAIN x2)
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey B
Reviews.Content: I ordered this a few weeks ago and received notice for delivery last Friday. It was delivered on Monday at 12:00 in the afternoon. The delivery service was fast, cordial and professional. They came in with the tv, removed it from the box, turned it on and hooked it up so I could inspect it. It was very bright in the room being lunch time and everything appeared to look good. It came on, the picture was beautiful, colorful and clear. The speakers give a very crisp and clear sound and is very loud on just a 1/3 of the volume. The internet interface is extremely easy to use and it was very easy to connect to our wifi. The connection was strong and worked just fine. I tried out Netflix and it streamed just fine through the tv and the sound quality again was very good. (Mind you this is all a review from our "tester" room before mounting it in our great room). I didn't mess too much with the picture settings and I won't until we get it mounted. I enjoyed the television throughout the day but when the sun started to set I noticed a BIG issue.My reason for the 2 star review- The lower left of the television is not backlit. You can clearly see how the light goes throughout the back and around the entire frame of the television until it gets to about the last 1/6th of the lower left corner and then the light just drops off. Clearly a damaged display light. It casts a horrible shadow over the lower left of the screen.I called Amazon first to find that the tv was not in stock and I would have to wait for a replacement an unsure amount of time. I then called Vizio to check on "going through warranty." and to see if this is a common occurrence. They said that it is not common and they've actually not heard a complaint like this before and they had me send a photo. Sure enough they saw it too. It would take nearly 6 weeks to go through warranty. Of course we chose otherwise.I have decided to do an exchange with Amazon since this tv is back in stock. They are sending me out one as quickly as possible and I should have my replacement within the next 7 days (in spite of it being Christmas). I am hoping that this was just a fluke and the second one coming will be trouble free.I will update my rating when I receive this second one.****December 27th, 2012--- reduced my 2 star rating to a 1 star rating after receiving defective TV #2.UPDATE: I just refused shipment on the second one. This one had a couple missing pixels on the lower left of the screen and a "smudge" print on the upper left of the screen. Am waiting to talk with Amazon to request a third try. If the third one fails we will likely be going to Best Buy to purchase a different brand all together. I'm surprised at the failure of this tv and brand after all the rave reviews here as well as from friends. Hoping that the 3rd time is the charm.I will update when I receive the third one...************UPDATE: January 11th, 2013We finally received our tv for the 3rd time on January the 3rd. This time it came with no issues to start.The color quality is amazing, the black levels are great and with some adjusting I've been able to find a happy medium between the old styleLCD viewing VS the smooth motion effects giving it a real "pop" that myself and the wife like. I've not experienced any "stuttering" since getting my settingstweaked correctly. This television surpasses any expectations that I had and so far has proved to be worth the incredible Black Friday cost I paid for it. I will recommend this television to my friends, hands down.I'm still giving this a reserved 3 stars until I own it a bit longer especially with the headaches I had with the first two.

Reviews.Title: Best TV I've Ever Owned
Reviews.Author: Puck the dog
Reviews.Content: Love this TV. App startup response is a little slow but that's a pretty minor concern. Once up, they work fast and seamlessly. You can control the YouTube app from your phone, which is pretty cool. I've also used Netflix a ton and Amazon streaming. Never had any freezing or stuttering. I have it plugged directly into the internet so I can't speak for the wireless connection. The sound is way better than I expected for this price. I have a surround sound system but usually don't feel the need to turn it on unless I want to crank a concert. I'm not a TV geek but the picture looks pretty dang sweet to me. When I got this, it was cheaper than any other set of this size with these features, so I'm very happy with this for the first month I've had it. The remote has a full keyboard on one side and has excellent range.

Reviews.Title: Value depends on what you are buying it for.
Reviews.Author: KrazyKorean
Reviews.Content: I was purchasing this TV for the kitchen. We are trying to break free of cable and we only have Netflix and Amazon Prime for TV show watching, which is why I purchased this "smart TV."Cons:Unfortunately, this Amazon prime app leaves much to be desired. The Amazon prime button on the remote does not work properly. Also, the Amazon prime app does not synch with your "list" on Amazon prime shows. You have to manually search for every show instead of it showing up in a que like it does for "my list" on Netflix.Also, the remote function in generally is a bit spotty. Not a huge drawback, but definitely annoying.Pros:Netflix app works great.Also, the TV itself is aesthetically appealing and pretty thin. Perfect for what we were looking for in the kitchen.The picture is good for the specs on the TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Duston
Reviews.Content: So far we love this tv.  After researching the different tv's out there I really wanted to stay with the plasma tv's but  I bought this one because it's a smart tv.  So far i'm loving it.

Reviews.Title: Vizio E-500i-A1  50 inch Smart HDTV  It is a winner!
Reviews.Author: Mary Wright
Reviews.Content: Ordered it off of Amazon and it arrived within 2 days.  It does take several people to put on the stand. We had to use a magnetic screw driver to put in the screws but it is a very sturdy stand when finished.  The picture on the set is wonderful.  I like how the picture has a small frame which means more picture in less space.  The apps are very nice to have right on your remote.  I really like the remote which is easy to handle for input into the tv.  My husband bought the tv as a Christmas present to each other.  We are really enjoying it.  Sound is good with the built in subwoofer.  Don't think you need a sound bar.  We really like it and plan on enjoying it for years to come.  Price was really good and I received $10 off of that as a prime member.  Also the 24 month financing same as cash was a good plus.  All in all I give the purchase 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: died after 10 months
Reviews.Author: Peoria AZ
