Reviews.Content: Vizio has an open recall for a computer board inside these TVs - confirmed on the 60" 70" models.  Of the two I purchased, one went in a bedroom, one in the living room.  The TV in the bedroom was used the most - typically use computers in the living room.Blue screen this morning - no response from the remote.  Called Vizio - they confirmed that an issues exists.  Asked if I had proof pot purchase, I said yes.  Vizio says we will replace the TV.  Sounds good.Sent proof of purchase from Amazon's Amazon Warehouse Deals.  Vizio now says I must pay $75 for a repair and have a 90 days warranty on the TV.  Ouch.So I am awaiting the death of my other 60" Vizio TV and another $75 repair cost.  Never had a TV die in 35 years....suppose I Was due for a dead TV on the most expensive TVs ever purchased.Lesson learned?  Warehouse deals may be warehouse duds.

Reviews.Title: Vizio is the absolute best!
Reviews.Author: Darob
Reviews.Content: This is my second Vizio Smart TV and am completely pleased with the quality and performance of the E420i-A0 42". What I like most about this particular model is that it is very lightweight, easy to mount on the wall, and the screen fills virtually the entire frame. It is operated solely by the remote, as there are no on-board accessible tuner controls. The setup is easy and dummy-proof... and you can't beat the picture and audio performance. To see how Vizio's quality stacks up with other brands, just stroll into a typical dept store and compare with the others... and you'll be able to see the difference. Without doubt, Vizio is your best choice for a reliable, quality TV. For my application, I installed the E420i-A0 on the wall with an Ominmount Play25x, a full-motion interactive VESA compatible mount, which works beautifully for effortless adjustments of viewing heights or angles.To use any of the apps in a Smart TV you need to have a wireless router WIFI attached to your internet connection. However, if you don't think you'll need the Smart TV version with the apps, save a few extra bucks and just get the the non-smart TV version (which is the E420-A0). Basically, most of the smart apps have a long way to go to be of much value anyway.

Reviews.Title: Gorgeous.
Reviews.Author: Francisco
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous color. Surprisingly lightweight, though. Have to be careful how and where it is placed because the cat can easily topple it. That aside, easy to set up especially with outstanding tech support from the Amazon tech team and the manufacturer's people. Very easily switches from mode to mode. Netflix, which I watch almost every day, and Amazon Prime have their own buttons, as does something called GO-M,which I have yet to explore. My only complaint so far is that the remote has such small buttons and keys, making it somewhat difficult to find a button by touch in the dark. I will have to memorize the topography. This is a huge improvement from my old standard TV's washed out images and sound. And the price is great!

Reviews.Title: Outstanding picture, so easy to set up
Reviews.Author: Shawna Whiteaker
Reviews.Content: I bought the VIZIO E601i-A3 60-inch 1080p 120Hz Razor LED Smart HDTV (thought I'd include that bit as so many of the reviews were written for various sizes/models)  It took two of us to remove this huge TV from the boxes, but only took us about 10 minutes to completely set it up on it's stand (will have it mounted on the wall later this week).  My daughter had it calibrated and had checked out the Wi Fi connection for Netflicks within another 10 and we were watching a movie 20 minutes after we opened the boxes.  The picture is stunning and it's really easy for even a non tech savy person to change the settings.  I'll be sure to update if there are any problems in the future, but right now I am a VERY happy camper. :DOh, and Amazon included 1 month of free tech support and Square Trade offers a discounted tech support for set up.  Haven't needed either, but it's really great to know I'd have had help if I'd needed it.  Man, I lLOVE Amazon!!  :D  They've been so great with all the electronic stuff I've bought over the last few years, I won't buy them from anybody else now.  You just have to make sure the item is fulfilled and shipped by Amazon.  Happy Christmas, all you Amazon shoppers out there! lol

Reviews.Title: great value compared to other brands
Reviews.Author: timazon "cybernaut"
Reviews.Content: A lot of bang for your buck here.29" smart tv for under $300 is pretty amazing, and 60hz not a big deal for smaller screens I don't think.The only weird thing for the unit I got (29 inch) is the tv stand, which has the screen tilted back at an angle.Should at least have the option for a "straight up" view.Otherwise, no complaints, though it would be nice if they included the "keyboard" remote with the less-expensive models too.

Reviews.Title: made a big difference in viewing
Reviews.Author: papa
Reviews.Content: Bought this to replace a 22 inch screen unit in my bedroom. It's only about 7-8 feet away but the smaller screen made it hard to see the score when watching a game. This unit has four different setting on the picture, wide, standard, panoramic and zoom. I use the zoom when watching a gme and now can see the score! The thing I like is there's no distortion like some other tvs I've seen where the picture looks stretched. You just have to learn all the little nuances to make it work for how you want to view, as there are infinite adjustments for color, tint, etc. It actually has more stuff than I'll ever use. Nice to be able to watch youtube, netflix etc too. For the money, I think the average viewer will be more than satisfied. oh yeah, I also used an articulating wall mount so you can swing it around and up and down to change the angleof viewing

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Dillon M. Rice
Reviews.Content: I got this TV for less than $700 with amazon's lightning deals. All of the problems in the other 3-4 star reviews are present with the addition of one major issue. The processor for the "Smart tv" sucks. I run this through my computer with a mid grade video card and therefore I have little to no problems with the resolution or frame rate, but when I run Hulu, netflix, amazon instant video through the smart TV the frame rate and the processor lag sometimes.All and all, its a pretty good deal, but I expect I will have to replace it within a few years.

Reviews.Title: Piece of junk
Reviews.Author: Robert M Kearns
Reviews.Content: Worst built TV I've ever had.  The screen broke after 2 weeks of sitting on the TV stand.  Vizio has decided this isn't covered by the warranty, leaving me with a $300 paperweight.  The only thing worse than the build quality of this TV is Vizio's customer support.  They're completely unhelpful and look for any opportunity to not honor their warranty.  I'll never purchase another Vizio product and would encourage you to do the same.

Reviews.Title: Brilliant
Reviews.Author: Verte Holdings
Reviews.Content: This is our first HD TV. The picture is stunning. Football looks great. Even local news is mesmerizing.The setup of the product was very easy. Hulu Plus is a joy. The only issue was the lack of an HDMI cable to connect with my computer. It would have been nice to know that was missing in advance, but it certainly doesn't diminish the product.

Reviews.Title: very good value
Reviews.Author: Frederick Macapagal
Reviews.Content: I love the fact that I can watch movies thru netflix and amazon prime without using any other connection to another device like my older flat screen tv,easy setup and wall mounting, nice picture even just on regular rabbit ears antenna

Reviews.Title: RIP after four days
Reviews.Author: Rutabegger
Reviews.Content: After four days of minor use and just receiving a DirecTV HD receiver to enjoy the HD on this new Vizio TV, it went black. Luckily I went through Amazon Fulfillment and will receive a replacement in about four days. I just connected the HD receiver last night and the picture was very sweet. Turned it on this morning and nothing. This is after I initially bought a Samsung 40" LED smart TV and it was delivered with a shattered screen. Hope third time is a keeper. If the replacement goes bad I will change my rating. Otherwise it was pretty easy hook up and set up.

Reviews.Title: WOW !!  Simply amazing
Reviews.Author: B. Berryhill
Reviews.Content: I just LOVE it!  The picture is awesome.  Almost looks like 3D sometimes.  The perfect centerpiece to my home theatre!The internet apps work fine, but are a bit slow and not all that user friendly.  I have a Roku and still use it prodominatly.But all-in-all I could not be happier with my purchase!

Reviews.Title: Wake up Vizio
Reviews.Author: Mark M.
Reviews.Content: If it would have come with a qwerty remote it would have got five stars. Very nice  television (hint Vizio)

Reviews.Title: Great Picture, Quality and Appeal at the right price.
Reviews.Author: Randall J. Craddock
Reviews.Content: I purchased the 70" version on the lightening deal over Black Friday (less than a grand).  We got rid of a 57" projection HDTV and a huge entertainment console that went around it.  Let me say first, if that is your current arrangement - do what I did.  Our room is so much larger now.  I told my wife before it came that she would say she thought it would be bigger (that'd be a first), and that is exactly what she said once we had it on the new entertainment center.  Go big or go home.The picture is excellent.  I am not one of those uber-picky AVS forum members (although I am a member) that talks about weird terms you've never heard of and has you looking for flashlighting or shadows etc.  The picture is simply excellent.  Realize, if you are watching cable or satellite, they compress the signals you receive, so the "HD" picture you receive is not as good as a Bluray.  But, it is still excellent.  Be sure to turn off the 120 Mhz motion setting  - it makes everything look like a soap opera with very harsh video looking effects, but that is true for all new tvs.The screen has no glare.  This is a major improvement over the plasmas on the market and even my old set.The sound is not great.  I'd give it three stars.  It can get plenty loud, but when there are voices and music playing during dramatic scenes, the music makes the voices very hard to hear.  I will be using external speakers with my set, so this will not be a problem.The built-in applications are much better than I expected.  I wish it had pandora and the amazon music application, but other than those two, it has what I need for now.The bevel is small and hardly noticeable.Be sure to get a stand at least as long as the TV is wide, so that it doesn't look imbalanced.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, great price!
Reviews.Author: Robert B. Sweeney
Reviews.Content: I purchased this set to replace a 7-year old Sony HDTV that had given up the ghost. I shopped around for the best quality/price compromise, asking advice from friends as to which brands have good reputations. Not having an unlimited budget, I soon found my choices narrowed down to this Visio model and another one with 3-D capability. Since I have no use for 3-D, I went with this model, which also saved me a few bucks over the 3-D. I managed to assemble the base by myself, but as other reviews have noted it is easier to do with an extra set of helping hands. After hooking it up and setting up the WiFi, I turned it on expecting to be wowed by the picture compared to my old Sony. After all, the technology has improved quite a bit in the last 7 years, but I was sorely disappointed! The picture was dull, flat and not all that sharp. I wondered if I had made a $648 mistake! But it was getting late and my wife and I had to leave for church. When we got back a couple hours later and turned on the set, we were greeted by an on-screen message telling us a firmware update had been installed. The picture now looked entirely different; bright, vivid and beautifully sharp. The viewing angle is amazing; any seat in the house is comfortable viewing. The remote works at almost any angle and is pretty straightforward and user friendly, although I'm stumped as to why there are 2 buttons (INFO and GUIDE) that perform the exact same function? Well, I guess it's always good to have a backup. I haven't used the "smart" features yet (with the exception of the automatic firmware update), so I cannot comment on how well streaming movies works. Bottom line: I love this set! My only regret is that I couldn't afford the 60-in. over the 50-in. But I can live with it. Happily.

Reviews.Title: Good Price and Features, But Picture Quality is Lacking
Reviews.Author: Tim Brennan "TWeederTool"
Reviews.Content: I bought this because we have a 1-year old Vizio 42" Smart TV that we are quite happy with.The picture quality of this model (E390i-A1) leaves something to be desired. The initial picture was not as sharp as our other Vizio and it seemed kind of dim. I tried numerous picture setting changes without much luck. I went online and found a post from someone who had purchased the calibration discs for this model, he then reposted the various setting for brightness, contrast, color, etc. I tried entering those settings, which helped a little, but the picture still wasn't near as good as our 42" Vizio.Next I called Vizio Tech Support. They were helpful, and walked me through several setting adjustments. It's still a little better, but not as good as our other set. I would have thought that this smaller set (39" vs 42") would have a crisper picture since they were both 1080p and 120 Hz refresh rate, but it isn't. It's acceptable, just not great.The remote isn't great either. It would be nice if the keys had backlighting, especially since this TV is for our bedroom and the lights are typically off when we are watching. The buttons are also quite close together, which makes it hard to hit the right button, especially if its dark.I do like the wi-fi feature and internet apps. I like the dedicated buttons on the remote for Netflix and Amazon Video (because I subscribe to them both), but there is also a dedicated button for "M-Go". I wasn't familiar with M-Go, but did some checking. It's a pay-as-you-go video rental service. Their selection is not very good and their rental pricing was not very attractive. Unless something changes with M-Go, I don't think it will be around very long. Maybe that button can be reprogrammed in the future if M-Go goes belly up.The initial set-up for was pretty easy and I didn't need to try to run an ethernet cable to the device because of the built in wi-fi, which made set up simple.Maybe I just got a bit of a lemon. Like I said, it's ok, just not great.

Reviews.Title: THE BEST!
Reviews.Author: Joseph M. Schalte
Reviews.Content: Best Tv I've ever owned (so far). Clear and bright picture. And it's really great to watch the Amazon prime movies.Very easy set-up.

Reviews.Title: Not obnoxious
Reviews.Author: Wit of a Twit
Reviews.Content: I think James May would agree with me when i say this not an obnoxious TV.Pros:-Good size-fast enough when operated one app at a time-useful apps.-Good sound-No trouble w/ set up or connecting to WiFiCons:-Slow when one attempts to access two apps simultaneously-<200 apps

Reviews.Title: Bedroom TV excels
Reviews.Author: Paul R. Cote "Paul"
Reviews.Content: The TV is my third Vizio and was purchased to replace an old bedroom unit.  It was easy to set up and delivers crisp, clear and colorful video.  The audio is acceptable.  I couldn't be more pleased with my selection.  The only minor problem I encountered involves the interface with Netflix.  This interface is not the same as my other two vizios and is very cumbersome to use.  I contacted Vizio and they are working on the replacement App (I hope) as I am writing this review..

Reviews.Title: GOOD DEAL
Reviews.Author: Mr Mike
Reviews.Content: Have had this TV 3 weeks now.  It updated itself via WIFI the first night.  Has good sound and picture at a great price, I'm very happy.

Reviews.Title: Vizio
Reviews.Author: Chels
Reviews.Content: Shipping arrived sooner then disclosed.  It was easy to unwrap and set up (linked WiFi with no hassle and then set up my amazon and Netflix accounts).  I think the picture and sound is great and it's easy to access WiFi accounts. Good quality at a good price!

Reviews.Title: VIZEO39" Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Jenny Kack "Jenny Kack"
Reviews.Content: I chose this VIZIO brand tv because the VIZIO I had previously worked so well UNTIL we had a direct lightening hit that burned much more than the tv.  I particularly like the "smart tv" feature which is so much more convenient that the previous tv which required a blue ray  player.  Fine tv w/excellent picture.

Reviews.Title: Love the VIZIO
Reviews.Author: Linda Reimer
Reviews.Content: Quality of picture is excellent, user friendly to install and program, price was right, received the next day from Amazon after ordering on line. This is our second Vizio television and highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Worked Great Until It Broke; But The Replacement Works Well So Far
Reviews.Author: Buddy S
Reviews.Content: I use this TV about 30-60 minutes four or five times a week in an exercise room and, after a little more than three weeks of use, the TV just completely quit receiving over the air (OTA) reception with an indoor antenna.  Until this problem occurred, the TV reception was outstanding, pulling in about 20 local channels, of which seven were in crystal clear high definition.  The TV also produced very good video from an up converting DVD player connected through the HDMI input.  Setting up the wireless function was quick and easy and I enjoyed listening to music through Pandora.Putting aside the catastrophic failure of the OTA TV reception, my only complaint with this TV lies with the small built-in speakers - the audio sounds tinny and anemic.  This, however, is not a major issue for me since I have a small home theater system connected to the TV through the TV's headphone jack.  The TV also has a digital optical output jack, but my inexpensive home theater receiver lacks a digital audio input, so I get stereo audio from the TV through the left and right front speakers in the home theater systemWhen I encountered the problem with no TV reception, I immediately called Amazon's technical support.  The tech rep suggested several possible fixes, most of which I had already tried and when it became obvious that there was a major problem that could not be resolved over the telephone, the tech rep arranged for a free exchange for a new TV.  Fortunately, I was still within Amazon's 30 day return period on my original purchase.  I just received the new TV today and it is working properly.  I will supplement this report as I get further use with the replacement.This 24 inch Smart HD TV offers a lot of bang for the buck and I am hoping the replacement unit, unlike the original, gives me many years of use.  If you purchase this TV, or for that matter any other electronic product, from Amazon, my suggestion is that you give it a heavy workout during the first 30 days.  If a defect shows up, you can then get it resolved with a minimum of expense and inconvenience during Amazon's 30 day return period.

Reviews.Title: Filled the need beautifully.
Reviews.Author: Darrick Webster
Reviews.Content: Bought this for the kids room.  They love both netflix and Amazon Prime, and having a button for each right there on the remote makes usage trivial; simpler than having to switch to Roku, for example.It connected to my wireless network without issue.  I can't say the same for my much more expensive Toshiba-branded TV, so bonus to Vizio for this.While this is perfect for a smaller room/kids room, it is not something that I would purchase for a larger room/living room because of the small size.  Note that this is my 2nd Vizio and I honestly don't have anything negative to say about either unit.  Both work well.  Good price, quality product.

Reviews.Title: Make Every Seat in the House the Best Seat in the House
Reviews.Author: Othello Lofton
Reviews.Content: This is our first HDTV. Our old SD CRT set is finally going to that great Living Room in the sky. The television arrived and I watched in horror as UPS tumbled the box out of the truck. The television box was safely in nestled in at least seven pounds of packing material and a larger, thicker card board box. Thank goodness for good packaging.We unpacked the television and everything worked right out of the box. It was easy to connect to Netflix and Amazon. The kids even prefer to use Netflix on the television as opposed to the Xbox360.I've noticed no lag and very few artifacts while watching football or playing video games. The picture is always bright and clear with very good color reproduction in a room with two large windows next to the TV. I have noticed a slight dimming and color washing when viewing off angle but it's much less than I expected.

Reviews.Title: as advertise
Reviews.Author: cheng
Reviews.Content: Great product.Came in as I expected.Easily to set up, but it feels fragile so don't drop it.Other than that it's great.

Reviews.Title: Amazing quality for the price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv as a replacement for my old Vizio that broke while I was moving. I have to say that I'm not the slightest bit disappointed. The tv looks great with the slimmer frame, the picture is great as always, and the apps are wonderful. I have read reviews in the past that the apps didn't work correctly. However, I have had no issues. I was a little nervous the first day I set it up because the screen froze and I had to unplug the unit to reset it. But I haven't had any issues since. I pretty much only watch netflix on this tv and the app works as good as on any other device and the user interface is as good as the Xbox. All in all, it was a great buy for me.

Reviews.Title: GOOD BUY
Reviews.Author: joe eldridge
Reviews.Content: EASY SETUP BUT TAKE TWO PEOPLE TO POSITION IT  DUE TO IT BEING SO LARGE.  IT IS EVERYTHING THAT I EXPECTED

Reviews.Title: worst tv I ever had
Reviews.Author: Robert J. Harris "Mexican Bobby"
Reviews.Content: My biggest complaint about this television is the viewing range.  If you sit directly in front of the tv, the color is fine.  If you move slightly to the left or right of the tv, the color fades dramatically.  Reminds me of the old rear projection TV's from the old days.  I can't believe they actually make a television like this.

Reviews.Title: Malfunctioned after 30 days and 2 hours use !!!
Reviews.Author: Richard M. Fisher
Reviews.Content: The power supply appears to have gone out, TV turns on and off at will, non-responsive to remote control, then finally died all together, 4 days beyond the Amazon return date - go figure, now forced to deal with VIZIO, we will see how cusromer service works when the VIZIO Help line opens at 8 AM PST  !So of course I called, a nice gal from a customer service office in South Dakota, took me thru some tests, and scheduled an in home tech repair visit, they are supposed to call within 5 days, news at 11.  I do feel better, unit will still not turn on -----dead !

Reviews.Title: Great TV.
Reviews.Author: Joe H Stanley
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV and I love it! It has a great picture and works great in the bedroom!

Reviews.Title: What I expected
Reviews.Author: dominick austin
Reviews.Content: I was looking for value and had bought Vizio products before so I bought with confidence... I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Best TV ever
Reviews.Author: Gettn2old
Reviews.Content: I have had this for tv for awhile now. I have been very impressed with the picture quality. I would buy this tv again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: Great buy!
Reviews.Author: Ryan Williamson
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv a little over a month ago and it works GREAT!  The blacks are black and the colors vibrant.  I haven't used the "SMART" function yet, but plan to very soon (I have to be the only person on the planet without internet...LOL).  My only qualm with this set is that the remote control has to be the worst one I have ever used in my whole life.  It feels cheap and the buttons are very awkward.  Needless to say, I will be purchasing a universal remote to my liking.  You can't go wrong with this television...and for the price, I highly recommend it! ;)

Reviews.Title: Excellent size for kitchen, sharp resolution, love the wireless connectivity to internet applications.
Reviews.Author: Deal Pilgrim
Reviews.Content: Although there are lower priced 22-24" HDTV's out there, I'm very glad I chose this model that includes the internet applications. After connecting with my wireless router, I downloaded all the current internet applications that appealed to me. Regularly use Netflix, Pandora. I love the size and the sharp picture. Although I probably could tweak the color setup a bit, the display is nearly perfect with factory settings. This unit replaced an old 13" tube TV and the quality and viewing is all the difference between night and day. Excellent satisfaction -- highly recommend this Vizio model.

Reviews.Title: Good Value
Reviews.Author: Andre R Rosete
Reviews.Content: This TV is a good value at $500.You can plug in a USB wireless keyboard to type things into search boxes in the Smart TV interface.I was disappointed that the 120Hz refresh rate is false, evident when using the TV with a computer. (only 60Hz option available from resolution settings in Windows)

Reviews.Title: Very good buy.
Reviews.Author: Ric Rotondi
Reviews.Content: Great picture, lots of features, and a good price. Got delivered way fast. Have really enjoyed it so far .Overall a really good buy.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV so far...
Reviews.Author: Charles B. Firth "Chuck"
Reviews.Content: I am watching more Netflix and Amazon movies than ever now that I have one button access to both. I am not a videophile and my standards would probably not live up to some people's but I think the picture is awesome! Setup was a breeze! I have this in my man-cave/workout room mounted high on the wall and it is so sweet.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO 70 inch LED RAZOR
Reviews.Author: Chuck Gruenwald
Reviews.Content: TV is so bright I'm tempted to adjust brightness setting but I'm fairly sure I won't.  It is a joy to watch, makes small scoreboard apps easy to read, and with the what I'll call the crawler apps is much more than just a TV.

Reviews.Title: Cannot beat this TV for the price!
Reviews.Author: Michael Wolfe
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical at purchasing a Vizio at first because they have not had the best reoutation in the past. However, I am SO GLAD I bit the bullet and gave this TV a shot! Has all the best features, Amazon Instant Video, Netflix, Twitter, Facebook and more! Plus the picture quality is unmatched! I went from a 40" Samsung and the 47" Vizio blows the Samsung out of the water both in terms of color and picture quality! I would recommend this TV to anyone in the Smart TV market, the only thing is no 3D but I did not want 3D anyway since it hurts my eyes.

Reviews.Title: best tv
Reviews.Author: orvil Savery
Reviews.Content: Buy this TV you won't be disappointed. I love this tv, everything about it screams sophisticated and the colors are sublime. If your arent playing battlefield on this, then shame on you.

Reviews.Title: A Happy Customer
Reviews.Author: k. king
Reviews.Content: Wonderful....Had I known of the capabilities and functionality of a smart tv I would have obtained one long, long, long time ago. This product is truly amazing and the display is WoW! Wonderful really enjoying it, I stream movies at every given opportunity. I've not hooked up the antenna nor do I have any intentions of so doing as I specifically purchased this tv for netflix viewing only. This is a must have for all you movies lovers, very good investment.

Reviews.Title: Very good 29" TV after manual adjusting
Reviews.Author: W. Hohauser
Reviews.Content: I purchased this after getting fed up with my 24" Samsung TV's lack of an audio out, getting up to manually switch an audio selector and having to manually adjust the audio when I want to watch a BluRay or NetFlix. Unfortunately many TVs now lack an audio out that follows the change of video input. Vizio is one of the few companies that still offers this feature in moderately priced TVs. I had purchased a Vizio 32" TV in the past year for a relative and was pleased with the image so I wasn't worried about picture quality much although I knew that it would probably be a step down from Samsung's high quality.First of all, after fidgeting with the cable box to get the audio thru the HDMI, the analog audio out works well and the sound is good thru my speakers. But my warning to you starts here. Vizio has programmed the set to do a lot of "intelligent" automatic adjustments out of the box. The most noticeable is how the image is constantly adjusting itself every time a scene changes or the camera pans to a different image in the same scene. This is probably fine during a baseball game but during an average TV show or movie it's changing all the time. This irritated me to no end so I spent a few minutes and turned off every automatic function in the picture menu. From there I manually adjusted the image to my liking and it's been great ever since. The same goes with the audio, there a few automatic functions that I turned off and now it's sounding great thru the external speakers. The internal speakers are OK, better than on the Samsung but not much.Now that the set is up and been getting daily use for two weeks, I am very happy with it. The only issue I have is the loud pop it sends out on the external analog audio as the set warms up. This may not happen with the optical audio out but I can't test this. I have not tested the Smart TV part yet as my BluRay is already set up for this although it is so slow I might be tempted to see if the Vizio is faster.Update: I finally decided to switch the internet connection over to the Vizio as I was getting frustrated with how slow my 3 year old Samsung BluRay player would take to update and to switch from selection to selection for internet content. The first thing you have to do is accept some sort of Yahoo service with checkboxes, you are not asked for any info. As I wanted to watch something only available on NetFlix online I set up the account which was reasonably easy. There are other on-line options on the Vizio which I haven't tried. Netflix booted up quickly and the quality of the image is much better than the Samsung BluRay player. However, I quickly noticed that all my manual settings for the image and audio had reverted to the factory defaults. The picture went back to adjusting itself in the middle of scenes. So I went thru the menus and set everything to manual again. Not sure why this happened but the very first time i turned on the set, the Yahoo acceptance selection came up automatically. I ignored it so possibly it's somehow hooked into the initial set-up of the set and it reset everything when I finally accepted it. Keep this in mind if you purchase the set. The Vizio already did a software update since I hooked it up and it did it totally in the background unlike the Samsung BluRay player which prevents you from doing anything until it is finished.This is a very good television.

Reviews.Title: Vizio makes a great TV
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: I just got this 60 inch TV by Vizio. The picture quality is excellent. I usually use Samsung TVs because their picture is so good, but this TV is just as good. I like the way it changes channels much quicker than the Samsung also. The Smart TV feature is very well done. Netflix comes up with one button push and all of the Internet videos and YouTube are very easy to watch.you can even search through Internet programs while watching the TV.

Reviews.Title: Nice Led
Reviews.Author: rcarb
Reviews.Content: I research most items from user reviews all over cyber land  before buying them as i did with this one. I haven't had it long but i tend to abuse items in first 30 days to see if they can stand up to running 24/7 and multiple other things. So far this TV has done great and I have no complaints. I have another Vizio TV and so far have been happy with it and its over 2 yrs old. The Smart applications in this one is way beyond my older one and all of it works great. I would recommend this to my friends.

Reviews.Title: Amazing picture and easy to use
Reviews.Author: Julie
Reviews.Content: The TV is great.  It has a real nice picture and it's so nice to have netflix built into the menus and the remote.  I am probably going to buy one more - definitely satisfied with our purchase.

Reviews.Title: Perfect size tv for my bedroom
Reviews.Author: Jessica Fisher
Reviews.Content: This tv does everything I need it to do! I love that it has the smart tv features and the picture looks just like my Samsung plasma!! Great tv great price would definitely buy another Vizio!

Reviews.Title: Good TV wouldn't get a smart tv again
Reviews.Author: Michael Kopplin
Reviews.Content: I like the picture quality and use the netflix app but most of the smart tv functions are not used.  I would have rather bought a roku or apple tv with the difference in price between smart and regular tv.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely amazing TV
Reviews.Author: WMH
Reviews.Content: This TV has a GREAT picture!  Very sharp and clear.  Using this TV on my outdoor patio and the picture has plenty of light during the daytime.  Logged into the TV's wireless WiFi using our PRIME account and caught up on Downton Abbey series.

Reviews.Title: Good little TV
Reviews.Author: Kelly W. Chandler "Kelly Wood"
Reviews.Content: Great TV at a fair price.  The apps are kind of limited to what Yahoo "sells" but serves the purpose.  If you want more apps (like the Amazon Cloud player), I'd recommend a Roku player.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture, But VIZIO Cut Corners on the Design
Reviews.Author: Gatorowl
Reviews.Content: We had our kitchen redone last year.  The design included a space for a wide-screen TV.  The designer misinformed me about the size of the space so I purchased a 26" TV.  It was a nice TV but I wanted the biggest TV that could fit into the 29.5"-wide space.  I hoped to fit a 32" TV in the space, but the smallest 32 had a 29.5 width.  I thought about ordering it, but opted to not risk it. I, therefore, purchased the 29" VIZIO instead.The bezel is very slim, so the TV easily fits in the allotted space. The price is definitely a bargain.  My BIL purchased a 30" HD about 7-8 years ago. The image quality was not nearly as good, and the cost was at least 3 times as much.  The IQ on the VIZIO is good in standard def, and excellent in HD.  That really isn't much of a surprise since it is much easier to produce a 29-30" screen than a 52" screen like I have in my bedroom.  Moreover, the capabilities are excellent.  I'm an Amazon Prime Instant Video user.  To see IV movies on my other TVs, I use a Blu-Ray player that has WI-FI and extra functions built in. It's always a hassle switching from regular TV to the extra functions.  By contrast, on the VIZIO, there is a dedicated Amazon IV button built into the remote! In fact there are two other dedicated buttons for NetFlix and U-GO. In addition, it appears that there are 4 additional buttons that can be programmed, presumably to access other services. I have to give the TV a top score for added functionality.However, I have to deduct a star for the construction.  VIZIO must intend this TV to be wall mounted because the stand is the crappiest piece of design I have seen associated with a high quality electronic product.  The stand is basically a flimsy piece of plastic that screws into the back.  Like a desktop picture frame, it points the TV upwards at about a 25 degree angle.  For me, this is unacceptable since the TV is already sitting on a shelf that's almost 6' above the floor. I had to put something under the stand to shift the angle.  This fix doesn't leave me with the greatest confidence that I won't lose the TV due to an accident bump or earthquake.Therefore, if you plan to wall mount this product, it deserves 5 stars. If, however, you need to employ the cheap stand, then the TV leaves a little bit to desire.Regardless, given the incredibly low price, it's hard for me to complain to loudly.

Reviews.Title: Fashlighting and white dots on the bottom screen
Reviews.Author: Joe M.
Reviews.Content: Two problems I found is that there is a small brite spot on the bottom right hand corner. Only noticeable when watching dark movies. And now after only 3 months of light use there is 3 brite white spots on the bottom of the screen. Vizio is swithcing it out but there giving me a returned refurbished tv. I then went to Best Buy, BJs and Target and found the same white dots on all three displays. You can only see these spots on a white screen like a hockey game. Vizio you should have a recall on these tvs before there is a majoe lawsuit. I am really dissapointed because before this I loved this TV and now I am stuck with a lemon, beware.

Reviews.Title: Smart HDTV
Reviews.Author: Akbutter
Reviews.Content: This TV is awesome.  I can access Netflix from it, get a variety of crazy channels via cable, and can surf the web and watch YouTube.  Great little TV.  Nice picture.  Very good sound.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: The Mate
Reviews.Content: First and only HDTV that I own, it is good as far as Im concerned, good picture, and sound. Updates automatically and does what it should. Would buy another one.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, would buy it again
Reviews.Author: Peter W.
Reviews.Content: Pros:- The picture is awesome. My Samsung was a 720p DLP. This is a 1080p LED. My wife immediately noticed the difference when I was playing 1080p content. She mentioned several times to me how beautiful the picture is. I sensed she was skeptical when I bought it because I don't think she has ever heard of Vizio before. I had though, so it wasn't a concern for me.- The sound is pretty good. I noticed when I watched Jurassic Park on this tv though that it lacks bass (during the title sequence with the loud booms). When I had my Samsung, I had the video and audio running through an Onkyo receiver. The sound coming through the 7.1 speakers clearly blew away anything out of the tiny speakers in this tv (which I presume are larger than some thinner tvs).- Because this tv had 4 HDMIs (4!), I could hook up all of my devices without needing an a/v receiver. I sure do miss the bass though, but I'm in a town-home. My neighbors probably have no complaints now.- Built-it Netflix and Amazon (to name just two) saves me from having to run my 2nd generation "fat" PS3 (another 300 watts).- In about a month of using this tv, I have saved 200 kilowatt hours and some money too on my electricity.Cons:-The remote is terrible. It is nice to have built-in buttons for Netflix and Amazon, but this remote requires you to press hard to get a response. Sometimes, you don't even know if the press registered. I replaced it with a programmable Logitech Harmony. This tv also requires you to point your remote directly at the sensor on the lower left corner of the bezel, or nothing happens.-The Internet apps, including Netflix are slow to load and buggy.I ordered it here at Amazon, price is just amazing: http://amzn.to/13ErHQn

Reviews.Title: it stopped working after only 4 months of very limited use !
Reviews.Author: Pamela J. Ray
Reviews.Content: I had this installed on the wall now I have to get someone to help me get it down so I can find the serial number on the back and contact vizio this tv was working great and I only used it for a short while everyday but it now has a black screen and will not work. I am going to contact vizio and pray it has a warranty but I know I would not buy this brand ever again.

Reviews.Title: Love TV But Hate the Remote
Reviews.Author: J Baker
Reviews.Content: The Vizio Smart HDTV is all I expected it to be, but the remote is way to stiff with way to small buttons. It would be nice if Vizio would make a new larger remote for this TV and send it out as a FREE replacement to all model owners. The TV itself has brilliant picture quality. I would recommend this TV to anyone looking for a great TV.

Reviews.Title: Wow! Great tv
Reviews.Author: Wayde LaRue
Reviews.Content: Great TV. Have in the kitchen on a wall mount. Bought this because comments about audio being better than most. It's more than fine for what we use it for. Highly recommend this TV!

Reviews.Title: Perfect for what we needed.
Reviews.Author: Vielehr
Reviews.Content: We bought this to mount on the wall in our bedroom. The 29" is not a common size, but it provided that perfect fit bigger than 26 and smaller than 32. Love the built in connectivity, used mostly for Hulu and Amazon streaming. We also have a 47" Vizio in our living room.Very impressed with this brand.

Reviews.Title: Another AMAZING vizio tv for our living room
Reviews.Author: Hillary L. Wald "hw"
Reviews.Content: We had another LCD vizio that we loved but needed something bigger and better :)  Got another vizio and LOVE this thing!  Perfect size for our small living room, makes watching tv or a movie a fun experience.  I'm no tv expert but this thing is user friendly and very clear.  Cool how you can watch movies with a couple clicks from our amazon prime account.  This tv is big but not too huge, would have gone with a 50" if you're into super big tvs or your living room is big.  Love our new vizio tv :)

Reviews.Title: Perfect for Small/Medium Living room
Reviews.Author: Ranjit Raveendran
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV  from  Amazon, 2 days back, Impressed with the quality even with 720P, Worth a buy @ $278 from Amazon for a smart HDTV. Installtion steps are simple as I connected WIFI and Cable in a minute and watched Movies in Netflix right away without any breaks or buffering (My WIFI modem is so close to TV). Got a Dilemma between Samsung HDTV and this one, As Samsung doesnt guaranteed the Smart version, I opted this one and quite happy with this.

Reviews.Title: No 3D Was Actually an Incentive!
Reviews.Author: MikeyrInKY "Mike"
Reviews.Content: This is arguably the best entry level 60" Smart LED/LCD HDTV on the market. Amazon sold me this great TV for less than a grand. The performance has been spectacular. I expected the HD content to look good and it has not disappointed, but the surprise is how well it does with SD content. I was unimpressed by all the 3D flat screens I've seen. In fact, one of them made me nauseated. As far as I'm concerned, no 3D was a plus!After winning a 40% off coupon from Square Trade, I got a 4 year warranty for about a hundred bucks. Now I have worry free enjoyment of my big screen tv.

Reviews.Title: Good Purchase
Reviews.Author: G. P. Jenkins Jr.
Reviews.Content: This television was purchased to replace a dinosaur of a 19" TV.  Since it was in a smaller room, (12'x14') I decided to try a 720p versus a 1080.  I decided to try one with the Smart TV options as I have been a Prime member for about 6 months.The television's setup was very easy.  It connected to my cable system without a problem.  It connected to my wireless network flawlessly.  The smart options worked without any issues.The picture is great.  It is impossible to notice the difference between this 720 TV and my 42' 1080, and 46" 1080 sets.  The sound is adequate for a smaller room.  The build seems solid and well put together.  The only thing that could have been done better is a longer electric cord.  It is about 3' long.  Not a big issue, but my only "complaint".I would recommend this TV to anyone looking for a reasonably priced LED.

Reviews.Title: slow startup, weak remote, otherwise great
Reviews.Author: Zachary Berman "nerd about town"
Reviews.Content: I use this TV only for Netflix, Amazon, Pandora and Hulu plus. No antenna, no cable. No ethernet, either, works great on wifi. It's replacing a computer that we had set up in front of the couch that we nicknamed "the tv". I was happy with programming selection, just wanted a bigger clearer screen.It works great for all of these, and I especially appreciate the option in advanced menu to set output volume to variable. I have the audio output to my stereo (as I was doing with the computer) and it is lovely to be able to adjust volume from the one remote. One remote! How many people have a tv experience with one remote?!That said, the remote has tiny buttons placed in awkward places (it's virtually impossible to find pause and play in the dark). Startup doesn't take quite as long as Windows XP, but close (30-40 seconds). If you lose the remote, you lose access to the smart features, because there the only button to access those features is on the remote: A big downside for me, a man with a toddler.I was waiting for a 32" smart tv under $300. This is it.

Reviews.Title: Constantly have to restart
Reviews.Author: Aphrodite Starr
Reviews.Content: This is an ok TV.  The picture comes in nicely, the sound is good.  The size is perfect for the bedroom.  The remote does not bother me because for the most part I use the cable remote.  But the remote does feel flimsy and that it could break easily.  I am thinking of ordering another while this model is still being produced because I have a feeling down the line I may need. it.  The main problem with this TV is that it takes a LONG time to turn on.  I have Sony Bravia Smart TV that does not take nearly as long.  And a lot of times both the TV and cable are on and nothing happens or it freezes and I have to restart.  Glad I did not spend a lot of money on this one6 month update:  Still have to restart quite a bit as I will turn it on and nothing happens.  Additionally it takes a long time to boot up when it does turn on. So it you are running upstairs to catch the last 5 minutes of something on this TV - Don't.  You will miss it if you do as it takes a while to start. Other than that I still like the picture and the sound.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the $$$
Reviews.Author: Audy Joy
Reviews.Content: This TV has great picture quality.  The moment I turned it on I noticed everything looked much more crisp than a couple other TVs I had.  The sounds seems to work fine.  I didn't adjust any of the settings so it seems to come out of the box pretty much ready to go.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Edia E. Bedell
Reviews.Content: I love my new tv.  It was easy to install and has a great picture.  I would recommend it others.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, especially for the price.
Reviews.Author: Kevin J Marsh
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this unit.  First, it was very affordable.  But even if it wasn't, the picture is great, The on board sound is way better than what's on my 42" Sharp that I paid a bunch more for.  Getting on line was a synch and haven't had any issues with NetFlix or Amazon instant video to speak of.  If you are looking for a solid, dependable 32", don't waste your money, get this bad boy.

Reviews.Title: Great price, great product!
Reviews.Author: Cheryl L Rosenberger
Reviews.Content: I originally bought this product because of the apps that come along with the television.  It works great!  I can watch netflix without having to watch the movies only on my computer.  The picture quality is fantastic.  I did want to say that the sound on this television is great!  Most of the flat screen televisions do not produce good sound, but the sound on this one is really great!.  Fantastic product and I saved 20.00 alone not paying tax, and because I am a prime member I saved an additional 10.00; in all I saved 30.00 on this purchase!  I love Amazon.com!

Reviews.Title: Good TV, Good Value
Reviews.Author: zenvent
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty decent TV, especially when compared to TVs in its price range. I originally had a 1080p projector theater (110" screen). Though I like the size and quality of the projector much more (it was a 1k dollar Optoma HD20), it could not compete with any light sources. Now that I have a new theater room with windows, I wanted a LCD/LED TV to compete.The TV arrived in a giant box, and surprise had a giant TV. Though it still seemed small to me, my girl friend was very excited about it's size. The picture is great, provided scenes are not too dark. All black reveals why this TV is cheaper, bleeding and contrast uniformity is not there- but I don't mind that and really only notice it on the black INPUT SELECT screen.The remote is pretty neat, however not many applications allow you to use the keyboard in my experience. I wish there was a way to assign inputs to buttons, instead of pressing input and scrolling each time.Annoyances:The TV OSD (interface / GUI) is terrible. It runs very slow, which is surprising because apps run very well. It reminds me of older android phones, where input is very laggy and outdated feeling. It works, however it does not feel like it belongs on such an expensive TV.-Streaming, I thought I was going to be able to play .mkv files on this TV, and while you can - it's difficult to stream them. You cannot browse your sever as you would with a PC, you have to have media streaming setup. In reality it's no better than what consoles offer as a streaming solution.In the end I hooked a HTPC to it so I could watch movies I "found" on the internet. Netflix and amazon prime are the only two "smart" features I use on this TV.Conclusion:If you're looking for a big TV to play games on and watch cable, this is it- look no further. I really couldn't find any competition in this price range. However you may want to visit a store and see if they have the 60" version to compare, it would save you a significant amount of money and to me doesn't seem much smaller.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV for the money!
Reviews.Author: Adam P.
Reviews.Content: This TV is fantastic.  Great color and clarity as well as some great features.  The bezel is great because it's small and is the way all TV's should be!

Reviews.Title: VIZIO E601i-A3 60-inch 1080p 120Hz Razor LED Smart HDTV
Reviews.Author: Shannon M. Sanders
Reviews.Content: this television is awesome love the remote with qwerty key board on the back side only flaw is the base of the tv and remote doesn't light up at night picture quality is fantastic had a plasma tv prior to this purchase and it looks just as good.

Reviews.Title: Great price and value
Reviews.Author: Paul Meehan
Reviews.Content: A smart TV priced very well.  We needed a TV for a guest room and wanted it to be "smart" and finding this product filled our need completely.  Picture every bit as good as our much larger and pricier Sharp Aquos we use as our primary TV.

Reviews.Title: Visio smart tv
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: It is a great television.  I love it.  I plan to buy another one in the near future.  The color and the clarity of the screen are great.  It was delivered on time and the setup was easy.

Reviews.Title: Vizio E320i-AO 32-inch
Reviews.Author: Donna M P
Reviews.Content: Have no complaints about the picture, better, it seems, than my larger and much more expensive plasma. Sound is just okay, but it is very easy to plug a sound bar into it.

Reviews.Title: Fourth Vizio HDTV
Reviews.Author: E. Treants "tree"
Reviews.Content: TV Weighs less than 50 lbs so wall mounting was a breeze.just as well asWhy do you buy a TV?  For me it comes down to one word - Picture.  And this TV really does deliver in that category.  I always though I had a great Picture in 1080i and I did.  BUT this TV has 1080p and that is a world apart as far as clarity and wow!  The TV does not support 480i, but will support and switch automatically into 480p, 720p, 1080i and 1080p.  The biggest problem here is that knowing 1080p is out there, I have a really hard time watching some channels (networks) that are not broadcasting in the highest quality HD signals available.Sound - hey this is not my Bose Wave Radio/CD player.  It is a TV and has sound dependent on different broadcasters.  The built in Surround System does a very good job, but is not an Audiophile's dream system.  I can enjoy the sound of the Tenners on PBS just as well as Football or Wrecks at NASCAR.  If you want a better sound system, they are all over the place, invest in one, but this is more than adequate in my opinion.Internet Access:  Sure does have it and it works fine.  Speed of access is dependent only on the speed of your connection.  Mine buzzes right along and internet access is a lot faster than Direct TV.  Not as many "wait while buffering" messages.  In fact none while using internet access.Remote Control:  Really must have to access internet functions.  Cannot use to control Direct TV, so you will still have to have at least 2 remotes.  Backside of remote is QWERTY and used to enter information at times, not really that great but looks nice, can use the front just as well with a little more movement of keys.Last: Picture one more time.  Really Great Picture and REALLY BIG.  Went from 42 inch to 60 inch and it is a world of difference.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Lorraine
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for a month now and I love it! The TV was so simple to set up. It is so easy to access netflix and hulu. The only complaint I have is it that the remote is small. It is sometimes difficult to hit the right button. But other than that I think its great.

Reviews.Title: Easy Neflix and Amazon Prime Access for a good price
Reviews.Author: TNC49
Reviews.Content: This TV was perfectly sized for a spot in our family room. Accessing the internet was relatively easy and we have watched movies on both Netflix and Amzn Prime with no issues. Overall very satisfied with the purchase. As some of the other reviews have stated, there is a little bit of a slow "turn on" time but given that the TV in our house is already on too long, it's not a big deal for me.

Reviews.Title: Problems
Reviews.Author: JT
Reviews.Content: I bought my Vizio 60" E601i-A3 about a month ago. Since then I have stated to experience problems with turning it "on or off." Twice I have had to unplug it from behind to get it to turn off. Neither the remote or manual button worked. Also a couple of times it would not turn "on" until many tries. Also, while thinking I was gettting a good price thru Amazon, this was not true. Walmart, Target & K-Mart, all were selling for a $100 or more cheaper. Got caught with my shorts down on this one.

Reviews.Title: HD tv
Reviews.Author: g-books
Reviews.Content: Great tv. Picture is remarkable. I have only one complaint. The remote could have been more substantial.However, the value and quality of the tv make it a great purchase. I shopped for a while and found this to be the best for the money by far. Buy it, you wil be pleased.

Reviews.Title: Vizio 60" LED Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Umpire.20
Reviews.Content: Purchase & Pricing –I purchased my TV on 11/21 and it was in stock.  Although I wasn’t able to get a Black Friday type price, Amazon did have a brief price change on their site.  It went from high to lower and back to high again.  I contacted Amazon asking about their price-matching because I saw a lower price at a “discount club”.  Initially the rep said I did not qualify since they (Amazon) had to add the “club membership of $40.00” to the club price.  That would have brought it back very close to Amazon’s price.  We hung up the call and within 2 minutes the rep called me back.  He realized that Amazon had made the price change I mentioned above and said I DID qualify.  He issued a credit to my account which was reflected within 24 hours.  I also got Amazon’s 2% bonus credited to me “for use on a future purchase”.  Shipping & Delivery –As an Amazon Prime subscriber I was offered delivery on 11/28.  Since Amazon also offered “white glove” delivery, with a scheduled date & time, I opted for it.  My TV was delivered on 12/1.  Although the delivery was about 1 hour late, I was still satisfied with it.  Sound –I was OK with the sound from the TV speakers but I certainly recognize that there are MANY better options.  Having them rear-facing dampens whatever comes out of them.  As a result, I added a sound bar to my setup.  I am using the Vizio SB4021M-A1.  It requires one optical connection and a power connection.  Now everything sounds GREAT.  Wall Mount –I opted for a wall mount from Monoprice(dot)com (less than $30.00).  It is a flush mount which can tilt some 15*.  With the TV mounted the front bezel is 4 inches from the wall.  The mount is “PID 4174” and is described as  “PREMIUM Adjustable Tilting 2.5mm Wall Mount Bracket for LCD LED Plasma (Max 165Lbs, 30~63inch) BLACK” on the web site.  This is one sturdy mount.  With a little help from the Mrs. it was installed & TV hanging in about 45 minutes.  Picture --I, like most users of this TV have played with the picture settings to obtain those which are ideal to me.  I have mine set pretty well, but I am still experimenting with them.  The quality of the picture and the colors etc. are just GREAT.  I’ve heard many people complain about theirs, but mine are all anyone could ask for.  Accessories --I have a Vizio sound bar model SB4021M-A1 attached.  I also have a Samsung Blu-Ray Disc/DVD Player model BD-EM57C attached to my TV.  I opted to use HDMI ports 3 and 4 for my connections.  (Some people had difficulty using HDMI 1 due to its ARC feature and they thought it was possibly their lip sync problem too).  Issues –Many people have complained about getting the BSOD (black screen of death) which led to repairs and or replacement of the TV.  I have not had such an encounter.I have had a minimal amount of lip sync, but the more I watch and pay attention, it appears to be a particular program on a particular network rather than a TV issue.  As a result, I have no complaint.The VIA bar (access to the SMART features) leaves a bit desired.  However, I didn't buy this TV to use it as a computer.  I've had no issues with any of the apps within the VIA bar, e.g. NETFLIX and others.  Conclusion –I would definitely recommend this TV to anyone looking for a 60” flat screen.  This TV replaced a Samsung 56” DLP set that was about 7 years old.  The picture quality is hands down better on the Vizio than it was on the Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Best 60" for the price!
Reviews.Author: R. B. Duncan
Reviews.Content: If you're an average TV enthusiast like me, then you don't need to pay $1500 or more for a 60" flat-screen.  This 120Hz Smart TV gives you a great picture, features like Netflix, Amazon Prime, etc., and a relatively thin frame for less than $900 (sometimes).  I got if for $888.  There isn't any other 60" with these features and quality for anywhere near that price.  Sure, if you want 3D or other high-priced features then this isn't the model for you, but if you just want to watch a nice large TV, you can't go wrong.  The bezel of this TV is thin as well as the depth.  Plenty of menu options to adjust the picture to your desired output.

Reviews.Title: This Set Is Awesome! Awesome! Awesome!!!
Reviews.Author: B. Hackman
Reviews.Content: UPDATED 04/15/2013 - I can not say enough great things about this TV set. I have now had this TV for over 2 months and can honestly say that I could not have a better picture if I would have paid 3 times the price! I do feel that your satisfaction with this unit is dependent on correct adjustment of the picture settings.  Below you will see my overall settings that I placed for the Vivid Mode:---Picture settings menu---Picture Mode: VividBacklight: 100Brightness: 19Contrast: 74Color: 59Tint: 0Sharpness: 14---Size & Position submenu---[no change]---Color Temperature submenu---Colour temperature: NormalRed Gain: 92Green Gain: 101Blue gain: 128Red offset: 128Green offset: 128Blue offset: 128--Advanced Picture submenu---Smooth motion effect: HighReal Cinema Mode: SmoothNoise Reduction: lowMPEG NR: LowColor Enhancement: Rich ColorAdaptive Luma: MediumFilm Mode: AutoBacklight Control: DCRAmbient Light sensor: OffLet me know what you think!Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: Great Television at a Great Price!
Reviews.Author: James Rillo "DRUM DEAN"
Reviews.Content: I looked long and hard for a quality 70" for my family room.We had a 67" DLP that had the Samsung name and quality. Trouble is, when the bulbs start going out on those you pay $300 each time. That gets old quick!It was time for the LED/LCD technology.I took a hard look at the Sharp 70's and the Samsung's--$2200----$2,800 just seemed too high.So I waited.When Amazon finally dropped the price to $1599, I jumped.WOW! What a difference. The 1,000,000 to one ratio makes a huge difference as does the LED back lighting.The colors just jump off the screen. Wonderful blacks.Very life like as well.The remote is user friendly with a keyboard on the back.There are also direct buttons for AMAZON and NETFLIX as well. Nice feature.The only negative I can state is that it comes with a complete joke for a stand. Will it keep it standing probably, but the width of the base for a Television this size is a joke. It moves and jiggles like a jumping bean on a table top. UNSTABLE!Thus, it was worth the money to mount the T.V. to the wall and junk the stand.All in all we love our new Vizio--I would recommend this set without hesitation. Amazon's delivery was on time, and they helped my son load up the DLP for its trip to his place.Great service.---great T.V.

Reviews.Title: Little Problem
Reviews.Author: Rit566
Reviews.Content: Got the first set it was defective Amazon quickly sent another tv, Its fantastic has an amazing picture and the sound is not bad at all, Internet apps take a bit to get use to but work great.the only thing I would like to see is a complete owners manual you only get a quick set up guide but you can get that at vizio .com

Reviews.Title: Above and beyond expectations.
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: This is a great buy! I still look at prices online and instore, I feel like I got a Great deal. It has a Amazon and Netflix button on the remote. Apps are preloaded and easy to use. Picture is great!  Very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: This VIzio is great!!
Reviews.Author: sean sullivan
Reviews.Content: This is my third Vizio. I love these TV's.  They are priced excellent and work really well. The Picture quality for this TV is good to excellent. The sound quality is a little to be desired and so I added a sound bar to address that issue.  The APPs on the TV are easy to use.  I f you are looking for a great priced and great TV. This is the one!!

Reviews.Title: Good value for the money. . .
Reviews.Author: GeeBee
Reviews.Content: Let me say straight off, I bought this locally and not from Amazon.  There was no difference in price and I wanted to see the floor model before I bought. But I like the Amazon user reviews, this is my 'go-to' site for user reviews so I want to contribute my experience with this TV.The 60 inch screen is BIG! Not TOO big, mind you, but big enough, and we have a large family room, I think. I'm glad I let my wife talk me out of that 70 inch screen.  It would have overpowered that room. I suspect you won't see many TVs much larger than 70 inches in size in the future, I can't imagine a room in a typical family home that could handle such a screen.  Remember, they look a lot smaller in the showroom! It replaced an old 48 inch 1st gen Panasonic rear projection HD TV that was showing its age (but was plenty big screen wise)Image quality and color is REALLY good, and I have not noticed the narrow angle of view issue that many reviews refer to and I think we have a wide viewing angle in our family room. Image quality is good EVEN when using 75 ohmn coax, IQ with the composite cables are at least as good as with coax.  We have digital, but not HD cable service, so I guess we get our signal in at 480p from cable, but the image is excellent, better than the old Panny.From other user reviews, I had done my research and was prepared to make the needed adjustments that would take care of any lip synch issues I might encounter.  However, I didn't have any lip synch problems.  I wonder if that issue is related to a certain brand or type of cable box.Netflix and Amazon have dedicated buttons on the remote so using them is EASY.  Netflix comes in at 720p as always, and the image is amazing on this TV. I don't use Amazon prime.Regarding the remote, it's pretty cool.  On one side, it is a standard remote with dedicated Netlix and Amazon buttons on the front, and on the flip side,it has a full QUERTY Chicklet type keyboard. On the keyboard side, there are also some gaming type control buttons.  You can download games from the app store (run by Yahoo on behalf of Vizio).  Other apps include Crackle, Hulu+, Vudu, etc. Pretty much similar in variety and in operation to the Roku store. More on this in a bit.The sound is typical tiny and tinny tv sound.  But in defense, the bezel (the frame) around the screen is only about 1/2 inch wide and an inch or so deep, not a lot of space for room filling speakers.  I think we will buy a sound bar for this set eventually.  But I have some spare higher quality PC speakers, in the meantime, I will look into hooking them up.Edit 1/15/13:I've tried to hook up my computer speakers to this TV only to discover that there is no 3.5 mm mini-plug outlet.  There are 2 RCA audio connections on the back and theoretically you can get a converter that converts to a female mini-plug, but Best Buy and HH Greg don't seem to carry them.  I guess I could order from Amazon or other internet vendor, but it seems kind of crazy to pay all that shipping if you don't have other things to buy.  I'll try Radio Shack across town later today.Major problem? No, but a bit of a pain, yes.  The 3.5 mini-plug socket should be part of any device with audio, in my mind.End of Edit:Set up was kind of odd. My Comcast cable box is considered an antenna source if using 75 ohm coax, but a cable connection if using composite cables on the same cable box. (My Comcast Cable box doesn't have HDMI).  The directions could have been clearer on this.I think the User Interface for set up is kind of complex and not very intuitive. I think it could be easier to use. As I said earlier, you have the ability to download apps to the TV from Yahoo even a few games and special Yahoo content apps, however that process seems kind of hidden.  Once you get to it, it works great and it's easy, but getting there is a tad difficult.  That being said, it is unlikely a child would accidentally get there and download something you don't want on your set.The wireless internet connectivity works pretty well.  My wireless router is about 40 feet away on the same floor as the TV.  Set up was relatively easy, but the TV set could be a little better in telling you the status of your connection. I had connected to my router on the first try, but hadn't realized it.  So I kept trying to complete the connection and it kept telling me that all it could find were my neighbor's networks.  Finally I realized it also kept telling me that the network I was on might be a bit slow.  (It isn't, trust me, this, I know) So I tried to get on to Netflix, and son of a gun! it worked!All the confusion aside, once you get the TV set up the way you like, the day to day operation is pretty straight forward and not difficult to use. But getting there could be easier.  Vizio needs to work on the out of box user experience I think.I feel I got a lot for my money, and I would buy it again.  If the users are tech savvy, then they should not hesitate to buy this TV.  But if the users need help setting up a regular tv then they will need someone to help them set this TV up for sure.  But like I said earlier, the day to day operation is pretty easy.  Even grandma should be able to use the set day to day (and even use Netflix and Amazon Prime!)I'm a happy camper with a HUGE TV.

Reviews.Title: Best deal for a TV this size and quality!
Reviews.Author: Jeff Reyes
Reviews.Content: I purchased this television for my parents as a Christmas present.  First off shipping was a breeze and the delivery men even set the TV up for my parents. The size and clarity of the picture are amazing for this price point.  I would recommend this TV for anyone looking to enjoy high definition at a fraction of the cost of a "big box" brand.

Reviews.Title: Vizio E6011-A3 60" T. V. 1080p  120Hz Razor LED smart HDTV
Reviews.Author: Barbara C. Meredith
Reviews.Content: We really love this T.V.  The picture is so clear & bright that you can tell the color of everyone's eyes and background items clearly.  We ordered this T. V. through Amazon.com and were unsure as to what we would be getting.  We did not see this item in person, but heard that Vizio had a great clear picture, so we ordered it because it was on sale at Amazon.com.  Our order went right through and Amazon responded to our order by e-mail, informing us that delivery would be on a certain day by a certain carrier.  Delivery was free.  It came delivered right into our house on the day indicated.  The delivery person brought it into the house, unpacked it, and checked it out to make sure that it worked and no damage was done.  We were really pleased at how our order was handled by Amazon, and how fast our order was processed.  I would order again from Amazon.com without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV
Reviews.Author: T. Johnson
Reviews.Content: I have been researching this tv for over a month and finally decided to buy it for my husband as a Christmas gift. It replaced our old school 32" tube tv. I was nervous that the tv would have some issues like other viewers have mentioned (light bleed, lines across screen, or lip syncing problems.) So far, it's perfect! Beautiful picture! Just crossing my fingers that it continues to work just as well for years to come. Totally worth the money!

Reviews.Title: Good for price
Reviews.Author: Lawrence Wolfram
Reviews.Content: Nice picture directly in front of the TV. But it fades out on a less than directly in front of the set. Cost is very good and the apps work, although the apps are slow operating if the side views were better I would give this a 4 star rating.I would recommend a purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture
Reviews.Author: NewOrleansLady
Reviews.Content: Love this tv, and the internet functions are great!  The stand could be a little sturdier, but we plan to mount so that wont be an issue much longer!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Sharilyn K. Franzman
Reviews.Content: Really good color and great features.  Delivered into the house in perfect condition. Very pleased with this purchase!  Considering getting another for the living room.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: James Ballew
Reviews.Content: Excellant picture. Good sound. Easy to set-up  Great price for the value and quality. Have not used it yet but the internet connection looks interesting.  The shipper helped unpack and assure no dammage and that the TV worked properly.  Excellant experience.

Reviews.Title: Exceeded my expectations
Reviews.Author: Bradley Freeman
Reviews.Content: This TV deserves five stars based on its cost and quality. The picture is stunning, bright, and sharp.  The 120hz helps with fast movement but still not as good as plasma which is still the best technology for sports.  Regardless, soccer, football, and basketball look great and I don't believe I am missing anything.  I am more than satisfied with this tv. The smart features are a plus but not a huge benefit as most everything seems to be connected but it is nicely tucked into a single unit. The contrast is fine.  I know some people have complained about white bleeding but I have not experienced that ith my set.In general: This is a great set. I would recommend it to anyone, especially at this price point.

Reviews.Title: VERY nice XXXL TV!  Perfect for large room!
Reviews.Author: CC
Reviews.Content: Well after waiting 3 weeks for delivery (from Costco - not Amazon.  Amazon was unfortunately sold out) I FINALLY received my TV.One word - WOW.  First off, its HUGE!  Second off, its HUGE!  Very easy to setup, wall mounted, hooked up my Vizio VHT-215 soundbar and I was ready to go.Impressed.  I caught the BF price of $1499 and managed to get Costco to throw in a free 5 year Square Trade warranty for the hassle over the delivery.A+

Reviews.Title: Best value in its size.
Reviews.Author: Steelers4life
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item from Amazon and have had it for a while now. It has everything you could want but 3D. I'm saving for the new 4K resolustion technology, until those sets arrive with and are found as advertised, this set will get me by and then some. I've tweeked the settings and find that the video temp. control set to "cool" rather than "normal" makes those whites really white and skin tones more natural.My settings:Picture mode: NormalBacklight: 52 (Darkening the backlight 50 - 60 is the key along with keeping the brighness 50-60 as well to a film-like image to get great black level performance. Raising the backlight setting to 90+ will give you that LED "POP" that plasma can't achieve, but kiss your blacks goodbye).Brightness:50Contrast: 70 (Sharp clear whites/deep blacks)Blacks are the deepest you're going to find in a non local dimming LED set, making this an outstanding value.Color: 52 (As good as the top of the line Panasonic plasma VT series. Yes, I said VT series.)Tint:0Sharpness:2Color Temp.: CoolRed: 104Green:110Blue:128Red Offset:128Green Offset:128Blue Offset:128Smooth motion effect: Low (I don't notice the soap opera effect - picture to smooth unnatural)All other settings set to off.My Wife didn't want to spend more than a grand since she knows 4K resolution is right around the corner.For under a grand, this is the best value/perfoming set you're going to find. With all that being said, if your looking for 3D in the here and now, go for an LG which is using passive 3D glasses able to see only 540 to each eye rather then active 3D glasses Full 1080P to each eye Panasonic and Samsung use, but it's going to cost you plenty more. I may also add that passive 3D glasses are cheaper, lighter and also don't require a battery.The screen is a bit reflective, but less so than other LED TVs costing much more.As far as the brand goes, Vizio is considered on the lower end by enthousiasts. Judging by the performace of this set AFTER it is calibrated one can certainly argue that point.I'm hoping it is durable enough to get me by until 4K becomes affordable.I would recommend this TV, but the settings need to be tweeked or you'll be looking to spend hundreds more on another brand to match its size and specs.

Reviews.Title: Good product for the price
Reviews.Author: Sunny K
Reviews.Content: This is a good product for the price. Amazon provided a great carrier too. I highly recommend this product. It can hook with PS3, Wii, Apple TV, Blu Ray. Love it!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Visio 60" LED Flat Panel TV
Reviews.Author: DK "Health Concious"
Reviews.Content: I have a 32" Vizio LCD TV and am very satisfied with the product.  So, when I saw the price on the new Vizio 60" Razor Thin set, I opted to make the purchase.  The picture quality is pretty good and it has hook ups for wi-fi, which interested me even more, because I can use my IPad with the TV.For the price, you can't go wrong.  I even called Vizio with a question, and their customer service was very helpfuland friendly. The only issue I have is with the remote.  The texting keys are on the backside, and sometimes when you hold the main part of the remote to change channels, you end up pressing those keys.  They should have made a sliding cover for remote.  Also, they don't have paper manuals anymore.  All instructions are programmed into the TV.  A hassle to lookup.Otherwise, a good set choice!

Reviews.Title: Crystal Clear Picture
Reviews.Author: Thomas
Reviews.Content: I have had a few HDTV's in the past (37" LCD 720P, 42" LCD 1080P and 43" Plasma 720P) and the VIZIO E601i-A3 60-Inch 1080p 120Hz Razor LED Smart HDTV blows them all away.The picture quality is so incredible, it makes the movies almost look fake. I sometimes feel like I'm watching a play on broadway rather than an actual Hollywood movie. The clarity couldn't be better. I can literally see the pores on people's faces.All of my prior TV's, in my opinion, were thin enough. This TV is so thin, that in order to really get any thinner it would just have to be a screen and that's it. It's about an inch and a half thick.The sound quality is surprisingly not bad. Let's face it, you don't buy a TV for the sound quality. I mean where are they supposed to put the speakers in a TV that is an inch a half thick? Having said that, I can actually turn up the volume to where it's pretty loud (over half way) and it doesn't get distorded like all of my prior TVs did.The best part about the TV, in my opinion, is the fact that it's a smart TV. I love that I can listen to my favorite radio stations on Pandora or flip over to Netflix and watching a movie in stunning HD. I also love the fact that if I'm bored and want to search the web for funny or interesting videos I can do it right there on my TV on a massive 60" screen rather than my little 16" laptop. You can also browse Facebook and update your status on the TV as well.The setup is extremely user friendly. Within the same day, I was cruising through the menu and was pushing buttons on the remote without even looking. Speaking of the remote, it pretty much has every button that you would ever need to work the TV and all the aspects of the TV without being overwhelming and not being confused. You can go straight to Netflix with a push of a button as well as a couple of other applications. The only negative thing I have to say about the remote is that I can't program it to work my blu ray player (not that I'm aware of anyway).Overall, I'm extremely satisfied with my purchase. For the price compared to the larger named brands, you really can't beat it. The picture quality combined with it being a smart TV is an excellent duo. I would highly recommend this TV to anyone who is looking for the best.

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Jones
Reviews.Content: We purchased this t.v. for a bedroom about a month ago. The size is perfect for the location; the picture quality is excellent and setup was quite easy. Don't know yet about its endurance over time, but so far, I would recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: WORKED FOR A TOTAL OF 42 DAYS!  (Screen Dead!)
Reviews.Author: Hyma
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to get this for the "special price" on black Friday. Tv worked well right out of the box, not plasma picture quality, but for the price i wasn't complaining.After about a week i dealt with the audio sync issues and would have to turn it off/back on again.Now the screen is completely dead, the TV back light is on and power light is on, but NO PICTURE!**Thankfully Amazon is awesome and is exchanging, but I have had more issues with this tv in the first month and a half that i have with all my other tv's combined**

Reviews.Title: Cheap Quality Parts
Reviews.Author: Michael A Toto
