Reviews.Content: speaker stopped working after 3 months. the extended warrantee I purchased was worthless. I had to send the TV back to Vizio repair depot in CA....waiting 4-6 weeks for the TV to be fixed. Next time I need a TV I will go to Costco. Integral Netflix and Amazon menus are horrible

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price, but NOT a 120hz TV
Reviews.Author: Javery
Reviews.Content: To start with, for the money I paid for this TV (on sale for $429), I'd probably buy it again.Pros: The picture looks great in general, but I'd recommend playing around with the settings until you're satisfied. Compared to my last piece of crap TV, the sound is actually pretty great. The app selection is fairly small, but it has most of the staples - Netflix, Hulu Plus (if you like commercials), Pandora, Amazon Prime, and a bunch of those online movie stores everyone keeps pushing. It also has DLNA capability, which I haven't used since it froze up on me the first time I tried it. 4 HDMI inputs is also a big plus.Cons: Even though it says 120hz, it really isn't. I've scoured the menus and the manuals looking for the Smooth Motion setting, but it just isn't there. I'm fairly sure they just skipped it for this model. I'm not a huge fan of the soap opera effect, but I don't really mind it. I DO mind this TV being labeled 120hz when it clearly is just a 60hz TV.

Reviews.Title: A Great TV and The Best Deal Available On a 70" LED TV If...
Reviews.Author: SuperJon
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV directly from Amazon in Sept 2013.  From the very first time I powered up the set, I had issues with a "ghost effect" in the darker screens.  The set appears to suffer from temorary "burn-in."  This is only noticeable on the dark or black screen shots directly after the regular picture was up on screen.  I tried resetting the settings and adjusting the settings all with no luck and no change.  I changed up the sources, too, to confirm the issue was not with a source.  That made no difference.I ran the TV for 10 days and the issue did not change.  I contacted Amazon who was simply amazing at providing customer support.  They, once again, reaffirmed to me why I prefer to buy my electronics from them!  Within minutes they agreed to send me a new TV at no cost to me and they also paid to take the old one back.  All I needed to do was be home to allow the shipping company to do there job!  Amazon said that this service is standard from them for the first 30 days of the TV's purchase life.  They also said the 30 days was reset when I got the replacement TV.  That's service!Unfortunately, the second TV suffered from the same issue.  In fact, the issue was even worse!  I again contacted Amazon who is taking care of me.  However, I also, this time, contacted Vizio to see there thoughts.  So far, all they want me to do is keep emailing them pictures of various screen shots showing the TV doing what I say it is doing.  They have not been of any significant help yet.  They said that they may just need to send me a new TV.  I told them I am going to work with Amazon as much as possible because they are much easier to deal with and require less of my time to get me satisfied.I will update this review as soon as we get to the next episode of this conundrum.

Reviews.Title: Exceptional picture - strong wifi signal - I love this TV
Reviews.Author: A Guy "Otis"
Reviews.Content: At first I was a little puzzled with some of the reviews being all over the map, but everyone's entitled to their opinion, so I'll give mine.We've only owned this tv about 2 1/2 weeks now, and I bought a refurbished unit from Amazon's 'little sister' company, so I could try out our first internet ready set without paying full price.I have to say I am very impressed with the picture clarity and all the other features of this 32" tv so far. Even with our less than spectacular internet connection, and this set being in our bedroom, over 30 feet from the wireless router, and through 3 walls, reception has been spectacular. The picture is twice as good as our 6 yr old Toshiba Regza 42" set. We use it to stream Netflix content quite a lot, and not only do most shows/movies come through crystal clear, with true color and deep blacks, but Netflix streams about 2x faster than on the larger tv outfitted with a little Magnavox media box, less than  12 feet from the wireless router. The sound quality is acceptable to our ears and another really nice thing is the usb port not only allows movie and personal photo viewing as well as music listening from a flash drive, I discovered that a WD 2 TB external hard drive is recognized and we have the option to play several hundred files from that. Of course it doesn't play all file types, but quite a few. I find the speakers good enough for me to listen to Pandora internet radio in the mornings and to enjoy it. Haven't hooked any periperals up via HDMI as yet, but a DVD player attached to the composite jacks looks excellent, so I imagine the HDMI hook ups should only be better.  If I had one small criticism of this tv it would be the remote is a bit clunky and when pressing the buttons its not as smooth as many others. Button pushes make an audible click, but it does work. This unit only came with a 90 day 3rd party warranty, being a refurb, so I will update this review if there are any changes in performance or our feelings toward it, but so far this is the best set I've ever owned, by a wide margin, and I'll be taking a hard look at the 47" Vizio when it comes time to replace our Toshiba.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV for the money
Reviews.Author: Aaron C. Ettlin
Reviews.Content: With a small footprint, slim design and an actually usable feature set, this set gets high marks from me. I love the built in WiFi and streaming video features, and the quality of the picture is great. It's not cluttered with unnecessary features like many other TVs offering better "features". I also feel like the 120hz doesn't upsample too much, like some other TVs, where their high refresh rate passes the 60hz source material (Blu-Rays, DVDs, video games, etc.) and yields an unnaturally fast looking image, making everything look like a daytime soap opera. For whatever reason the 120hz refresh rate on this Vizio feels very natural, but keeps up with fast cut scenes, or action sequences.Also, I wish I had bought this TV on Amazon, it just went on sale for $50 less than I paid for it in-store. Either way, I think this TV is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: Good picture, terrible DLNA and slow interface
Reviews.Author: D. Sauer "Unix Geek"
Reviews.Content: So, to start off, the picture is very good.  The anti-glare treatment on the screen works pretty well, and the off-angle viewing is very good both to the sides and vertically (important if you're, say, mounting this for view in a bedroom where you may be either standing up or laying down while watching).  I also liked the way that the stand attaches and removes, as it doesn't leave a stupid piece sticking out on a wall mount (the necessary allen wrench for attaching/removing the base was included, too).  It's got a nice downward-angled attachment for the power cord and the jacks on the back orient plugs parallel to the wall, so you can mount this quite close to a wall.  The frame also looked nice, though it felt pretty cheap / flimsy.  But how often do you handle a TV? :)However, the primary reason to get a "smart" TV is, IMHO, for the smartness.  And this TV is not very smart.  First, to connect this thing to a network, you must agree to some asinine Yahoo! Internet applications terms of service.  How the heck is Yahoo! even relevant anymore?  Whatever.  I had no intention of using Internet apps; I only wanted to view content from my own local network.  But you can't set up the IP address or otherwise connect it to a network until you agree to the click-through agreement.  Fine, I finally gave in and agreed.  Then, once you've done that, you're greeted with a *very* slow to respond set of apps.  Each app takes a fairly long time to load, and there are some pretty useless things on there.  Again, as I mentioned, I only wanted DLNA support to play videos and music from my existing media center network (XBMC on Ubuntu Linux, for the curious).  This POS not only takes *forever* to load the list of content (like, minutes), navigation is terrible.  No artwork is displayed, and, the best part, nearly no formats are supported.  Most all of my video is in mp4 format, which pretty much everything supports.  Not this - everything comes back "this format is not supported".  Go to Vizio's web site to find out what's supported, and all they have is a page saying that some formats may not be supported.  There's no list of what is or is not supported, just "some".  Ugh.  Look around online at formus, and people are talking about how bad Viso'z DLNA support is.  Granted, it did stream mp3s ok, but again without album art (all of my mp3s are tagged with id3v1 and 2 tags, with embedded album art) - and it was really slow to start playing them (over a nearly idle "wireless n" network).  Also, it does not broadcast on the network as a DLNA display device, so you can't do things like have your phone auto-discover the TV and play back to it.  It's a very, *very* minimal DLNA device with a sketchy implmentation of what they actually did finish (e.g, UTF support is broken, certain headers cause the TV to crash, etc).For what it's worth, I also used the Amazon instant video app.  While that app technically works, it also doesn't work well.  It does not provide access to your "watchlist", so you have to search for things you marked on something like a Roku or a better device.  There's no indication of video quality or now long it'll take to initially buffer, so if you're on a slow link, you just watch a wait cursor for however long it takes to get a video started.  It takes longer than necessary to navigate through available videos.  In summary, the Vizio Amazon app is unsurprisingly as poorly designed and unresponsive as the Vizio DLNA support.I returned the item indicating that it did not match the description on the page.  The product description says it's a DLNA-compatible smart TV, but that's like saying a child's tricycle is a car on the basis that it has more than two tires.  I bought a Samsung UN32EH5300 to replace it.  Sure, the Samsung was $100 more, but everything actually works on the Samsung.  Even the VESA mount is better; the Vizio mount used some really tiny metric bolts which were a different length on the top and the bottom, while the Samsung uses much more substantial bolts.  The Samsung's DLNA support is also way better; much faster loading (on the same network) and a better interface.  Also, there was no stupid clickthrough privacy agreement on the Samsung. :)With all that said, if you just want in inexpensive 32" LCD, the Vizio is not bad; it has a really good picture, and the remote isn't enormous.  But if you actually intend to use the "smart" features at all -- especially DLNA -- keep looking; I suggest the Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Top of class
Reviews.Author: Wayne Matthes "movie collector"
Reviews.Content: Absolutely great picture. Thin frame makes it look like a picture, low weight, easy to set.up. Connects to the internet through my router faster than my computer or Kindle does. I now have 3 Vizio TV's because of my good experience with them.

Reviews.Title: Wasn't what I expected definitely pleased
Reviews.Author: T. A. Lewis "- Mr. Lewis"
Reviews.Content: First off, the TV is wonderful. Some reviews said that the sound could be louder. I personally find the sound is more than loud enough. The picture is great. Initial set up was very easy to navigate on the screen. The HD displays a crisp, clear, and colorful picture. My only issue with the TV is that it does not have an internet browser. I was under the impression that I would be able to get on the internet right from my TV but that is not that case. It comes with some pre-installed apps, that connects using an internet connection (Ethernet cable or Wi-Fi). Looking back, I should have contacted Vizio's customer support to ask them if the TV comes with an internet browser. But I love the TV other than that. Definitely a great buy for a budget under $700.

Reviews.Title: LOVE THIS TV!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Scubafiend "scubafiend"
Reviews.Content: My old 32" tube died about 6 months ago and I had been thinking about replacing it with a large LED but just couldn't decide. I finally decided on this TV, and was just about to purchase and the price jumped $100 so I waited. Then it dropped again and I jumped on it and I'm SO GLAD I DID.I have Amazon Prime so the shipping cost me nothing. They delivered to my house, unpacked it, set it up, confirmed it was working, and would have removed packaging but I want to keep it for just a little while. Purchase and delivery were impeccable. No problems at all.So - the TV itself. OMG. The first thing I streamed from Amazon came across in HD and I literally was standing in my living room with my mouth open. Just amazing picture! I have since purchased a BluRay player - another thing I had been procrastinating on- and OMG again!!!! Worth every penny!!! I've used the Netflix and Amazon streaming apps and they work great. The remote is great - I have no problems with it. The display is sharp and brilliant even with the blinds open by it. The sound is good - particularly as compared to my Bravia. Note - I have not purchased the sound bar. I live in a condo and have to consider my neighbors so I won't really blast it but I haven't needed to put the volume above about 40.Hiccups -I think my wireless is a little fickle. If I stream to the Vizio, shut the TV off, and go to my Bravia and stream there, when I go back to the Vizio it takes a 2nd request for it to find my wireless. But it does every time. Honestly, I don't care enough about it to worry.I'm not wildly fond of the interface of the Amazon streaming app - it doesn't seem to have my watchlist unless I'm just missing something. The Netflix works fine with my queue.All in all - absolutely excellent purchase!

Reviews.Title: Vizios seem to be nice TVs
Reviews.Author: FoxyGma
Reviews.Content: We like the Vizio's.  Nice picture and decent sound out of the tv speakers for the price.  First one came damaged since it comes UPS in the store tv packaging.  This one seems fine.  Only bad comment is the internet is hard to keep connected and you need an N-router to even have a hope of connecting.  So far I've had to reconnect each time I want access but maybe I'm missing a setting.  once connected apps are slow to load but I think this seems to be the case for all devices except idevices and the ps3.

Reviews.Title: Great Product: Reasonable Price
Reviews.Author: JMarcos
Reviews.Content: Excellent TV for the price. I was a little hesistant in buying a VIZIO because the brand was little known to me. I am glad I made the purchase and only regret that I did not buy the 60 inch. It would be nice to have a web browser as one of the apps to the Smart TV software.

Reviews.Title: I Love Vizio!
Reviews.Author: ZachBG
Reviews.Content: This is my second Vizio TV and first LED Smart TV.  I shopped around a lot before buying this product and found this TV to be the best bang for the buck. The newest LED 1080 HD technology, 50 inch Smart 1080 HDTV for under $700 is a great buy.  I found comparable Samsung's and LG TV's for 400+ more, and thought this was a great TV for the price tag.The screen looks beautiful, design is sleek, thin and light.  Picture quality is incredible.I like the remote and the Amazon and Netflix buttons featured on the remote.I'm very happy with my Vizio TV and highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Overall, very happy. Amazing picture, nice functionality, great value.
Reviews.Author: on the river
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV - the picture is simply outstanding. I upgraded from a 65" DLP to this and the difference was amazing. I would say it is 3d-like without the glasses. It took some getting used to it is so crisp and deep.I love the way the netflix app works - have not played with many others. It also makes a great computer monitor over HDMI.The TV is really easy to setup - I had it on my wireless in less than 5 minutes, and when I decided to hardwire the network for my final installation the TV just picked up the hardwire and dropped the wireless. It took me 3 minutes to figure out that i didn't have to change anything. I love that.I'm using my harmony universal remote with it with very good results.This TV would get 5 stars from me if it weren't for 2 little things: * I wish the DLNA support was better. Not many people use this and maybe I should just give up. This TV's DLNA support is not good. It picks up my server, but won't play much of anything reliably. * I really wish the screen border was matte instead of glossy. This doesn't bother me as much as I thought it would though, because the frame is very thin.Overall - so far, so good. Amazing picture at a great price.Amazon special delivery? Meh. I had to help they guy carry it into the house and get it out of the box - not a huge deal but I was trying to heal a pulled muscle in my back and wish that hadn't happened. Pilot was the delivery service and they let it sit in their warehouse for 4 days before calling to set up an appointment - I had to get nasty with them to get it delivered.Update: 1/24/13 - I noticed after I wrote this review the price of the TV dropped. I called Amazon and asked that they honor their low price guarantee. I was just a couple of days out of the 14 day window, but they gave me the guarantee and refunded me the difference anyway.  Your mileage may vary, and I certainly understand that they did me a favor, but I was impressed. Amazon knows how to keep their customers happy.  BTW - I said "great value" at the old price, at the current price it's just kind of stupid how much TV you can get for your dollar if you get this one.....

Reviews.Title: Good TV for the money
Reviews.Author: Brian Hart
Reviews.Content: We purchased this tv as a second in our home. It has a good picture, decent sound, and was easy to set up and operate. I know some people remark about the sound being under whelming, but we aren't using this as a "theater" tv, just a living room sit and watch. I think for the money this Vizio is tough to beat in the 50" size. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV with a lot of features and CHEAP!
Reviews.Author: Howard P. Webb
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV on cyber Monday but through Walmart it was $300 cheaper at the time. I would have preferred Amazon but the competition had the better deal that day.The picture is unbelievable. At some times it looks almost 3D or that you're looking out a window instead of into a screen. I won't even consider another brand than Vizio after seeing this tv. As far as I can see the picture is as good or better than a Sony or LG or any other brand costing several hundreds more for the same size screen but fewer features or inputs.I only have 2 gripes. One is the sound. The volume range is 0-100 and I usually have mine set in the 40-50 range to understand what people are saying and i'm directly in front of the tv at 10 feet yet when I go into the adjoining rooms I hear and understand the speech much better? My guess is the ultra thin design just doesn't make for good speakers or speaker placement. It's like the speakers were put in facing the back or something. Lastly that on non HD programs I sometimes see thin white horizontal lines like bits of string at the very top of the screen that move left and right and change width with the movement of the show. This may be a defect with my particular tv I will be taking this up with Vizio support. But I can elliminate the problem by simply switching to the HD version of that channel...lines gone. And why would I want to watch/record a show in 480I if it's available in 1080I (cable DVR's display only 1080I to save bandwidth. To get 1080P you need Satellite DVR's I want G4 and AMC so I'm stuck with 1080I cable) anyways and 90% of what I watch is on networks with HD available.UPDATE: The white line issue was a senior moment on my part. This is my 1st Flat screen TV all I had to compare it with was PC monitors and my laptop. I was unaware you could adjust the screen left/right/up/down These features are greyed out and unusable on my PC monitor. moving the screen just 2 points vertical eliminated the white lines. So I am upgrading the TV to 5 stars.About support; Vizio is outstanding. I made a call when the tv arrived because it was very cold outside and wanted to know if I needed to let the tv acclamate to inside temp before turning it on. My wait time was less than 5 minutes and I actually got to speak to a very pleasant person who could actually speak ENGLISH for a change!!! No outsourced support with an Indian guy named "Bob" and an accent so thick you can cut it with a knife speaking through a crappy scratchy sounding headset. Clear crisp English that I had no problem understanding with my tinnitus. It was a pleasure to speak with them instead of a chore asking them to repeat every other word over and over again.UPDATE regarding support. I think it's also worth noting that Vizio reads customer reviews and comments and attempts to resolve any issue a customer puts in his comments at least on walmart.com. That just shows their level of commitment to their customers. I am just blown away by the quality of support I see and have received.I wish I could give this TV and Vizio a 4.5 out of 5 instead of just a 4.Because the white line issue was my ignorance and not the TV I raised my review to 5 stars. I don't like to give 5 star "perfect" reviews because so many customers default to 5 stars or 1 and that's an emotional reaction not an accurate rating of the product. Like it automatic perfect 5 one small issue and people hit it with a 1 out of anger not taking into account the good things about it or the issue could be with them and not the product as was with me an the white line issue. I would prefer to rate items like PC software is rated. I would give it a 96/100 because I'm still having audio issues with hearing but not understanding speech when I'm in front of the TV yet hearing it fine from the sides or rear of the set even from another room. I'm listening at 45 and my poor wife who's trying to take a nap is getting blasted with like a 75 in the bedroom 25 feet away. I'm no audiophile I just want clear sound so I don't do external sound setups nor do I need another remote to misplace. I may just get wireless headphones to keep the peace in the house :)

Reviews.Title: excellent tv with acceptable flaws
Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: I bought the TV from sam's club before Black Friday! $698. The best price for 60 inch LED.1, smart TV, most time I can watch youtube and control it with my ipad or iphone, very convenient.2, TV can play movie/video file on through, although only mp4 is supported but you can change the file name to play other format file, like mkv, avi to mp4. But rmvb is not supported.3, remote control can input letters, but it si not very sensitive, you have to point to the tv to input. And the remote control doesn't have back light.4,  Like most tv speaker, the speaker is not very good, but I connect my computer speaker to the TV, much better, just 96 cents to do that.5, I cannot visit my computer through tv, I hope vizio can have apps to do thatupdate: find the method to connect to computer--> First, ensure you home network is ready to go with Internet access and a router that acts as a DHCP server. Your PC and HDTV should be  connected to the same router. This is needed so the PC and HDTV can discover each other, and allow content to be shared. Once this is  verified, you are ready to setup a DLNA media server.--> In Windows 7, open Windows media player (Start → All Programs → Windows Media Player)  In Windows media player go to stream → Allow Internet access to home media  Click "Link Online ID" in the ensuing popup.  Next, Internet Explorer will open a download page for Windows Live Essentials. Download Live Essentials to obtain the Windows Live ID  sign-in assistant.  Install Live Essentials and repeat step 2.  This time, you'll be able to sign in with a Windows Live ID, e.g. Hotmail account.  Once signed in, go back to stream → Allow Internet access to home media.  Click "Allow Internet access to home media" in the ensuing UAC dialog box.--> So far now we have enabled media player to share our files but still we have not given the rights to play media files. In order to do that,  click stream → select "automatically allow device to play media", this enables us to access files from our computer using DLNA.--> The next step is adding media files such as videos. To start, open windows media player and in the left pane select videos and right click  videos and click "manage video library".--> In the video library location you can select the folders and videos to the library, or you can copy & paste the files to the root directory  of the library. In our case we are copying the HD Avatar trailer to the root directory.--> then choose 'media', then you can find your computer, choose video or music

Reviews.Title: Vizio 60 LED TV is the Best Value for Money
Reviews.Author: Santosh
Reviews.Content: I wanted one from Amazon but even though I pulled the plug exactly the lightening deal timer turned "0" it said it was 100% claimed.Thank god I had a backup plan @ Walmart.I bought this TV on BF from Walmart. When I installed it I was greatly disappointed with the picture quality and were wondering if I did the right thing.I sat through the night and made some custom changes to the settings and that gave me some comfort but still weren't that happy till I saw the settings listed in AVS forum and amazon from CNET. that really changed the picture quality and looks pretty good.Pircture Quality - W/o going in to the technicalities all I can say is I love it...not as awesome as Samsung 8000 series which i say @ BB but that also sets you back $2500 even with BF deal..but I would say its pretty close IMO.Very impressed with the built in apps especially Netflix.It has practically made my apple TV redundant as I watch my netflix and youtube on the TV using the keyboard style remote.It makes my life so much easier than the crazy remote of apple of selecting and clicking each character at a time.Though I have noticed at times the netflix would stop saying its unable to connect not sure if its my WiFI network or the app itself.Remote-Pros-Its pretty good compared to other TV remotes that I have used earlier.Best part is the built in QWERTY on the backCons- Sometimes the remote when typing is not very responsive.It needs to have a real clear line of sight and I guess it needs to be pointed when typing and that could be inconvenient at times.Vizio apps - Loving it.Never imagined the beauty and ease of watching web videos on TV I like them and hope Vizio comes out with some more updates to the apps and we could somehow update the app base using the internet as we can do currently with Apple TV.If Vizio continues the way they are going I am POSITIVE they will very soon dethrone Samsung with the quality of there TV for the Price. As I best best Value for money and better than other more expensive TV from other vendors.

Reviews.Title: Malfunctioned in 2 Months
Reviews.Author: RBC "RBCal"
Reviews.Content: This TV died within 2 months of purchase.  Not recommended due to it's unreliability.  The set has a nice picture but no TV should be this unreliable.I also want to warn people about the horrible customer service I experienced returning this POS.  Amazon guaranteed that the shipper would bring packing material.  However the shipper showed up an hour late and had no packaging material.  He ended up tying the TV to dolly.Do not buy this TV and avoid buying Amazon electronics!  Costco is a better choice for purchasing electronics.

Reviews.Title: Vizio TV
Reviews.Author: prisonjudy
Reviews.Content: We love Vizio products.  We currently have four Vizio TVs.  The pictures are crystal clear, audio is great, and the slim size is perfect!

Reviews.Title: Great tv, but not reliable.
Reviews.Author: bulldog2000
Reviews.Content: Great TV when working, but the screen failed after two months. I am wondering if this model has some reliability issues, so I did not exchange it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV with two quibbles...
Reviews.Author: C. DeBoer
Reviews.Content: I won't go into the technical stuff. Previous reviewers have covered everything and I used the settings they downloaded from CNET before I even tried to actually view programming on this wonderful television. The only tweak I made to those settings was a little more brightness because my living room is very well lit due to large, west-facing windows. This is my 3rd Vizio and I have never experienced a problem with them. The little 24" in my sun room is ideal. The 5-year old Gallevia 46" that had been in the living room is now in the master bedroom. Talk about an upgrade!!Now, to the quibbles. I absolutely hate the remote control. I realize that, in this smart phone world, most purchasers will not mind the remote. Count me out. I don't and won't have a smart phone, even though I have a perfectly serviceable cell phone. I tried the Vizio Co-Star video streamer and returned it because of the ridiculous remote. I'm 69 years old and have always been very comfortable with a standard 10-key key pad (telephone or calculator). Even those are becoming a little difficult to use as the arthritis in my hands (particularly my thumbs) becomes more pronounced. The tiny buttons on the remote are all but impossible for me to manage. It's not Vizio's fault. They've geared this device to a younger demographic and I understand that. Fortunately, the Gallevia's remote works perfectly well, is back-lit, and far easier for me to use thanks to the space between and around the buttons. I found one here on Amazon and have ordered it, so I'll have one for each of my "big" televisions. Unlike some who might downgrade a product because they dislike one aspect of it, I won't do that because it wouldn't a fair review.12-26-12...Near catastrophe yesterday when the grandchildren were visiting and rough-housing. One of them almost knocked the TV off the oak stand (yes, it was secured with earthquake straps). It swayed and twisted and I thought it was going to break off its actual pedestal, on which other reviewers have commented. For a TV this size, Vizio put little thought into its stand, which is smaller and lighter than the Gallevia's. I realize most people will probably wall-mount a 60-inch TV but I have no wall space for such an installation. Because of this near disaster, and the portent something similar in the future, this set is going back to Costco next week. No warranty would cover such a problem and I'm not going to lose $1,000 over what I consider a design flaw.

Reviews.Title: Vizio 60" tv Shutting off on its own
Reviews.Author: DC
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Vizio 60" smart Tv at costco on 11/21/2012 and  I am returning it soon with the problems this set have turning itself off every 10- 20 minutes. I actually posted my brother in law at the remote at thanksgiving just to turn the TV back on when it would shut off..I contacted Customer service and they are sending out a new firmware for set within a week. If this does not work the set will be returned to costco. I have a warranty..Never again,

Reviews.Title: How is this TV so cheap?
Reviews.Author: Patrick
Reviews.Content: Technology is getting so amazing.  I can't believe the quality of this TV for the price.  I upgraded my bedroom TV and the smart TV was huge for Netflix and Amazon Prime.The TV is light, slick looking and the picture is amazing.  I have nothing negative.  The sound is ok, but what kind of speakers can you fit in a flat screen?It's a no brainer.  Great purchase.

Reviews.Title: Plugged it in and watched it Work
Reviews.Author: Edward W Nesoff
Reviews.Content: I do not normally take the time to do ratings, but this one is worth the time.  This TV exceeded my expectations despite some of the negative reviews.  It worked right out of the box.  I did not have to mess with settings or anything.  Also, this TV was purchased through Amazon and was shipped in perfect condition, and it arrived in only 2 days to Honolulu!!!

Reviews.Title: Very nice tv for the price.
Reviews.Author: BJW
Reviews.Content: I had been considering upgrading my old 36" tube TV to my first HDTV for a couple of years now and had narrowed it down between a Samsung and Vizio, Samsung didn't have the 42" size I determined I needed and there closest model was more expensive so I went with this 42" Vizio. This TV has a impressive picture, especially when you hook it up using the HDMI cable for max resolution and calrity. Component cable is not that bad looking, if that is all you have and don't want to buy additional cables, but would recommend the HDMI cable. Wasn't expecting the built in speakers to have nice sound but it does, it has different modes(rock, jazz, classical like on a stereo or ipod, it even has a sound equalizer. This TV has a lot of features and several picture and sound modes, but the picture has a custom mode if you don't want to use any of the predetermine modes you can adjust the TV manually.Amazon shipped this out quick and arrived, it good condition ordered it on a Saturday night it came on Tuesday.I was concerned before receiving this because I didn't get the Samsung and Vizio is the lesser manufacturer, but heard some good things about Vizio in the past, so this also helped my final decision I am so glad I did I am very happy with it so far. I haven't use the smart features yet, like the ethernet or the wifi yet as I had the TV just a short time. But will update my review once I do.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV except for the stand.
Reviews.Author: B. Kirkorian "History buff"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV for one of the bedrooms. Considering the small size, the features, price, and picture and sound quality are excellent. My wireless N router is located about 15 feet away from the TV in another room, but the wireless strength is excellent. No issues streaming Netflix, Vudu, or the other sites.Unlike most small flat screen TVs with a tilting stand, this particular model comes with a fixed angle table top stand, in which the best viewing quality will be if the TV height is lower than eye level. In my case, I initially set the TV on top of a 5 ft tall chest of drawers to be viewed in essentially a prone position below the TV. Needless to say, the picture quality as a result of this viewing angle was poor. I resolved this issue by replacing the supplied fixed table mount with a tilt/swivel wall mount, and mounting the TV to the wall. I now have the perfect viewing angle and the picture is great.Now if the TV manufacturer's could only include a snore detector that would turn the TV off automatically...

Reviews.Title: User Manual Sucks - ARC explained
Reviews.Author: Paul B. Ulrich
Reviews.Content: This is how you make sure the TV will send an ARC signal on HDMI 1 to your sound system.  Click Menu on the REmote, Go to Settings, CEC settings, Go to CEC function, enable it.  Go to System Audio Control, set it to ON.You also have to set HDMI control to on on your sound system, but this instruction above was not found in the manual.

Reviews.Title: Not as crisp as i expected
Reviews.Author: jack wood
Reviews.Content: It is a very soft picture.  I have gone online and found several different methods for calibrating and none seem to give it a crisp picture.  The blacks are an almost washed out look not at all stark.

Reviews.Title: Can't beat it
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Neader
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a Christmas present for my husband and I use it more than he even does. Wonderful picture quality, and having the internet feature on the TV is perfect. Amazon Prime and Netflix just one button away is so easy. Would highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: Eric O
Reviews.Content: Really appreciate this TV, it has an excellent picture, good quality, the price point was excellent for a Smart HDTV. Don't use the smart functions as much as I thought, but nice to have them available.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy
Reviews.Author: jay m witkowski
Reviews.Content: TV came with no visible flaws. Excellent picture and sound. Able to access you tube and other preloaded apps. Great price. Would recommend Highly!

Reviews.Title: Couldn't be happier
Reviews.Author: Brianna Scheper
Reviews.Content: It was in great condition and I love how easy it is to use the apps. Definitely worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Size matters - in sound quality
Reviews.Author: Tastinient
Reviews.Content: I recently rated the 24" model of this series. I rated the TV 3 stars because of the low quality 2 watt speakers. What is the point of high definition, and streaming audio and video, if the sound is just bad? I also think the tilted base is odd and limiting for many people.But it's better news for this size. Happily, the 29" model comes with 5 watt speakers, and while it's not exactly a theater experience, the sound is adequate and improved in comparison to the 24".This set is otherwise impressive for the price. It starts up quickly, gets a strong signal from my router, and has an impressive amount of apps. It's light, the picture is crisp, in short it checks nearly every box you want for a web enabled TV. The tilted base on this series remains strange, and because the set has limited viewing angles, it's a problem for many, so I give it 4 rather than 5 stars. I have mounted mine to the wall, so the base is not an issue, and I'm completely satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Comprehensive Smart, But
Reviews.Author: Randall Griffin
Reviews.Content: Pros:Video - good not crisp.  cropping or zoom may be required.  8 of 10Audio - fine.  8 of 10Smart - Netflix and media library and othersCons:Media app doesn't have current video and audio codecs and no updates are possible or available (per their helpdesk)Media app response time and display fair.  Took minutes to display folder contents and then only a few ~15 per pageStuck.  Device froze a couple of times (grey screen of death).  Had to unplug to reset.  (Not good during the first week.)Conclusion:It is going back.  I will spend $50 more to get better video and access to my media library (perhaps Samsung UN32EH5300)

Reviews.Title: Fonts not appropriate for size of TV
Reviews.Author: Megan
Reviews.Content: The fonts in the settings and most of the apps are not readable on this size of television. There is a "white light" fuzzy lettering on black issue. You have to be up close to see them. Normal television lettering such as commercials and the news are fine. It's just in the settings and apps.The remote is so bad, it's embarrassing. I'm not sure it's that easy to change remotes for this television, because I couldn't get other device remotes working with this. They easily hook up with Bravia. The support site has all the codes you should need, but even after a call to support (really nice, helpful support), I couldn't get other remotes to work with this television. They are selling a Vizio Universal Remote that is just as bad looking a this one. This one is like Taiwan, 1973.Sound and picture are really  pretty good, it's not a Bravia, but it's not the same price either.App navigation is not that great either, but it's OK. Like software, some TV's have better software features and navigation. If you are buying this for the apps, like YouTube and Netflix, you should choose something else. This is a second television for apps and DLNA (no cable), so I didn't want to spend much....in hindsight, I would have spent more. Not sure how LG apps are, but Bravia's are definitely better than this.If you're not buying this television for the apps, buy their lower model without the apps, and the picture and sound will most probably be quite acceptable as well. The remote is probably just as ugly...

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Wonderful!
Reviews.Author: Renee Ann Hermiz
Reviews.Content: This item arrived within a day or two -- so quickly.  I bought it new, but want to make clear that it was in perfect condition.  So first, bravo for the packaging and shipping.  The product itself ... well, I can't believe how amazing it is.  The TV is easy to use ... the set up was simple.  I bought a Blue Ray player to go with it and am so happy.  I'm still stunned at how little it cost for what it can do:  go online ... watch netflix ... beautiful picture image ... etc.  I bought it with the black surrounding trim.  Some users have said it takes a little long to turn on -- eh!!!  There's a bit of a moment you wait once you press the "on" button, but I so don't care ... quite a petty thing compared to the package itself.  EXCELLENT BUY!

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price - plus we ditched cable
Reviews.Author: christina
Reviews.Content: When our old TV died, we started doing research on what to get, and read reviews here on Amazon, and CNET, etc.  This TV got great reviews everywhere and so we went for it (even tho we had never heard of this brand).So besides being a space-saving flat screen, and having a great HD picture, the best part of having this new TV is that we no longer have cable!  Instead, since this is a "smart TV" -- we have our internet plugged in directly to the TV, and since the TV comes with NetFlix, Hulu and Amazon Prime (and many more) "pre-loaded" - it's super fast and easy to stream from the internet.So far we're loving the TV and not having to pay a cable bill.  Highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Love this product, did not come with the keyboard remote.
Reviews.Author: Naturegirl "Naturegirl"
Reviews.Content: I had to plug in the computer keyboard to enter in the wireless stuff because the remote has no keyboard. But the sound and picture quality is excellent. Especially considering the 24 inch only takes 5 dollars a year to operate. It was really easy to set up Netflix and Amazon Instant. I would recommend this tv to those people who do not have a xbox to connect netflix with.

Reviews.Title: exactly what I wanted
Reviews.Author: Alicia
Reviews.Content: Easy set up..color and picture is great.I bought this for my 9 year olds son's room for him to watch Netflix on and he loves it. The remote makes it easy to access Netflix and Amazon and a bunch of other apps.

Reviews.Title: Great Gift
Reviews.Author: Lynn Nolan
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV as a Christmas gift for my daughter who is just out of college and moved into her own small apartment, she is very happy with it she doesn't have cable so the Wi-Fi with Netflix and other options are great for her and the price was right in my opinion

Reviews.Title: Vizio tv review
Reviews.Author: Daniel
Reviews.Content: The tv freezes on me. sometimes I can't change between inputs or change the volume. I would have to turn the tv on then off

Reviews.Title: Great bang for the buck; smart TV is limited, disappointing
Reviews.Author: Bobbity
Reviews.Content: Just a quick review, point by point:* The black levels are fantastic on this TV* However, white is not so good. The four corners are a bit dim compared to the rest of the display area. I've heard this is typical of low-end/budget LED TVs. So be it.* Four HDMI inputs is great for people with lots of devices and no receiver to handle the device switching.* Smart TV features are lame. I think the wifi radio inside the TV is too weak to do much, honestly. Netflix, for example, is terrible. But a PS3 just less than a foot away can stream Netflix on the same wifi router with no issues at all.Bottom line: Great bang for your buck. Don't buy it for the smart TV features, get an Apple TV or Roku device instead.

Reviews.Title: Help Support Sucks
Reviews.Author: John E. Doyle
Reviews.Content: So far I like the picture on this TV. Real sharp and clear. The set-up was real easy for me. It's the apps that come with this TV. If you are into You-Tube forget about it. It don't work and it will never work on this TV.The buffering is the issue.The other app called web videos will work some of the time. If you think it's just me Google VIZIO TV ISSUES and you will come up with tons of sites to check out. The Netflix movies all work with this TV. At first I thought maybe it was my WIFI but nope. So the next day I hard wired the TV with the Ethernet cable and no go with You-Tube again. Made no difference what so ever.I did talked with Vizio tech support about the You-Tube issue and was told there was nothing that can be done about this problem. The tech gal I was talking to told me the same thing happens with her smart phone..like who cares lady. And she was not a big fan of You-Tube. The thing here is Vizio should not be advertising that you can use You-Tube on this TV. They have known all along about this problem and have done nothing to correct it.Only wish I  could give this two and half stars on the rating.

Reviews.Title: Terrific Purchase
Reviews.Author: Valerie C. Kashubara
Reviews.Content: This TV is absolutely fabulous with one tiny exception....the background music, etc., is too loud and I cannot figure out how to lower it so that I can hear the dialogue more clearly.  I am sure there is a way to do this, but I just have not found it yet.The TV was easy to set up with very clear instructions as to how to do it.So very glad I purchased this Vizio!!!

Reviews.Title: Screen isn't very bright, needs a low light room
Reviews.Author: Curious Guy
Reviews.Content: My parents bought this TV in a black Friday sale and like it well enough, now that we adjusted the settings. As the title suggests, the TV lacks brightness, I have never seen such a dim LED screen on another TV. At first, it was completely awful, ANY source of light reflected on the screen and made it impossible to make out any detail on the video behind that light. My parents have a small lamp on an end table with a 40 Watt bulb in it, which was covered with a lamp shade and still caused this, no matter where you sat in the room.However, once you go into the setting and turn OFF the ambient light sensor, "Luma" setting, and Auto dimming, it's not nearly as bad. It's still not great, but even during the day with some sunlight on the screen it is possible to watch something and see what is on the screen. So the auto-dimming feature is basically so aggressively trying to save power, it dims the screen too much (or maybe it just can't accurately tell how bright the room is). Again, once you turn off all those features it's much better, probably a 4 Star viewing experience, though the power use will be MUCH higher than normal with those features off.So why the 2 Star review then? The first TV my parents bought was the 47 inch version, and they loved it. They especially liked the smart TV features and only bought the 50 inch version because with the black Friday special it was 3 inches more screen for 50 dollars LESS money.However, the first 50 inch TV they got had a faulty wi-fi adapter in it, so none of the smart TV features would actually work. They called Vizio and Vizio's support rep was completely unable to help resolve the issue. He told them that the TV needed to be only 25 ft away from the router at most because if they put higher quality wi-fi adapters in the TV's it would cost 600 dollars more for the TV (which they got for 500)! They explained that they had basically the same TV and it worked in the same spot, and he continued to assure them that Vizio uses junk parts to save money and it wasn't going to work no matter what.They took the bad TV back to the store and haven't had any problems yet with the new set. So the lesson here is that if you call Vizio with a warranty issue, they will likely tell you "Of course it doesn't work, we use cheap parts". I didn't believe it, but a Vizio employee who claimed to be a manager repeated that line to us about 20 times.

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: David A. Rollins
Reviews.Content: It takes almost 60 seconds to boot up, but I guess that is normal with all Smart TV's these days.  Changing channels takes 3-5 seconds, so an older TV has it beat on that, but it does have wireless internet and we watch Netflix and YouTube streamed right onto our TV.  Good price, good TV, not the best but it does the job, has decent sound as well.  I like the multiple HDMI ports, that is one of the reasons why I got this one.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV for the money....
Reviews.Author: Cpr178
Reviews.Content: I researched the Smart-TV's and found the Vizio brand to be the best bang for my buck. I've had my Vizio 70' inch Smart TV for 3 weeks now and I am impressed. The picture is sharp and crystal clear with 4 HDMI connections that allow easy hookup to my Xbox 360 and Playstation 3. The Smart video apps are easily accessed from the remote control. Delivery was on time and with free box removal ( it's a huge box!). I decided to purchase the 4 year extended warranty for around $100 bucks for my peace of mind. I pondered purchasing the Samsung 70' Smart TV, but couldn't talk myself into paying the $500 in price difference. In all, I'm very satisfied with my purchase price from Amazon and the quality of this Vizio product.

Reviews.Title: This is possibly THE best TV I have ever had for the money!
Reviews.Author: Gary L. Iverson, Sr.
Reviews.Content: I expected nothing more than the normal good quality HDTV like I have bought before..... this was much more.I cannot imagine how anyone would be disappointed with this TV.  As an added benefit, I loved the easy access to NetFlix and Amazon,.... but the 1080 screen is so clear, clean, and bright that I was really pleasantly surprised!It it nearly effortless to set-up, install, and get everything going intuitively.  You do have two small screws to place in the special V-stand.... very easy to do with a regular phillips screw driver.  Even a "caveman" can do it with ease.....(smiles).  AS an added plus:  The mounting or setup base is unique to Visio only and makes it to fit into smaller places without looking so big and out of place!  In all the other TVs, I found not one that sat so low and firm/stable.  I needed to fit this into a corner spot in my home office and it not only works great, it looks fantastic.  Clean, sharp lines, and small..... very small for a 29 inch TV.... foot print. Perfect.  The plastic rim is VERY narrow, so you do not have all this huge black bezel around the picture.  The sound is crisp and clear too - excellent.Buy with confidence.  Now if you really wanted a 50 inch, do NOT buy this great 29 inch and then be disappointed.  :-)Now my wife wnats one for her bedroom...... (Oh my, what have I done? Ha ha!)  Do Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: I needed a new TV
Reviews.Author: Outlaw
Reviews.Content: Other people rave about it but I'm not quite THAT thrilled. The remote doesn't work that well on it's own even with new batteries frequently and it doesn't seem to sync well with the basic remote for Verizon. A bit of a pain in the ___.

Reviews.Title: Do NOT buy the Vizio E320i-A0 if you want a good "Smart TV" Experience
Reviews.Author: Humble Patriot
Reviews.Content: As Amazon consolidates reviews for various models in the same product line, please note that this is a review of the Vizio E320i-A0.If you purchase this TV it will bring you frustration.  The user interface (UI) installed on the Vizio E320i-A0 is Vizio's crippled Yahoo! TV Apps/M-GO interface, NOT the company's "Vizio Internet Apps Plus" interface.  It is clunky, frustrating, limited, and NOT user friendly.  While the TV is just fine as standard TV or monitor, and has a decent picture, adequate sound, and plenty of inputs, the UI is terrible and the remote is almost worthless.  It is not a good value as it comes at a premium over a similarly appointed HD set, and you can save nearly a C-note and a whole bunch of frustration if you simply buy a "dumb" 32-inch HD set and a Roku LT from Amazon.I purchased this TV in January 2013 on Vizio's promise that it would provide an outstanding Smart TV experience.  It was anything BUT outstanding.  Its primary app, "M-GO" (prominently displayed on both the unit's UI home screen and its lousy remote control), was billed as a "revolutionary" TV experience when I purchased the TV.  Bizarrely, M-GO wasn't installed on the TV at the time of purchase and didn't even become available for it until Summer 2013.  When it finally did arrive via Vizio's eventual firmware update, M-GO turned out to be all "pay" TV - no included content.  It was thoroughly disappointing and not "revolutionary" as promised.  I already have Netflix and Amazon Prime, so I don't need their lousy pay app.  Aside from M-GO, there are other apps available for the E320i-A0 -- some are preinstalled like Yahoo! Finance and Skype, but most are downloaded through the Yahoo! TV Apps store in the unit's poorly structured UI.  Strangely, Yahoo! TV Apps offers only a very limited number of apps for this "smart" TV -- a grand total of 134 (that's right:  ONLY ONE HUNDRED AND THIRTY FOUR!) as of this writing on December 26, 2013 -- and most of them are either local news station apps from distant corners of the U.S., or paid anime/cartoon channels. Even the familiar apps like iHeart Radio have limited feature sets and don't offer the programmable, personalized channels you would customarily be able to set up on your computer or smart phone, but rather offer only a specified set of broadcast stations from select markets.  The entire experience is really bizarre.Ultimately, the greatest disappointment of the E320i-A0 is its abysmal UI and limited apps, which Vizio flatly informed me it has no intention to update to its current "VIA Plus" interface.  Again, the TV is good in terms of picture, size, sound and inputs, but the "smart" content is worthless.  If you buy this TV you will be stuck with the lousy UI, crappy remote, and crippled apps.  Be forewarned, and get a "dumb" TV and a Roku (or Chromecast, or XBox 360, etc); you'll be much happier you did.

Reviews.Title: Very good basic smart TV at a great price.
Reviews.Author: Jblakus
Reviews.Content: I have had the 32" set for 3 weeks now and so far am happy with it.  It suits my general viewing purpose very well. Primarily have it hooked up on an antenna to receive local channels in HD or standard broadcast. The smart function allow me to also view streamed programs if I choose.The picture quality was good out of the box.  The screen is very clear, bright and capable for all lighting conditions. HD programs were crisp and clear in 720P. However, after adjusting the picture setting in the menu to my preferences the picture quality is now very good to excellent.  I definitely recommend turning off all the automatic picture enhancement features then, adjusting the settings back to your own personal taste. There are a couple of older reviews that can help with that chore. Its worth the effort.The built in WiFi works well for using Netflix or Amazon prime programs.  Set up was fairly easy on the WiFi. I am also impressed with the built-in audio. The speakers are louder and better than the older 32" LCD this one replaced. The remote is very basic and has small buttons which could be a problem for some people. The remote buttons also do not illuminate.So far the only thing I was not impressed with was the flimsy, light weight, stand.  It also does not much of a footprint compared to the older 32" TV stands it replaced (also a Vizio). So stability could be a concern with the stand that comes with the set. But the stand is not a big concern for me since I wall mounted this TV, just like the older one before it, to a very secure bracket.The one thing I have not done with this set is watched DVD's or BR disks with it. So I cannot speak of the dynamic range. I highly recommend this set for general purposes viewing.  It would be very good in a bedroom, small den/office, workshop or maybe for a student or person who need a good first TV set.

Reviews.Title: Good Television, Great Value
Reviews.Author: clancyfurr
Reviews.Content: Compared to other LED TV's of this size the Vizio was much more reasonably priced.  The set up was quick and easy and the apps were easy to use; Vizio customer service was phenomenal as usual.  You get a REAL person who picks up immediately and will stay on the phone with you until your questions or problems are resolved.  Our last problem was with the DiSH box NOT the Vizio TV but the Vizio Customer service rep knew that and even talked us through correcting THOSE settings! I am not a TV snob and don't really spend hours and hours in front of the boob toob but I am very happy with this set and would recommend it.  My only wish is that there were more apps included such as HBO on demand; but the HDMI cable is easy to reach.

Reviews.Title: After 3 months I still love it
Reviews.Author: D. Barnes
Reviews.Content: What can I say that hasn't already been said? This is a fabulous TV at a great price. I bought the 39-inch model because my living room is tiny, and it's just about the perfect size for my viewing distance. The built-in apps are all you really need but you can add and delete apps (yes, it's actually possible to delete the useless Yahoo apps). You do have to sign up for the Yahoo app store but that's painless. I had no trouble at all getting the TV to recognize my WiFi network, and connecting it to Netflix and Amazon Prime couldn't be easier.The slim-bezel design ensures that none of the picture gets cut off. Of the brands I shopped before buying this TV and experience with friends' TVs, Vizio and Samsung seem to be the best at not chopping the bottom of the screen off. Panasonic and LG cut off a significant portion of the picture on all sides, and Magnavox cuts off quite a bit too.TV reception is solid, the tuner has all the latest DTV technology and it has no trouble with my indoor antenna. Fast-motion shots in football games can be problematic if your local station has any sub-channels eating up their bandwidth but as long as the source signal isn't compressed too much you won't notice any artifacts. Picture quality is incredibly sharp and the built-in speakers are all most people will ever need but it does support external audio devices if you are a surround-sound aficionado.The coolest thing about the Amazon Prime app is that while you're searching on the left side of the screen for the video you want to watch, the live TV picture scales down to the remaining 75% of the screen on the right so you can browse for the latest Downton Abbey episodes while your local meteorologist talks about the weather. Of the video-streaming apps on this TV, the Amazon Prime app is the best.Netflix comes in a close second. Navigation is easy and video quality is second to none, as long as the video is available for 720p or 1080p. Some TV shows that were produced in HD are only available on NF in 480p resolution, but the TV handles those well. I was actually surprised when I was watching a David Tennant-era Doctor Who episode and the TV reported that it was only receiving a 480p stream from NF.The YouTube app is kind of clunky but when it's playing videos it plays them back without any problems, and you can sign in to your YouTube account so you can use the website to find videos and put them in your Watch Later list, then get to them from the TV without having to deal with the app's search function.The only app I was disappointed with was Hulu Plus. The video was washed out, and the sound was tinny. I hooked up the Xbox and played the same video using that Hulu app and the video and sound quality were great, so this is a fault with the Hulu Plus app for Vizio. I contacted Hulu support and they were not helpful. Most of what I wanted to watch they still don't have rights to stream to TV or mobile devices so I canceled my free trial anyway. Therefore the Hulu app's shortcomings are a non-issue for me. If you want to use Hulu and have a game console or other streaming device, use that for Hulu, not the TV's Hulu app.The media player app can stream videos, music and photos from your PC running media-streaming software such as TVersity. Combined with Windows Media Center (free) and a TV tuner card, I've made this my DVR.This is by far the best TV I have ever owned. I'm planning to buy a smaller version for the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: Only one issue with the TV
Reviews.Author: Saverio N. Paglioni
Reviews.Content: Everything is perfect with the exception of one item...the TV's Wi-Fi.  I streamed Netflix last night (I have a repeater hardwired into the television) and the "feathering" is very noticeable.  I then streamed Netflix through the Wii, and it was brilliant.  So, stream with a device not on the tv.Other than that, it's a fantastic television.

Reviews.Title: Decent TV; WiFi adapter is worthless
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I don't normally write reviews but felt I had to write so that people will know that if they intend to use this TV for its Smart TV apps (Netflix, Amazon, Hulu Plus, YouTube, etc) via WiFi, you will be sorely disappointed. I have yet to try a wired connection, but the built-in WiFi adapter for this TV is terrible. My Nexus 7, iPhone, and laptop all get good reception using the same streaming apps from the same spot, but the Vizio TV either cannot connect or the connections constantly drop out. So unless you are intending to use this with only with a set-top box and/or a wire Ethernet connection, I'd say look for another solution. My way around this problem was to buy a Google Chromecast.That said, the TV is otherwise a decent, low-end TV. The picture is good, the connections are adequate (only 1x HDMI), and setup was simple.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful TV at a great price
Reviews.Author: James Boer
Reviews.Content: I purchased a 60" model to replace my old, failing 63" internal projection TV.  I have to say, I'm not going to miss those giant cabinets, since now I need to figure out how to dispose of that old monster.  The new TV looks splendid to me, although admittedly I'm not exactly a videophile.  I had considered a plasma, but I'm extremely happy that I decided against it, what with the dangers of burn in, additional weight, cost, and power consumption for a supposedly better picture that I'd probably never notice anyhow.  LED TVs make a lot more sense for most consumers, in my opinion.I really don't care much at all about the "smarts" of this smart TV either, since I'll always be connected to an Xbox and/or PlayStation, both of which function just fine as media centers, and which are typically much easier to control.  So, I'm afraid I can't comment on those, as I don't plan on ever using them.  For me, the TV itself is enough for me, and it's definitely of sufficient quality to earn it high marks.I had purchased this TV a while ago, and the price has plummeted since then.  I thought it was a good deal even near the retail price I paid, but now its an absolute steal.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO E390i-A1 39-Inch 1080p 120Hz Smart LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: KellyB
Reviews.Content: Including the tv I have since the reviews seem to include all the eSeries Vizios, regardless of size.I've had this tv for a couple weeks and love it for the most part.  This is my first LED or HDTV as my previous tv came over on the Mayflower.  :)Plusses:Netflix and Amazon Prime Streaming are great.  I've also used an HDMI cable to hook my laptop up to it to watch other video, which works well once it's set up.It has a great pictures, after adjustments as described below.Original setup was painless.Minuses:The remote--Would be better if lit.  It could also be easier to read and would be nice if it included a keyboard.When watching streaming (Amazon/Netflix/etc), I can't get it to stay at 1080i or other picture settings to stay without resetting it every time I turn the tv on.  I use the "Reset Picture Mode" to get to 1080i, and then go in and turn off the Smart Dimming.  It's ok when it's the DVR, so I'm not sure what I'm doing wrong there. It would be nice if those settings would stick.

Reviews.Title: good picture from directly in front
Reviews.Author: James R Rowe
Reviews.Content: very faded picture if off center viewing. unclear directions for making picture fill the screen. difficult directions to setup and use smart wifi feature as no0 printed directions are provided, just references to computer or working within the tv....navigation difficult.

Reviews.Title: One really good value!
Reviews.Author: Lawrence
Reviews.Content: You don't know how much of a picture you are missing till you see it on this TV! At 60Hz there are things that you never see. Watch football on this one!

Reviews.Title: Not happy with the product
Reviews.Author: Lovin' life in Florida
Reviews.Content: Not happy with the product.  Have had a very difficult time adjusting the color balance.  Colors in the shadows go very dark too easily and if I adjust to brighten up the shadows, it blows out the brighter colors.  Also struggling to get the tints just right.  Looked at other reviews for clues on settings, but it seems other Vizio products use different scales on color settings, so not much help.  Did not have the same problem with a Samsung product.I assumed due to weak audio, I would hook up a PC speaker set to the TV to enhance the audio. First TV had no earphone jack signal output.  It was easily and quickly replaced by Vizio (Kudos to Vizio).  Replacement TV earphone jack output signal was very weak.  Had to crank up to 90% to get low to average sound output on either earphones or the PC speaker set.  [Earphones and speakers worked fine on my PC at 20-25% volume setting]  Spoke to Vizio Customer Service and was told (1) earphone jack was not for that purpose(??); (2) Earphone jack was not  an "amplified" output (true, but it should provide a variable level signal to drive the earphones); (3) it was a constant volume output (not true; varying the volume level would vary the output) and they couldn't help me further.

Reviews.Title: Love the Smart TV Functionality
Reviews.Author: Robert Harris
Reviews.Content: Let's face it...it's great to have the wireless device inside the TV instead of a separate wireless receiver and related extra remote.  The picture quality is quite good but not quite as sharp as my existing Samsung Flat Screen TVs.  I had to avoid Samsung since it didn't come with the Smart TV feature in a 29 inch TV.  Another "stand out" feature is the sub-woofer and great speakers...what a super sound out of a 29 inch frame!!!  The price is also very low for all the features that you get.  I'd buy it again without any hesitation.....

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: Helen R "Helen R"
Reviews.Content: I love this smart tv and have had no problems with it at all. I would recommend it without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: Great quaility
Reviews.Author: Gary Chatham
Reviews.Content: Great Picture , Easy to use and the Smart part of this Flat Screen takes you to another Level of Electronic Devices.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV with great value
Reviews.Author: EFP
Reviews.Content: This set is my first flat screen and I couldn't be happier with it. The picture is crystal clear with vivid colors. Especially useful is the smart TV features: I'm able to connect instantly to Netflix and Amazon Instant Videos. It's an excellent choice for the money.

Reviews.Title: Best bang for your buck
Reviews.Author: Joshua Rene Gomez
Reviews.Content: Viizo has really improved the quality of their products.  A couple of years ago I would have never bought a Vizio but I couldnt pass it up at the price I got it for and I am truly happy with my descision.  I watch Netflix and play my PS4 on it and the picture/refresh rate is gorgeous.  Another plus is that it is an American company with a 1 year warranty.

Reviews.Title: 3 times and out
Reviews.Author: Surf Boy
Reviews.Content: I really tried to like this TV, but finally ran out of patience after experiencing problems with the third set that I received. The problems were either related to poor image stability or no external audio. The picture problem appeared while watching a video that was over an hour long. The picture started to get darker and then lighter.Many thanks to the good folks at Amazon who assisted me with these problems. I cannot say enough good things about their customer service!Finally ended up buying a Samsung 32" TV (without any Internet options), which I purchased from Amazon. It has a solid picture!

Reviews.Title: Great HDTV
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: Love the picture, love the "Smart-ness", love the price!  Researched TVs for a while before settling on this one, and glad we did...it's been fantastic.  Having a remote control button for Netflix is particularly helpful, and the Pandora and YouTube/Hulu apps work great too.  Wish it had a browser or just an ESPN3 app and then I'd be completely satisfied.  But overall, you're hard-pressed to beat the functionality, quality, and price this TV offers.

Reviews.Title: Great for the teenager
Reviews.Author: Helena R McMaster
Reviews.Content: This TV was purchased for Christmas for my 12 year old son.  I have to admit I am jealous my husband and I now wish we had one.  The smart TV capabilities make this TV awesome.  The picture is very nice, and the quality of the HD is very good.  I recommend getting a good HDMI cable to show this TV's potential.  The sound is even pretty good, my son uses this TV with his Xbox and you can see the difference in the graphics and the screen size is just right for his age.  Not to big and certainly not to small.  My son loves the smart TV apps, he has already set up his Netflix, Hulu, and my amazon account for streaming TV shows and movies.  The set up was very easy and quick. Setting  up the internet is also very quick and easy.  You cant go wrong with this purchase for the price and the fact its a smart TV its a great deal.  My mother is planning to purchase one for herself this coming year, and my husband and I would like to purchase the 39" for ourselves this coming summer.  Cant wait.

Reviews.Title: pretty sweet
Reviews.Author: Phyllis Williams
Reviews.Content: so far so good great selection of settings and its great that my wife can use apps on ithopefully this tv doesn't suddenly die or something retarded

Reviews.Title: Very happy
Reviews.Author: ronno "ronno"
Reviews.Content: Works as expected. I have good luck with Vizio products, although they might think about working n the sound quality of all their products.

Reviews.Title: Great upgrade over 42" class LCD
Reviews.Author: Kerry in Cali
Reviews.Content: It was time to upgrade the 42" LCD, so I started looking at Black Friday specials. This was one of the advertised sets that checked all my boxes. I was hoping Amazon would match Walmart's $688 deal, but I found it at Best Buy delivered for $677, so I jumped on that deal. Very happy with this set so far. Picture is fantastic and have found the smart capabilities very convenient for both Netflix and Amazon Prime streaming. If you are looking to upgrade and are not concerned about 3D, I highly recommend this over more expensive options from Samsung and Panasonic.Kerry

Reviews.Title: Great TV with no issues
Reviews.Author: Clifton Drew Gentle
Reviews.Content: Bought the 60" vizio off of Amazon a week ago. I was a little worried after reading some of the comments about customers receiving damaged TVs, but luckily this TV had nothing wrong with it when I received it. It was delivered on time with no issues. It was easy to set up and easy to figure out how the smart TV function works (this was my first smart TV). The picture isn't as good as I thought it would be, but it's still very good for a TV of that size. I googled different picture setting suggestions for that model TV that I tried and modified them a little to what I thought worked well. So far I am very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Quality!
Reviews.Author: Soljaboi26 "soljaboi26"
Reviews.Content: I have had this television for about a year and I can say it is AMAZING (A-Z). I seen some of the customer images and seen the ones with the lights in the corner of the display, I too have had those problems too in the first few weeks but after a while it fades. I have had no other problems since then. I do wish they would release an update for it as well as Amazon Instant Vid, and the other apps. The mobile connectivity is wonderful as well. I have always had a reliable connection with not a single problem.The keyboard on the back of the remote is a bit wired to use if you are not directly in front of the television. All in all a wonderful product!

Reviews.Title: RECOMMENDED SETTINGS and other thoughts
Reviews.Author: Vltrn
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for a few weeks now, using it as a 2nd set in the bedroom.  So far I have been very satisfied, but it took me quite a while to get picture settings the way I wanted.  You can find my settings below.Pros:- great value for a smart TV- Very good picture, once you correct the terrible out-of-the-box settings (see below)- Easy to use interface for changing settings, browsing apps, etc.  I didn't have to hunt for anything.Cons:- Mine has 2 dead pixels (yes they are dead, not stuck).  I can only notice them close up though, and I know it's not enough to get a warranty replacement.- Audio is rather low quality compared to other TVs of this size.  I didn't really expect much in this department though.- Included stand angles the TV upward (it leans back).  I have mine wall mounted, but unless you are going to be sitting at or above eye level this may be an issue.RECOMMENDED SETTINGS:I came up with these settings through a combination of those posted by C|NET reviews of similar (but not the same) models, and also by using the AVS HD 709 calibration disc.  Currently there is no review of this actual model range that has calibration settings listed, but I was able to get things to look naturalFirmware Version 2.05.2---Picture settings menu---Picture Mode: MovieBacklight: 59Brightness: 49Contrast: 50Color: 50Tint: 0Sharpness: 6---Size & Position submenu---[no change]---Color Temperature submenu---Colour temperature: CustomRed Gain: 58Green Gain: 48Blue gain: 41Red offset: 50Green offset: 49Blue offset: 50--Advanced Picture submenu---Noise Reduction: OffMPEG NR: OffColor Enhancement: OffAdaptive Luma: OffFilm Mode: AutoBacklight Control: OffSo far I've been very happy using it to watch Blu-Rays, Netflix, and cable tv.  Recommended.

Reviews.Title: Nice little TV...BUT
Reviews.Author: dave
Reviews.Content: It's not a bad little TV.The picture,screen size and imputs are all good.I won't go all "tech" in this review but with those nice things being said there are a couple of things you should know before you purchase.I bought it because of the built in apps but honestly they don't work that great.Even if you have a fantastic wifi signal in your house the tv often has issues dropping the apps midway and freezing .More times than not Netflix will have problems loading and all of this can be very frustrating.The remote is also clunky.The buttons don't always seem to respond properly and the quality isn't that great.As I noted earlier picture quality and sound are great but for a 32 inch you may be better off getting a cheaper model without all the so called frills and purchasing a wifi blu ray player with apps sepratley.

Reviews.Title: good tv - wireless reception not great.
Reviews.Author: Chris A James
Reviews.Content: picture quality is great - Netflix does not work good it all -- they say it's because i need to move the wireless router closer - which defeats the purpose of purchasing a smart tv.  wireless on the xbox and laptop work fine in the same room.  it's the reception on the tv that sucks.

Reviews.Title: My first Smart TV was a SMART buy!
Reviews.Author: JoyDesigns "Owner"
Reviews.Content: I LOVE THIS TV. Picture and sound clear as a bell. This is my first Smart TV and I find it very easy to use and enjoy. The TV remote has easy access buttons for Amazon & Netflix, it has a full QWERTY keeyboard on one side and standard remote on the other. I was afaid that i wouldn't be able to figure out this TV but it was so easy I was watching Amazon Prime in my living room in minutes,Deliver if the TV was smooth and easy. The deliever comapny called and set up a window for delivery, called when they were on the way and arrived as promised. They brought the TV into the house and un boxed it. They were not "allowed" to set it up on the stand but they did plug it in and made sure it worked and that there was no damage to the set before they left. I am VERY happy with the delivery service.Great TV. Great value, Great service.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, terrible stand!
Reviews.Author: NBelks
Reviews.Content: The tv itself is perfect, great picture and decent sound - we use it as a second tv. However, it gets a less than perfect star rating for the terrible design of the stand. It is flimsy and breaks easily. I installed it correctly - which was no easy task with the tiny screws - but it cracked within two weeks. Trying to re-order a replacement stand was next to impossible, with nowhere having that size or type of stand (don't get me started on the best-buy - parts dept that was the only place claiming to have one and shipping me one that was totally different because they wanted my money rather than tell me they didn't have it in stock). Anyway, I ended up having to spend more money on a different type of stand that is mounting as well as standing -- much sturdier. So, that whole stand debacle made the tv price end up being a lot more!

Reviews.Title: 47" Vizio Smart Tv. Great tv, poor shipping conditions
Reviews.Author: Daniel
Reviews.Content: After failing to come out of black friday with a new televsision I began an online hunt. After much debating, I took a gamble and went with my gut with this 47" Vizio Smart tv.The first problem was with the shipping. I ordered this through Amazon Prime, the amount of time it took to arrive was great, 2 days just as expected. The problem was upon seeing the box there was a HUGE hole that was larger than the diameter of a baseball bat. My nerves went through the roof with the hole seeming severe. I took the actual tv out of the shipping box and noticed a hole in it. The hole was smaller, maybe the size of a half dollar. Which doesn't make sense when compared to the size of the hole in the shipping box. I removed the tv and was fortunate that the holes were on the backside, and there wasn't a scratch (miraculously) on the backside of the tv even. I am really hesitant to purchase a tv online anymore after this experience.After removing it the set up was simple. The stand screws in easily with 3 screws. The only thing I don't like about the stand is that it doesn't swivel. With a 47" tv you don't need to swivel much so it's not a major concern, but it would be nice to have easier access to the HDMI ports and such. I was amazed that this 47" tv is A LOT lighter than my previous 32" HDTV that was purchased 7 years ago that I was replacing.The onscreen set up was easy. I am still trying to adjust picture settings to get a good picture because it's just not too great for me out of the box. Shouldn't be a big deal to keep tweaking the custom setting.
