I have Verizon Fios connected through HDMI. I am a big NHL fan so immediately I turned on Center Ice. I notice there is a little lag with the players. Maybe its my eyes just not used to this size of a screen. I'll give it some time to adjust. I wouldn't expect lag with it being (supposedly) 120hz.I checked out some of the apps. I tried Netflix but kept getting errors and couldn't even have a chance to sign in to my account. I tried Hulu and it worked perfectly. I tried netflix again, still nothing. However, after going to bed, waking up today and seeing a firmware update, I tried netflix again and magically it works today!Over all good picture. Not the best thing in the world but definitely not the worst. For the price I am satisfied minus the shipping incident.I would recommend this television. If I can get the picture to a quality I desire I may bump this up to 4 stars. I notice in the corner of the tv it says "1080i" for that setting, this is supposed to be a 1080p tv so if I can figure out how to adjust that setting it may help as well.

Reviews.Title: Is Amazon price the best, beware...
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: For the price this is a GREAT TV.  I have it connected to a media center PC and play video from my server quite well.  My only problem is the current price - On 12/6/13 the price with Prime discount is $568.  I purchased on 8/31/13 for $420.  That is a SIGNIFICANT increase, makes me a little less sure that Amazon prices are the best.  Did they think that just because it it Black Friday week that the price is going to be the best and just buy blindly?  The price of these TV's is coming DOWN, not going UP...

Reviews.Title: Terrible streaming apps, good television.
Reviews.Author: NeonBlack
Reviews.Content: I recently received this television, and although I cannot comment on the sound quality (I am using a soundbar), the picture looks great to me.  I'm using the television on the included base, not wall mounted, and I will say that it is a little bit wobbly. They should have provided two mounting points on the base instead of one for a screen this size.My main complaint is that the Amazon streaming app is absolutely terrible.  For something that is so boldly advertised on the product page, it is just embarrassingly bad. The app opens in a tiny sidebar taking up a quarter of the left hand side of the screen at most, and lacks basic functionality that is standard in every other available streaming app, and even in the Amazon app available for any other platform that I've used it on (Xbox360, PS3, WiiU).  There is no access to a watchlist of any sort and absolutely no way to see your recently watched videos (making it impossible to pick up where you left off in a series for example).  The lack of any sort of a real, full screen navigational interface is a huge oversight, and makes it extraordinarily painful to navigate, even on a 70" screen.  You could blame this on the ability of the TV itself to handle a fully featured app if it weren't for the Netflix app available for the TV that works pretty well and has all of the features that you would expect.Maybe I was foolish to plan on using the Vizio streaming apps to replace those on my consoles (which I was planning to move to a different part of the house), but I really didn't expect the offerings to be this terrible.  The Netflix app is actually pretty good, but Hulu is also sub-par when compared to Netflix on this tv, or the Hulu app available elsewhere.  I will likely just need to buy a new Roku box to fill in for the baked in apps.

Reviews.Title: Mediocre streaming capabilities
Reviews.Author: AJC
Reviews.Content: Picture and sound are fine.  Download speed over wifi is inconsistent, and often results in the tv stalling and stuttering.  Restarting the TV usually fixes the issue (the issue only occurs with the TV, not any other device in the house, it is not an issue with my internet provider).Would only recommend when on sale.

Reviews.Title: Buy it if there are any left
Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: Great TV for the price. Perfect for the bedroom. Crystal clear HD picture. Has just the  right amount of features

Reviews.Title: Watch Netfix or Prime?  This is the tv for you!
Reviews.Author: Teresa James
Reviews.Content: Great picture, great sound.  I purchased this tv quite a few months ago and couldn't be happier.  In my option, Vizio is the best quality for your dollar.  We have 3 Vizio tv's in our home and all of them have been great.  Easy to set up.  About 20 minutes and you are connected to all your favorite internet apps.  My only gripe is that the remote doesn't have a querty keyboard, but seriously not a huge issue.  I would highly recommend this tv.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful HDTV SMART!
Reviews.Author: Rev. Mark Johnson "Rev Mark Johnson"
Reviews.Content: This HDTV is the best ever and it is SMART!  Wow what afind this unit is with great sound and picture and all the apps you can imagine!  Buy this unit and you will like it!

Reviews.Title: Great Picture
Reviews.Author: Ross Fryer
Reviews.Content: The picture and clarity is great. TV broke down on the second day of operation however. Vizio replaced all the main electronics boards and now it works great. If you buy one save the box and all your paper work as you will need it to send information on them to Vizio to verify your purchase. Amazon . com was great as all the paperwork was in My account. I would recommend this TV to anyone I intended to keep as a friend. Buy a sound bar for this TV as the internal sound is not so good.

Reviews.Title: enjoyed it
Reviews.Author: Gerard Seitzinger
Reviews.Content: It has everything I wanted. I have another VIZIO TV and enjoy it. That was a 47 inch 3D. both have wifi and I enjoy the apps on it too.

Reviews.Title: nice
Reviews.Author: Chanda J.
Reviews.Content: really good price and it shows very nice as well, it was delivered within good time. sometimes the volume lowers on it own but its ok otherwise

Reviews.Title: Vizio E420iAo 42-Inch 1080Hz Smart Led HDTV
Reviews.Author: Charles
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV about 4 months ago. It is the best TV I ever bought. I have my Wi Fi  plugged up to it and it's shows a great picture. Netflix shows just as great without my HD box.  I bought two more remotes, but the first one is working just fine. The remotes are cheap in price at Amazon and not like those $150.00 remotes that breaks easy!

Reviews.Title: TV's for Dummy's
Reviews.Author: Jeremy Rohrbacher
Reviews.Content: So easy to use and install even my engineering manager could do it... and he has no idea how to do anything... soo....

Reviews.Title: It meets our expectations.
Reviews.Author: Janet Day
Reviews.Content: It meets all our expectations.  We researched other brands and decided on this one because of reputation for quality of manufacture and the recommendations of friends who have this product.

Reviews.Title: Vizio E-Series E241i-A1 24-Inch
Reviews.Author: Betty Anne Johnson
Reviews.Content: Nice good looking TV and the price from Amazon under $200.00 was great.  Unfortunately, it looks like you get what you pay for.  I received this TV on 09/24/2013.  As of 11/16/2013, the remote control and panel remotes no longer work.  Only recourse is to pack and ship from Florida to Vizio service center in California at my expense.

Reviews.Title: Best value for the price under $1000
Reviews.Author: Nom D. Plume
Reviews.Content: We grabbed this TV at an amazing price point, at around $650.  TV is large, sharp, and glare is minimal (although there is not much sunlight in the room we mounted it in).  The sound quality was not great, but a Vizio sound bar did the trick.  We were amazed how light weight the TV was for the size when we wall-mounted it (~50lbs without the stand).  Only cons are the built-in Wifi and Apps, which are slow, clunky, and lose intermittent connectivity, but "built-in" features really should not affect your decision to purchase a TV, as you can easily buy and keep an Android TV stick / Chromecast / Apple TV upgraded.

Reviews.Title: Great design, great features, great price.
Reviews.Author: James S. Morgan "Jim@HiTek"
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesitant to buy a Vizio TV after the experience I had with one of their 55" LCD units. The pic was great and all but the software was soooo sucky. It was totally annoying having to reconfigure it whenever you turned it on since it always switched back to the default settings instead of keeping the current. 'Nuff said about it.Some of the dumb things you find with modern TVs these days is a delay after changing channels. You'll get a blue screen for 2-3 seconds (even some older Vizio's do this), followed by the sound a couple seconds later. There is no reason for this, other then bad design. This Vizio did away with that silliness so when you change channels, it's virtually instant. Sound comes along for the ride and it's on instantly too. Even when switching to a pixelated picture it's happy to go there, without the annoyance of jumping back to the previous channel like some TVs and VCR/DVD players do.The picture is great even at wide angles (though you loose some brightness), and although I'll need to have an articulated wall mounting device to allow 25° tilt so I can watch either from my desk, or while lying down on the couch, I'd say that most won't have a problem with the viewing angles.In my small RV, it's a pleasure to have such a wide TV...compared to the old CRT 19" it replaced. The thin screen surround (3/4") is thin enough that it disappears into the background. And at only 22" wide, it fits perfectly over my existing cabinetry without any extensive alterations or interfering with the cabinet doors on either side. Though I will do some cabinet mods at a later date.The WiFi feature was an added bonus at the price paid for this unit, and although it requires a pretty strong, local signal, once it's up and working, it's nice and stable. But if the signal is down to 2-3 bars, it tends to lose it. Then sometimes it doesn't even show the AP it was just connected to as available until you turn off the TV and back on. This is the only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5.The built-in internet software favors commercial sources (the remote has direct keys for Amazon, Netflix, and M-Go, then there are several more commercial or pay-to-use sources, like Hulu, shown at the bottom of the screen when you press the VIA button on the remote) and although I haven't figured out how to just enter a URL yet, I expect I'll be able to. Haven't tried the Cat5 direct connection yet either. One thing they missed is that when entering the passcode, the typical cell phone shows upper case for the first entry and goes to lower case after you enter the first letter. The Vizio starts at lower case so you have to walk down to the control to set it up for upper. A minor annoyance as I find most passcodes start with uppercase. Strangely, when you need to enter a password into say, Netflix, the on-screen keyboard DOES work like a phone. Showing upper case first, then auto-switching to lower case after the first entry.The input sources available are more then just adequate, though I would have liked to connect via S-Video (no connector for that). Instead, I hooked up my computer and my VCR/DVD recorder/player via both HDMI and AV and the TV worked flawlessly. Push the remotes 'Input' button and a scrollable window pops up without blacking out the current picture...I like that. I also like that the picture scrunches up on the right side when you press menu, which shows up in a nicely readable box on the left taking up 1/3 of the screen. Navigation with the remote is fairly easy tho some keys could be larger, like the 'Mute' button. And the default settings for color, brightness and the like are perfect for me.Even the sound is better then expected. I will be going to a sound bar soon for improved dynamic range, but this TV is pretty good as it stands. Especially if it's sitting on a hard surface to reflect some of the sound from the front firing speakers and the passive rear grill openings.As a full time RV'er, it was a pleasure to find a TV like this that has such an easy to use 'Available Channel' scanning system. Many are so slow or have user unfriendly multiple pages as to be annoying. This Vizio is easy to use but as far as scanning speed goes it is about average, taking 5:45 to find 29 digital OTA channels. I am in a fringe area so that may have added some time to the scan. Haven't tried it on cable yet and I'm hoping for a faster scan with that typically stronger signal.For the price, feature set, and the quality, you would be hard pressed to find something that would beat the Vizio E241i-A1. For RV'ers who don't want to do extensive remodeling of their cabinetry, it's darn near perfect.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: K. Cashman "xboxer"
Reviews.Content: Love this TV.  I bought it becasue it was Internet ready.  It's such a pleasure to have something work like it's supposed and not break the bank.

Reviews.Title: Love the TV.
Reviews.Author: mac2monster
Reviews.Content: This TV is awesome. Fast internet, big screen, bright and crisp! It is a little slow to start up (about 5 seconds maybe) but well worth it.Buy a cable with it if you don't have a Cable/satellite appointment to hook it up (Usually they provide a cable for free)

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Charles Devin Daulton
Reviews.Content: This was my first LED TV I bought it a a 29" at the same time.  So far I'm very pleased with both of them.

Reviews.Title: It rawks!!
Reviews.Author: Mud Dauber
Reviews.Content: Works well, very well, in fact. Minus one star for tiny non-illuminated remote buttons. You'll need audio equipment. Speakers are for appearance only.

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: mikaela robinson
Reviews.Content: I like this tv. It's a little slow scrolling around the apps and netflix but it's definitely tolerable. Its a great tv for the price.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV!
Reviews.Author: Volarath
Reviews.Content: Excellent Blueray playback quality, and easy to set up.  Well, easy to watch it be set up.  Delivery/installation guy was great, and made it on time.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Warren Redlich
Reviews.Content: Very happy with it.First of all, the matte screen is better at dealing with reflections from the surroundings like windows letting in exterior light. This is one of the reasons I chose it and I'm glad I did.Second, the picture is outstanding. No complaints.Third, ability to access Amazon Prime is a big plus, though we actually haven't used it much so far.My only mistake? I should've bought the 70" model. This is big enough, but I'm kicking myself about not spending a few extra bucks.

Reviews.Title: WOW
Reviews.Author: William R.
Reviews.Content: After tweaking the picture settings and letting the tv update it's firmware and smart tv programs everything seems amazing. really really happy so far with this tv.

Reviews.Title: It's good
Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: Wish it had more apps, but otherwise is great. It's lightweight and easy to move around. Color is great, sound good.

Reviews.Title: bought a used tv from this seller
Reviews.Author: bryan
Reviews.Content: It was a lot better than expected no marks on the screen and a very very minor fingerprint mark less then a fingernails length cant even notice it.  the screen was perfect to say the least although a bit slow, but then fast in the end.  It made no sense but fast in the end.  Overall im very happy with the product and having a television that has everything intergrated makes life so much easier.  the picture is perfect but it did not come with a manual.  I figured out 95 percent of the tv within 10 mins anyways.  I thank them for having a product like this in my price range.  Well worth the wait! Im going back to watching tv, take care.

Reviews.Title: TV
Reviews.Author: Guy Davies
Reviews.Content: Does great so far!! Every thing I thought it would be!!! Nice picture quality and the sound is great and adjustable!!!

Reviews.Title: Vizio E-Series 24 inch 1080 LED Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Linda Eaton
Reviews.Content: This is my third Vizio TV.  I have a 70 inch, 42 inch and this 24 inch that I keep in the kitchen.  Really good quality clear picture.  Ours are set up with Netfix.  So Great.  The price from this seller was the best price out there.  Well worth the purchase.  I would buy from this seller again.

Reviews.Title: Very Good Price, Great Quality, Terrible Wireless Connection
Reviews.Author: wadej93
Reviews.Content: This Vizio has very good quality, though not nearly as good as my 5-6 year old Samsung Plasma. The picture is crisp, and the colors are pretty good. The sound from the built in speakers is good too, but nothing special, pretty much just what I was expecting.But the main reason for purchasing this TV was for it's affordable price for being a smart TV. It was easy setting up the wireless connection, just needed to point it to the right network and punch the password and viola! I mainly used it for Netflix and the picture brought down from Netflix was pristine. But I eventually started running into trouble with it constantly dropping the WiFi connection. To fix it I had to restart the whole TV. I even went into my router's settings and made sure that there was no chance that anything in the router would mess it up, but it still consistently dropped the connection (and it doesn't seem like I'm the only one). So I ended up buying a Google Chromecast to plug into it (USB port in this TV works for supplying power to the Chromecast), and the Chromecast has worked flawlessly. Hasn't dropped a connection once, which should be embarrassing for Vizio that a tiny $35 HDMI dongle can outperform the streaming capabilities of a 32-inch TV set.Though I wish the connection was stable, it was still a decent buy. It was a fairly cheap price for a TV of pretty good quality, although I would recommend just getting a TV without wireless streaming and spend the money you save on a Chromecast (if you have a smartphone or tablet, that is).

Reviews.Title: Vizio 39" TV
Reviews.Author: Jonathan E. Lepoff
Reviews.Content: Excellent picture quality, although it requires adjustments to achieve it and it was very easy to set up. I am happy with it

Reviews.Title: VERY happy with this TV
Reviews.Author: Terra R
Reviews.Content: We are very happy with the sound quality and picture on our new VIZIO E390i-A1 TV and would recommend it to others. This is our second VIZIO and we would buy from them again.

Reviews.Title: Not just a TV
Reviews.Author: Texasdan
Reviews.Content: Just got my new Vizio 42" TV and WOW the picture is great and if I'd known what it could do I would not have waited.Hooked it up to the internet via my router and instantly started watching Amazon prime videos.I like to listen to music while I cook but in the area i live in you cant get a good radio station so I tried the free app that came on the TV called Pandora internet radio and created my own stations and now all my favorite music is streaming on my TV loud ,clear and free,I love it. Many more apps I have not tried yet,cant wait to see all the things they will do.Also arrived on time and in prefect condition so dont be affraid to get it shipped to you.

Reviews.Title: Too slow to be Smart
Reviews.Author: Marcello De Feo
Reviews.Content: The possibility certainly exists that there is a flaw specific to the television that I received -- and I would like to hear from others who own this TV to get their feedback too -- but the Wi-Fi on this television is terrible, which renders most of the apps useless. You want to get a weather update? Awesome. You want to watch something on Netflix? Good luck with that.The picture on the TV is very good on the whole but I bought this specifically because it was "Smart" and did not intend to get a cable box or streaming device. If this is a product-wide flaw, though, I would recommend that you save some money and get the next model down without Smart capabilities and buy a Roku or Apple TV, unless you are capable of directly hooking up the ethernet connection.

Reviews.Title: It stopped working right when it was too late to return it.
Reviews.Author: Carolyn M. Rondthaler "artist"
Reviews.Content: I had this tv less than two months when it stopped working.  A guy who came to look at it said the tuner was broken.  I can use it in my art studio now for streaming reception, but that is all.  Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Good price for 39 inch smart TV
Reviews.Author: Missy jost
Reviews.Content: Paid under $400 on Amazon. It was the best price I found anywhere at the time, also bought the square trade 4year plan at a discount. I have a 50 inch LG plasma, a 32 inch samsung, and others. I was expecting a lot from reading all the reviews, but was a little disappointed when I hooked it up. The colors didn't seem to in tune with what I was expecting, it also seemed to have ghosting problems when on sports channels. At night there seems to be a bit of a backlight problem. I decided to give it a week of trial. After manually tuning in the color for a week I started to like it. It has the nice smart TV features which included Netflix and Amazon apps. I would recommend it for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture
Reviews.Author: Mike Mazzante
Reviews.Content: I'm no HDTV guru or anything but I do believe that this TV has a crisp, clear and colorful picture. Oh, and it's awesome because you can access Netflix, etc. from the remote! (See, I'm not electronically technologically up-to-date.)

Reviews.Title: Display quality is good, App quality is poor
Reviews.Author: Craig Yarnold
Reviews.Content: The apps are slow to launch, and the Amazon Prime app ABSOLUTELY STINKS! Also, the TV has randomly rebooted a couple of times, may be related to the Netflix app? Now that I know that smart TVs are notorious for having crummy apps, I would re-consider my purchase next time, and instead purchase a "dumb" TV + Roku, which actually works well.

Reviews.Title: TV
Reviews.Author: Roger Pierce
Reviews.Content: I really like this TV. It was easy to set up.  It has a really nice picture but the sound is not very good.  But for the price I do no think it can be beat.

Reviews.Title: Great so far and it is my second one
Reviews.Author: J. Gerving "JAG"
Reviews.Content: I have purchased the smaller 39" and now the 47". Connectivity is amazing and quick, just a little fumpling with the multifunction key pad but no big deal.Netflix works seamlessly, Amazon prime is great, Vudu, Hulu and all in one package. I shopped around a little bit but with my prime membership and the discount no one beat the price and it was delivered to my door!I dont pay for Cable but use the free channels and this things goes right through the auto set-up and then you can easily delete the channels you dont want. So saving the 100-200.00 a month for cable and using netflix, amozon, hulu, and vudu you just cant beat it. Along with all of that the sound out of this TV is really amazing for its size and price. i am a sound and loud movie nut, this does ok for what i do with it and would more than likely please 99% of the people who would buy it.So all i can say is if you need and or are looking for a SMART TV but this TV no matter what size it is!

Reviews.Title: Vizio 70 in Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Clarence
Reviews.Content: Quality Smart TV for the price. Nice picture and smooth transition from cable to Internet tv. Glad I bought this tv.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: Luziano Chavez
Reviews.Content: Most definitely one of my top purchases from Amazon! Vizio is a great brand and the price was unbeatable at the time! Nothing wrong with it and the netflix app on it saves so much time =]

Reviews.Title: Good buy. Great price.
Reviews.Author: Thedivamd
Reviews.Content: Good picture. Connects easily to wifi. Sound not so great which is why I gave 4 instead of 5 stars. I'm not very technically savvy and I got this hooked up and in use very quickly. Looking at buying one for my daughter's room instead of cable connection there. Very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Brenda Debouse "Brneda  Waters-DeBouse"
Reviews.Content: Excellent  picture quality, vivid. color. Received it sooner than expected. I love all of the features available on my new "Smart" TV.  You can't beat the price.  I'm in heaven!!!

Reviews.Title: it is smart
Reviews.Author: MC - Texas
Reviews.Content: Love it!  Easy to set up and install.  Internet is great, my Amazon Prime is easy.  Have not played any video games as of yet.  The picture is not the greatest I've ever seen, but is still good.  Side view you can still see the show.

Reviews.Title: NO CLOSED CAPTIONS
Reviews.Author: betty boop
Reviews.Content: IT IS NOT CAPABLE OF CLOSED CAPTIOING WHEN STREAMING SHOWS . THIS WAS A LITTLE DISSAPOINTING BECAUSE I USE PRIME FOR TV I MISSED.

Reviews.Title: Great TV after tons of research
Reviews.Author: P. DeHaan
Reviews.Content: This TV is great! After days of research using Consumer Reports, Amazon reviews, CNET, PC World, and a host of other opinions, I settled on this TV, due to it's affordability, features, size, price, back light technology, etc. This is an excellent value.I have a Vizio sound bar set mounted above the tv using two steel brackets I also purchased on Amazon and absolutely love the setup.Perhaps one con is that the screen can't be swiveled sideways, but that's a minor fix of buying a small rotating plate for it to sit on.Other than that, the picture quality is excellent, I love how sleek the TV is, the screen with its matte finish (thank goodness it's NOT glossy!), how thin the edges are... just love it. And I'm usually a Samsung guy.

Reviews.Title: Great Smart HDTV at very reasonable price and easy setup
Reviews.Author: Artsy
Reviews.Content: I searched Amazon reviews and was aware that Samsung was considered number 1.... But after many reviews that I read on settled on the Vizio and I'am glad I did. It's excellent and I think rivals Samsung . Easy setup and the best thing is up front on quick start is 800 number for tech support and it's not in India I can easily understand everything... Best ever decision... Plus it has quick button right on remote to Netflix, etc.

Reviews.Title: Good buy
Reviews.Author: R. Herrera "rherrera"
Reviews.Content: Love it.  Apps works great.  Only drawback is remote is not lighted.  still have recommended this to friends.  Worth the money.  Great Amazon service as usual.

Reviews.Title: Bought Used and it works great!
Reviews.Author: Markiv
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV after some heavy deliberation.  I did not want to spend too much on a TV, but I wanted something that will last and hoped to get a smart TV so I don't need to buy chromecast or anything else.  I needed a TV mainly for cable, netflix, and hulu plus.I really liked the reviews and specs on this TV, so I took a chance and bought it used, and it turned out to be a great decision!The Netflix and Hulu apps work well (though typing can be a pain sometimes) and the youtube app pairs with your phone or computer, so all the smart features work fine.The television quality is great when you use the apps, but i do wish it was a bit crisper, but then again, it is 720p.Overall, I'm quite happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Good t.v. for the price
Reviews.Author: Jesus R.
Reviews.Content: Considering this was 485 with shipping it was a great deal BUT i was disappointed to see the 42 inch modelat the same price at a brand store 50 dollars cheaper considering i paid shipping, so not very happy about that... (rhymes with warget).The television it self looks amazing the wifi isn't so great i tried youtube and netflix. Netflix worked great but youtube would buffer constantly even though i had full wifi bars and have a 30Mb/s speed. Might have been a youtube issue.

Reviews.Title: Great........
Reviews.Author: deno
Reviews.Content: Perfect the tv shows great and the sound is ok but what would u expect for a 70 inch for 1500 my xbox show excellent with the hdmi/cable hook up I would recommend u to get one...

Reviews.Title: A great TV so far
Reviews.Author: Blake R. Rosengren "Blakesterguy"
Reviews.Content: What can I say? It is a really great TV for an awesome price. Pick one up for yourself today.

Reviews.Title: Its our 3rd Vizio.
Reviews.Author: Mike Vanner
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with there TVs and more so there customer service. This is the 3rd Vizio we purchased in the last couple years as replace the old dinosaurs one by one. Will be getting another soon.

Reviews.Title: Missing HDMI
Reviews.Author: Murry E. Page
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Vizio E320i-A0 based on all the reviews I had read and because it had 2 HDMI inputs. I needed both.When I received the product from Amazon the HDTV had only one HDMI input.Very deceptive.10/14/2013 Update:I called Vizio and come to find out the serial number TV that was shipped to me, but not the one shown in the manual I received with my TV, has the second HDMI connection underneath next to the Ethernet port.  All is well.

Reviews.Title: Wow
Reviews.Author: Bryon Bean "Rock n Rolla"
Reviews.Content: What can I say, I love this television. The HD picture is great, the setup was easy, and it would be hard to express the titillation that I felt when I discovered that there was an Amazon.com button on the remote. Seriously? Yes Seriously. It's like having movie rental store at the tip of your fingertips; I can watch whatever I want, whenever I want. The other app that I find absolutely incredible is the YouTube app. It allows you to select YouTube videos from your computer so you don't have to go through the painful process of trying to find movies with a remote. You can also watch, without interruption, the videos on your watch list. This is 50" of pure television bliss. I'm very impressed.

Reviews.Title: Needed a new television - this one is great!
Reviews.Author: Laura Grimmer
Reviews.Content: I truly like that this television allows for internet access, too.  It makes it more than just a television - it makes it a true entertainment center.  I also got it at a really good price!

Reviews.Title: Truly a SMART tv
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "jjfenton"
Reviews.Content: I am somewhat of an early adopter. I got a Roku a couple of years ago and loved being able to connect to Netflix from my tv. Then, I got a BlueRay with internet and was able to add Youtube to the mix. Score. We needed to replace our tv in our bedroom and went with the Vizio E320i-AO and love it. The quality is wonderful. What I really enjoy is being able to launch my smart apps within the active tv window instead of having to turn on a different device. It is all there and I can browse while my tv show is playing. This is great for checking the weather, stocks, news, etc...Overall here are my list of pros/consPros:Nice interfaceEasy to set upClean designCan switch viewing modes (panoramic, wide screen) very easilySleep timer - intuitive (good for bedroom)Ports placement is decentLightweightEasy to see from many anglesCons:Wish the remote was back litBody cheaper plastic

Reviews.Title: Great 32" Television
Reviews.Author: Rinaldi
Reviews.Content: I wanted a small television for my sunroom and this one fit the bill. Generally speaking not anything special as far as picture or sound. The feature I like the most is the apps available, specifically amazon prime and youtube. Lightweight and small border are a bonus as well.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Diane L. Fisher
Reviews.Content: I haven't had a new TV since 1985 and imagine my amazement at this new technology with the Vizio.  Not to mention the clarity and size of the picture.  Love it!

Reviews.Title: Great TV but font on apps a little small
Reviews.Author: Jea
Reviews.Content: This was a great TV for the price. The picture quality is great and set up was a breeze.I love everything about it except for the fonts on the apps. It is hard to read from not too far away. I also don't like the way the Amazon prime app functions but that is not Vizios fault. I have a Roku hooked up on my other TV and the interface there is much better. You are about to view your watch list and it is much easier to find content.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Vincent Hotz
Reviews.Content: Really enjoying this smart TV. I got a good deal at $397 and I would have happily paid another $100 for it. Great picture after adjusting settings. Great apps. Easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: TravCo
Reviews.Content: I am not a video professional so maybe my opinions, knowledge and standards rate low but this TV is the best I have seen at this price point. Do you really need 240Hz? Not my family, I have paid extra for years for the most powerful features and frankly a bunch a specs I really don't need. So I bought this panel instead of the 240Hz models that I was originally looking at. My family is simply blown away by the picture on this TV right out of the box, we watched Thursday night football right after I mounted this giant thing to the wall and my wife made the comment of she felt like we were actually at the game. I will admit though I had to turn off the true motion setting because my HD show "hell on wheels" did look way to clear, I think they call it the soap opera effect. All the apps work great for us and the 70" Vizio looks great on the wall. Best purchase I have made yet on tv's.

Reviews.Title: Nice display
Reviews.Author: Beth
Reviews.Content: Got this tv for my husband for football season and he just loves it!  The picture is super clear and there's no traces of the screen blurring or anything. The kids also love it for the video games very nice picture.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV !!!
Reviews.Author: David L. Bernier
Reviews.Content: Great look, great features and the reception is outstanding.  Best deal for the money !!! You certainly can't go wrong

Reviews.Title: Phenomenal value for the price, even if it had cost 50% more.
Reviews.Author: E. Heinrich "CDBurnguy13"
Reviews.Content: We wanted a smaller TV for our kids' playroom but we like to watch movies off our other media devices as well as from Amazon Prime Video.  This LED TV has great picture, good sound (for small built-in speakers), and plenty of input options.  my ONLY complaint is that it does take more time than most TV's to power ON.  At first, we frequently pressed POWER more than once while waiting for it to start, but were turning it back off by accident.  Now we know to just wait 8-10 seconds and it comes on.  Everything else responds normally.  We are very happy with this purchase and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Worth the money
Reviews.Author: J. Thacker "JT"
Reviews.Content: Great color, really amazing Hi Def, plus Internet availability.  Picture is best I've seen on any TV of this size.  Sound can be tailored to your liking, but may be somewhat limited at some frequencies.

Reviews.Title: Perfect size for a computer monitor and watch OTA channels in Hi Def.
Reviews.Author: fryedinaz
Reviews.Content: Awesome as a HD computer monitor and since I work on Saturdays I can switch to TV input to watch college football in HiDef with an $8 RCA antenna hooked up to it. Bought 2, 1 for work and 1 for home. I have an Apple Macbook Pro attached with an HDMI cord and a thunderbolt adapter. Also nice having built in speakers. Audio from the Macbook comes through the HDMI input.

Reviews.Title: ONLY 3  STARS, HAVING ISSUES...
Reviews.Author: Franklin L.
Reviews.Content: This was a great price at Best Buy, later I even saw it advertised at Big Lots for about the same as it was at Best Buy. Here are the problems I'm having...1. When the screen goes black momentarily between scenes, I can make out a slight trace of the previous scene on the dark screen before the next scene, only mildly annoying. I've tried visual adjustments in settings, nothing fixes this.2. There isn't any 'Over the air' antenna digital information on programs. It will sometimes display what is currently playing, sometimes... An old generic 42" lcd I have displays listings for channels several hours in advance for the shows through 'Over the air' free digital channel broadcast. The worst thing about this problem is when I called Vizio about it, the person just gave me a dismissive techno savvy response suggesting 'WHAT STONE-AGE DINOSAUR STILL USES OVER THE AIR SIGNALS???!!!'. I'm being a little dramatic, but it still rubbed me the wrong way.3. Netflix screws up every other time I use it on this tv, the only way to fix the problem is by turning off and back on the television, otherwise Netflix will stay frozen and not finish loading. Though it takes longer for Amazon instant video to load, it never has this problem. In all fairness, this could have more to due with my router not being a newer model designed for streaming.4. When turning on my tv after being off a while, there will be a few second delay before the tv responds to the remote control commands, this has only happened occasionally though.5. Often the volume up down, channel up down buttons on the remote control will get stuck, this sometimes causes me to fly past the channel I wanted to watch.Though sounding like a grouch, I'd rate this as 3 1/2 stars, the problems are almost always seldom or minor and the pros have mostly outweighed the cons.

Reviews.Title: Good but not Great
Reviews.Author: Jay Meeks
Reviews.Content: Only had the TV for two months but so far I have been satisfied with this product. Keep in mind you get what you pay for. The picture on this TV will not be what you get on a Samsung that is twice the price. Depending on what I am watching I may have to adjust the picture. My settings for watching football is different than watching Big Bang Theory. I would still recommend this TV to the low cost consumer.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV
Reviews.Author: sweet
Reviews.Content: AS expected, VIZIO didn't let me down. Great TV at a great Price. Once you mess around with the settings to get that perfect picture this TV is just as good if not better than TV's that are double the price. The slim border looks nice too. Only negative I had was that when playing movies over any of the apps the sound will not come through the surround sound due to the TV needing an audio out jack. You have to set it up as another source and switch sources on your audio. You will need a digital optical audio cable which you can buy for less than $10.

Reviews.Title: Awesome quality television!
Reviews.Author: Brittany Steed
Reviews.Content: Works awesome is the biggest bang for your buck! Clear picture that is awesome for watching NFL games, movies and playing video games.

Reviews.Title: Wait for something better
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: Walmart was having a 10%-off and $50 gift card promotion for this TV in August. So I managed to buy one.My family has been purchasing Vizio televisions for a while now. Our first TV was a 42" Vizio. It cost $900 in 2007. I bought a 32" Vizio in 2008 for $550. Vizio HDTVs are cheap and they provide a good value for the buck. However, the black levels on their "value" TVs are atrocious.The black levels on this TV are no better. It's a pity since this TV is beautiful.The TV is still a good value for its price. I look forward to my buying a 80" Vizio in 2015-2016. Hopefully, the black levels should be better by then.

Reviews.Title: Wifi Would not Work!
Reviews.Author: Paul A Sisco
Reviews.Content: I hooked up the TV and connected to my cable box.  Started to activation process and the wifi would not work.  I plugged the TV into my LAN and TV worked great.  Ran filmware update, still no luck on the wifi.  I repeatedly tried to restore default settings and could not get the WIFI to work.  Good picture on the TV, but I returned the item due to it's defect.  I'm sure I just got a bad unit, but I can't go back to Vizio.  Also, the remote control would not work for a few minutes at a time and then suddenly start up again.  Too many issues from the start.

Reviews.Title: vizio 39 inch
Reviews.Author: Adam Bethea
Reviews.Content: vizio is the only way to go. i love the apps and the easy set up. i have a 42 inch lcd and a 39 led. once the colors are adjusted the tv has a superior color. some people complain about the remote.  i love the remote. it's small and simple.

Reviews.Title: App doesn't support Watchlist on Amazon
Reviews.Author: Paul C
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv since the width would just fit into my cabinet. I also wanted to use Amazon instant video service. The lack of the watchlist feature with Amazon means I won't be using be using the TV smart app. The picture is OK, not as good as my similarly sized Sony from several years back. I could have saved some money and got the non smart app version.

Reviews.Title: great tv for the money
Reviews.Author: John Smothermon
Reviews.Content: I love this TV!  I have 7 Vizio's and they are the are a great value for the money!  Never buy any other brand.

Reviews.Title: Great little tv
Reviews.Author: Ami Dougherty "Ami"
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my son's room. He is VERY happy. It's a great little light weight tv that doesn't take up too much room. Great picture quality. We got it hooked up to the wifi easily and he was watching Netflix and streaming Rhapsody in no time. (Those are paid services we had existing accounts with.) The sound leaves a little to be desired. A little weak and tinny. We hooked up an mp3 JBL speaker we had lying around and it sounds great now. Very happy with the value and the product.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV for the Price
Reviews.Author: Jerry L. Price
Reviews.Content: This is a great Smart TV for the price (paid less than $700).  The picture quality is very good, viewing angle is good and the sound is decent.  I added my own sound bar to get even better sound.  Since this TV recently was installed in a mountain condo that we get to once every couple of months, I have not had a chance to fine tune the picture or to use the Smart features that much, but I don't anticipate problems in these areas from others' reviews that I have read.  Obviously, I can't speak to the reliability of this TV, but I have had good luck in that regard with my previous Vizio 37-inch non-Smart TV.

Reviews.Title: Decent TV
Reviews.Author: Justin Schaefer
Reviews.Content: Bought this for our bedroom and wanted Netflix and network streaming. The interface is a little slow, but functional. If you try to stream from your network and it says something like incompatible file type, you can just transfer them to a thumb drive or external HDD and plug them into the USB on the side of the tv and it will play them just fine.

Reviews.Title: Like this a lot
Reviews.Author: Chari
Reviews.Content: The reviews on this were spot on - I purchased the 42" for a friend but the 32" is perfect for my bedroom the only issue is that it  not  pick up my wireless network while other devices do - that's why it lost a star.

Reviews.Title: This TV is awesome
Reviews.Author: L. Jackson
Reviews.Content: Love this TV.  Got it for a great price and it was delivered, set up and trash removed.  No complaints at all.  I'm not one of those crazy people that comment on all of the technical aspects of TV sets.  I have a Sharp 60" in my family room and my husband decided he wanted a 70" for his man cave.  After browsing around I settled on this one as all of our previous TV's were Vizio brand and we had never had a problem with any of them.  I thought the Sharp had the best picture but after having both now for over six months I can't complain about either.  They both look good to me.

Reviews.Title: Very good TV, very good value
Reviews.Author: EMTP EJ "EJ"
Reviews.Content: This TV has 4 HDMI ports,one component (shared with the composite input)Digital TV / TV coax - either cable or antenna1 USBEthernet or wifias well as L & R RCA audio out and optical audio out.The remote uses a 4-way pointer, like you would see on a cellphone or other device, in addition to the usual remote control buttons.Since it is a smart TV, it can use on-board apps.It also has the standard VESA mounting system.

Reviews.Title: Screen finish shiny
Reviews.Author: amalia litos
Reviews.Content: Although the TV is described as LED, the screen finish is almost as shiny as a plasma.  This is an issue for high light rooms.Also, after the wireless internet features did not connect, I contacted Vizio about the issue and I was told that unless your modem is within 30' of the TV, it will probably not connect and there is nothing that can be done about it.  This should have been stated in the description.Lastly, when the TV did not connect to my DVR for programming, I was told by Vizio that I needed to take it off the wall bracket and connect it to another DVR to test whether it was my DVR which was the issue or the TV itself, and that Vizio would not send a tech out until I did as they instructed!!  As I found this demand to be unacceptable, I asked for a supervisor who directed me through a few steps to get the programming up and running.Positives are that the TV has a compact, streamlined look.

Reviews.Title: Exactly What I hoped for
Reviews.Author: iBane
Reviews.Content: TV came in perfect working order and looks terrific.  No dead pixels, great picture in various types of light.  Lots of people reported remote control problems with this model, but no such problems with mine.  Remote works find and is easy to use.  My guess is the remote has been improved in response to previous problems.Amazon's freight forwarder of choice was prompt and helpful.  Shipping carton was in good condition.No problems whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: Fantasic TV & monitor
Reviews.Author: A. Dightam
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV.I use just about every option available. I have my Google Chromebox in one HDMI and use the Vizio as a monitor for several hours a day for work. I have my Windows 7 PC in the other HDMI input and can use the DVD player on the PC to play movies over the Vizio, or stream anything I want. I also have an antenna for my over-the-air TV reception. I've run a movie in the USB slot off a 4GB thumb drive. Everything works really well.HDTV via my indoor antenna is excellent. I live in a city in a valley with TV towers 7-miles from my house. The picture is crisp (sometimes breathtaking depending on the program source).720 & 60 is just fine for a 32" screen. I was watching Braquo on Hulu the other day and could see the finest detail on one of the female character's colorful costume - it wouldn't have been any better with 1080 & 120. Refresh is good enough; I get some artifacts on over the air progs with fast moving content but kind of expect it with a TV that costs less than 300-bucks.The apps are great - I use Netflix (excellent), Amazon Prime (excellent), Hulu (excellent), YouTube (very good), Pandora (vg), Tune-in (buggy - some stations don't work), IHeartRadio (same as Tune-in - buggy). Warning to all: don't install the Weather4us app unless you want a constant siren alert when your area has a weather emergency (like a flash flood warning). The alert also takes over the Vizio completely shutting down all operations. Obviously, I uninstalled it.I wired in my internet in which is recommended. The wifi works fine but I get much faster speed over Ethernet which is better for Amazon, Hulu, Netflix, etc.Highly recommended. Go get yourself one.

Reviews.Title: Younger generation "Know How"
Reviews.Author: Satisfied
Reviews.Content: I was surprised to discover how light weight the unit was.  It came much sooner than was predicted. I was unable to sync it with my cable provider . I am so not techy. My son and daughter came over one evening and set it all up for me.  Can fully enjoy it now. It was a good purchase experience.

Reviews.Title: Good as a smart tv, not as a PC display
Reviews.Author: Abraham
Reviews.Content: I hoped this would be good as a pc display and tv, but was not fast enough as a pc display. Returned it.

Reviews.Title: Vizio 47" LED Smart HDTV
Reviews.Author: Rico
Reviews.Content: As advertised.  Great quality and functionality.  Wish it had more component/HDMI plug-ins, but for the price, I can't complain.  As advertised.

Reviews.Title: piece of garbage
Reviews.Author: Kim springer
Reviews.Content: we have had so many problems with this tv, the main one being, it freezes up all the time and we have to  unplug the tv and turn it back on.  I would not recommend this TV to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Great selection of TV
Reviews.Author: Kenan J. Kern
Reviews.Content: A superior TV with all the bells and whistles.  I would recommend this television to anyone looking to upgrade or replace an older unit.

Reviews.Title: Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Tyson
Reviews.Content: I watch a lot of you tube tutorials and it is great having this on the big screen sitting in the comfort of your living room. Also if you are entertained by music videos, this has several great sources.

Reviews.Title: great TV
Reviews.Author: Eileen Levesque
Reviews.Content: I love this TV!  Great picture quality easy to set up!Great TV for the money I would but it again!

Reviews.Title: Nice Picture Quality and Customer Service is Great
Reviews.Author: John Q.
Reviews.Content: After about 7 months this TV went completely black during a July 4th gathering (2013) I called Vizio customer service and they instantly made plans for the pickup and replacement of the TV. Some of these TVs were manufactured with defective chips. That being said; I really enjoy this model and it has an awesome picture. The internet connection is a little lagging when it comes to connectivity strength so I get that dreaded spinning symbol when Im streaming videos. And sometimes Netflix will completely freeze up and I have to do a reset to factory default and put all my credential into the TV over and over again for my video apps. (Worth mentioning: The internet is actually connected via ethernet cable from my high-speed router) Overall, this is still a great buy and it's simply beautiful mounted above my fire-place mantel.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Land Shark
Reviews.Content: Great Picture... Apps are fantastic with quick load times.  For the money this TV can not be beat.  As always, Amazon delivery was quick and painless.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Ellie
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with this TV.  So easy to set up,  ( Remote, as well) even having a Bose Surround Sound System.  The Clarity is awesome and colors are perfect!

Reviews.Title: Mostly Ok
Reviews.Author: Robert Heaton
Reviews.Content: Almost a great TV. All the features works well, and the apps much faster than on the Samsung products.Only problem is that from time to time screen brightness varies intermittently. Viewing normal TV it is not noticeable - but on apps, which have a constant brightness background, it is irritating.So one has the difficult decision weather to put up with it, or go through the whole business of getting a replacement.Either way, this is a unit that should not have got through QA. In retrospect, paying $50 or $100 more would be a better deal.

Reviews.Title: Wow! What a TV
Reviews.Author: A. Schott
Reviews.Content: For the price it's definitely at the top of all TV's I've seen and tested. Of course you could spend $6000 and get a slightly better picture but 99.99% of people wouldn't notice a difference. Shipping was great. The delivery guys setup the tv and removed all of the trash after inspection and testing.

Reviews.Title: Best TV yet.
Reviews.Author: Michael Yardis
Reviews.Content: And it's my 3rd flat screen.Best value, picture, apps, adjustability, and bang for your buck.Amazon prime finally makes sense.And did again this week when my wife broke our Breville Coffee maker.Don't bother with any other TV set.I own a Sony, an LG, and now this.Vizio hands down the clear cut winner.Click add to cart, and you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: Excellent HDTV at such a low price
Reviews.Author: Kathy Cai
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe the picture is so crystal clear.  With regard to the function and quality it is similar to or better than other HDTVs at much higher prices.For all HDTVs of this kind regardless of their brands, the sound quality is poor because the TV is so thin. In particular, the low frequency sound (bass) does not exist. Therefore to enjoy more you definitely need a sound bar or a sound system when you watch movies or TV shows.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Pat Choate
Reviews.Content: The TV is very easy to set-up.  The picture is superb, as advertised and verified by many buyers.  Really a great value and Vizio service is as good as Apple.  Lightening struck the house and knocked out the TV, which was in warranty.  Vizio made it good instantly.

Reviews.Title: Better than I expected!
Reviews.Author: WoodWorker "Willym47"
Reviews.Content: I was a little skeptical after some of the negative reviews that I have read, but based on my past experience with VIZIO products I kept them in balance with what I knew. After tweaking the picture settings and turning of the ambient sensor and the some of the other sensors, I found that the picture was quite pleasing and realistic. The blackness level is really good and even in a very bright room the picture is great. I would not hesitate to recommend this TV to anyone, especially if they can take the time to adjust a few settings and not accept the factory settings. Who drives a new car where the factory last left there seat position?

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Great Picture, Slow menus
Reviews.Author: t0astm0nkey
Reviews.Content: I selected this TV over comparable Samsung and Sony televisions based on the reduced price and slimmer profile.  The picture IS wonderful, and the SmartTv functions are incredibly easy to use.  My only complaint, is that it takes 5-6 seconds for the TV to respond upon pressing the Netflix button on the remote, not a deal breaker, just kind of a nuisance, as others who use my tv will press the button a second time, thinking the TV didn't get the signal, which will cause it to cancel out of the Netflix start-up.

Reviews.Title: I'm Enjoying it.
Reviews.Author: Atom K
Reviews.Content: Great TvFor the Price can't beat it.Solid Quality, Wi/Smart tv feature was easy to learn,I have the tv talking to my router and playing movies from my external harddrive hooked to my computer.It seemed easyer for the tv to find stuff on my external.The Menu system on the search/harddrive feature is a little rough, But i think it just need to play with it more.Have a 25Ft HMDI cable coming so i can run it straight from the comp to the tv.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: J. Edgar Mihelic "The Optimist"
Reviews.Content: For what I paid for this thing, and comparing it to other brands at the same size for twice the price, this thing is a steal.  I can watch netflix and Amazon streaming, as well as YouTube videos.  When I just want to relax and listen some music, Pandora streaming is available.The only issue is that the input for alphabetical entries is harder than necessary.  A qwerty remote is available, but it costs extra.  Otherwise, an awesome buy.

Reviews.Title: Good tv, as advertised
Reviews.Author: J. Wolken
Reviews.Content: I got this tv for my Grandpa, he likes it because it has a good picture and good sound. Quickly shipped was a nice bonus.

Reviews.Title: A really nice smart TV
Reviews.Author: randy
Reviews.Content: Very easy to understand and use. The setup was very simple.  I have used a memory stick in the USB port several times to play movies, it will play the most common formats.

Reviews.Title: 24" Vizio excellent buy for $200
Reviews.Author: jarco61
Reviews.Content: First off, spend the extra $20 and get the wireless version.  Sure it isn't perfect and doesn't have the strongest signal, but it works and works well.  Great set, great picture, easy set up.  Enjoy that Amazon and Netflix have one button access (as does M-GO, but it isn't available yet).  When the "off" brands first hit the market, I stayed clear, but the quality has improved tremendously and is definitely work a closer look.I liked this so much, I bought 2!

Reviews.Title: As advertised
Reviews.Author: Page H
Reviews.Content: I chose this television for its size.  We use it in a small bedroom that is used as a guest room and a second tv viewing room.The quality seems good and it works well.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: Ernst
Reviews.Content: Nice lottle room tv, great picture and sound for agreat price. It was quite a deal. Love this tv. Yes

Reviews.Title: 32inch vizio smart tv
Reviews.Author: moto91
Reviews.Content: Decent tv for the money like the smart features plus it is an led tv  which saves on electricity ,picture quality could be better.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Spiritgirl
Reviews.Content: IThis tv works great without an antenna. The wifi setup was not difficult. For internet access it is best to connect your tv by hdmi and the internet is easily accessible. The picture is vibrant and clear, the sound is good and I am really happy about the purchase. If this vizio does well, we will certainly purchase another. Thanks much!

Reviews.Title: Just go BIG!
Reviews.Author: Lue Thao
Reviews.Content: For the price you cant beat it, this TV has all the basic stuff you need in a smart TV and more, 70 inch is pretty big...

Reviews.Title: Amazing Picture
Reviews.Author: JaredL
Reviews.Content: Small things that I like:* When you mute the TV you can turn down the volume, without turning the sound back on. I know many times I'll cut the TV on in the morning or while my kid is sleeping on the couch and I mute it because it's so loud, but it's still going to be loud when I turn it down, but with this TV I don't have that problem.* The apps pop up on the side when you select them and you can size your screen to where it doesn't cut it off while you're looking for something.* The slim frame makes it seem as if it's floating in the dark, you feel like you're at the theater.Picture:The quality is extremely good with HDMI, the streaming through WI-FI, and an antenna. With sports there is a big difference in this and the 60 hz, plus it has settings to make it even better. It takes a while for it to come on (compared to other TV's) as others have said, but honestly, why is everyone in such a hurry for their TV to come on? Are you really that impatient to where you can't wait 60 secs for TV when you're probably going to watch at least 30 mins?Apps:The only ones I really use are the Netflix and Amazon. Netflix is laid out the same as my PS3 and I like that, but it does seem to buffer slower and takes a while to get a clear  picture. The Amazon app, doesn't have a place to select your watchlist (that I've found) so you have to search or dig for anything you want to watch. I'll probably use my PS3 more for Amazon, but it is convenient to not have to turn on a separate device. Youtube works good playing from the phone most of the time and I really like that feature. I'll update on other apps once I've used more, but haven't had a chance or need yet.Antenna:It was easy to set up and scan for channels and the picture quality was amazing, not to mention I get better reception with it. It actually tells you what is on local channels, how long it will be on, and gives a short description, just like cable or satellite would.Sound:This is one spot where the TV doesn't hold up well against others. The sound isn't terrible it's just not great. I will definitely invest in a sound bar as soon as I can. The speakers are on the bottom BTW. UPDATE: If you change the sound from Surround to standard it sounds much less distorted and is still plenty loud enough.Stand:I used a wall mount, but the stand seemed very solid and was very heavy so I think it would have done just fine.Remote:I like the convenience of the Netflix button and Amazon Prime button and the buttons are easy to read and it's laid out fairly well. It's small and light and points very easily. You can have it facing any where near the TV and it will work.Hook ups:The hook ups are easy to get to on the side (which is good if you want to plug something in temporarily like a phone or computer) and even though the ones that are facing downward are hard to reach it makes it where if you're mounting to the wall you can get it very flush. There are more than enough hook ups to fit just about anyone's needs.Overall, I couldn't find a TV that beat this one for the features and price and I couldn't be happier. I just hope it last longer than my Sharp did.

Reviews.Title: Does the job for a decent price.
Reviews.Author: P. Miller "Chucklehead"
Reviews.Content: Not bad. Decent picture. Easy to set up. Bought for my parents who are in their 70s and needed a good TV, but are not comfortable with complicated technology and don't care that much about the quality of the picture. That having been said- the picture is solid, and there's little to complain about so far with this TV. Some of the content provider apps are decent (Netflix, Amazon Prime, etc.), though a bit clumsy to navigate. If you really want those, Roku is a better answer, not the built-in apps. Good secondary TV for a guest room, or other use- not for your main.

Reviews.Title: Highly recommended
Reviews.Author: William H Hall Jr
Reviews.Content: I ordered this via Amazon in late afternoon on July 15.  It arrived at my door before 3pm the very next day delivered with free shipping via Amazon Prime.  Less than 24 hours, ordered and running in my home.  Amazing Amazon.  Great picture, easy setup, just as advertised.  Had to upgrade cable box for HDMI output to get HD.  Again, newly installed, but as of today, everything is great and I would recommend it.  I would also recommend buying the two sided remote fro the keyboard aspect.  ish i had paid the extra $13 bucks and ordered it, but I didn't know what kind of remote came wuith TV and I couldn't find out on internet before I ordered it.  Buy this, a deal at less than $400 for 39" Smart TV 1080p 120Hz

Reviews.Title: Works great as a monitor too!
Reviews.Author: Anton Suhy
Reviews.Content: Bought this to use as the primary extended display for my wife's 15" Mac Book Pro which is also our primary media center.Connected over HDMI and running at 1080p, this screen look brilliant! Much brighter than our old TV which was hard to see when movies had dark scenes. Can't comment much on the "smart" side of the TV as we don't currently subscribe to any of the services (living overseas at the moment) but the picture quality is excellent!For the price, this IS the best 24" TV on Amazon right now.

Reviews.Title: Everything I expected
Reviews.Author: Jorge Luis Amador
Reviews.Content: You really can't beat this TV for the price. The image is clear with a nice sharp contrast. The color levels are fantastic. It is heavier than I thought, weighing close to 100 pounds. Otherwise this is a great entry TV for very large screen sizes.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, size and features at a best value price
Reviews.Author: Bob Carroll : Gooplusplus•com "multi-search, ...
Reviews.Content: UPDATE: What the BLEEP ???  Why is Amazon now combining all kinds of different size and model Vizio TVs in this single review thread? This is a disservice to users. It is confusing and inefficient.===========================================================================This 29 inch Vizio TV is the perfect size for viewing when the TV is sitting just beyond the foot-of-the-bed. The slim profile and light weight makes it easy to fit into tighter spaces without sacrificing quality or comfortable viewing.The TV is capable of remarkable color and clarity. However, it did take me a while to customize the settings for optimal color and picture quality. The default setup does not reflect the picture potential that is available with careful tweaking.My personal preference (your mileage/taste may vary):Advanced Picture -> Color Enhancement -> GM/BlueAdvanced Picture -> Luma -> MediumAdvanced Picture -> Backlight Control -> OffColor Temperature -> CoolPicture Mode -> Custom-- backlight -> 41-- brightness -> 37-- contrast -> 42-- color -> 51-- tint -> -2-- sharpness -> 10The remote control (RC-29") took some getting used to. I often like to control with "feel" instead of sight. Since the RC-29" thickness is uniform and the top and bottom are both rounded, it is easy to grab the remote in the dark and not know immediately whether you are holding it from the top or bottom. In contrast, the RC from my other Vizio 16" TV is, in most respects, more ergonomic. The RC-16" was longer so buttons were more spread out and easier to locate in the dark. The RC-16" also had a smooth battery bump on the back, making it much easier to determine top and bottom in the dark. I would have just used the old RC-16" to control my 29" Vizio except that the RC-29" had channel numbers at the very bottom, making it easier to select channels by "feel" than via the RC-16".I also use a tiny $60 Android/TV box about the size of a fat harmonica that connects to one of the two Vizio HDMI ports. It gives me full internet web access (via wi-fi) and access to plenty of great apps, essentially a small Android 4.2.2 computer using the TV as a 1280x720 pixel monitor. Although this box is capable of being powered by the Vizio USB port, I prefer to use an external powered USB hub. My favorite app is the XBMC media player allowing me to easily access, via wi-fi, my notebook's USB hard drive's 1TB of movies, MP3s, and various other media files.LINK: hypercube.us/forum/index.php?topic=1202.0The Vizio E291i-A1 29 inch HDTV would be a great deal even without its wi-fi capabilities. However, why would anyone buy a non-internet capable model when any savings would amount to just a few dollars?

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Author: Vic
Reviews.Content: Bought to replace my 7 year old 42 Vizio, this was almost half the price and a fantastic picture, you can't beat this for the price and it arrived in 2 days, ordered it on July 3rd and it was here by 10am July 5th

Reviews.Title: 39" smart tv is ruining my life! /s
Reviews.Author: RBR
Reviews.Content: This 39" smart tv is ruining my life! The picture is really great, and the netflix feature is making me stay indoors during these heat spells and watch a lot more tv than I would ever watch before. All kidding aside, the vizio is a great tv at a more than reasonable price. I have it in my smallish mancave and it is about 12' away. At this distance the picture is great and the size feels like a much bigger screen. The narrow frame means that this unit took up only a couple of inches more than the 32" tv it replaced. Setup was very easy, though there were minimal instructions on remote use. I ordered a qwerty remote to make searches on netflix easier. I would recommend this to my friends and would buy an other.Please note that the 4 stars instead of 5 is I only rate 5 for spectacular. This unit does what it is supposed to do and well.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: yarid
Reviews.Content: I am grateful to them whoever make this TV. Its cheap in price but the picture quality is great like a expensive TV. It looks good, real slim. I just love this TV.

Reviews.Title: What a great TV!
Reviews.Author: shamrock reader
Reviews.Content: Ordered this TV for my son.  It was a great value at $198 with free shipping.  He is able to easily stream Netflix, access his Facebook.  It does so much we haven't been able to browse all of the cool things it does.  Thinking of buying a second one.

Reviews.Title: A super good deal!
Reviews.Author: veritablevintage
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd Vizio tv that I have bought. They are very easy to set up and a very nice picture on all of my sets. This one is a smart tv which is AWESOME! No need for an extra device to watch Netflix and other media! My sister has a Samsung tv and Vizio beats them hands down!

Reviews.Title: Great TV, but Wi-Fi Reception is Spotty
Reviews.Author: Jeremy Carr
Reviews.Content: Great picture quality and overall features on this TV, but unless the Wi-Fi router is extremely close to the TV it won't work.  It even says the signal is strong, but won't connect to online apps.  Looks like some other reviewers have diagnosed the problem.

Reviews.Title: TV works but WIFI does not
Reviews.Author: Lindsey
Reviews.Content: The TV itself seems to work fine, however, we have not been able to watch Netflix on it which is part of the reason we bought this TV.  It plays the movie for 5 minutes at the most then it says it's "Loading" constantly and just will not work.  It is impossible to watch anything on Netflix on this TV.  We thought at first it was our internet but it is not. We even connected an ethernet cord directly into the TV to see if that would work and it still didn't.  Our internet is plenty fast enough and Netflix works on our other TV through the Wii just fine.  When we run netflix on the Wii it never says it's loading except for in the beginning and will play the movie entirely.  We called Vizio and they said it must be that our internet isn't fast enough.  I really don't think that is the case though because why would netflix work on the Wii just fine?  I will update this post if/when we find a solution to the problem but at this point I am very disappointed in this “smart” TV.

Reviews.Title: Incredible Value: Feature packed, good quality, cheap
Reviews.Author: Edward Barnett
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a second TV, for the family room / play room.  I selected this model based on the Amazon reviews, then bounced over to Conzumer Reportz and found that it was one of the top rated models in this size.  Based on my first week's use, I have to agree with both the Amazon and CR reviewers.  The TV is super light weight, and therefore a breeze to mount on a wall (it also comes with a plastic "foot" that lets you set it on a cabinet or table if you want).  Setup was very simple -- it connected to my router through the built-in WiFi connection, and registering the TV to my online media accounts (e.g., Amazon Prime for TV/movies) took a matter of seconds.  The picture quality is very good -- better than I expected for this price.  The sound is OK -- good for a second TV, but if I planned to watch a lot of movies on this set I'd probably hook it up to better speakers.  The web content apps (Amazon Prime, YouTube, Netflix, etc.) work well and easily, but the load times are significantly slower than on my PC, and typing on the on-screen soft keyboard is slow.  The TV does not have a general purpose browser, so you're limited to the apps Vizio supports.  The Sony Blu-ray player I hooked up the Vizio TV has a browser, so the lack of a browser in the TV set itself wasn't a big deal for me, but I wish it were clearer in the product description (references to Internet and WiFi led me to assume I could get onto the Internet from the TV).Bottom line:  A very good quality picture, OK sound, with built-in wifi and easy-to-use apps, all for around two fifty make this an exceptional value.  An excellent choice in this size class.

Reviews.Title: Bad Chip in a large batch of these TV, great customer service
Reviews.Author: ctb
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV on Black Friday, Nov 2012, at Wal Mart. On 7/05/2013 the TV screen went black, no display.  Called Vizio customer service and they will send out a replacement within a week.  They will setup and take bad tv back.  Customer service explained a large batch of these TVs were put out with bad chips.  These chips would go out after approx 500 hours of use.  I gave them my SN and it was in their list of bad chip TVs.  So, if you buy, call Vizio to determine if you have one of these TVs.  They will gladly replace.  I'm using my 55 Vizio LCD in the meantime (never any issues).

Reviews.Title: Solid, Low-Cost TV
Reviews.Author: Craig B. Kaminsky "ImageAid"
Reviews.Content: This is a nice Television. The built-in apps are handy for me since I use Netflix, Hulu Plus and Amazon. This allowed me to move a DVD/Blue-Ray player to another television and free up space around this TV, which was in a more crowded spot.It's nice looking, and I particularly like how the stand is constructed.My only complaint, thus far, is that the volume/speakers is mediocre at best. As with many of these low-cost TVs, sound quality is at a minimum.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely worth every inch, er penny!
Reviews.Author: Philip S. Talpers
Reviews.Content: I have two 55 inch TV's, one a TCL and the other LG and while they are also both fantastic sets, this one far beats it obviously on size but the picture is simply amazing.  It was effortless to get on WiFi and I can not rave enough about the value and the picture.  I didn't think Vizio could deliver such an amazing product but they did! .. If you want a 70", the price is right and you will not be dissapointed .. I sure wasn't!

Reviews.Title: Very happy with this TV
Reviews.Author: Wilson
Reviews.Content: I chose this unit over slightly larger and slightly cheaper Samsung models because it has a 120Hz refresh rate and seemed like the most appealing option in my $400 range. I wasn't expecting to use any of the built in apps but I decided to signup for a Netflix free trial because it was so convenient (it has its own button on the remote! Along with Amazon Instant Video and M-GO.)

Reviews.Title: Nice and big
Reviews.Author: George Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: Unit works as advertised. It has a good picture.  We had a problem with the delivery but the Amazon large purchase department took care of all issues.  For the last year i have not shopped at bestbuy and will keep shopping at Amazon.  I love Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Great picture...
Reviews.Author: Ken L. Barber
Reviews.Content: I've only had the TV for two (2) months & I'm very pleased. It replaced a Mitzibishi 65". It connected to my Wi-Fi very easy.The remote control could have been a little b etter designed, but don't let that stop you from purchasing this TV if you can get it at a good price...Ken

Reviews.Title: nice flat screen
Reviews.Author: Serafin D. Arce
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty good flat screen for the money.  I have two complaints.  The picture is not bright enough to avoid distortion from the glare coming in from the windows.  The sound quality leaves a lot to be desired but since I have it hooked up to my amplifier it is o.k.

Reviews.Title: Quick set-up
Reviews.Author: Randall Laws
Reviews.Content: Worked as advertised right out of the box.  I was amazed with how light it is.  I'm using it mainly as a second computer monitor connected to a laptop, and so far everything is working great.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: William Tucker
Reviews.Content: I am extremely pleased with this product. It was delivered as expected in perfect order. I have no negative issues, and will most likely order another, maybe larger!

Reviews.Title: Great deal on an AWESOME LED
Reviews.Author: A. Saunders "als10point"
Reviews.Content: Excellent picture and a breeze to set up!  Replaced an older Samsung 42" plasma and, wow, what a difference in picture quality!

Reviews.Title: Awsome picture! I
Reviews.Author: jeffrey p. kidd
Reviews.Content: I just watched OZ the Powerful & It looked like it was 3D. Setup was a breeze. You can't find a better TV for the money.

Reviews.Title: It seems ok, but it's not what I was hoping for.
Reviews.Author: BobbyB
Reviews.Content: The one thing that pushes me to say I don't like this unit is that it emits (intermittently, but at least as, if not more often, than not) an extremely high pitched tone that emerges, especially when the volume is pushed up due to low volume levels on the program I am watching.  It's way up there, maybe in the 10-12Khz range.  I don't know why it's there, and I've considered using the square trade protection plan to see if someone will come here to fix it.  I'm not going to bother shipping it anywhere.There is also another factor I'm none too crazy about; but this isn't specific to the unit, itself, rather to all new 16:9 aspect ratio televisions.  If something is in the old 4:3 aspect ratio, it looks fine on this (or any 16:9) screen, because it fills the screen from top to bottom, and, obviously, goes only as wide as 4/3rds of the height.  But very few things are displayed anymore in the old aspect ratio, except for commercials.  Almost everything is in a new aspect ratio that is NOT proportional to screen size.  This new format seems to be some sort of hybrid meant to work, more or less, with both aspect ratios.If you zoom in, you get full width, but part of the top and bottom of the picture is cropped off.  This is usually (but not always) ok for viewing.  But if you are zoomed and using the menu of your cable box to see what else is on, the very bottom of the screen (for my CSP) shows the date; and that date is gone.  Zooming can also be a problem with subtitles.  The date is always cut off, and  subtitles are often cropped too when zoomed, forcing a change in aspect ratio to normal, which then reduces the size of the image on screen with a lot of wasted space on the sides, and a bit less waste at the top and bottom.  That is an annoyance.  But, as stated, this is by no means a problem unique to this particular unit.I'll be replacing this 32" unit with a 3rd (38.5"--"39," nominal) HDTV, and relegating this unit to my spare bedroom, where it will rarely be watched or heard at all; and, if/when it is watched, it will be from much closer so that the smaller picture won't matter nearly as much.  I'm also replacing a 37" unit, from another manufacturer, in my living room that's not quite 2 years old, because of this aspect ratio problem.  Both of these units will be a bit larger (wider) than I'd like, but they will fit in the areas I have available for them and should solve the screen Image-size problem.I was going to go with another Vizio (so I don't dislike the brand), but I was unable to find a single Vizio that has two inputs for older styles of video equipment, Component AND AV.  That led me to go with 41.9" (42," nominal) unit from the same manufacturer as the 37" unit I'm replacing, because that one does have TWO inputs for things that aren't HD.How much could it cost per unit to include two of the old style inputs, instead of just one?  I have old VCRs, a DVD Player and a Blue Ray player hooked up to the 37" unit.  All I'll have to do is unplug everything from the 37" T.V. and plug it all back into the new 42" T.V.  Nothing needs to change in terms of how it's plugged into my home entertainment amplifier.In both cases (the 37" and the 32" HDTVs) I was replacing old 4:3 aspect ratio T.V.s.  Two years ago I was replacing a 3:4 27" with the 37" HD; and, a few months ago I replaced 3:4 25" with the 32" HD.  One thing you never see in the stores where they try to sell you these new things, is a smaller picture framed by black.  But that's what you get with these new T.V.s and that "hybrid" format--unless you zoom in, which is by no means without its problems.Go with at least a 37" to replace an old 3:4 25" T.V.  I went with a 38.5" Vizio to replace the 32," because the newest, sleekest designs by Vizio seem to weigh less than comparably priced T.V.s by competitors and have a narrower width, overall, because there is only a very narrow frame around the screen.
