We have a wireless LAN in the house and the TV connects easily and streams 98% of the time with no hesitation or lag.  We really enjoy watching our favorite shows via Neflix streaming or Hulu Plus, with few or no commercials for a minor additional cost!  Much more bang for your buck this way vs. cable.

Reviews.Title: Wonerful tv
Reviews.Author: Andrew J Peaden
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful tv.  It has a clear picture and is easy to use.  I would recommend to any one looking for a 60" TV.

Reviews.Title: Welcome to the age of Home Theatre for all of us!!
Reviews.Author: Lee Valesquez
Reviews.Content: More than likely CNET or Consumer Reports will say that some other 60-inch flat screen out there has a technically "better" image quality than this Vizio (perhaps for reasons that the majority of us normal folks cannot see or do not care about).  I think the picture is superb, bright, sharp, fast resolution (no artifacts or trailing).  Most importantly, and this is what's really the most amazing fact of all: this home theatre-sized flatscreen is currently priced at less than $1,000.  Considering how much time most Americans spend watching TV nowadays, it would seem like this is as important of a home appliance to buy as say a refrigerator, washer-dryer or other $1,000+ priced home appliances.  Do you want to be the only loser left with a tiny flat screen (or, God forbid, one of those Grandpa-style square tube TV's??).  Get with the times, dude, and get yourself a frickin' huge window to the world!

Reviews.Title: My husband is in Heaven!
Reviews.Author: shelly Rios
Reviews.Content: My husband loves this TV! It is $20 cheaper at Costco, but  worth it if you don't want to deal with getting into your car. We have it mounted on the wall, which makes it a little difficult to get to the HDMI plugs, but other than that, we are very satisfied!

Reviews.Title: Technical Problems
Reviews.Author: R. Cummings "reycumm"
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I have been experiencing problems with my TV. It locks while streaming. Then it won't turn off for 15 minutes. When it does it makes a loud popping sound. We are reaching out to Vizio Tech Services. What a let down.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO E320i-AO 32-inch LED Smart TV
Reviews.Author: R. King
Reviews.Content: Great color,easy to set-up,just the right size for an small bedroom.Can go right to netflix and Amazon with the remote.Only negative comment is the buttons on the remote are very close togeather,could be improved.

Reviews.Title: defect with the audio sync
Reviews.Author: Albert J. Angelo
Reviews.Content: I have been in contact with representative's from Vizio for over a week, because of a product defect. Still waiting to see what is going to be done about it.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding TV
Reviews.Author: JOHN W. BLEICH
Reviews.Content: Bought the smart tv and glad I did. I am very impressed with how easy everything was to set up and how quickly it found my wifi. The picture is excellent and I'm quite pleased with everything overall.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Donald Greenwell "Red Bandit"
Reviews.Content: It has good color, you have to set the settings yourself to get the best picture or sound it is a great tv

Reviews.Title: A decent LED HDTV... for the price.
Reviews.Author: J. Corso
Reviews.Content: When Vizio announced they were releasing $999 (60") and $1999 (70") LED HDTVs, I'll admit I was excited. I've owned Vizio LCDs in the past and typically was impressed with the picture for the price. So when the 60" became available, I immediately purchased it. Out of the box, I thought it was OK. The picture quality was decent (not spectacular), the WiFi wouldn't stay connected to my network, and the application menu seemed dated and slow. I ended up returning it, disappointed.Fast forward a few weeks to Black Friday... when this TV became available for $688 at WalMart, Amazon, and other big box stores. For that kind of deal, I thought it was much more appropriately priced - so I purchased it again, at $688. Out of the box, the TV had 2 lines through the screen, again disappointed - I called Vizio and their customer service was actually great. They promptly sent me a replacement unit (brand new, not refurb) within a week.The new replacement they sent has been great, the WiFi connects perfectly and no screen issues. Overall, for the price ($688)... I really can't complain. Don't expect top of the line Samsung picture (D8000, ES8000), but more in the 6000-7000 Samsung model range. I've owned many LED TVs over the years, and I can say that for this is one of the best purchases you can make if you can find the lower price. So why the 3 stars? Be prepared for potential issues; lines through your LCD panel, WiFi not connecting, it seems Vizio may have rushed these out of their factory in time for Christmas without properly completing quality checks.Is it the best TV Vizio has made? Absolutely not - but again, for the price... it's tough to argue.

Reviews.Title: Great so far, time will tell...
Reviews.Author: skydiver30960
Reviews.Content: Only been up and running for about two weeks. So far, no problems, everything seems as advertised. Very much a fan of the Netflix and Amazon instant video apps.WRT delivery: I was originally told delivery would be delayed, and that I should email to set a new delivery time. I never received word back, and then the delivery arrived at the originally scheduled time. I'm glad we didn't change our plans after the original email. Upon delivery, the delivery person tried to convince my wife he wasn't required to set up and test the TV, just to drop it off. Fortunately, I had printed out the page on Amazon that explains what to expect on delivery. Once my wife called him on it, he did set up the TV and make sure it worked before leaving.

Reviews.Title: This is really a great TV
Reviews.Author: jpogar
Reviews.Content: Lot's of other positive reviews on this Television here.  I'm very pleased in every aspect of this TV for the price and in comparison to other brands of the same size.  They only minor complaint, if I had one, is the time it takes to turn on.  It's about 20-30 seconds to turn on after pushing the power button.  At first, wasn't sure if the TV was coming on, but now were used to it.  Great value, great TV, just give it a few seconds to warm up.

Reviews.Title: GREAT FOR MONEY
Reviews.Author: Jill Brady
Reviews.Content: GOOD PIC  SLIM DESIGN  AND BEST PART IS THE FRAME IS NOT 2INCHES ALL AROUND  1/2 INCH  SO ITS ALL SCREEN

Reviews.Title: Best TV and TV buying experience ever!
Reviews.Author: Joseph St. Pierre
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV following advise from a friend.  It was the first time buying a TV on line.  Experience was outstanding, TV was delivered and tested upon delivery as advertised.  The picture is the best of any TV I have owned/seen.  Push button NETFLIX feature is awesome.  Best purchase I made in 2012!

Reviews.Title: VIZIO E320i-A0 32-inch 720p 60Hz LED Smart HDTV
Reviews.Author: Frank B
Reviews.Content: Look at many TV's. I liked this one for the features compared to price. Only downside so far is can't get many channels without a cable box from Comcast. Otherwise need an antenna. TV Setup and use are easy. THe picture quality is excellent.

Reviews.Title: Luv the remote
Reviews.Author: Mary107
Reviews.Content: A nice size smart TV for our bedroom. Luv the netflix button right on the remote. A little slow on start up but understandable as it has to link to the wireless. The TV is clear and a quick response in loading my Queue.

Reviews.Title: Great Budget-Oriented 60" TV
Reviews.Author: D. Davidson
Reviews.Content: I'm pretty happy with this purchase.  I had some reservations but for the price this thing cannot currently be beat.The Good:- Obviously 60" is a huge selling point at this price.- Picture quality is as good as I had hoped.  With quality source material this thing looks really sharp.- I was worried about the sound quality (since I currently don't have my home theater setup set up) but it's actually about as good as you can expect from an LCD TV this thin.- This thing really is thin and the bezel is slim as well.  It's also pretty light for the size.- The packaging was well-done and the stand was easy to install.- Wifi works well and I have streamed a ton of content so far with zero buffering issues.The Bad:- It really does take a while for this thing to boot up.  Not a huge deal but it can be slightly annoying.- The apps are totally functional but not exactly state-of-the art in terms of their UI and they can be slightly sluggish.- No 3D support (which isn't a huge factor for me but might deter some).Apps:- Amazon app is great but only 720p.  There is also a frustrating thing where, when navigating, the app remains in the side-bar and it would be nice if you could navigate titles full-screen (like the Vudu app allows you to do).- Hulu works really well and the shows look great (though again they are only 720p).  The interface is nice as well and it's easy to load up your queue on your computer then burn through it on your TV.- Vudu is awesome.  The interface is actually pretty polished and you can browse titles full-screen which is nice.  Vudu HDX mode is 1080p and is noticeably better than Amazon's HD content (I bought the same show and compared them back to back).  The only downside is: HDX generally costs more.  I have a lot of content already in my Amazon library so I am pretty invested in the Amazon ecosystem and will not be making the switch.  However, for rentals, HDX is awesome.  A final note on Vudu: it is owned by Wal-Mart which might be a consideration for some.- YouTube looks pretty shockingly good on the YouTube app.  The YouTube app's interface is also pretty usable and it's generally speaking pretty easy to find the content you're looking for.- The other apps I found to be mostly useless.  I don't need to browse FaceBook, listen to internet radio, or check the weather on my TV (since I have other devices that are better-suited for these tasks).  I know everybody has different needs so these features could be important to you.Basically, if you are on a budget and want a huge screen that looks great with built-in wifi and apps this thing is pretty tough to beat.  If you care about 3D but want to stay within this budget you might want to sacrifice screen size and go with a smaller 3D TV.

Reviews.Title: Greatest deal ever
Reviews.Author: Marc Fisher
Reviews.Content: I was allowed to purchase a 50 inch tv but had to stick within a budget. I found this tv on amazon and waited for a long time for it to come in stock so i could purchase it.I am not disappointed at all. The tv is easy to use, great picture and the 120hz is a rare find in this price. The tv looks great due to its thin bezel. I also wanted a tv that gets amazon instant since i am a prime member. This tv works very well and I like that the show stays on while i browse amazon titles.I could not be happier with this tv- unless my wife lets me buy the 60 inch version!!!The only downside is that i have a lot of videos in my amazon watchlist and this tv does not show the watchlist when i connect to amazon. Maybe that'll be fixed in an update.Great tv. Vizio has really come through with a great tv.***update 01/07/13*** Shortly after setting the tv up my wife began to complain the tv had an odor to it. I noticed after a little bit that the tv had an electrical, plastic smell. We contacted customer service through vizio and they were great to work with. Vizio will be replacing our tv. Hopefully that one wont smell because my wife and i really like this tv.

Reviews.Title: best television i've ever seen
Reviews.Author: Patricia Grindberg
Reviews.Content: i love all the features. of this tv.. including the internet feature.. it's everything i was expecting and more.  couldn't ask for a better television.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: B. Lai
Reviews.Content: I'm not a TV expert, but this TV works great for me.  I have had 2 Vizios already and both are great.  They work better than the Samsung TV that I used to have, which broke down in less than 2 years.  My first Vizio is a 42" that is still working after 6 years and the picture quality is still amazing.  This Vizio TV is even more impressive, and the price is unbeatable.  I would choose Vizio over Samsung anytime, based on quality, price, and durability.

Reviews.Title: 60" TV
Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: The picture is outstanding. Having the internet intergrated with the tv is a very nice feature. Anyone looking for this size tv should consider this product.

Reviews.Title: I found it and more!
Reviews.Author: Mo
Reviews.Content: I've been looking for a nice TV for a cheep price for about 5 years now. I just wanted a TV that was around 50", LCD, 1080p and 120hz for less than $600-$700 or cheaper. I found it and more! This TV was bigger than what I was looking for. It is LED, 1080p and 120hz. 4 HDMI hook ups. It has all of the Internet apps which was a bouns I didn't care about those. And I was able to get it all for a really good deal on Black Friday. I paid less then the $999.99 but after getting the TV, I would pay that now. It's picture is amazing. The sound is great. I can see the picture from all angles. It is easy to use. Buy this TV if you can. I've only had it a month but so far so good. The only thing I've had an issue with was the remote. The one in the box was defective.It worked for about an hour to get the TV setup then quite. I called in to the support line and they ran through some trouble shooting and sent me a new remote. It was all very simple. My only other issue with remote is that it is not a programable remote. I can't run my cable box and DVD player. Why a TV remote wouldn't be programbable I think is stupid. Having to buy VIZIO's universal remote is just them being greedy. Otherwise I LOVE THIS TV!

Reviews.Title: Nice product for the money
Reviews.Author: ABK
Reviews.Content: VIZIO E320i-A0 32-inch 720p 60Hz LED Smart HDTV is worth the money so fardisplay is ok and sound not so

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: william carpenter jr
Reviews.Content: Just as advertised Crisp clear picture. Easy to setup. Speakers not the best there is but I have SRS so sounds great now. I could not ask for more!

Reviews.Title: A Great picture
Reviews.Author: Reviewer LTL
Reviews.Content: A great picture....and extremely easy set up....particularly using HDMI cable....one cable makes it so much easier...and less tangles to contend with also.Thus far the only problem I have experienced is the audio not timed in perfectly with the lips moving....and, only on certain HD channels.  I understand there is an adjustment in the menu features that can fix this problem so wil be doing that soon.All in all we are very impressed....I'd do it again!

Reviews.Title: Great Economical TV
Reviews.Author: R. Hickox
Reviews.Content: Purchased for guest bedroom.  Works and looks great.  Easy step-by-step internet TV setup once connected to internet.  I had originally used the built in wifi to connect to my wireless router that was 60 ft. away through 5-walls into my office where the router is.  Although this worked and I was able to make an internet connection, the playback of on-line video from Netflix, Amazon, and HULU was slow and caused pauses in playback.  Once I hooked up to my available wired coax cable already in this room from my router, all internet video playback became normal.  I don't blame the built in wifi.  I think the distance and number of walls the signal had to travel though from my wireless router was the issue in my case.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: M De Lara "Music Lover"
Reviews.Content: This replaced a major namebrand DLP 61" HDTV that we've only had for 6 years before the power supply (we think) went out. To replace that would cost more than half of what this new TV cost.  This LCD is much more crisper, less expensive and lighter and more streamlined than the DLP.  It's also a ""smart tv with wifi".  I would say....just do yourself a favor already and buy this.  You won't regret it.  The seller was awesome also!  I requested a specific delivery date and they delivered on time.

Reviews.Title: Nice Addition to our Family Room
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: We have really enjoyed this HDTV.  It is perfect for areas where you need a low profile on the wall, as it is only 1" thick.  The picture is great and works well with our Sony receiver.  The only negative we have noticed is the TV takes a while to come on, or recognize components when switching.  Good value.

Reviews.Title: Good picture for price
Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV to replace a 6 year old 20" Magnavox in the bedroom that was on its last leg. My first surprise was that this TV was noticeably lighter than the smaller unit it was replacing. Very nice. Mounting and connection was straight forward and hassle free,although it might be a pain to get it hung on the wall if I were trying to do it alone,but that is true of all TV's this size. Picture is as good as the Samsung that resides in the living room,so no complaints on that front. I would rate the sound of the unit as acceptable,especially for a bedroom application. Not all is rosy however. On two separate occasions,I have turned it on and the sound has been absent. Both times turning it off and back on has solved the problem,and I'm hoping it doesn't become a frequent occurrence. Now on to the biggest problem that I'm having with the unit. Netflix! The TV only connects to Netflix every 10th attempt or so. I've tried every fix recommended on the Internet to no avail. I've even tried connecting via Ethernet cable,but the result was the same. It should be mentioned that the TV has no problem connecting to wifi,I just tried the cable out of desperation. We use Netflix via the Wii in another room without issue,so the problem definitely lies with the TV. Hulu+ also refused to connect the one time that I tried it,but we don't use that service,so I've not experimented farther with that one. All of the other apps seem to work well. I enjoy watching full size HD YouTube videos. All in all I'm happy with the unit for the price paid($299) and would recommend it for regular TV viewing. The "smart" features of the unit could use a little work. If that was sorted out,I would give it 5 stars. As it stands,4 is the best I can give.

Reviews.Title: Vizio E60i1-a3 60-inch tv
Reviews.Author: Bill Garsee
Reviews.Content: The product exceeded all our expectations' great features' great picture' love it and would recomend it to any wanting a new tv

Reviews.Title: Big tv
Reviews.Author: Amfair856
Reviews.Content: It's nice but don't like how slow it comes on other then that love it and would tell a friend about it hope they will get one to

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the money.
Reviews.Author: Christopher Brown
Reviews.Content: Great picture and amazing contrast.  The only problem I noticed is that the speakers were facing out of the rear of the set. This results in weird reflection of certain sounds.  I would definitely recommend a sound system or soundbar. Other than that I love the television.  Great pucture and sleak design. This is my second Vizio and I like it.

Reviews.Title: big and nice
Reviews.Author: Y LAM
Reviews.Content: For $999 (12/15/2012), you get a 60 inches flat screen TV. It is still a great deal, if you didn't score one from blackfriday deal.Vizio is not as famous as other Korean or Japanese brand, but it is as good as you can get for this type of TV.Remote feel comfortable and compact despite of its double sides. I was bit worry at the beginning, but this worry went away right after i hold it for few seconds.Some cons:TV start up time is slow, like 10 seconds.Smart apps is bit slow for my taste. But I bought this TV for its size not for the apps. I have other streaming device for that purpose.Factory pre-set default picture setting is not good, you almost for sure need to tune it. See Cnet review for calibration suggestion.WiFi reception seems week.My first unit from Amazon has a very bad blacklight leak on top edge, amazon exchange it for another set which has none of the problem. They shipped a new one and picked up the old one free of charge and get it done within a week, truly amazing and save me lot of hassle. Buying big screen TV from amazon is actually now a benefit not a burden.

Reviews.Title: Best TV for the price!
Reviews.Author: G. Boettecher
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV on Black Friday 2012 and am still ecstatic about it! I am the type who never reviews products either. The picture is amazing and for the $999 price it just can't be beat. I upgraded from an LG 50'' 720p plasma I bought 4 years ago for the same price. Let me tell you the picture quality between the 2 are night and day!! The Vizio blows the other HDTV out of the water I wanted a great picture without spending the $400+ for a 3D capable TV. I now many people who went that route and have only used the 3D feature a handful of times. I used the Cheetah flush mount system and with how thin this tv is it looks great against in my living room. The built in apps for YouTube and Netflix are great and the smart remote makes it very easy to navigate. **The one issue I have is lip syncing between the picture and sound. There is an option in the menu to calibrate this but does not work that well. I find that changing the channel and changing back usually corrects the issue.**

Reviews.Title: Havent seen better
Reviews.Author: Larry Carothers
Reviews.Content: Big and beautiful. Great resolution. Top of technology. Colors are realistic. Easy to use. Amazing how thin and lightweight it is, A sound bar is a must in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Best tv I've ever owned!
Reviews.Author: Terry L Rhea
Reviews.Content: I checked out a LOT of tv's but this tv offers the most features and best picture for the price range......You would have to be insane to go with another tv that doesn't have all these features......the picture is flawless, bright, vivid and breathtaking, especially when watching blu ray.....i just find myself more enthralled with the actual picture quality then the movie itself at times lol. definitely worth the money!!

Reviews.Title: Nice Unit
Reviews.Author: arcelton
Reviews.Content: Just got this TV last week and have it mounted and running.  The picture is outstanding and I have not found any major issues.  The remote seems to test my patience though, not always working on the first or second try. I bought a Cheetah mount and found that there is only 1 position that works with it and this TV.  If you have a limited space to put this in, be sure to carefully measure before putting the mount up.

Reviews.Title: Great Quality, good price
Reviews.Author: Longhorn
Reviews.Content: I'm just a few weeks into my new purchase, but so far this TV is great.  The picture quality is very clear, and the built-in WiFi allows for quick and easy access to Amazon Instant Video and Netflix. I would recommend buying this TV.

Reviews.Title: Subpar picture and sound is off
Reviews.Author: Dave Knight
Reviews.Content: TV was returned.  For a few hundred dollars more, you can get a TV with much better picture quality. The picture is average at best (colors very dull and not crystal clear like our sony) plus the sound did not match the picture while watching a football game.

Reviews.Title: Unreal
Reviews.Author: DrB
Reviews.Content: I am still in awe of this TV we just installed, even more so knowing that we saved a ton of money on going with this. We had a Vizio TV prior to this, and have been very happy with it, so we weren't too concerned that the quality would be poor. What I was not expecting was that this really seems to have a comparable, if not BETTER, picture to the Sharp 70". The image and colors right out of the box are truly stunning, as is the motion smoothing. I have only been using surround sound, so I can't comment on the built-in sound, but I did set up the Smart TV part of it, and it is very quick and easy to use, with quite a few features.I would say the only con to this TV, which for me really wasn't at all, is that it is not 3D. But again, for this price, there really is no comparison. I HIGHLY recommend this TV!!

Reviews.Title: Far beyond our expectations!
Reviews.Author: Carrie Campbell
Reviews.Content: This was so easy to set up even for us "50" somethings!!! It puts everything on one remote! High quality product and so glad we purchased it.

Reviews.Title: Great Value!  Built in Wifi!  Simple to setup and use.
Reviews.Author: M. Dunning "fedexav8r"
Reviews.Content: Nice picture easy set up and the remote has a Netflix, Hulu and Amazon buttons make it super easy to access these services.  This is my first smart TV (built in wifi).  I bought it to replace our old kitchen TV and the whole family loves it.

Reviews.Title: TV remote, and physical buttons on the TV itself, do not work.
Reviews.Author: Chris S.
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV from Amazon because of the low input lag (I had planned to use it for gaming).  The picture and sound were fine, as was the lag.  I was happy with the TV.But then, after a long gaming session, I tried to adjust the volume.  That's when I discovered that there is an intermittent issue, with a high occurrence rate, in which absolutely no TV settings can be adjusted (this includes volume, power, menu access - literally everything).  The picture and sound will still work when this is happening, but the TV will not respond to ANY input from the user, whether it comes from the remote or the physical buttons on the TV.  I'm not talking about gaming here, just to clarify - I'm talking about the TV settings.  You seriously can't even turn the set off unless you physically unplug it.I contacted Amazon's tech support (you get it free for 30 days with this set) and, after an exhaustive call, the representative agreed that there was a hardware issue with the TV.  She told me what my options were at that point, and I decided to get a replacement set after she assured me that the rest of the TVs in stock had been tested and that this wouldn't be a problem with the replacement set.Well, I set up the replacement set today and it does the exact same thing.  To top it all off, both the original set AND the replacement set arrived after my "guaranteed" delivery date (which was not Amazon's fault - it was the courier's - but it is still frustrating).I called customer service about the new one and I am getting a refund.  I'm still a bit upset that I was assured that the new TV wouldn't have this problem (by an Amazon representative), but it did.This whole order has turned into a 3-week long ordeal, and I certainly haven't been compensated for the amount of time I've had to invest in it (setting up the TVs, re-packing them, taking them back to the UPS facility, etc.).  I was given a $30 promotional certificate, which was a nice gesture, but I don't think it makes up for the hassle of having to return two faulty TVs.I would recommend that people stay away from this TV.  There is a very high chance that your set won't function properly, and you'll be rewarded with headaches, headaches, and more headaches.

Reviews.Title: Very disapointing wi-fi
Reviews.Author: k postma
Reviews.Content: I bought this thing because of its wifi. The wifi works very, VERY badly. I have been on the phone with Vizio probably 8 - 12 times the first 12 hours I have had this TV. First solution they came up with was "we'll send a repair guy, he'll be there in 8 - 13 business days". Well that wasn't about to happen for a TV 2 hours in the house. That solution got fixed, but took some talking. The suggestion was made by Vizio why don't you hardwire it instead? Well, if that was an option I would have done it in the first place, and NO, I will not run cabling thru the house to get to my wi-fi TV. This was about par for the course for the rest of my conversations. They come up some nonsense answer, I question them some and low and behold another answer pops up that I should have received in the first place. In the end I got a new firmware downloaded (after 3 phone calls, with 3 different sets of instructions). I still can not get decent Wi-Fi reception, with a decent speed although my laptops and my cell phone have no problem getting enough speed in exactly the same location. If I turn the TV a different way (the way it fits in my cabinet) reception completely disappears, it seems the TV is shielding it from the router. Very disappointing experience. It is going back to Amazon. I hope retuning the TV is not going to cost me an arm and leg.

Reviews.Title: A LOT of BANG for YOUR BUCK!!
Reviews.Author: Big Papi
Reviews.Content: I don't think you can find a better picture for the money. I got free shipping and set up with my order and was very happy that they called to see if they could deliver the TV earlier in the day!! The set up was easy and professional. I really enjoy the bright and clear picture. I have only used the smart options a couple of times since I have a ROKU but when I did it was very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Works as advertised with a few hiccups
Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: The only two things I have complaints about are the wifi connectivity and the remote.  It would be great if the remote had a slide out keyboard or something.  The way you input words into the tv is really unimpressive.  Pretty much the only option is to use the multi directional pad and select each letter one by one.  My sony tv lets you dial in letters with a system that is similar to the way that text messaging works on phones without full qwerty keyboard.  Secondly, sometimes that wifi mysteriously needs to be reconnected through the settings menu.  I also forgot to mention that sometimes it takes more then one click of the remote to power up the tv.  I don't know if that is a problem with my remote or the tv.  Other then that, this tv works as advertised.  I actually have 2 of these so that should tell you that the aforementioned issues that aren't deal breakers.  Great tv overall.

Reviews.Title: THIS SMART TV HAS NETWORKING ISSUES!  DON'T BUY FOR STREAMING!
Reviews.Author: J. Russell Fruhwirth "Russ"
Reviews.Content: TV picture quality is average/normal for these newer HDTV's.  I shelled out $50 extra for this 'smart' version of this TV, and Netflix streaming works only about 15% of the time.  Yes, I've contacted Vizio support, they just had me reset the TV, reboot my router, reconfigure my TV, that's it.  Yes, I have a 40Mb/20Mb very good Internet connection, and a 802.11n home wifi network.  Neither of these are problem, since none of our other devices in the house have any problem streaming from Netflix whatsoever.  As a matter of fact, whenever I have Netflix problems on this Vizio TV, I just plug in my laptop and stream through that without any kind of problem at all.  I'd call Vizio and have them send a replacement, but the truth is that I just don't have the time.  So, just dropped $35 for another Chromecast and we'll call it good.  Cheers!

Reviews.Title: Wireless router must be in the same room as the TV
Reviews.Author: Charles Bogenberger
Reviews.Content: As a disclaimer, I have tested 2 of these TV's and they both have the same problem.  I returned the first one because I assumed it was defective, but after unpacking the second one, it became clear, this is an issue with the TV itself.The WiFi doesn't work if the router isn't in the same room.  I live in a 1 bedroom apartment, so the router is only about 30 feet away from the TV, but still it won't work.  When I put them in the same room, it works fine.  I called tech support and after identifying the problem they told me to contact my internet company.No other device in my house has trouble with the internet.  My laptop, my iPad and my iPhone all connect just fine.  It's only the TV that is unable to receive a signal from 30 feet away.I am returning this TV

Reviews.Title: Bought four sets, no problems
Reviews.Author: Stephen E. Crume
Reviews.Content: This was my first Vizio TV.  I have since bought  three more in various sizes from Amazon.  They are indeed very Smart!

Reviews.Title: Third times HOPEFULLY a charm
Reviews.Author: Heather
Reviews.Content: Bought this tv at a great price back in December 2012.  Since then, when the tv has worked, its been great - but now I'm going to be on my third tv.  In February, the tv went black, fizzed out and that was it.  Called customer service, they were great and set up a replacement tv to be freighted (due to the large size) to me within 2 weeks.  The day that my tv was to be delivered, we got a call that the freight was stolen and they would have to set up another request - therefore ANOTHER 2 weeks.  Frustrating as it was, we dealt with it and had a brand new tv set up a month after the old one died.  Now here I am in August 2013 and the same thing happened to us - the tv fizzed out and died.  So now I am waiting for another tv to be freighted to me in 2 weeks - hopefully this one doesn't get stolen on route.  I told Vizio that the first time I was complacent about the issue, figured these things happen, but now I am pissed.  They replied back this was uncommon, however how does one person get two "lemon" tvs?  I wish I never got a Vizio honestly.  If you're deciding which brand to buy - go for the more expensive brand with a valiant reputation because it is not worth the aggravation!!!!

Reviews.Title: Easy TV for my mom to set up and use with no fuss and all the features
Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: We bought this TV for my mom who has not had a new tv since 1998 or so - she gets VERY frustrated by anything that is new technology and difficult to set up. I was really worried that this TV would scare her off from a flat screen.However, I literally removed this TV from the box for her, added the piece for a stand, and stood it up immediately. It is lightweight and you can set it up anywhere in the house. It was just the right size by about 4 inches that she could fit it in her old TV cabinet from the 1990's! We plugged it in and plugged her cable into it - within 10 mins of downloading channels, we were all watching it. The remote is easy to understand and use - not complicated. Last, but not least, my sister helped her setup the wifi and watch Netflix. She is now officially in 2013 with her smart tv!The price was right through amazon as we chose one that said it had slight cosmetic damage (we could not find it anywhere.) I am considering buying another for myself just to use in the office or kitchen. A+++

Reviews.Title: After a week, still happy
Reviews.Author: J. Swartz
Reviews.Content: Built in wireless access to your router? Kindof has a built in "roku" media box inside of it that handles all the stuff roku does. Picture quality is very good, the remote buttons are small. My only beef is this tv comes with no STAND that holds it up. Its designed with this little plastic piece in the back that keeps it from falling over but because of this the tv is angled slightly up which prevents you from watching it head on. If it had a proper stand like most leds I' give it a 5 star.

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: traveler
Reviews.Content: Works as advertised, senior mother has no problem in using it. Good picture, easy set up, works with my wireless. I would recommended it.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: CAB601
Reviews.Content: TV has a great picture. And the Netflix and Amazon Prime work great. Price was very reasonable. I would recommend this TV to anybody.

Reviews.Title: Worst TV ever for streaming
Reviews.Author: Lucia Fedina
Reviews.Content: The TV has many problems.  First, the connection to Netlix and other streaming sites is extremely poor and works 1 out of 100 times.  The help phone number said there were issues with connection, with Netflix, etc; but our other TV that used Roku did not have any issues at all.  Considering streaming was the primary purpose to purchase this TV, give it 1 star rating

Reviews.Title: Good picture during bright scenes, OK color after calibration
Reviews.Author: brian_in_charlotte "brian_in_charlotte"
Reviews.Content: Out of the box the picture is washed out and colors seem off.  Using the Disney blu-ray calibration disk helped, but colors are still not as rich as other options.  Clarity of picture is excellent during normal or bright scenes.  Has trouble during dark scenes though.  Side viewing is OK, but quickly washes out the colors even more.Audio through built-in speakers is rather weak.It is a good looking TV with very small bezel and slight matte screen (rare these days).Takes 20 seconds to fully turn on which is annoying until you get used to it.Wifi connected quickly and easily, but seems to be limited to about 6 Mbps when my router is sending out 16 Mbps.  Confusingly, running an ethernet cable (Cat 5e or Cat 6 - I tried them both) limits speeds to about 3 Mbps when they should be higher with a direct connection.  A laptop connected to the same cable shows 16 Mbps download speeds.  Either Vizio is throttling the speeds or their internal speed test is off.  Either way, it does take a few seconds before Netflix will buffer enough to be able to show in HD.One annoying thing is the inability to disable unused inputs in the input selection menu.  So if you only have a cable box and DVD player connected, you still have to cycle through 7-8 inputs to switch between the 2 and you can't do this very quickly as it tends to pause at each input.  Not a big deal, but something Vizio could have easily fixed.Rhapsody doesn't work well - from what I hear from Rhapsody this is a problem between Vizio and Rhapsody.  Pandora works just fine, and while it's not included out of the box, it's easily added (for free) from the Vizio app store.For the price I paid, it's a pretty good TV, but if you're looking for rich colors and good black level performance, there are probably better options out there for a couple hundred bucks more.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: LTC
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV to be used as a computer monitor. It surpasses what I was expecting for a monitor as well as an excellent TV.Delivery was before the expected date. I am very pleased with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: TV for Bedroom.
Reviews.Author: Dexter
Reviews.Content: This TV is fantastic! I love the wireless connectivity Netflix and USB capability. I haven't tried the Amazon Video function yet, but I am sure it will work just fine.

Reviews.Title: Loved the picture on first one until it died, loved the second one until it died!
Reviews.Author: Brian Carlo
Reviews.Content: First set up was easy with the channel search, time zone, and other misc programming.  EXCEPT, getting the surround sound to work for my tv input on my yamaha receiver.  I disabled the sound on the tv, but that still didn't solve my problem.  You had to go under some menue heading and change a setting that should not involve not having the tv send sound out to a brand new yamaha receiver.  I only found the solution at av forums.  It was such a pain.Second, the first one died after 94 days.  Black screen of death.  Bought it from costco, only 90 day return on tvs.  The costco csr got the serial number and said just take it back they will instant replace it.  She stated these models have a problem.  Awsome since they have like 30 on the shelf and people are buying them right and left.Third, second tv died 37 days later.  Black screen of death.  Called costco again, oh this serial number is not in the list of defective models, sent me to visio.  Visio csr by the book, no empathy, just read off the screen.  Stated will get new tv 7-10 business days.  I told him that was unacceptable.  He then began reading the delivery and process state by step day by day log on how and why it will take so long.  Informed csr that my yearly bonus was used to buy this tv and its the only one I have.  Csr said will not authorize replacement at costco or other retailer.  Asked the csr how he would like having no tv for about 2 weeks.  Csr didn't even say sorry.  Explained to csr that tv got great reviews until they started failling and that it might take months againt to figure out if my particular serial number is also bad.  Csr didn't even reply.  Informed csr that I will write this review and also on cnet.  Csr didn't say anything.I work in a call center, inbound csr.  I was expecting quality service, especially since thye boost its american tech support.  Csr just read off the screen and the scripting.  No emotion in the job, just another call, showed no empathy.  Never responded to anything I said except to reading the scripting on why it takes 7-10 business days to get a new tv.Because costco has the 90 return period, I returned the tv and got my money back in cash.  I will never buy a visio again.  Sad because the price was good, features nice, and image was 3d like.  Now I have to save up another couple hundred dollars to get the samsung.  Kinda hard to do when you pretty much break even.  Now I am out of a tv for a month or two and out a couple of hundred dollars.

Reviews.Title: CHEAP AND BEST!
Reviews.Author: Daljit Singh
Reviews.Content: What a TV! I love it, it is made so simple, remote control and the options are so easy to maneuver, though holds a BIG punch. Really made well for the price, really well. Only thing I would let all the buyers know is that if you are switching from LCD you might want to go to little bigger size than you think of, All  LED's don't have the edge like older TV's though screen might be what we look for, though tv looks smaller, just fyi.Updated: August 31, 2013: I really love this TV, still going strong and works beautifully. Only regret i have is that i should have bought bigger tv than 47". As these tv's do not have any waste on edges in actual the tv looks smaller. Still 05 stars.

Reviews.Title: Pretty nice but..
Reviews.Author: Tom "Tom"
Reviews.Content: They say it supports DLNA (which it does) and MP4 (which it does) but NOT MP4 over DLNA. Seems like that's a pretty important thing to mention, especially since most of your customers are PROBABLY buying the TV to play media that they've spent a LOT of time converting from some old disc to one of these spiffy codecs.So I get to RE-RIP my DVDs to MPEG. If you're a fan of advanced codecs, make sure you request a list of DLNA supported codecs before ordering. Just sayin'....

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: aspurlock "Angie"
Reviews.Content: This is the best TV I have ever owned. The cost was great and the features are perfect for what I was looking for. It has great sound and picture quality and I love the apps for Netflix and amazon. It took no time to set up and I would deffinately recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Vizio E701i-A3 Buying Experience
Reviews.Author: Arcrider
Reviews.Content: I had a Mitsubishi 65" DLP that I bought in 2006. It was a great TV. But after replacing 2 bulbs I bought on ebay in 3 weeks I figured it was time. So, I did an exhaustive search for a TV that was at least 65" but preferably larger.That's when I stumbled onto this TV.  I bought it for $1699 and it was delivered within 3 days for free as part of prime membership. After 3 hours (had to acclimate) fired it up and great picture, wow. No regrets.  However after 1 week, the price dropped $100.00. I submitted a low price claim and was credited that money. Thanks Amazon. If you are hesitating, don't.

Reviews.Title: An excellent smart TV and it's big!
Reviews.Author: Richard L. Carver
Reviews.Content: I bought the 60 inch version of the set back in October of '12 for 974.00 from Amazon and it's been a great TV so I knew what to expect with the E70. When these sets were introduced I was beginning the 'looking' process to replace both my aging current sets, an 07 47' Toshiba and an 08 65' Olevia. Both worked fine but the new tech had passed them by.My plan was to get a Sharp 70 for the LR and an LG 55 for the BR. In fact I ordered a 70 Sharp from Amazon for 2300 but the seller refused to ship over 500 miles from his place so that deal was backed out, thank god. When these sets were introduced in October I knew I would be buying both the 60 and the 70, even at full retail the combined price of these sets was about what a high end 55 would cost less than a year ago, amazing.I bought the E70 in January from Amazon for 1599.00  and found it to be operationally identical to the E60. The key to these sets is spending the time to dial in the picture to your satisfaction. They are capable of amazing color and clarity especially for sets at this price point. There are giant threads for both these sets at avsforum.com. All the inside information you will ever need and many people have listed their picture settings for others to try out.My only requirement for a television is that it have a great picture. I don't care what a blank screen looks like, I don't obsess over clouds and flashlights and all the other 'flaws' some of the geeks torture themselves with, simply not important to me. I spend very little time looking at a blank screen.There were some early production problems with the E60, not so many with the E70 and the current production on both sets seems superb. Vizio has stood by their products, they gave me a two year replacement warranty on my E60 because it was in the serial range that had some problems so if my panel fails in the next two year Vizio will ship me a new set for free. That's customer service, I've become a real Vizio fan.Seriously, I can recommend these sets to anyone. Big changes are coming in displays with OLED and 4k just around the corner and these big, bright, inexpensive sets make superb interim TVs while waiting for the new tech to come down in price.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I needed
Reviews.Author: Saida
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV couple weeks ago, it arrive within 2 days as expected, it was very easy to hook up. Easy directions. I didn't have Youtube feature on there first 12 hours, called customer service they were very helpful and told me it would update slowly the longer it was connected to the internet, As soon as I got of the phone Youtube was on as well as all other apps. The sound is absolutely perfect I thought I would need the sound bar, but I was very happy with the audio. The remote could be a little bit more advanced, but I can't complain it's easy for the kids to use. I would recommend this TV

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: TJH "TJH"
Reviews.Content: Great picture, good sound, easy to set up.  The only issue that I have with this TV is that when you first turn on the power, it seems to take about 20 seconds to come to life.  This seems slow, but you get used to it very quickly.  If I needed another TV, I would buy another one of these.

Reviews.Title: Hveto diagree with oter reviewers
Reviews.Author: Sean "Sean"
Reviews.Content: I just go this TV and I too had trouble setting it up. I called the support number in th quick setup guide and was able to set it up and achieve the picture I expected. Love the internet WiFI feature. The alphabet input is annoying I agree but not impossible to negotiate...having the usb connect certainly is a way to improve it. For the price - $499 @ Costco w/ 2 yr warranty and $29 to add 3 more years w/ ability to exchange for replacement is a good deal for the product. Most Smart TVs are running 800 to over 1000. I'll update if things change.

Reviews.Title: Vizio E320i-A0 32-inch
Reviews.Author: Lori
Reviews.Content: This TV is really cool!! i've owned it for about a month now and havnt had any issues.the wi-fi lagged a bit but, i'm sure it's not the TV and more so my router trying to handle too much going on in my household with my son's gaming, the wireless computer going and streaming movies on the TV so, i bought a cable and clipped in direct to the router..perfection.the picture on this Vizio is beautiful, clear and colorful, the sound is decent/clear no issues there.i love that the internet apps are built right in...one click on the remote and you can get to many, many dif. apps. too many to list.my only issue is the remote control. it's small and hard to read but, i've got the feel of it enough now...you know that you goes. ' gets to the point where you dont have to look at the remote to know what button to press...the set up out of the box was a snap..had it out of the box and turned on in under 15 min.anyway, i love the TV and would buy again and recommend without hesitation

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: Caleb
Reviews.Content: This tv is amazing!  The quality of the picture is fantastic and although people complain about the remote... I like the simplistic design of it.  The sound also quite nice giving the low price of this tv.  When browsing through internet apps it is sometimes a little slow to respond but I would assume it only has a processor that is required, not comparable to a computer or gaming system.  The set up for this device was very easy, 7 screws and you are up and running.  Also, with the thin edge, it actually makes the screen size a little larger.  There are four hdmi inputs on the side and a composite towards the bottom of the tv.  In my opinion, this is a good layout because of how few devices use composite cables anymore.The only issue I have had is my device is taking some time for the firmware to update.  If you have issues with netflix (shows not playing) check your firmware version at the help menu and system settings.  I think the most current is 3.x, but when mine arrived it was only on 2.35.x.  As long as this automatic firmware update works correctly, I am more than happy with this tv.  And if it doesn't, vizio's support plus amazon's return policy... Still a good purchase.Oh, and shipping on this item was excellent.  I know some people are concerned buying electronics online because they may be tossed around or the box looks rough... That is not the case at all with amazon.  Mine was shipped in less than 24 hours (paid 8.99 for Saturday shipping) with a box in perfect condition by FedEx.

Reviews.Title: BSOD (black screen of death) on Super bowl Sunday
Reviews.Author: MDG
Reviews.Content: Purchased tv on Black Friday 2012 at Walmart. Excellent tv for the price while it worked. Failed on Feb 3rd 2013 9:30pm EST!--BSOD. Picture went out,sound still heard. Turned off set,unplugged for 30 min.; restarted tv. Still no picture not even the Vizio emblem that appears on screen when the tv is first turned on. It appears this problem is becomming common on this model as these sets age. -check the internet. Luckily for me mine still falls under Walmarts 90 Day exchange or money back warranty and the set will be taken back today. Set was used approx. 6 hrs a day. First 2 numbers in serial number are 41  Good Luck

Reviews.Title: Very Impressed
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with this TV. It is very easy to set up, great picture, and the sound is very loud.

Reviews.Title: Downstairs TV replacement used for sports and some movies
Reviews.Author: Ralph M Hawk
Reviews.Content: After getting a professional install of entire entertainment system the tv WORKS FINE - except: I know it is high def., however the screen is a little to bright - football fields look almost like being covered with a light snow.I haven't had a chance yet to determine if there is an adjustment. WE use DirecTV for viewing and this TV is much less natural in color than our other two (one being a 46" Panasonic).Otherwise it performs well, especially using our SOUND system ( TV s is to high pitched).

Reviews.Title: Awsome!
Reviews.Author: bob curtis
Reviews.Content: Very clear picturee! Couldnt ask for more! Only way to go! Researched all brands, this is the best for money!

Reviews.Title: Extremely Impressed!
Reviews.Author: Nicole M Bolin
Reviews.Content: I got this TV from Walmart...waited 4 hours on Black Friday for it and got it for $688.00. This was not the original TV I was going for. I originally was gonna go for a 50" Samsung which going for the same price because I have always stuck with Samsung as I have always had good quality stuff from them, and I was not familiar with the Vizio brand. My husband talked me into changing my mind and I COULD NOT BE HAPPIER!! I am soo very impressed with this TV! It's only about an inch and a half thick so it takes up very little room, and the picture on this TV in mindblowingly awesome!! Everything from HDTV, to HD DVD's, to Video games, just look so very clear and detailed on the TV I almost can't beleive it! The smart capabilities were very user friendly and work very well. We can do so many things with it we couldn't do with a reguler TV. For a TV that is lower priced than other TV's sold in the same category (which I assumed would mean it was cheaper in quality, of which I was very mistaken)it is excellent quality and value! I will definately reccommend this TV to others!!

Reviews.Title: This TV is GREAT!!!!! LOVE IT!!!!
Reviews.Author: Jenice R.
Reviews.Content: I just got this TV on the 29th of November it's a great TV the picture and sound its great quality love it..... I can watch Hulu and Netflix on it Great TV Great Price......  I would recomend it to anyone.  My husband and I are enjoying it. :-)

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Mister S.
Reviews.Content: This is a must have TV if you want to watch Netflix or some other on-line service without having to connect some other device to you TV. Picture, sound, apps, are all awesome!Down with Sony!!!!

Reviews.Title: Grabbed this on BF; best bang for your buck
Reviews.Author: Bruce
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to pick this up for $688 at walmart, but make no mistake, this TV is most certainly worth the $1k price tag.  The picture is sharp and can rival most 60" class TVs, blacks leave something to be desired, but that is to be expected.  You are going to need a sound bar/sound system as it does sound tinny, but for me a TV is entirely for the picture anyway.  Haven't delved too far into the smart apps yet, though setting up wifi was a breeze and netflix works like a charm.  To be honest I'm still in shock I snagged this for such a good price.  Gigantic, beautiful TV for an amazing price; I'd recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Vizio 1080p 120Hz Smooth Motion LED Smart TV E601i-A3
Reviews.Author: WhoMe
Reviews.Content: Pros:  Wow..sets up super easy.  Connects like "right now" to WiFi.  Netflix WiFi interface is EXCELLENT.  Sound is really good on the wall mount.  I do have a JBL soundbar with woofer connected also.  Only use it for movies etc.  Day to day the built in speakers work well.  I highly recommend it.Cons:  This set replaced a Samsung 46" LCD/LED.  The picture is excellent but not quite up to the visual acuity of the 46" Samsung..  However, it is 14" larger so it is quite a task to keep up with the resolution on the much larger screen.  BUT, it still looks really, really good. At $500 to $1000 less than the competition...this set rocks.  I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Vizio E601i-A3
Reviews.Author: Esteban Gil
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item during the Sam's Club VIP event a few days ago. I would have purchased it from Amazon but I heard they will only have 24 available at the sale price (making it close to impossible to get one once it goes on sale)-The picture quality CANNOT be beat for the price I paid. it's simply stunning watching blurays or streaming videos with the TV's SmartTV functions.-Sound quality is BETTER than my old 46" samsung LED but still not very good. (I don't really care about this considering I usually use external speakers)-SmartTV functions are great for the price. No internet access and DLNA hasn't worked for me so far ( I havent spent too much time with it )unfortunately, I am giving the TV 4 stars due to clouding issues. First TV I purchased had some SERIOUS issues. I understand that it is an edge lit LED and not every TV is going to be perfect BUT this one had about 15 clouds all over the screen which made it very uncomfortable to watch in a dark room. Thankfully, I am on my second TV and this one isn't anywhere near as bad as my first.Overall, even at retail price, this TV cannot be beat when it comes to features and picture quality. Would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a big screen under 1000 bucks.Thanks!EDIT: I would highly recommend pairing this TV with the Cheetah Mounts APTMM2B. Just mounted it and it looks AMAZING on the wall.Cheetah Mounts APTMM2B Flat Screen TV Wall Mount Bracket for 32-65-Inch Plasma LED LCD TV

Reviews.Title: Perfectly adequate LED... but the key story is the price
Reviews.Author: BofJoe
Reviews.Content: Impressions out of the box are the TV is lighter and thinner than anticipated.  The picture seems plenty adequate (I am not the type who notices differences in one HD picture versus another).  Only criticism is the "Smart" aspects of the TV are somewhat clunky, and the response times for the set to recognize remote controls are a little longer than ideal.But the key here is the price - this box is priced way below competitive sets.  Margins must be razor thin.

Reviews.Title: Vizio Envy
Reviews.Author: SS
Reviews.Content: I am the envy of all my friends with this new TV.  Two have ordered their own since coming over to see mine.

Reviews.Title: Vizio E320i-A0 Lacks Full Amazon Video functionality
Reviews.Author: B.G. Williams
Reviews.Content: Despite having a dedicated Amazon button on the Vizio remote control, this product lacks functionality to watch Amazon Prime content using Vizio's internet app (VIA). When the Amazon button is pressed, nothing happens. By contrast, when the Netflix button is pressed, full Netflix functionality is present.Secondly, when Amazon is accessed thru the Vizio VIA app, there is no access to Amazon Prime features such as Watchlist, Recently Watched, etc. available thru your Amazon Prime account.  This is the case even though one has to authorize VIA with Amazon the same way other streaming devices such as Roku get authorized. However, the only thing one can easily do is watch content recommended by Amazon. For anything else, you have to search for the content, which is very cumbersome. Even after you find shows you can't save them in any way. This is ok I guess for movies but clearly not for TV series.A quick internet search will show that this is a long-standing issue that Vizio and Amazon have failed to address despite being contacted directly by many users and the issue being posted on Amazon user forums and reviews. This was my first and last Vizio purchase and I cannot recommend that anyone should buy any Vizio internet enabled TV product. Also, this experience has made me question whether I will continue with Amazon Prime.  I have previously used streaming devices such as Roku and now have to connect it to this so-called internet enabled TV in order to have reasonable Amazon Prime functionality. For any future TV purchases, I think I will avoid internet enabled models and rely on my trusty Roku and other streaming devices.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Terrible Customer Service if you have problems with it
Reviews.Author: N3rd_4_Lyfe
Reviews.Content: Got this TV on black friday and everything was great. Fast forward 8 months and the video stops working but audio is fine. Turns out a batch of the Vizio 60 inch TV's had a bad chipset in them. I called Vizio and they knew the problem right away and said they would have a new TV to me in 10 to 12 days. At first i was impressed by how they handled the situation. 2 weeks go by and still i have not heard from the delivery company that Vizio uses (Manna Distribution). After two weeks of calling every other day to both Vizio and Manna Distribution trying to figure out why my TV hasn't arrived yet, and why i haven't received any updates I finally get fed up and ask for a manager. I get a delivery date between 12 - 4 pm on a weekday scheduled because they do not do night deliveries. After taking off work for this I get a call the night before saying the TV was delayed another 24 hours so I would have to take another day off work to wait for this TV. Keep in mind these additional delays are coming Over A Month after my initial request was put in for the new TV. After more calls and complaints i get a night delivery scheduled instead. Finally got my TV over a month later. All in all I spent probably a good 12-16 hours of my own time over the course of the month with Vizio and Manna trying to figure out why my TV was not moving.** TLDNR **Pros: TV Quality is excellent, remote with full keyboard is very handyCons: Customer service is a nightmare, good luck if you have to deal with Manna Distribution - you will need it.

Reviews.Title: vizio 39 inch tv
Reviews.Author: Bonnie
Reviews.Content: great picture. just what I wanted. take your time to get get the picture the way you want it. took many days to get everything set. good value for price

Reviews.Title: LOVE MY NEW VIZIO
Reviews.Author: Maureen Brokaw
Reviews.Content: I BOUGHT A VIZIO AFTER DOING A LOT OF RESEARCH ON OTHER BRANDS.IT HAD ALL THE OPTIONS I WANTED AT A VERY GOOD PRICE COMPARED TO A LOT OF OTHER BRANDS.AFTER SETTING IT UP,I WAS VERY PLEASED WITH MY NEW VIZIO AND WOULD RECOMMEND IT TO ANYONE

Reviews.Title: A Poor Choice
Reviews.Author: John S. Eddinger
Reviews.Content: Arrived ontime.  The remote control is difficult to use.  We were unable to hook up to wireless.  We called Vizio Customer Support.  They suggested we move the TV closer to the modem.  We did so, but the TV was still not able to connect to WiFi.  We returned the TV.

Reviews.Title: Not-so Smart TV - BEWARE (FIRST WORLD PROBLEMS)
Reviews.Author: Jason Willome
Reviews.Content: This TV has a great picture quality, for the price, and compared to other "smart" TV's in its class, its interface for streaming video is a little faster and slightly easier to navigate. They have a very responsive customer service system in place, that you can contact by phone or email, although it's only available during normal business hours (which is frustrating, as I usually don't watch my TV/have problems with it, during normal business hours).My experience with this TV has been very mixed. We bought it for its "smart" features, so that we could stream Netflix and Amazon, wirelessly, but this feature only works about 50% of the time. When it is having a good day, it's beautiful, streaming video effortlessly, with a gorgeous picture and sound. When it's having a bad day, I spend the whole evening digging through trouble-shooting info online, emailing the Vizio customer service people, since they have usually gone home for the day, checking my wi-fi signal, restarting my cable modem and router, and resetting the TV to default (which is usually what the customer service folks tell me to do, anyway).The last point has become the most frustrating aspect of owning this thing. Sometimes, resetting the TV to default actually works, so the hopeful, optimistic side of me gives it a try. This means that you have to re-enter all of the required data, not only for the TV itself, but for all of your streaming accounts (email, passwords, check-here-if-you-agree, etc.). You would think this would not be too much of a hassle, but consider that you have to do this using the arrow & enter keys on the remote, often scouring a non-QWERTY keyboard for the right letter. If any of your passwords are long and have both numbers and upper/lower-case letters, this can be a bit hard on one's positive state of mind.Another thing you should be aware of is the sensitivity of the wireless feature, itself. We bought a new Cisco E2500 wireless router, anticipating the purchase of this TV, which beams a full signal throughout our 1920's era house (with its plaster and expanded steel lath walls), and out into our backyard. We also recently bumped up our internet subscription to the highest speed (thinking maybe the 20mbps we were getting wasn't enough for our poor Vizio). Often, what happens is that the signal doesn't show up on the TV at all, or shows a signal that is at about 2-3 bars - much weaker than what our laptops, iPhone, and kindle show (all of them showing full signal strength). Last night, after trying to get it to work for an hour, we gave up and watched Netflix on my laptop...BOO.So, ultimately, I have given up on this TV being "smart." For the money, it's a good quality TV for the picture and sound, but the wireless features are so sketchy, they are practically non-existent. At this point, we will probably buy a Roku or some other external device for streaming wirelessly.  A "smart" TV is a great concept, but this is our second one in this price range, and both have offered a similarly disappointing experience (we exchanged the first for this current one - god bless costco). I would say that as there are so many positive reviews on this TV, that we must be the common denominator where our problems are concerned (our old house/the metal lath in our walls), but then I can't account for the strong connectivity with all of out other devices. As far as I'm concerned, it's all about the hardware, and the cheap components in this TV are reflected in the affordable price.There. Now I feel a little better. Thanks, Amazon, for letting me feel a little better about my first world problems. Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: Overall Acceptable
Reviews.Author: AH
Reviews.Content: I give this rating 3 stars mostly due to the price (I paid just under $800).  I upgraded to this from a plasma 42" and, to be honest, I don't notice a difference.  I do notice a reduction in sound quality; on certain programs it's even scratchy and makes a noise akin to nails on a chalkboard (though to be fair, I did read this before buying and was prepared to purchase an additional sound bar, but after actually getting it, I have decided that $800 shouldn't require anything additional).  I don't hate it, and I haven't been so dissatisfied that I have returned it.  But I must say, if I had bought it from Best Buy or a brick-and-mortar local store that would have made the return less of a hassle, I would have.  Especially since about 2 weeks after my purchase, I saw several sales for even better televisions for as much or even less than what I paid (e.g. 60" or same size but with 3D).  For comparable televisions not on sale, this is a good buy.  But if you're interested in getting the most bang for your buck and can afford to hold out for a sale (and right now is sale time), then you can certainly find better for less.

Reviews.Title: Wow, what a deal!
Reviews.Author: PH from Texas "Sales Pro"
Reviews.Content: Received the TV yesterday, and it is amazing!  You absolutely cannot beat it for value.  The picture quality is great, but to make it great, it does take some fiddling of not only the basic picture settings, but also the advanced.  I turned off a lot of the advanced features, and it solved what made the picture look like it was washed out.  There are some advanced settings that will make the picture freakishly crisp.  So crisp, it's like you are watching a sitcom that is being taped live without all those camera filters.  That's cool, but it's a little unsettling at the same time. However, it shows how amazing the TV is at delivering a great picture.  If anyone says the picture is disappointing, it's because they haven't worked on these advanced settings.Lots of complaints about the stand in review, but I can tell you that it's just fine. I am guessing these people are putting the TV on some flimsy table because my TV table is rock solid and the TV stands fine on its own stand.  It doesn't feel like it's going to tip over at all.I bought the 5 year Amazon warranty because even though it's a few hundred dollars, I don't want the same problem I had with my Samsung that just broke out of warranty after only 2 years and it costs more to fix than buy a new one.  This warranty is inhouse, so I don't have to ship it back.  I can sleep easy for 5 years now.And the best news of all is that right before I bought it, the price dropped from $1999 to $1899.  I got the TV last night, and while filling out the warranty card, I went back on Amazon to get the invoice details and noticed it dropped to $1599!  Since it has the 14 day price guarantee, I have another $300 coming back to me.  That basically pays for the 5 year warranty.  I am so glad I didn't buy it at Walmart that doesn't offer as long and as good a warranty.

Reviews.Title: Don't expect it to be good, or reliable
Reviews.Author: Lance B. Udasco
Reviews.Content: The TV is thin and light, which is nice, but it is also to be expected with this kind of TV. That is where a lot of the quality ends. There is a lot of hot spots on the tv where the LED backlighting shows through brighter than other spots. It takes a lot of adjusting with the backlight and contrast setting to get this somewhat resolved.Following that, don't expect it to last long. I had a 52" Mitsubishi DLP that aside from bulb replacements is still going strong 5 years later. This was delivered on 10/22/2012. IT BROKE, yes BROKE on 1/23/2012. It lasted a whopping 3 months!While Vizio customer service was very friendly (And in America, which goes a long way) to get a replacement TV is still 9-13 days. To get parts to repair it is 5-6 days. The Super Bowl is 10 days away. Great!This is a TV that will do if it has to, but don't expect to be happy with it. When your friends ask "How do you like the TV?" The best response you should be prepared to give is "Eh, it's OK I suppose."I WOULD NOT buy this again and I WOULD NOT recommend it.

Reviews.Title: crunels
Reviews.Author: crunels
Reviews.Content: I bought this television on Black Friday.  I had actually planned on buying this set at full price, $998, but when the Black Friday deal surfaced I had to jump.  The television was great at first.  I have read a lot of other reviews that stated the audio was faulty and I also experienced this, but I had a sound bar and the tv audio didn't really matter.  The picture and features on this set are great.  Unfortunately it didn't last for two months.  Don't buy this tv unless you plan on taking it off your wall and returning it.  I don't think Vizio has really figured out the whole LED equation just yet.  Hold off for now on their LED products.

Reviews.Title: Great deal (steal)
Reviews.Author: Melina
Reviews.Content: This TV is one great TV. I can't believe how many features came with this TV at this price point. This is by far the least expensive LED TV with apps. The only this I didn't like was that it didn't come with the keyboard remote because it gets annoying when setting up or doing a search for a movie on Netflix to use the directional pad to pick each letter on the screen. I've only had it for two days so I'll try and update a little while longer down the road, but so far I think it's great and worth probably 200 more.Update 4/12/13I've had this product now for about 1/2 a year and it is so nice. We are even thinking about cutting off our cable because we most of the time just use the Netflix and Amazon apps. Heck, my wife even does workout videos through the Youtube app. It is so much better than using something like a Roku or PS3 to use apps. We've had pretty much zero problems, but there was one time it froze on the Netflix app, but I think I attribute it to Netflix server being down. I just did a hard restart and everything was back to normal. This is definitely a TV that is so worth the price and way more. 100% glad I purchased.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV GREAT PRICE
Reviews.Author: murenovich
Reviews.Content: Awesome Features and Awesome Picture Quality. The Apps are great and easy to use and setup and the Initial Setup for the TV was a Breeze. Great Tv I would Recommend this TV to anyone looking for an entry level Smart LED TV

Reviews.Title: Just love it!
Reviews.Author: DIANE FURST
Reviews.Content: I'm quite time challenged at the moment but I had to stop by and tell you this is an amazing viewing experience! I was concerned that once it was in my home I'd be disappointed (because it was the lowest priced of all the 60" models I saw) I was actually shocked at how beautiful the picture is especially compared to the LG it replaced. I loved my 40" LG but needed a larger screen for my new larger home. Vizio blows away the competition based on value for your $$. I've only had this a few days but will update if anything changes my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Maybe I just have bad luck?
Reviews.Author: Bowser Koopa
Reviews.Content: I am really, really disappointed to have to give a 1 star review for this TV. I bought a 47" Vizio LCD HDTV in 2007 and it's -still- running like a champ. Overall, I love Vizio and want to continue supporting them since, in my opinion, they offer the highest quality economy televisions out there; however, I cannot, in good conscience, ever recommend the Vizio E701i 70" TV to anyone. Over the past 4 months, I've bought and returned 2 of these models at my local Costco. Thankfully, they have a very generous return policy.The reason why I returned both TVs is that after one and a half to two months, I started noticing little white bright spots appearing at the bottom third of the television. They don't look quite like dead pixels. These white spotty areas are generally the size of a handful of pixels. Maybe 5-6 pixels in a circular cluster. They also generally only appear when light images appear on the screen. Like, when you're watching a hockey game or a commercial with a white or light screen. They generally don't show up when the screen has landscapes, dark scenes, etc. It almost looks like someone took a fine tipped stick and poked the TV.What surprised me even more was when I went to Costco today to take back my 2nd 70 inch TV. I was wandering around, searching for a suitable replacement when I saw the same 70 inch TV on display. I waited until a bright screen popped up to see if the floor model TV was plagued with the same issue as mine. Sure enough, an NHL demo popped up, showing some hockey highlights. Boom, there they were, the bright white offenders at the bottom third of the screen.In a way, I was happy to know that I wasn't the only one being affected by this issue. Still, I'm surprised that there aren't more people out there complaining about it. 3 out of 3 TVs that I've seen have been affected by this? not very good numbers!So, to wrap things up here, I would recommend looking elsewhere if you're in the market for a large HDTV. As attractive as the price is on this model, it's just not worth it. Once you see those bright clusters of pixels at the bottom of your TV, you just can't unsee them. After dropping $1600 clams or so on this beast of a TV, the last thing you want is to feel like you didn't get your money's worth.Vizio, I'm giving you one last chance. A Costco employee seems to think your M series is better than your E series, which the E701i-A3 is. I didn't really want the 3D capabilities that come with the M class, but the price on the M series is still right (I settled for a 65" M651d-A2R).Do yourself a favor, if you buy this TV, get it from a local Costco, or get some kind of extended warranty that will allow you to exchange the TV within 90 (if not more) days. 2 months was the magic number for me when these little bright spots started appearing. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: Alan Outhouse
Reviews.Content: The first unit came much earlier than expected, but was damaged in shipping.  This would have been very discouraging except for the exceptional ease of the Amazon exchange policy.  The second unit arrived very quickly and has been working wonderfully.  It took a bit of a learning curve to operate it, no much in the form of instructions.  But if I can figure it out, anyone can do it.  Beatiful picture, great internet compatibility.  Fair price for a good quality product.

Reviews.Title: Vizio E-Series E241i-A1 24-inch 1080p 60 Hz LED Smart HDTV
Reviews.Author: Tool User
Reviews.Content: This is the second Vizio tv that we have purchased. We bought this one to replace a small and older tv in our kitchen. Since we are planning to cut the cord from Directv, we wanted a tv with apps (Netflix, Hulu Plus and Amazon, etc). Due to the space in the kitchen, the largest tv that would fit was this 24 inch.  As far as I can tell, Vizio is the only 24 inch TV that is 1080p with apps, all for under $200. Other brands of 24 inch tvs would not fit due to the stands.  Vizio's stand is different letting the tv base sits flush on the surface.  The picture quality is superb and that is watching an over-the-air (OTA) station from an outdoor antenna. Since OTA signals are not compressed, the picture is far better than the Directv picture.  I have this tv hard wired to the internet and the apps work fine. I have not tested the wifi, but, based on my other Vizio, I am confident that it works fine.  The other Vizio wifi works better than my large Samsung wifi. Also, I find it easier to navigate the apps on a Vizio, compared to the Samsung.  I like Vizio.  I think they make a great product at a great price.  Excellent value

Reviews.Title: Great for me.
Reviews.Author: People Paula
Reviews.Content: I'm not the pickiest person as far as clarity and whatnot. I'm just a normal person who wanted a huge, fancyish TV, and that's what I got! My guy friends seem amazed by it, so I guess that's proof that it's at least pretty good. It's solid, with good color and not a lot of reflection from light across the room. As a non-expert, I totally recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Loving my Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Ghettobomb
Reviews.Content: It took a little extra time to be shipped but considering; it was after the mad online rush for black friday and cyber monday it shipped relatively quickly.Likes* Netflix app works great* Youtube app preloaded* A very sleek and sexy design* Great veiwing anglesDon't Like*Amazon video only works if your in the USA*Did not receive the stand that connects the TV to the base*The on-screen keyboard is very tedious

Reviews.Title: The needle in the haystack, look no further
Reviews.Author: Scott S.
Reviews.Content: This TV truly is the needle in the haystack.  It's only been on the market for 2 months and I was hesitant to buy at first.  I have now owned this TV for about a month and can't say enough about it.  60" Edge-Lit LED for under $1000?  Wow.  Amazing.  After killing the soap opera effect, everything from Movies to Sports to Games and Internet all look great on this set.  I'm actually typing this review using the TV as my monitor.  Out of the box everything worked perfectly, no dead pixels or DOA remote.  All HDMI ports work great.  Great picture from all angles!  It took a lot of playing around with the settings to get everything perfect so that you wouldn't have to change a preset for every different kind of show you were watching (sports, soap, movie or even games).  My settings are:PictureBacklight: 100Brightness: 30Contrast: 75Color: 75Tint: 4Sharpness: 0Color TempRed Gain: 128Green Gain: 123Blue Gain: 118Red Offset: 133Green Offset: 128Blue Offset: 123Advanced PictureSmooth Motion Effect: MediumReal Cinema Mode: SmoothNoise Reduction: LowMPEG NR: LowEverything else is Off.These settings makes the best out of colors; they pop and aren't dull or faded.  Football looks great, no ghosting.  Blu-rays look stunning.Your settings do not carry over to the next Input.
