This can be good or bad, but I use the same settings across all Inputs.As for the apps, I now regularly use Amazon Prime's instant videos.  HD streaming is just as good as Blu-ray.  YouTube works well.  Those are the only two I've used so far, look forward to more.  Needs a browser app.The remote takes some getting used to.  Full QWERTY keyboard on the back is just the right size, even for large fingers.  Didn't have high hopes there...it's intended to be a remote, not a keyboard.  Backlighting would help, as using the keyboard in darkness is nearly impossible.  The control side of the remote isn't so bad, main buttons are easy to memorize.  Video control functions on the remote work with the apps so you can pause, fast forward, rewind (etc...) using buttons.Speakers are great, but don't expect them to be the latest and greatest; you can't expect a whole lot with the small bezel and slim-size.The only quirk I have is that it takes about 10-12 seconds to turn on after pressing the power button.Bottom line: this TV is second to none for the price.

Reviews.Title: Best Value in TVs Today
Reviews.Author: Jerry Palmerino Jr
Reviews.Content: This is my first Vizio.  I replaced a Samsung DLP and Onkyo a/v receiver with this tv. I must say, this is the best value for my money and everything I hoped for (with the exception of a few minor issues).The combination of my Samsung and Onkyo setup was using 800 watts of electricity to run at all times, so this tv was a cost effective replacement at only 62 watts.  Plus, my onkyo receiver was flaking out, losing the HDMI signals multiple times during a show, buzzing through the speakers, and causing "sparklies", so it was time to junk it.Pros:The picture is awesome.  My Samsung was a 720p DLP.  This is a 1080p LED.  My wife immediately noticed the difference when I was playing 1080p content.  She mentioned several times to me how beautiful the picture is.  I sensed she was skeptical when I bought it because I don't think she has ever heard of Vizio before.  I had though, so it wasn't a concern for me.The sound is pretty good. I noticed when I watched Jurassic Park on this tv though that it lacks bass (during the title sequence with the loud booms).  When I had my Samsung, I had the video and audio running through an Onkyo receiver.  The sound coming through the 7.1 speakers clearly blew away anything out of the tiny speakers in this tv (which I presume are larger than some thinner tvs).Because this tv had 4 HDMIs (4!), I could hook up all of my devices without needing an a/v receiver.  I sure do miss the bass though, but I'm in a town-home.  My neighbors probably have no complaints now.Built-it Netflix and Amazon (to name just two) saves me from having to run my 2nd generation "fat" PS3 (another 300 watts).In about a month of using this tv, I have saved 200 kilowatt hours and some money too on my electricity.Cons:The remote is terrible.  It is nice to have built-in buttons for Netflix and Amazon, but this remote requires you to press hard to get a response.  Sometimes, you don't even know if the press registered. I replaced it with a programmable Logitech Harmony. This tv also requires you to point your remote directly at the sensor on the lower left corner of the bezel, or nothing happens.The Internet apps, including Netflix are slow to load and buggy.  I have had to unplug the tv once already (in about a month's total usage) because it froze while watching Netflix and I could not get the tv to respond.  The Netflix app also has an aspect ratio issue, meaning that, if a movie has letter boxing, sometimes the letter boxing gets smaller and larger multiple times during a movie. This results in an effect where it looks like the movie jumps (as it then occupies more screen area and then suddenly less when it jumps back).  The changes are uniform, in that if the screen size changes 1/4 inch at the top and bottom, it then changes back by the same amount (of course I'm eyeballing this measurement).  This does not happen when I watch the same movie on Netflix using my PS3.Why is there no Picture-in-Picture?Overall, I am happy enough with this tv for the amount I spent for it.  It would have been twice as much or more for a similar model from the bigger tv manufacturers.  I can live with and work around its flaws.  Maybe a software update will fix the issues I mentioned.

Reviews.Title: Incredible functionality for the price
Reviews.Author: O
Reviews.Content: I use the 32inch version for watching Netflix while running on the treadmill.  Previous reviews of earlier VIZIO models complained that Netflix was slow to load and navigate.  This version does not suffer from this issue.  I found it more responsive than my (4-year old) ROKU box.Set-up was a breeze; connected to the Internet, pressed the Netflix button on the remote control, put in email and password, and there was my instant queue.  The remote does have small buttons, but I have not found this to be an issue; on the contrary, everything is in easy thumb reach.  Mounting was made easier due to its very lightweight.Picture quality for casual viewing is very good.  Blacks and colors are all where they should be.  Most important is that there are no annoying artifacts to distract viewing.My only beef with the TV is that the sound is not great.  Although I expect it is not worse than other TV's in its class.  Making the TV's look slicker from the front and slimmer from the side is the opposite of what you want to do for good sound.  It is OK for casual viewing, but not for serious movie watching.

Reviews.Title: Vizio 70"
Reviews.Author: Corey A. Broeder "HiFiOrDie"
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Vizio 70" LED LCD on Black Friday at Costco because I wanted a big tv at a low price.  You just can't beat 70" of screen for 1499.99.  I have a 60" Samsung Plasma that has been on my wall for three years and I have loved it, but I was always thinking I would go to something substantially bigger when it came out and came down in price.  Here are my thoughts on the vizio:I have a Vizio M3D470KD 47" LED LCD in my bedroom and I like it a lot.  It's black levels and uniformity are not quite as impressive as those in a high end plasma, but that was to be expected.  When I bought the 70" Vizio, I expected the picture to be similar to that of my 47" Vizio.  I was sadly disappointed.  While the tv was passable with Blu-Rays, my video games only looked mediocre and the Direct TV picture was appalling.  I tried everything in picture settings to change this, but I never achieved the type of picture I was used to with my Samsung plasma.  The picture looked washed out, colors were weak, and black levels were pitiful.  I ended up returning this tv and buying a Panasonic 65" plasma.  The picture quality on the Panasonic tv is 10x better.  I thought maybe it was just me nitpicking with the picture quality on the 70" Vizio, but my wife and several of my friends commented that they thought the 60" Samsung I had wall mounted before the Vizio looked much better.  I tried CNET's picture settings, I tried my own, the tv just never looked right and I am glad I returned it and got the Panasonic.  It looks exceptional with Blu-Rays, DVDs, video games, and my Direct TV.

Reviews.Title: wireless is useless
Reviews.Author: Paul Di Sciullo
Reviews.Content: this product has an extremely cheap wireless adaptor in it. If the tv is more than 10 feet from the router the download speed drops off significantly making it impossible to stream hd. Do not even attampt a wireless g connection. I have a wireless n/ac router which is the latest and get below 4 meg download when the tv is about 15 feet away from router. For ideal streaming you either need to be hardwired or wireless within 5 feet of router. You have been warned!

Reviews.Title: Can't be beat at this price
Reviews.Author: patrick220
Reviews.Content: 1. Excellent picture2. Good sound from 2x10 watt speakers3.Decent apps4.Good looking tv with thin bezel5.No regrets6.Would buy again7.Go for it

Reviews.Title: Great TV - Black Friday Pricing
Reviews.Author: Diego the Reviewer "Doug"
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic TV at a great price.  Amazing how much TV you can get today compared to just a few years ago ... for the same price.Watch for prices over holidays however.************************************************************************* NOTE: This TV is on sale at Walmart for Black Friday at 688.00 *************************************************************************

Reviews.Title: Worst Experience
Reviews.Author: Ft. Washington
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV from Sam's Club.  Had it for 3 weeks. Picture was beautiful - sound not bad. By the third week only had half of a picture (picture was totally gone on the left side).  Called tech support - could not help. Was told to send a copy of the picture itself, picture of TV with the Vizio logo, and copy of the purchase receipt. Decided to return to Sam's.  Called for a return pickup - was told I would be contacted in 2 business days by carrier to schedule pickup.  Two days later no - call.  Called again for pickup was to told the same thing.  Called again two days later - was told may hear from carrier after Christmas.  Wanted to order another TV but cannot do so until I receive credit from this purchase.  Will not order any merchandise from Sam's Club that I have to have returned by carrier.  Would have returned to Sam's myself if it would fit in the car. Do not purchase from Sam's any item you cannot return yourself.  This has been a very frustrating experience.Update 01/05/2013:  Called on two other occasions and was told by Sam's the same thing - someone will call to schedule a pickup date. The carrier that Sam's Club used never contacted me for a pickup. Finally I rented a truck and returned it myself.  Have been trying to have this thing picked up since 12/17/2012.  This is ridiculous - never again will I order anything from Sam's Club that I cannot fit in my car for a return.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: jcalbi
Reviews.Content: The last of our old analog TV's finally bought the farm. I wanted to move our HP 32" flat screen out of the master BR and into the playroom. Found this on the Vizio website and immediately went to Amazon when it came out for sale. Our space was limited on the wall but this 39" TV fit in the same space as the old 32" which was a big win for me. Picture is excellent and sound is adequate for a bedroom. This is our second Vizio TV and we are more than satisfied with their quality.  Haven't really delved into the 'smart' aspect yet but that will come with time.

Reviews.Title: Bad audio
Reviews.Author: Kyle
Reviews.Content: Audio sounds tinny; you will need to add a sound bar.  Also, after about 30 minutes on one channel the audio lags a full second behind the video; you have to wire the sound directly from the cable box to the sound bar to remedy this.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY
Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: Worked for 50 days.  It had sound periodically not in sync with video.  Turning off cable box and then back on would fix audio sync for awhile.  Now has sound but no picture.  Vizio says they'll send a new one within two weeks.  Ouch.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO E701i-A3 70-inch 1080p 120Hz Razor LED Smart HDTV
Reviews.Author: Birdie
Reviews.Content: What's not to love about 70" of pleasure?  This HDTV is the real deal, and well worth the price.  My husband and I purchased and moved into our new home in late December of '12, and due to the fact that we hadn't bought a new family room sized TV in more than 17 years, I knew we were way overdue. I thought a nice, new flat screen would be the perfect surprise addition to our new digs, to coincide with our wedding anniversary and would also a very nice housewarming gift to ourselves. I'd been checking out the flat screens in different establishments for quite some time and loving them, I knew we just had to have one. Of all the different types,  models and sizes, Vizio was by far my favorite. I began to research the tech mags regarding the various types - plasma vs.  LED-LCD, along with the preferred settings and ratings for each, this was the perfect model for us. The clarity is astounding, and having chosen the LED due to location and glare issues, it has been no let down.  I'd been unaware they came in 70" sizes, and upon learning they did (the perfect size for the location I wanted it mounted), that was THE deciding factor for me. However, The DEAL SEALER was sweetened even more, when I accidentally happened upon a "Black Friday" special price in March, so I couldn't take a pass on that good of a price.  We love our Vizio, hope it lasts for a very long time, and would absolutely recommend it to anyone without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: Think before you buy
Reviews.Author: J. Lee
Reviews.Content: ProsPicture was really nice4 HDMI portsGreat sound for a flat screen.Great priceLoved the size1 yr manufactures warrantyWas offered a 4 year extended warranty and purchased itI think the customer service department was really nice and helpful then again is this a con? because thinking about it now, if the TV was so great I should not have to call customer service and find out how great they are !!ConsRecommends a sound bar or secondary sound system for all flat screens1 yr manufactures warranty-everything is not covered4 yr extended warranty starts day 1 but you must use manufactures warranty first so it only extends the warranty 3 years past the original manufactures warranty even know they call it a 4 year extended warrantyTV expected life cycle 24 Months7 Months later I'm on my 3rd TV set waiting for my 4th (Thick white line, Burned out LED back lighting, Thick Green / Pink Line)Extended warranty only covers up to the purchased value of the TV, so if the repair cost is 1,000 dollars (parts & labor) and you purchased the TV for 1600.00 if you need the same repair again your out 400 bucks and your warranty is gone.PS I have 3 other Samsung TV's although the price of the Samsung TV's are higher I have not had 1 Issue with them (2 LED 1 Plasma) I would not recommend a Vizio TV to anyone i liked lol.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, very disappointing sound
Reviews.Author: Incident51
Reviews.Content: I bought the Vizio E-series E241i-A1 24 inch 1040p LED Smart HTDV.  I see in the other reviews that different size screens are mixed into the same collection.  My comments may only apply to smaller sizes, I don't know. But here goes...Arrived quickly, reasonably well packed, no damage.  Set up very easily.  Great picture (cable TV).  Also found my WiFi and confirmed so far that Netflix comes thru.  Comprehensive user's manual internally loaded and accessible via the remote, very nice!  Decent user interface for all these special functions.But, oh my, what poor sound.  Soup cans and a string poor.  Many controls available - bass/treble, graphic equalizer with presets like Rock, Classical, Jazz, etc.  Surround / standard choices.  Automatic volume leveling option so commercials don't blare.  These controls are all available, I worked thru them all. No joy.  They make the sound different, but they don't make it any better.Oddly, when I listen from the back of the device it sounds better than the front.  Maybe if I had an acoustically tuned bookshelf for it to resonate into it would help a little.  Not going to work on our kitchen peninsula against a tiled backsplash, though.  I see many similar negative reviews for this and other 24 inch brands (geez, now I notice them!).  Seems like this whole generation of device really wants to play thru a separate sound system or "pedestal soundbar."  Not kitchen friendly.

Reviews.Title: Not a bad price. Looks good (when turned off).
Reviews.Author: Jim R. "Photo man"
Reviews.Content: If you aren't critical when it comes to color, contrast, brightness/darkness, then this is probably the 70-inch TV for you.I thought I was upgrading from a 72" DLP projection HDTV when I purchased this. I was getting tired of not being able to see the image in a bright room since we have lots of windows in our living room. LED TVs are typically much brighter, and this one certainly is. I saw this model at Sams and it appeared to be pretty good, but you really can't tell how well they perform in those settings because of the ambient light, and the video signal that the TVs get.So I decided to order this TV based on the reviews here on Amazon. They're pretty good. I received it yesterday, set it up and did all of the tweaking I could to get the best possible picture. I'm just not impressed. As you move even slightly off centered, the image begins to wash out (brightly). Move too much and it looks really bad.Colors are rarely accurate. They're all over the spectrum depending on what video source you're watching. Amazon Prime looks horrible. The audio sounds like it's coming from a metal can. The remote is not programmable. Searching through the streaming services like Amazon Prime is not nearly as easy as it is with a Roku (which I have).In a nutshell, if I could return this TV without paying shipping and going through the headaches of repackaging it, I WOULD. Now that I have it, I feel "stuck." I'm just going to live with it. The kids are ok with it, so at least they're happy.If you have a little more money, I highly recommend looking elsewhere for your next TV. If not, and again if you don't care about image or sound quality or a cumbersome remote/on-screen menu, then this is your TV.Good luck.

Reviews.Title: Huge Disappointment
Reviews.Author: MattyBoy717
Reviews.Content: I had such high hopes for this TV especially after reading the glowing reviews by so many consumers. But I gotta tell ya, Vizio can't hold a candle to LG or Samsung. The picture is dull and lifeless. Stand ever so slightly to the side and the picture turns gray and grainy. The audio is very bassy and you have to turn the volume way up to hear anything. The apps are sparse. No Amazon cloud, no HBO Go. They have iHeart radio but it doesn't work. Vudu works, but the picture comes off dark and gloomy. I don't blame Vudu because Vudu on my LG is brilliant. I blame Vizio. People, stay away from this TV. Stay far away.

Reviews.Title: BUDGET model all the way
Reviews.Author: MP06011999 "RESEARCHER"
Reviews.Content: UPDATE July 7, 2013:  Glad I returned it and got the Sony.  The 70 inch Vizio had issues with:*  Wireless connection*  Streaming*  Running its own apps*  Lip Sync*  Flashlighting*  Random shutdownsIt also has very limited apps.The Sony has had none of these issues.  Yes, it cost $600 more, but I'm glad I sent the Vizio back.  For me, it's all about doing what it is supposed to.NOTE:  I completely deleted my original review as it was long and really no longer applicable.  I still give the Vizio 2 stars as it is still a 70 inch "option" for those that wont spend the money for a better tv.

Reviews.Title: Power Problems
Reviews.Author: Travis Smigiel
Reviews.Content: TV turned itself off and would not turn back on for several minutes.I called Vizio and did a reset but the problem persisted soon after.I ended up returning it.

Reviews.Title: DMI
Reviews.Author: susie
Reviews.Content: I am amazed as I learn the features of my smart television. I'm a weather freak and this feature satisfies my anxiety.

Reviews.Title: Not what I expected of best rated J D Powers award tv.
Reviews.Author: walloon
Reviews.Content: The color was washed out and the backgound was grayish. Motion blur and background was wavy like a heat wave. I called Vizio and they were very helpful in tweeking the color to vivid but it still had blur. Amazon tech helped also but in the end both my husband and I remained too disappointed to keep the tv and returned it. Amazon was very helpful and I am ordering a replacement Samsung tv.Pro: Easy to set up, solid base, nice looking slim line. Amazon very helpful in trying to get better color and ease of return. Made in USA.Con: Washed out color, generally grayish tint. Took long to start. I couldn't get rid of motion blur and wavy background.

Reviews.Title: Hope you love issues and bad customer service
Reviews.Author: Jon Haines
Reviews.Content: Purchased this TV in an attempt to start supporting the domestic technology market.I've been a Samsung fan for years and have never had one problem with any of their televisions, but decided that as this was the last american TV company i'd send them my business.I have never been so wrong...The TV is INCREDIBLY short on hardware.  It has very little processing power for the host of apps it intendeds to make use of.  Long delays after button presses to access features, steaming apps will fail to to buffer and stutter or stop, and the TV will crash.The first one I purchased died in the first sixty days. I called the "award winning" customer service of Vizio and was told I could get a "recertified" model delivered to my house a week after I completed the information process.  So basically ten days for them to send me a TV that didn't sell somewhere else(they swear it isn't refurbished) all because the TV I bought blew up.  I instead opted to take the TV back to Sams Club and get a new one there.The new set has all the same issues of the old one, just has yet to die.  I called Vizio again asking about how to stop the steaming apps from crashing and stuttering and they put me through the old "Powercycle it!  No no, Clear the settings!  Set it factory!  Now powercycle it again!" bullcrap.  I tried to explain to the high school graduate technician I was dealing with that software and hardware related issues that were obviously causing this performance problem were not going to be solved by simply rebooting it.In the end, the technician told me "There are no other solutions I can offer you at this time."Basically, "We know it's broken, it doesn't work, sorry, we'll document your issue and maybe fix it later.  For now, too bad, so sad, Vizio."The technician swore the issue was absolutely unheard of by Vizio, despite the numerous posts on their own forums and all over the internet.In short, getting a solid TV with internet apps for around a 1000 dollars is unlikely.  Vizio tried to make that a reality but in doing so shorted various aspects of the process, resulting in this sub-par product.If all you do is watch Nascar and Football and want something huge to drink beer in front of, this may be the TV for you.If you want the full usage of the apps suite that a new age, connected individual would make use of, look somewhere else.TL;DRTV has bad hardware specs and is really slow, if you're just watching cable its fine, don't expect great streaming or functionality out of it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV for price
Reviews.Author: RC
Reviews.Content: Had been looking at tv's for months and was going to buy the 65 inch version of this one and then found the 70 inch at a great price with free shipping.  No complaints at all about this TV.  Excellent picture and cost a lot less than other models.  Wasn't interested in 3D.  Haven't noticed any problems when watching sports with blur.

Reviews.Title: Quit Looking - Buy this TV !!!
Reviews.Author: Mikey
Reviews.Content: Bought this at Christmas for long-overdue entertainment center upgrade (on a budget), and have been very pleased with it.Lots of bang for the buck....good picture quality and contrast (amazing specs vs non-LED backlit sets), nice big 50" size (couldn't afford the 60", but the 50" is such an improvement from what we used to have, no regrets), ok sound quality (better than I was expecting for flat panel TV) but we are augmenting with a ZVox 555 pedestal sound box so not important regardless.  Built-in WiFi and "smart" stuff are nice extras.Took one star off for the Remote Control....its ok, but Vizio packages this TV with their cheap (non-QWERTY) remote.Do yourself a favor and buy the "Vizio XRT302 Qwerty keyboard Remote".  It works great with this set, and I was able to order a new one online for about $16.50 including free shipping.  Vizio should have included this one with the set.  grrrrRegarding the "smart" stuff (Vizio Internet Apps): I haven't played with other smart TV implementations, but the apps on this set seem slow to load and clunky.  For a set at this price point, I wasn't expecting much, so am not disappointed.  The split panel approach is nice: you can be inputting stuff on the left 1/3 vertical UI panel while watching content on the right 2/3 panel.  Forget using most of the app stuff (except Netflix maybe?) without a QWERTY remote though for anything other casual playing around.Since we already have an iPad2, we ended up buying an AppleTV, so with wireless AirPlay mirroring of the iPad display to the TV set through the AppleTV box, the iPad is acting as our "smart" (more like brilliant) capability.  The Netflix app on the AppleTV (or Roku) is a better implementation than what comes bundled with the TV or our Sony BluRay player. And with the iPad setup, we get what is really useful:  a web browser!!!!  Note that most iPad apps will not utilize the full screen of any TV (think 4:3 aspect ratio picture on 16:9 TV set) -- the app needs to be written to support "full screen mode".  The built-in Safari web browser on the iPad only shows up in non-full screen format, but we found a really good alternative called "Perfect Web Browser" that does, and one of the really cool things about it is that while you are watching a youtube video through the TV (in full screen glory) from one "tab" of the browser on the iPad, you can flip to another browser "tab" on the iPad (visible just the on iPad screen) to do other surfing.Back on the TV, we showed off the TV to a home theater enthusiast friend, and he was satisfied with what he saw, but commented on how the colors seemed a little muted or washed out.  I haven't played with any of the picture or color settings yet, but that's on my (low-priority) to-do list based on his comments and some other feedback recommendations I have seen online for this set.

Reviews.Title: BEST 60 inch for under $1000!!!!!
Reviews.Author: C. Alindog
Reviews.Content: I actually got this TV at Sam's Club during their Early Black Friday sale for VIPs. It was priced for $698 and it was definitely worth the 2 hrs. i stood in line for lol. I decided to purchase this TV since it's been 8 years since I've bought a new set (50' Samsung DLP)and for the price it just was too good to pass up. Not the prefect TV out there (but then again what is?) but for the price it just can't be beat in terms of what the TV has to offer. Smart hub from Netflix, Youtube (my fav.), Amazon, Hulu, just to name a few, 120Hz,LOTS of inputs and the picture quality is just as good as any other LCD tv out there. But the main thing was the PRICE.I ended up paying $810 out the door with tax and it also included a 4year warranty (1 manufacture, 3 year Sam's for $60). But I used a $200 gift card from which my sister-in-law gave me for an early christmas gift so i ended up only paying $610!!!!!! BEST CHRISTMAS GIFT EVER!!!!! So all in all i would recommend this tv to anyone looking for 60 inch for under $1000. Best Deal out there.

Reviews.Title: A Wonderful TV
Reviews.Author: J. Spencer
Reviews.Content: I like many recently got this TV from WalMart on Black Friday for 688.00 and yes it was a total STEAL!!! I along with others got very lucky at this price I admit, but the TV is absolutely worth the 1K that you are being charged here at AmazonThe picture is fantastic....it sets up very easily and the keyboard on the back of the remote is a major plus for entering information. With the thin Bezel it gives a nice clean look and using a low profile mount it looks fantastic on the wall.Now it is easy to expound on all the virtues of the tv which there are many but I will give you SMALL issues I did have with it because that is really what you are looking for right?1) the Standard picture setting you get out of the Box have to be tweaked as they are way too "colorful"....use the settings giving in here from Kris above as they are an excellent starting point and then tweak a little here and there to your liking. The problem I had is that you had to redo them for all the different inputs.....it isnt a one time fix. Once you have done them for the inputs though they stay2) the hook ups and power connector are set a little far in IMO and make it difficult (slightly) to hook things in when you are mounting on a wall. If you are going for a clean install you want to hide the cluster of wires behind the tv so they will already be sitting there and you have hook them up last. A minor issue3) my Biggest issue with the whole thing really is the remote.......it is a great remote to be sure as I mentioned above but I think it was short sighted of Vizio to not make this a Universal remote. I was going to buy a Vizio Bluray player also but found out that even though both of the remotes are basically identical one will not control both pieces of equipment. Something for them to think about......It would make the experience better if they made the TV remote a Universal and also promote brand loyalty4) the access to Netflix and Amazon prime is excellent and the experience with Netflix is what you have come to expect but if you really look into it, the content in Prime streaming is actually surpassing Netflix now. Example (for us 40-50 year olds) you can now stream Friends and the West Wing on Prime and you can not do that on Netflix.....so the issue is that the interface with Netflix is excellent for saving what you are watching and your instant Que......Prime really needs to make the interface better. you have to jumps through a few too many hoops to get back to where you were. Again a smallish thingAll in all a wonderful purchase and if you are in the market for a TV this size you simply can not go wrong with this TVand this is for you out there that think that a 60 Inch TV is too big for a bedroom.........its because you havent tried it. This thing is on the wall in my Bedroom and I am LOVING IT!!!

Reviews.Title: VIZIO E320i-A0 "Smart" TV!!! A WINNER OUT OF THE BOX!!!
Reviews.Author: HappyUser
Reviews.Content: Needed to replace a 33" SONY Bravia HDTV for a 20' x 25' room, to fit in a 35" shelf space. After reading a boatload of these reviews and other leading consumer electronics rating websites, I chose to evaluate the Vizio E320i-A0 IN PERSON. Had enough of other people's subjective "visual" opinions, so I visited the two largest electronics U.S. retailers to see for myself. These two mega-stores had incredible working displays of just about EVERY brand of 32" to 60+" hdtv's ... and side-by-side.Walked out with the E320i-A0!!! for $249 (price rose to $288 everywhere 5 days later). A bargain for this smart TV!! It had THE BEST picture!! This TV has a max resolution of 720p, but there is NO need to spend an additional $100-or-so for a 1080i or 1080p because according to every website expert (CNet, etc.), the difference between 720p and 1080p cannot be detected by the human eye in a TV that is under 45 inches wide.Got it home, set it up on the included stand, plugged in the power cord, plugged in the HDMI cable from the DirecTV DVR box to the TV, and finally, an HDMI cable from a Dolby 5.1 surround-sound receiver to the second of two HDMI inputs on the TV (it is optical cable and S-Video cable capable too).Set-up was a BREEEEEZE and took literally just minutes!! The onscreen menus are simple and easy to understand for a non-techie like me! The remote acts as a keyboard for choosing options. That being said, the only adjustment necessary was that I liked a little brighter picture, otherwise everything was perfect .. from the nice rich black to the vivid colors!During set-up, the TV picked up my home wireless signal immediately, asked me to give it a name, and to enter the network's wireless password. Netflix worked flawlessly with full surround sound! ... as did my other subscriptions.The remote has dedicated buttons to launch Netflix, Amazon On Demand, and MGo Movies ... but you can add ANY subscription you want to the on-screen menu (called a "VIA Dock"), for instant access (like Hulu, etc.), and put it in any order you wish! Totally convenient when one button away!The only criticisms I have is: 1) The black plastic frame around the screen is shiny (not matte), and it reflects lamps and other light sources. Not a problem, but still - it would be better if it was matte. 2) Can't sit too far to the side, but this is for watching TV in bed anyway. 3) The remote could be a tad larger.If you are looking for a small, smart, led tv with an incredible picture, RUN ... DON'T WALK to where ever you plan to buy - and pull the trigger!!

Reviews.Title: Disappointed with CNET, PCMAG and other reviewers
Reviews.Author: Love to read "Love to read"
Reviews.Content: I can't believe the so called pros wrote glorious reviews about this TV. It looks like they just copy and paste "black levels", Uniformity etc. without even testing the TV.Here are few points which you don't see from the "Pros":1. VIA Apps - at best crappy. Screen is blurry, Remote full keyboard don't function with VIA apps (!), System hangs if you go back and forth while watching shows  (had to power cycle literally, power button doesn't work when it hangs), and many more issues - such as - CC button is right next to EXIT on remote. So if you turn off and CC and by mistake hit Exit, the VIA apps is exited and have to start all over again to reload app and go to the channel.2. Brightness - So called "Pros" said this is a very bright TV.  Perhaps they watched this in dark rooms.3. It looks like the picture settings are not carried over from  TV mode to VIA apps mode (Can't believe this is true but it appears to be).Many more issues, i am still evaluating.The only PRO i see with this TV is its is cheap, literally.I am thinking of returning this if my disappointment continues.

Reviews.Title: Superb picture quality, viewing angle a bit narrow, but acceptable.
Reviews.Author: Petiteface "gadget lover"
Reviews.Content: After several attempts, I have settled on the following setting for my vizio 70 incher. I used the THX app in iOS for the basic settings and then starting from the cnet recommendations, I used some judgement by eye to get the rest. I am quite satisfied with the settings at present. This TV set has outstanding picture quality and the only downside is the off-axis viewing is a little bit narrow relative to my superb 60" LG Plasma. I got mine from Costco (wish the Walmart deal was available here, but even with $500 bucks more, it seems worth it). I don't use the smart features or the sound. I have a pioneer receiver with the marvell qdeo chip for upscaling and an internet connected google tv device for my "smart" content like netlifx, youtube and amazon.The interesting thing about this TV is that the quality of the picture is wholly reliant on the source material. The better the source, the better the picture quality. The TV is not very forgiving (I guess 70" ensures that) and it is "quite revealing".Picture Mode - MovieBacklight 55Brightness 44Contrast 80 (This can be tweaked down to suit your taste)Color 55Tint -5Sharpness 6Color Temp - CustomRed gain - 128Green gain - 92Blue Gain - 142Red, Green, Blue Offset - 128Smooth Motion Effect - OffReal Cinema Mode - Smooth (Greyed out)Noise Red, MPEG NR, Color Enhancement, Adaptive Luma, Film Mode, Backlight COntrol, Ambient LIght Sensor - OffWith these settings, the color almost matches my really superb 60" LG Plasma. The big benefit for the Vizio compared to the LG plasma TV is non-reflective screen, larger size, better in bright room conditions and lower power consumption ($40 for 60" LG vs $21 for 70" Vizio). Hope you guys find these settings useful.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV at a Very Reasonable Price
Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV as a gift for my parents and we are very pleased with it so far. Before buying this, I did alot of research on similar 47" LED TV`s. The consensus was that for TV`s this size and price range the Vizio E Series was a safe bet and I couldn`t agree more. The picture is absolutely beautiful. The Smart TV apps are responsive. The set-up was very easy. Others have mentioned issues with the remote in their reviews, but I find that as long as the remote is pointed at the TV it works as it should.I`ve also read other reviews of how people have adjusted their picture settings according to CNET`s preferences. I value CNET`s opinion, so I tried their recommended settings with this TV.  In my case, where the TV is located, this does not benefit from their suggestions. I have this TV in a living room, perpendicular to a large bay window which faces south. During the day there is alot of sunlight in this room and CNET`s picture settings were too dark. In my opinion, the optimal picture is acheived with Vizio`s "Retail" setting in a room with alot of sunlight. There is almost no noticeable glare to speak of. There really is no general "ideal" picture setting. Every application has it`s differences, and it`s nice that this TV has the ability to be adjusted based on what yours are.The other thing I`d like to mention was my hesitation of ordering a TV like this online. I have always bought my electronics in an actual store as opposed to the internet for fear of damage incurred with shipping. This is the first time I`ve ordered something like this online and I`d like to point out that Amazon does a very nice job with the packaging. The TV arrived with not so much as a scratch on the box. I even ordered a 48 month extended warranty with this just in case. I am pleased with my purchase and would recommend it to others.  Thank you for reading this and I hope it helps your decision.

Reviews.Title: Two small details Vizio got cheap on
Reviews.Author: J. Lowe "cyclocross"
Reviews.Content: For the price this is a great set. Out of the box I found the picture be a bit to saturated, even on the normal setting. After a few minutes of adjustments and turning off some of the features I had the set looking the way I wanted it. I'm dinging it a star due to two very small annoyances that Vizio could easily and inexpensively fix:1) The included power cord is only 4 feet long. That's way too short given how many people prefer to wall mount their displays or if your electrical outlet isn't located where you want your set to go. An 8 foot cord wouldn't be that much more expensive to include and it's always better to have a cord that is 2 feet two long than 2 inches too short!2) If you want to wall mount the set you'll need 4 M6x18 bolts as Vizio didn't bother to include them. Vizio also doesn't bother to say what size bolts you need in the included quick start guide. Again, it would cost maybe $.20-.30 to include 4 M6x18 bolts.Both of these problems could easily be fixed by Vizio and it would save customers from having to make an extra run to the hardware store. Otherwise, great set for the money. Picture quality is identical to the more expensive Samsung 42" set I looked at once you adjust the settings (NEVER go with how the sets look in the store!)

Reviews.Title: A Good Inexpensive LED HDTV: A VIZIO E-Series E241i-A1 24-Inch 1080p 60Hz LED Smart HDTV Review
Reviews.Author: L. T. Beasimer "www.LBphoto.net"
Reviews.Content: Grandmother wanted a small TV for her bedroom.  Based on her budget and wants, I found the Vizio E241-A1 24-inch Razor LED HDTV.  After a little more research I decided to add a few extra bucks in myself and get her the Vizio E-Series E241i-A1 24-Inch 1080p 60Hz LED Smart HDTV.Both are 24 inch LED HDTVs with 1080p and 60Hz.  The best that I can tell, the only difference is the ability of the E24li-A1 to connect to the internet to provide additional functionality and viewing options.Once I connected the Vizio LED smart HDTV to her Wi-Fi, I was able to set up her profile, update weather cities, and connect to Hulu.  Everything seems to work fine until I selected a show to watch in Hulu.  Grandmother's DSL based Wi-Fi speed is good enough for her limited use, but isn't fast enough to stream without buffering.  This TV doesn't buffer at all, so watching the show was stop and go to a point of being unwatchable.  I didn't expect buffering capabilities, although it would have been nice to know ahead of time this would be an issue.  Fortunately, watching Hulu isn't a feature grandmother is likely to use.I was able to teach grandmother how to check the weather and look at yahoo news articles.  She isn't internet or technically savvy, so it's clearly a simple to use and understand menuing system which allowed her to pick it up so quickly.  Plus she is happy with the picture quality and sound.  Even watching a little football, I couldn't see any ghosting or artifacts from fast action.If you're looking for an inexpensive internet ready HDTV, the Vizio E-Series E241i-A1 24-Inch LED Smart HDTV is worth considering.  Wi-Fi speed may be an issue for those looking to watch Amazon Prime Videos or Hulu Plus.  Even if Wi-Fi speed is an option today, I would still suggest spending the minor difference for the extra features.PROS:Good picture qualityNo ghosting while watching sportsSimple to use menu systemCONS:No buffering capabilities

Reviews.Title: Picture perfect
Reviews.Author: Smooth
Reviews.Content: Nothing else needs to be said about this tv...great quality, picture and sound it's an awesome buy. Get it today!

Reviews.Title: Stop reading and buy it!!!
Reviews.Author: DG Outdoors "Dave"
Reviews.Content: Stop reading and buy it! Best TV I've ever owned and I've owned a LOT of TV's. Mounted over my fireplace and easy to watch from anywhere in my living room. This is your TV!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Shame on Amazon for carrying such an inferior product. Avoid Vizio!!
Reviews.Author: Jasen
Reviews.Content: Remote does not work- sometimes I can't even turn the tv off!Tv pops and crackles with on/offTv displays "No input" even when there is an input.Buttons on the side of the tv do not work. (Esp within Netflix app.)Don't be fooled by this seemingly good deal, and low price. This tv is a piece...

Reviews.Title: 47" E470i-A0 product review
Reviews.Author: Adam Wright "Electrical Engineer"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV after looking at other manufacturers with TVs that have similar features.  I've been using it for two weeks.I've owned Vizio products before and I haven't had a single problem with them.There are a lot of the connectors are on the left side of the TV.  This was a little bit of a problem for me because all of the things I want to connect to it are on the right side of the TV.  I just needed to use longer cables, not much of an issue.I connected a coaxial antennae to the TV, scanned the channels and was watching OTA HD in minutes.I connected to the internet through WIFI setup was painless and easy!  Ethernet cable connection is plug and play.The SMART TV functionality is nice. A lot of the same features (Amazon instant video, netflix, etc) can also be done with my XBOX360, but I'd rather only have one device on (instead of two).  This TV is very low power so it doesn't heat up my room as much as my old LCD tv + XBOX360.Now onto the TVs display.Out of the box, the TV didn't need any tuning at first glance.  I was watching a college football game (Georgia bull dogs vs Clemson Tigers)  You could tell the difference easily between the Deep red of Georgia and the deep orange of Clemson.  I was in a sports bar watching a replay of the game and you couldn't tell the difference.  Big points for out of the box tuning.This TV has some really deep blacks.  It's especially noticeable when the screen goes dark between scene transitions in a movie.  If the TV is the only source of light in the room, the room will go pitch dark.All in all, it's a good buy.  Amazon beat the price of my local walmart/best buy/etc.

Reviews.Title: Good picture but buggy TV...
Reviews.Author: Chuck
Reviews.Content: This is my second one of these because the first would lock up and not want to power on or off at times. The second one, while better, it will always power off and not lock up, it still has issues when powering up. After you turn it off, if you try to turn it back on too quick, it won't power up. We have to wait several minutes to able to get it to power up. On top of that, sometimes when it powers up, the logo is not display and no picture is displayed for more than a minute. It looks like the the TV is locked up but EVENTUALLY it will come around and finally display video and unfreeze itself. Other times it will display the logo and power up and display video within about 5-10 seconds. The other thing I noticed is the setup menu is completely inaccessible for several minutes after the TV powers on. I press the button or select the smart bar option to open it and nothing happens. Then eventually several minutes later, out of the blue the setup menu will appear. Again, this is my second one, so it has become extremely frustrating.The picture itself is very nice once you get the settings right. I found a CNet post recommending setting for this and they worked well. I do feel the viewing angles aren't all that great. Moving off center, the contrast changes become noticeable. Overall tho, I am happy with the picture.On the smart TV side, I like that they have just about all the major ones, including news apps for a couple of my local stations, which is cool. However, they don't have MLB.TV or NHL Gamecenter. The Amazon app leaves a lot to me desired too since it never starts a full screen app, leaving you to navigate thru pages and pages of movies in a 1 quarter screen sized window. Plus on the Prime side, you do NOT have access to your watchlist. All you get is a list of top movies and top TV shows to browse thru. The Netflix interface is nice but viewing stuff is buggy. We've several occurrences of Netflix just dropping completely out of the smart tv section mid movie.I think I am going to try the LG 39LN5700. This one is just too buggy for me(especially the unreliable on/off function)ProsNice picture once you get it set right120mhz refresh so smooth actionHas most major movie/tv/music appsLike the idea of my local stations having an app for news and closingsCONSBUGGY on/off functionalityNetflix app buggy and drops you out at random timesNo MLB.TV or NHL Gamecenter appsAmazon app needs a Full Screen window and access to your watchlist and categoriesViewing angles aren't that great

Reviews.Title: Good TV, too bad it has no internet browser
Reviews.Author: lric
Reviews.Content: That's a nice TV, easy to setup, the processing time to access the Apps is not bad. Image quality is great, you don't need to spend a lot for a big TV and a nice image. Got mine from a wholesaler almost for the same price Amazon is selling it.CONS:- Has no internet browser (for free navigation).- Has no audio output on the regular headphone P2 plug.- Poor sound, no bass.PROS:- Great image.- Big screen.- Great price.- Sound is good enough if you are "just a regular person" who wants to watch tv.- Lightweight

Reviews.Title: bad stand - leans backwards
Reviews.Author: Tego
Reviews.Content: The stand only allows the tv to lean backwards. I think that is a poor design. I'd like a tv that stands up straight or has an adjustment. Our larger Vizio has such a small plastic stand. Will either have to make a stand or return it - can't find any alternative and Vizio customer support is of no help.

Reviews.Title: restricted viewing angle
Reviews.Author: GRACE COPELAND
Reviews.Content: The viewing angle degrades rapidly. Not as good as my other vizio. Next time I will have to actually see the product before buying.

Reviews.Title: Broken on Arrival
Reviews.Author: Thomas N. Thompson "SciFi 4evR"
Reviews.Content: Item arrived in its undamaged factory box with factory packaging and all protective film in place.  Mounted TV to its stand.  Installed batteries in the remote.  Plugged TV into power outlet.  Unit would not power on.  Rechecked the connections: good.  Checked power outlet for power: good.  Checked power cord for power: good.  Did a closer inspection of TV and found the screen was cracked and bowed out from the frame in the top middle.  Set up a return for replacement with Amazon as I did not believe tech support could solve this problem.Update 7/19/3013: Replacement arrived this evening.  This one powered on and setup went smoothly until the Wi-Fi connection failed.  Spent 1 hour and 9 minutes with Tech Support: very courteous and helpful.  Problem is that I had to go to my wireless router setup page on the internet, change my security protocol and password before the TV would accept it.  Downloading speed is/was 5.5 Mb/s on my wireless router.  I was hoping this one would fail so I could upgrade to a better set.  Time will tell how well this unit performs: more testing tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: Dont bother if you want to use netflix
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "erik"
Reviews.Content: Tried everything to get netflix to work. It would work for 5 mins, then cut out. So annoying. Lots of Internet research came up with vizio is falsely advertising netflix as being supported. Each company blames the other. Sent this TV back and bought a Samsung instead. Miraculously netflix works now! Probably will never try a vizio again.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic purchase
Reviews.Author: xaeinstein "xaeinstein"
Reviews.Content: This is a review for the VIZIO E701i-A3 70-inch 1080p 120Hz Razor LED Smart HDTV.Solid 4.4+ stars reviews right here at Amazon and at other places.This is an outstanding 1080p TV.I bought one new a month ago ($1600 in BJ Wholesale Club, similar price as Amazon), I almost snagged this as a refurb but in the end the $400 difference wasn't worth it to me. (I have several woot refurb projectors and they have worked out just fine).This TV sold last year for around $2,000 new. It is cheaper now because VIZIO came out with a 240HZ model.I don't usually care about additional features on a TV but I found this model's built-in Wifi and apps, very handy when it came to watching Netflix and Amazon VOD. Just flick a button on the remote. NO need to switch to a separate box.Since it runs at 120Hz video refresh, you will probably want to adjust the settings to avoid having movies look like tv soap operas due to the "smooth action" algo - It's a personal taste kind of kind. Some folks love the "extra clear look", I prefer my movies to look like movies including filmed TV series.  You won't have to call a professional, you have access to many options right from your remote and if you read the reviews here at Amazon and other places you will see folks list their favorite settings. Initially I left mine as it came, but after a week I played with the settings to tune it to my liking, including removing the smooth action.Angle wise, some reviewers complain about NOT being able to see it from the side, we haven't had that problem. It replaced a Samsung DLP which could be viewed from many different angles and this is the same or probably better. We have it in a room with an L shaped "pit" furniture and a huge ottoman in center and it is equally enjoyable anywhere on the room.The picture quality is very bright (can be toned down or turned up at will) and can be very vivid or subdued (again based on your taste). On a dark room, the brightest settings will set your eyelashes on fire. It has very good blacks and dark areas on the screen. I know some people complaint that LEDs can't come close to PLASMA TVs but this one is close enough for anyone less than a purist.The built-in sound is good considering there is NOTHING to this TV. Meaning it has a thin (one inch or less) "frame" around the screen like a picture frame, so the speakers face backwards (mounted behind). This actually makes the sound bounce back at you from the wall behind it which surprisingly works out fine. I prefer deeper/louder sound so I have it hooked up to a receiver, but I sometimes I don't turn on the receiver and the kids often use it without the amp.  It depends on taste. Via the amp the surround sound is as rich as any other quality audio source. Without it is fairly loud.If you are mounting it on a wall, make sure to get the right mount. And if you are not, make sure you push in the included base tightly against the TV and tighten the four screws "in sequence" (like replacing a tire). The TV is huge and the stand is tiny, so you want a nice tight fit. I'm using it on a glass stand I had and I found it best to open the box upside down, and apply the base while the TV was upright (vertical) upside down looking down on it. Gravity helped sit the base in nicely.In terms of size, if you have a 60 or 65 inch Samsung type DLP TV, the 70 will fit in nearly the same space because as I said earlier it is just the screen and a thin frame around it- no extra plastic.I'm picky about large TVs, taking me a while to find one that I would like at a price I feel is fair and this TV is very nice all around. I would definitely buy it again. You can not get a better 70in TV unless you pay an additional $800-$1,000 and considering how quickly the technology changes, it wasn't worth it to me. But even if you do pay more, I'm not sure many people could tell the difference.We have an 11 foot screen "movie room" in the basement but this TV gets a lot of attention right in the living room. People see it and are drawn to whatever it's playing on it. Fantastic purchase.

Reviews.Title: Low Priced TV that Delivers Low Quality Viewing.
Reviews.Author: Daniel S
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV to replace a broken LG Plasma TV and was so disappointed with the picture quality I returned it.  My wife and son couldn't believe how hazy the picture was on sporting events and how flat the colors were overall.  As they noted, there was no "pop" to it and the screen even after lots if adjusting just was not very bright.  I have a smaller Vizio Razor in a guest bedroom which I liked and thought that this would be just as good.  But it wasn't.  I replaced it with a Panasonic for $50 more and it is worlds above the Vizio.I don't understand all of the good reviews here about it. The only thing I can figure is that a lot of reviewers have bought this as their first HD TV (probably due to its low price) so compared to a tube TV it is excellent. But, compared to just about any other HD TV, it is fair at best.  The small savings isn't worth it for the low quality image.The remote is flimsy and hard to use as well. The only thing that was good about it was the very good sound and thin frame around the TV which was sleek.  But you want a TV for its picture and this Vizio just doesn't deliver. Spend $50-100 more and get an LG, Panasonic or Samsung.  It will be money well spent and provide a much better viewing experience.

Reviews.Title: Slow Internet Apps and Netflix App does not work
Reviews.Author: Brittany
Reviews.Content: Very excited when I received the tv. I primarily bought the tv for the Amazon Instant Videos and Netflix App. Unfortunately, once I powered the tv on and connected it to the internet, all of the apps EXCEPT the Amazon Instant Videos and Netflix app were not connecting to the internet/working. Luckily, the next day the Amazon app began to work.  The apps on the tv and loading takes awhile. I have called customer service for Netflix and Vizio to resolve the Netflix problem and both companies point the finger that it is not their system. So since we couldn't get my Netflix working for over a week, then it makes more sense to return the product and try out Samsung. Such a nice looking tv, yet the apps were pretty basic, (except youtube) and Netflix doesn't work. I would not recommend this TV if you plan on using it primarily for Netflix. But if you don't mind that part, then the tv is cool.

Reviews.Title: Great Smart TV for the Price!
Reviews.Author: Be Informed Not Fooled
Reviews.Content: TV worked flawlessly out of the box.  Connected to coaxial cable from the wall (no cable boxes etc.). Scanned the channels all the HD channels are great so are the SD channels. I plugged my sound system  in using the 3.5mm jack  it work quite well. The TV sound is fine by itself however. Connected a bluray player it produced a stunning picture (LOTR bluray). The WIFI works perfectly.  Amazon and Netflix work fine no problems.  All the apps work fine.  I deleted the ones I didn't want and added news.  Its now my favorite TV even though I have 42"  plasma TV's in the bedrooms.  The remote works fine it could have been a little bigger but it has all the features and gets the job done.  You get the 'best bang for the buck' with this TV.

Reviews.Title: We all love it - drop HEFTY Cable Bills.
Reviews.Author: JuliaM
Reviews.Content: We purchased two of TV's for the kids and we are happy we did. We made the decision to do so after deciding to drop the HEFTY cable which only repeats everything on television. Since my kids are Netflix users this is perfect. They can see all their Disney Channel shows on Netflix. without the hefty Cable bill. No to mention if you are an Amazon Prime member you can stream Amazon Videos at no additional cost. Well worth the money...in two months of owning the TV's we will save about $300.00.

Reviews.Title: Amazon App Does Not Connect on this TV
Reviews.Author: Laney "Laney"
Reviews.Content: This SMART Vizio TV is great except it does not connect to the Amazon app so I cannot access my Amazon Prime movies. This is strange because Amazon is offering its Amazon Prime customers a $10.00 discount to buy this TV. I spent an afternoon on the phone with Vizio and Amazon only to discover that this is a known technical problem on Amazon's side. Thank you for admitting that Amazon, but I purchased the TV to watch my Amazon Prime movies! You have been working on this problem two months? I am hoping you get it fixed. Meanwhile, I will have to send this model back to you. But you can't give me back my time. :(****************************UPDATE********************************Amazon accepted my return and delivered a replacement the same day! I set it up with no problems. All the apps loaded and updated and I was able to use the supplied on-screen code to register my Vizio with Amazon to connect with my Amazon Prime membership free movies. Thank you, Amazon. The rating goes from a two to a five for product and service.

Reviews.Title: This 47 inch model really ..really ... disappointed me !
Reviews.Author: colorprint
Reviews.Content: I had this TV for only 5 days and it just broke today. It made some squeaky noise at first and then it won't shut off by the remote or the manual button, unplugged it and plugged it back to the outlet and it never turned it back on. The TV just went dead. I really enjoyed the picture and sound quality for this TV for the last few days. Well, I am so glad I can return it to the store I purchased. I didn't get it from Amazon, it just a waste of my time to make trips to the store.

Reviews.Title: Vizio 24 inch TV
Reviews.Author: christina
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with this product. It's the best investment I have made . t v has everything u need and the picture is great. The only thing is that the remote does not work well., I'm verv pleased with this TV.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: N. Singh
Reviews.Content: I just got this TV delivered by Amazon yesterday and am loving it. Its picture quality is good, but its the features that I simply love - you could turn power led on/off, won't annoy you anymore. Quick internet connection and I notice that apps run faster on this TV. Setup is a breeze. I would mention though that it does not have wide viewing angle, which I think it similar with most lcd/led tvs. Sound is pretty decent. I would highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Nice wireless TV for the money
Reviews.Author: C. Falconburg
Reviews.Content: This TV is just what I expected.  It's easy to set up.  The stand is very easy to attach with just a phillip's head screwdriver.  The picture quality is good, and there are several settings you can choose, including custom.  The color was very red, but I adjusted it, and it's fine now.  The sound is a bit tinny, and there is no way that I can see to increase the bass.  This isn't really important, since I use wireless headphones with my cable box most of the time anyway.  I'm not sure that this TV is really 1080p, although the specs say it is.  It may be the fact that I am only receiving 720p through my cable box.  I have not tested it with my computer yet, so it may be 1080p.

Reviews.Title: great price
Reviews.Author: IRIS SMITH
Reviews.Content: bought smart tv for my sixteen year old daughter. tv plays perfect. she loves the netflix. surfing the internet slows down when there are too many electronics on at the same time

Reviews.Title: Vizio recalled some of these bc TV goes BLACK!
Reviews.Author: Katie Sybert
Reviews.Content: This Tv was very hard to sync up the wifi when we first got it but after it was all set up we loved it.  Fast forward 3 months... We were watching TV one night when the screen just went black.  Went on to Vizio's website and found that there had been a recall on some of serial numbers and ours was one of them.  Vizio said they would send us another TV to replace our broke one.  Its been 2 weeks and Im still waiting.  Not too happy.  It was a great TV before all this extra hassel.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Andrew Endicott
Reviews.Content: I have read reviews about this TV. Most I was seeing what might be wrong with it or what people were upset with about this TV. I have to say after using it for a while now, it is a pretty great SmartTV and it's value for the quality is uncomparable!

Reviews.Title: Great color, screen, wifi, but horrible stand
Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: I purchased this visio for my bedroom, it was working fine and everything, but the stand is plastic and does not work well. After using it for almost 3 weeks, the tv just randomly fell off the stand. The screen then became black on one side. i contacted visio because you have a one year warranty with them and they're sending a replacement. Great TV, great apps. Netflix is awesome! but 4 stars because stand is cheap plastic that has nothing to connect to, it just sits on top of the stand

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: K. Heinrich
Reviews.Content: Love this TVPRO - easily connects to my wifiGreat pictureGood SoundCONwish the remote would light uptakes too long for the picture to appear when turned on

Reviews.Title: Do NOT buy for DLNA streaming
Reviews.Author: pbarry00
Reviews.Content: The picture on the TV is borderline great and the Internet features are pretty good as well.  As expected, the sound is pretty lousy, but an easy fix with a soundbar or surround sound.The reason I'm taking time to write this review is to warn anyone that's looking to stream from their DLNA server to their smart TV.  While Vizio claims they offer this, I'd beg to differ.  Should your fie/folder appear on the third page or beyond when you pull your list up, you have about a 50/50 chance of the correct file being streamed to your TV.  After a call to support, the basically said DLNA is new to their TVs and they have no answer.  Debating whether to buy yet another device to properly stream through or not.  May end up shipping the TV back.

Reviews.Title: TV went dead
Reviews.Author: Tai
Reviews.Content: i bought 3 set of these tvs and 3 month later 1 went dead!!!!!!!Be careful, I bring them to Costa Rica...and now I have to figure out how to fix it..#&%

Reviews.Title: Rated low because of Vizio cust. service
Reviews.Author: sherry7340
Reviews.Content: I ordered this TV in December, it was easy to set up and the picture is very nice. It didn't take long for the audio problems to start. First it was a lip sync problem then the sound would just go off then once a day the TV would emit a terrible high pitch sound. I called Vizio customer service and was told to do the reboot and other things but that didn't help. They told me I had to rule out a cable box problem which I did, but even then they would not help me and only wanted to do more reboots and trouble shooting. I called Amazon and found out I was still in my window to return the TV. Amazon was WONDERFUL! No questions asked they just took my information, set up delivery and I had a replacement TV on the way. I have to say that the replacement TV is working well (although there still is the lip sync problem) and I would give the new TV a 4 star rating if not for the Vizio service. But if I could give Amazon service a star rating it would be 5 plus because they were so helpful

Reviews.Title: God value
Reviews.Author: R. E. Atkins
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv after looking at many others.  It is the second Vizio smart tv that i have bought.  Both are providing outstanding service. The color is vivid and the internet features are just right if you are a member of Netflix and Amazon prime which I am.  It is not to difficult to get it set up and running but it does take patience as there are minimal directions that come with the tv.  You have to download the manual from the internet....which I advise you to do so.  All in all a very good buy in the 40" smart tv market.  It does not have many bells and whistles thus the low price for this kind of tv. And....it doesn't hurt that it is made in the USA either.

Reviews.Title: After 25-28 days it has started flickering (Dim to Bright back to Dim).  Needs replacing!
Reviews.Author: KBA
Reviews.Content: Have had great experience with Vizio TVs until this one as it is going from Bright to Dim and back. Initial Easy setup and install to all devices.  Would still recommend Vizio to any one wanting 47 inch tv.I do hope Amazon helps get mine replaced.

Reviews.Title: Nice television set...
Reviews.Author: William Del Pilar
Reviews.Content: I have given this five stars because I ordered it for my spare room where guests stay and it does the job very well. I didn't need anything fancy but an ability for guests to be able to view television while they are in the room. At 32" it's the perfect size and cost I was looking for and would recommend it to anyone looking for a spare television for a room they for guests or a child's playroom, home workout area, etc. I don't use it as my main television and to be frank don't view it myself but when I asked my guests they had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: great buy
Reviews.Author: nativita warner
Reviews.Content: worth every penny, perfect picture wonderful. I would recommend this television i brought it for my mother, she was so pleased.

Reviews.Title: Best TV for the money!
Reviews.Author: Paul E. Stansberry III
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews prior to purchasing this TV.  Additionally, my mother has an older 42" Vizio TV that has been great.  All of this factored into my decision to buy.  (It also doesn't hurt that it was on sale at the time of purchase for $1599!)Overall, I love this TV so far.  I have no real big complaints.  I would definately buy this TV again.  Time will tell if it holds up well, but if my mom's TV is any indicator, then it should be fine.  If something changes I will certainly update this review.Here are some more details...PROS:  - Size!  This is a 70" TV for a rediculous price.  (Did I mention it's cheap!)  - Price! It's a great deal, even at a higher price than what I paid!  - Picture!  It looks great from anywhere in the room.  It's bright, consistent, and highly configurable.  - Inputs!  There are a ton of them!  4 HDMI inputs, plus component, USB, VGA, and sound!CONS:  - Sound.  It's mediocre.  The plus is that it gets plenty loud enough, even in my large room.  But there's no bass.  - Remote.  It's also mediocre.  The back has a keyboard, but you have to hold it pointed towards the TV because it's RF.NEUTRAL:  - Stand.  Apparently it doesn't swivel and because the TV is so big it is a bit wobbly.  Mine is wall mounted so I don't know.  - Apps!  It's got em'!  But, I have a ROKU that I use that already does all of the same stuff and has MLB.tv, too...UPDATE 03/20/13 - I've had this TV for over a month now, and we're still very happy with it.  Playing Xbox on it is very cool and the picture and color still look great!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic for the Price
Reviews.Author: DigitalMagic
Reviews.Content: I am a professional photographer. I understand color.Some reviewers seem to agonize over perfect color calibration. While necessary for a professional photographer who works with print media, it is not necessary with TV viewing for many reasons. The human eye from person to person do NOT see the same colors, nor do all camera's or broadcast studios. If a few want to attempt perfect color calibration, knock yourself out.Anyone who tells you to set it this way or that way is presumptuous at best. Set it the way YOU like it.For the price paid, this 70" rocks! Granted, you do need to adjust some color parameters to suit your individual preferences.I found the "Standard" setting pretty close to what I like. I suggest experimenting; just remember to either write down your setting prior to adjusting or simply do a "reset" if you get lost.The "flimsy" base stand question is w/o merit, unless your kids want to climb on it. Set it in place and leave it alone.It is a little slow when you turn it on. Big deal. 20 seconds will hardly cause me concern. What's your hurry anyway?I have  3 yr old 42"Sony Bravia LED. This Vizio displays a far better picture.WiFi works flawlessly. My router is about 40 feet from the TV and I get almost full scale reception. A high speed wireless modem is preferred if you intend to stream video, especially 5.1 audio and HD.I compared this Vizio at the store right next to a similar sized Sony that cost two grand more. Sorry, I didn't see the Sony being worth $2,000 more. I adjusted both the Vizio and the Sony for best possible picture. Often stores will intentionally adjust a certain model poorly to lure the consumer into buying the more expensive set.I can't really comment on the built in speakers as I am a firm believer that video is only half the enjoyment of a home theater system.For $1600 bucks, free shipping and no tax, this model is a no-brainer.Get it before the price goes up...seems it already is.

Reviews.Title: Wow... Just... Hell yeah!
Reviews.Author: Mr. Olympia
Reviews.Content: I am legally blind and when it came time to upgrade to a new tv, this was THE perfect choice. My wife tried to talk me into getting a 60 inch tv and when she came home to this beast she thanked me for sticking to my guns and not settling for anything smaller than 70 inches.I'd like to make it clear... Im grateful to see anything at all, so I can not nitpick over colors and backlighting and all this other jargon people cry over... Simply put, the image is sharp, vibrant, and allows me to enjoy movies with my family without having to strain my eyes and squint etc... Plenty of the negative reviews are well argued, but usually by folks who take for granted the gift of sight... I am totally stoked by what this tv offers. I CAN EVEN ENJOY VIDEO GAMES! Granted, I need to sit about two feet from the screen, which is comical to some, I guess, but it is better than nothing.All in all, it is a great tv, at a reasonable price that can accommodate everyone in the home! We don't watch much premium cable, but built in NETFLIX, PANDORA, and AMAZON are a fantastic touch!Highly recommend this tv!

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Author: April Veurink
Reviews.Content: The TV is great. Had to adjust the factory setting as far as the picture goes, but now that we have it tweaked, it's an awesome picture

Reviews.Title: Vizio screen turns black but sound works
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: It's not wiring. I bought the vizio led 60 inch on Black Friday and 2 months later while I was watching it started turning black from the top left corner then slowly worked its way down to the bottom right. I turned it off and on again and nothing but the sound was working so I knew it took a crap on me. I took the tv back to walmart and exchanged it for a new one, this was a few weeks ago and tonight the day before the Super Bowl it again did it again. I'm having a big Super Bowl party and this happens so I took it back once again to walmart and now they don't have any in stock. After calling every walmart in sacramento just to find out they're all sold out. If you buy one make sure u buy the extended warrenty. Thank u vizio for costing me more then I saved on back Friday and making me look like a fool tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: Buyer beware!!
Reviews.Author: Carlos
Reviews.Content: Let me start saying that yes, at the beginning the price, the seemingly good reviews and all the offers seem like a can miss offer. But it isn't.This tv is an absolutely failure of product. At first everything seems fine. Then you'll start to notice the lip-synch problems and you'll think that it's OK, you can live with that. Then it will be more noticeable and you'll needed to change the channel. No problem, you'll say, only happens while watching TV.After some weeks you'll notice that the TV starts to look a little more obscure at times and a couple of seconds later it will return to normal. "no problem".But, after only 2 months of use you'll be watching TV and suddenly it will turn off by itself and that will be it, it's gone. Then you'll contact service and the best thing they can offer is to send a technician and that can take up to a month.So you contact amazon and let them know that the product you purchased have gone dead before even 3 months and you want your money back. Luckilly, amazon having the great service they have, tells you that sure, no problem, they'll send someone to pickup the tv and they'll refund all the money you paid.So, that's happened to me and a increasing number of other people. The word is that vizio rushed this product to make it available to last (2012) black friday so it wasnt tested enough. Either case, honestly, please avoid the hassle and don't buy this product. Invest a couple of extra bucks and buy a better tv that wont have you feeling increasely frustrated over time seeing how it goes worse and worse.

Reviews.Title: Failed.. Red,green lines after three hours of owning the tv .
Reviews.Author: Brandon Esparsen
Reviews.Content: Very happy with my TV  this is my third 60 inch tv in the past two months the other two were a 60 inch LCD Sharp Aquous and the other a LED Sharp Aquous and this Smart tv blows those two out of the water and its cheaper in price. It has a nice Qwerty keyboard on the back of the remote. the remote has a good feel to it. the apps on the tv are nice and have easy access. The picture is great, my wife was blown away by it,Edit:  we'll I thought this tv was great not even a few hours after writing the previous review the tv failed... It has red,green, lines thru the whole picture it's completely distorted .sending back probably get a Samsung .. Too bad it was nice for a few hours...

Reviews.Title: Warranty
Reviews.Author: Bob F
Reviews.Content: I purchased this VIZIO E601i-A3 TV on Thanksgiving 2012.  For the 1st 68 days it has been superb.  It has left nothing desired as far as an HDTV could provide.  I have found both the video and audio good.  I have not tweeked the video settings as it came to me.  I found no need to seek improvement.  I have the choice of running the sound thru a BOSE home entertainment system, but actually prefer the TV's voice sound.  I especially like the remote.  One of its best features is the WIDE button in the lower left hand corner.  With current TV formats being delivered in different sizes, it is nice to be able to select the picture expansion choices, there are 4 choices, quickly and easily.  One of the main factors in my selecting VIZIO over other brands, is that their customer technical support is in UTAH, USA.  Without prejudice, I felt that if the time should come that I might need to talk to them, I would be able to understand them.  Well the time came, and it was a great experience.  I had forgotten how good customer service could be.  The video went out today.  I spoke to Liz at their support center.  In a 10 minute call, max, she had me unplug the TV, hold the ON button in for 30 seconds, plug it back in, turn it ON and see that the screen was still a deep blue.  From that she determined that they would send me a new TV, via freight, set the new TV up, repack the old defective one and take it away at no charge.  I do not know how I could ask for more.  I also asked her, from her experience, how often does she see this problem.  Her answer is that approx. 1 in 100 experience a bad video card.  I would like to rate this TV 5 stars, but I quess that would seem wrong, since it has quit working.  :-)  BobF

Reviews.Title: Amazing Television with one minor exception (updated)
Reviews.Author: Kyle McAdams
Reviews.Content: So I've been looking at this TV for a really long time. I waited after Christmas because I missed the sales and didn't want to have to pay full price for it.Just a few days ago it dropped in price and I was ready to buy.First off, i have read most of all the customer reviews from both Vizio and Amazon and was prepared that something might not be perfect when it arrived. I have a 32 Vizio that I got 4 years ago and was completely amazed at how it performed. So I mostly went with this set because of past experience (and for the price and 70"). So When it arrived I had that nervous feeling in my stomach till I could get home to set it up.The Delivery Company was probably the best experience I've ever had. They were professional, and actually carried it up a flight of stairs. That doesn't usually happen here in Chicago. Usually you have to pay the guy 20 dollars to even consider doing anything besides just opening the back door of the truck. And most of the time they are not very nice.So anyway, got it all set up and the picture was amazing. I had to tweak the settings but played some bluray and DVDs and tested the cable and overall i was completely happy with the quality. I read about problems with the off-axis issues some people were having but I really did not see anything that was what I had read about. It does fade a little but really unless you are picky about that kind of thing I have no worries about any of my guests for the super bowl coming up having a bad experience.But here comes the minor exception... while I had read some talk about black level quality and uniformity issues there was a problem with my set having some strange fading, blacklit problems.. Not sure if thats what you call it. But basically when there was a black spot between scenes in a movie, or on a unused input there was a noticeable gray splotches. No matter what you did, turning down brightness, contrast, etc it didn't go away. It was very distracting watching a movie that had black bars. I could tell that it was a problem with the screen and not normal.So having a replacement sent.. and thanks to Amazon for having the best customer service. I look forward to getting the new set and will update. Because besides what I think is a bad apple out of a bunch.. the new one should hopefully fix this issue.UPDATE 6/8: Okay so after the replacement the cloudy screen was much much better. There was still a little bit of the flashlight effect in the lower corner. but overall i hardly ever noticed it.
