Skip to a few months later and then in the bottom 1/3 the tv developed bright spots... like some of the pixels wouldn't turn off... you could see it when the screen was on something light or brigh white but dark screen you couldn't see it.So i called Amazon who sent me to Vizio for help. Vizio, i have to say, reps are very nice and helpful. we went through a few steps to check if it was just something that could be fixed.. like resetting to factory settings.. unpluging the power cord and let it sit for a sec.. the normal tech support things. Then they asked for me to send pic cause it did sound like a defect in the screen.I did and they sent a replacement right away. This one came from Vizio directly so after the issues I've had with the last two sets and what i've read from others troubles I figured this should get me a set that is perfect. It arrived, set it up, and I am happy to say.. this set is without a flaw that I can see in the picture quality or the screen itself... i was happy to not see any flashlighting or cloudy blacks... I don't know if they had problems with the first few manufactured sets but maybe they finally got it worked out because I could not be happier..Yes it was a pain to have to get it replaced a third time but after all this I am happy it turned out.I really like this television. The picture quality is superb. The audio.. does suck but expected that. Plan on getting a proper home theater setup soon.Overall if you are looking at this television and it's at a price you like.. i would get it. I don't know if there were a few bad apples in the bunch but the television i finally ended up with i couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: Stopped after 2 months
Reviews.Author: AMD0323
Reviews.Content: I bought this at Sam's for a black Friday deal and yesterday my husband informed me he screen went out.  We've owned it just over 2 months.  So we're taking it back to Sam's.  Be warned!

Reviews.Title: Not as impressed.  On to 3rd time around
Reviews.Author: Regular guy
Reviews.Content: After looking at all the name brand TV's for several months we finally pulled the trigger with the Vizio.  We were going to go with the 55 inch but the 60 inch came on sale now before the super bowl.  Got the TV home and it shut itself off within 2 minutes.  In the spam of a 30 minute TV program it would shut itself off 3 times.  While watching the playoff games it shut down 15 times.  After two calls to customer service (which were pleasent)  they could not solve the problem and we took the TV back.  The second one has been fine so far. No problems and the kids and adults love it.What to like:1) Picture quality is quite good.As other reviews state you do have to play with the settings to get a good picture that is specific for your room.  I read several review stating to use the "vivid" mode.  This ended up being way too bright and made the colors run.  We are happy with the standard setting.  Honestly unless you have two TV's side by side it is hard to say that this is better or worse than brand name Samsung or Sony.  Watching sports or HD programming is very clear.  Just make sure to turn off the "soap opera effect".2)  Remote.Having the qwerty keyboard makes typing everything in for internet use and for setup very easy and quick.  Since we have young kids and watch most tv at night having the keys backlit would have been nice but not a deal breaker.3)  PriceHow can you go wrong for the price for a 60 inch smart TvNot so good:1) Time to turn onIt take about 15 seconds for the tv to turn on.  Not a huge problem just something some people may not like.2) Stand.We bought the tv with plans to mount it so it doesn't affect us but for those who are going to just use the stand make other plans to stabilize it.  This is a big Tv and it is very wobbly on the stand and could be easily knocked over by kids or pets  .Summary:  All in all the TV works great.  The picture is good and functions are easy to navigate.  Outside of a couple minor annoyances you can't go wrong.***first update** 11/12/13Up until now the TV has been fine but on Sunday the kids were watching morning cartoons the TV screen went black never to return.  The power light will come on and after 10 seconds it dims but no picture or light comes onto the screen.  After reading other reviews about a faulty video chip we were left with two options.  Either wait around for Vizio to send out a repairman or just return it back to Sams.  We opted for the return route.  I am changing the stars that I gave it initially because this will now be our 3rd Vizio 60 inch and we a not sure the quality of the TV is going to going to make it a good deal from a price stand point. Hopefully this new one will last longer than 10 months.  I have noticed that the picture is good but our 8 year old Phillips does give a sharper picture.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING!
Reviews.Author: Turbo87
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for 4 months and I have no complaints at all! It's huge and the picture quality is unbelievable! You can't go wrong with this Vizio product!

Reviews.Title: Defective
Reviews.Author: Gengarr
Reviews.Content: Had the tv for three months and now the power comes on but no picture.  Called Vizio and they did all the troubleshooting over the phone.  Will not work.  A new tv will not be delivered for 14 days!!! Thats ridiculous.  I will not have a tv for the Superbowl.! Really? Why not refund me my money so I can get a new tv asap...  Also the original delivery company was a NIGHTMARE! Something to be said about buying big ticket itemd at a local big box retailer...

Reviews.Title: Defective TV Replaced With Another Defective
Reviews.Author: Terry keyes
Reviews.Content: I have owned this TV for 2 months now, purchased it on black friday. Right out the box its is very nice. Slim, sleek, shiny, very good looking TV and that continues after you turn the TV on. Beautiful colors, HD, great settings to tune TV how you like it. I am in the middle of getting a replacement because I have no picture or sound anymore. Vizio tech support was useless and they offered to send a repair man out in 6-10 days but I don't feel comfortable having someone who is probably poorly trained opening my TV up and touching things so I requested a replacement from Amazon due to defectiveness.Pros:Beautiful PictureUltra thinSmart TV is awesomeCons:Besides having the defect there are really no cons. TV froze a couple times while using apps but a quick unplug fixed that. And it can be expected by any smart tv. Just a little bummed out I have to go a week without my beautiful TV =(UPDATE 1/25/2013!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!I received my replacement for my original TV that was defective on 1/22 and have already had problem with the new replacement. The audio glitches up and stops works. I turned the TV off with the remote and I am unable to turn it back on until it makes a few *popping* noises that sound like its coming from the speakers. This has happened 3 times in throughout the few days I have had it and I have already filed for another replacement. It my second replacement is not functional I will be returning for a money back refund. Be careful, very high failure rates on these sets. Thank god Amazon has great customer support and policies!

Reviews.Title: Two TVs Both Failed!
Reviews.Author: CTR94
Reviews.Content: We purchased this TV at Walmart on Thanksgiving. Two days ago the picture went out. Still had sound, but no picture- even though the screen was still back-lit to some degree (kind of a blue glow). Called Vizio customer service and they walked me through a reset which did not solve the problem. They offered to send someone out to repair it. I said thanks but no thanks. Considering it is only a month and a half old I would return it to Walmart. Walmart, after a little persuasion, agreed to an exchange. We took the first set back yesterday and exchanged it. I set up the new set this morning and, right out of the box, it has colored vertical lines running through the right 1/3 of the screen. Needless to say, I am very upset. I am returning this and getting my money back. I have a 32 inch Vizio that we have had for over ten years without a single issue. I don't know if Vizio tried to rush this product out in time for Christmas or what the problem is, but their quality control department needs to do a better job as this experience has insured I will never buy another Vizio product again!Update - We called Vizio customer service again to report this second failure and they were thouroughly unhelpful and almost rude! Basically just "Sorry, you have that kind of thing with electronics sometimes, deal with it." I'm paraphrasing, but that is the gist of it. This reinforces my earlier statement I will NEVER buy another Vizio product!!01/20/2013 - I have replaced this unit with a 60" Sony Bravia from Hhgregg and I absolutely love it! Required NO modifications to the picture, it was perfectly calibrated right out of the box. The TV speakers aren't great, but when are they? That's what I have external audio for. This was actually an open box, so I got it for $1,169. Almost twice what I initially paid for the Vizio(but $700 off suggested retail for the Sony and around $300 less than regular price), but after the problems I had with the Vizio and the stellar performance of this set, it is well worth it. Just thought this information might be helpful to someone. Sony KDL60EX645 60-Inch 1080p 120HZ Internet Slim LED HDTV (Black)

Reviews.Title: Great with a minimal Comcast subscription
Reviews.Author: J. Smith "yus9"
Reviews.Content: We are retired, not so poor but have cut way backon our very expensive monthly Comcast services.I was worried this 70" display would look terriblewithout high definition service and without HDMI.But it mostly looks great.Fooled around with the settings,Decided the default to be best for us.Purchased at Costco in Santa Cruz for $1879 12/28/2012, btw

Reviews.Title: 32 day dead pixel issue/resolved
Reviews.Author: DobeLady "seashell7729"
Reviews.Content: Got it 11/28/12 and it was great, but on 12/31/12 suddenly a fine vertical red line appeared down the mid screen though everything else works fine. Email to Vizio and as of 1/3/12 they are sending out a new set in exchange-takes approx 10 days for carrier to schedule. That's what I call great customer service. This was a replacement for a Samsung that died at age 3 so now too surprised there is a problem with this one, seems to go along with big screen's. This time I purchased a SquareTrade 4 year warranty just to ward off evil spirits. Vizio says they want to hear about problems like this in the first 60 days, and ST says if Vizio doesn't resolve issues then they will get involved so I feel I have good warranty coverage down the road considering the TV cost. Otherwise, I would give it a 5 for the value & great customer support.UPDATE: 1-17-13- Manna Distribution delivered a brand new set in exchange for this defective set on 1/16/13, so only 16 days since first reported to Vizio, can't beat that, and I still have my Square Trade warranty to fall back on. This is a nice TV with good color,sound, ease of operation...works from my Wi-Fi for Internet Apps. I have not felt the need to tweak any settings on the new set at this point.

Reviews.Title: Yikes
Reviews.Author: howard
Reviews.Content: This is my first time working with a VIZIO product. We bought it on Oct, 27th 2012 and the picture quality was decent when it worked. But it just decided to quit working altogether. Oh well, going to call their tech support and see what happens.

Reviews.Title: Poor TV
Reviews.Author: John "John"
Reviews.Content: Pro:BigCheap4 HDMI InputsSmartMinus:Bad blacksBad angle viewingBad for SD sorcesBad colors, screen has no gloss at all and it seems to kill colors.Overall I was very disapointed in this TV.  It does not have good black levels and SD content is extrealy poor.  I also noticed very poor view angles, as soon as you get a few feet off center the picture gets very bad.  I am compairing this to a older LG 42" LCD and a new Samsung 50" LED.  The Vizio had a worse picture SD, HD, etc than my old LG and we compairing it to my new Samsung 50" it was like night and day.This TV is only acceptable if you need size above all else.  And at that you would put this in a theater room that you will watch it only dead on with only HD sorces.  Alot of TV for the money just very poor picture and colors.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: DeVan Janssen
Reviews.Content: I'm happy with the TV, it works well and the picture is fine.  I needed a little help getting it set up, but their service department was top notch and guided me through it in just a few minutes.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Dennis C. Scheifele "OldDen"
Reviews.Content: Picture perfect and a real easy setup, sound is great for a TV at this price ($288). My wife is very happy with the built in WiFi also..

Reviews.Title: Pleasantly Pleased
Reviews.Author: Heather
Reviews.Content: I'm always a bit spectical when it comes to buying an off brand for big purchases, however Vizio has slowly made a name for itself. This TV is great, it looks good and the "smart" option is a definate plus, and it is at the right price.One negative: the refresh rate is too slow, it is not ideal for playing video games (per my boyfriend).

Reviews.Title: Very slow to turn on
Reviews.Author: jerry kohnen
Reviews.Content: This model is very slow to turn on. It takes aprox. 20 Seconds to get a picture from the time you turn it on, this seems a bit long. One of the sets will loose sound, and you have to turn off TV and back on to get the sound back. Not sure what the problem is with that. Unit does have a nice picture.

Reviews.Title: Remarkable value at this price point!
Reviews.Author: Graham
Reviews.Content: We are, perhaps, not the most demanding viewers.  That said, we find the picture excellent, with a wide array of adjustments available and feel we got a terrific deal at about $1k.  Rating is based on overall value of the deal.... not that this is the best one out there, just a great one for the money.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: AA
Reviews.Content: I bought mine from Costco for $ 929. Missed it on Black Friday where it was $698 at SAMs and Walmart. I rather pay $200 more than fighting crowd :). Well buying from Costco adds one additional year to warranty. Using Amex adds another and you can buy additional warranty for 3 years for 59.95. This adds 6 years for $60. Nobody can match that try it at Best buy or Walmart. Bought a Visio sound bar for 99 on sale, this is an excellent TV and at power with Samsung, Sony or Sharp. It is not fair of those who are comparing this TV to Samsung 8000/7000 series costing above $2500. This TV is as good as my Samsung 55 inch 8000 series which is $2700, yes Samsung is more vivid but this TV is close. Above all Visio is a very reliable brand compared to others. My Samsung is professionally calibrated by Geek Squad. Even than this Visio is excellent. One thing the stand is weak specially if you have children in the house. Use a wire to tie to wall, mine is going up the wall. Paid $27 for a mount from Amazon. My advise is go for it.....excellent choice and you will not regret.

Reviews.Title: Nice LED 60" HDTV under $1000 -- PROBLEMATIC !!!
Reviews.Author: Gadget Man "Phu Nguyen"
Reviews.Content: *** OK HERE IS MY UPDATE AS OF 4/30/2013.After just about 3 months of use, the Vizio TV has vertical dark line right at the center of the screen. These are probably dead pixels, or bad display driver. Brought back the TV to Costco, and guess what. They don't accept return after 90 days. They told me to call Vizio for support. Had to haul back the TV home. Today I downgraded by rating to 2 stars/5.Keep tuned!==================================================================================================Got the Vizio from Costco this weekend of Dec 2012. Brought home, and replaced my 52" 4 year old Samsung TV. Didn't buy another Samsung because of the service and LCD panel problems, but that's an entire different story. For the short term, no more Samsung TV please.The Vizio picture quality is stunning, both in terms of contrast clarity and vibrance. Watched ESPN football on this, and wow - amazing colors. Used its scanner feature to scan off air channels from HDTV antenna.Then tested the apps, Netflix worked beautifully, amazingly sharp pictures. The kids love watching Netflix on this TV. My son as I am sure will play PS3 COD ... and will love it.The audio is pretty good too, considering it comes from this 1" thick TV... not much room to squeeze in decent speakers. Hooked up optical audio to my audio booster, and wow- got home theater 6 channels :-)What I liked about the TV:1. Picture quality with sharpness, clarity and vibrance.2. The best 60" you can get under $10003. Smart features including Netflix, Youtube, etc4. USB ports that allow me to watch photos, videos, and listen to music off my USB thumb drive.5. Wifi and internet hook up.6. Low power, only estimated $17 per year electricity usage.What I hope Vizio will improve:1. The base/stand should swivel some angle so we don't need to move the base with the TV. The screws are kinda flimsy and weak.2. The mechanical design overall could be better, smoother, and more sexy. The outside plastic looks plain.3. Boring look, and cheap appeal.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey
Reviews.Content: Wow.  What a great TV.  Picture and sound quality are excellent out of the (huge) box.  Easy to set up.  The 2-sided remote  is a very convenient way to access the Internet apps. (One side of the remote is a QWERTY keyboard that's easier to type on than my iPhone)  4 HDMI inputs are a big plus, too. An unexpected bonus: I was also thrilled to see that the estimated annual energy cost is only $17.00.There may be more expensive TVs with better-rated picture or sound, but after watching this set, I doubt that it's anything I could see or hear.  A terrific value.

Reviews.Title: My first ever BIG SCREEN TV
Reviews.Author: Anthony Stoner
Reviews.Content: Day 2. I bought mine at Target November 28th 2012. $1149.12 with tax and 3 yr in-store warranty. First one i got was damaged so i took it back and returned it the very same day i opened it up. Easy as pie return. this thing is huge. It will fit on a smaller stand as long as you think it will hold the weight. over time your stand may sag so in my case i reinforced my press wood  china thing i already had. if you get this tv and it's in the open or you have kids you would be better off getting a 60 inch stan so people will be forced to walk around the stand thus keeping someone from hitting the edge and possibly knocking it off.i noticed some people say the apps are slow to load. in a way i guess they are. BUT, are they comparing it to their phone? i personally do not have a cell phone at all so maybe,maybe not. the apps are not quick and scroll at the bottom of the screen and load times for those i would say are 30-40 seconds. when you decide the one you want to use there is a load time to consider. in this case i would say another 20-25 seconds. it does "seem" like a lot of time but for me i'm ok with it.my living room is 19 feet by 13 feet wide. the sound out of this thing as great for me and it's not even half-way up. i got a blu-ray surround sound home theater system on the way and now i wonder if i really needed it. also this tv has the hdmi (arc) feature on it. an audio return component i think it's called and if you want to use that feature MAKE SURE YOUR HOME THEATER SYSTEM HAS THAT FEATURE ALSO.packaging is easy to remove and all there is is a stand and 3 screws to put in....your done. mine is hard wired to my router for internet so i don't have problems that other people have in their reviews. remember that if your SHAREING this tv with other laptops/printers/computers/tablets in your home load times for your apps and down loading movies will suffer if more then one is use at the time. also if you are wi-fi house hold there are transmitting and recieving issues along with what was stated above. the world we live in has many thing communicating all around us. i bought a 50 foot cat6 cable and it runs under the floor in my basement.i have no cable or sattelite at the time so all i have is an antenna on my house with a pre-amp ($100). the tv will scan for channels and i got 25 plus one really bad analog signal...i didn't think it was used anymore. the menu was for me very easy to navigate and understand. the remote is a normal remote on one side and if you flip it over there is a key board style lay out of buttons on that side. sweet !The picture is very crisp with 4 sizes to choose from so if your channel is say 720 instead od 1080p you can just hit a button and widen it or zoom to get the pic the way you want it. there are about 10 different preset picture settings: vivid/football/baseball/basketball/movie/.....etc, etc or you can make your own up (custom). if i remember correctly there are 3 differenet sound settings to choos from.last night i tried out the Amazon app because i all ready  had a movie in my list i watched on my computer months ago. you need to have your computer on when you first try this app because your tv gives you a code to register your tv at amazon.com. i went to amazon via the computer and registered my tv in about 10 seconds..easy,easy,easy. sat there and watched my movie last night. took maybe 30-40 seconds to load and buffer in. great picture and sound.my sony blu-ray home theater system i ordered also has the internet hook up feature and apps so i i want to i could also use it to stream movies right to my tv. for me i am getting the NETFLIX subscription in the near future.one other note: while changeing channels for me with an antenna there is a slight delay. say 1-2 seconds. maybe because i don't have sattelite/cable hook-up.NEW NOTE ADDED NOVEMBER 30TH 2012: JUST DELEATED SOME OF MY PREINSTALLED APPS AND FOUND MANY MANY MORE AT THE YAHOO STORE ONLINE. YOUR ALLOWED TO DELETE AND STORE NEW APPS! A LOT ARE FREE. I ADDED EBAY/DARTS (GAME)/TEXAS HOLD EM/YAHOO FANTASY FOOTBALL/ TRIVIA QUESTION /AND A FEW OTHER ONES. KEPT AMAZON AND WEATHER CHANNEL AND A FEW PRE SETS. QUICK AND EASY ONCE YOU FIND IT AND LEARN HOW TO DO IT....THE DART GAME WAS FUN AND EASY...COULD EASILY SEE ME AND MY SON PLAYING IT....TAKES THE WHOLE SCREEN UP !HOPE MY RANTINGS HELP SOMEONE OUT THERE TO MAKE A CHOICE ON WHICH TV TO BUY.....HAVE A GOOD NEW YEAR/X-MAS ALLNEW NOTE ADDED 12-9-2012: DID INCOUNTER ONE HANG-UP. WHILE USING NETFLIX APP AND FINISHING ONE MYTHBUSTER EPEISODE AND GOING TO THE NEXT ONE, THE NEW EPISODE ONLY BUFFERED IN ABOUT %20 AND LOCKED UP. THIS HAS HAPPENED TWICE ON DIFFERNET TV SHOWS. I HAD TO POWER DOWN THE TV TO GET OUT OF IT. EVEN THE POWER SWITCH ON THE SIDE WOULD NOT WORK. IT WAS AS IF THE TV WAS STILL TRYING TO DOWNLOAD THE SHOW. MAYBE I SHOULD HAVE WAITED LONGER BUT AT THE TIME I HAD WAITED ABOUT 4 MINUTES OR SO. THIS COULD ALL BE NETFLIX SIDE OR MAYBE MY OLDER TYPE (WIRED) ROUTER....? DON'T KNOW FOR SURE BUT IT HASN'T HAPPENED FOR AWHILE NOW.Update: March 25 2013 Tv Picture just went out. Had the Tv for 4 months now. Had to contact VIZIO Company Proper to get it fixed. I had 2 options: 1. (quicker) repairman comes to my house and replaces a controller board in the tv....they know about this exact issue  2. BRAND NEW TV DELIVERED RIGHT TO MY DOOR STEP. I chose the repairman since i will be receiving the updated chip in a new controller board and if that doesn't fix it i can always just get a new tv ! Got to love VIZIO  SUPPORT . After getting off the phone from Vizio i have a repair number and 2 emails to confirm they have my Claim. The actual repair company will contact me in 3 buisness days inorder to set up an appointment to come to my house and repair it......Friday is a holiday darn it....pooey. I will update this post after repair.4-2-2013 took 1 1/2 hrs. repairman showed up with a "kit" containing all 3 boards for my tv. after replacing the 2nd board it fired up. the main video board was the problem. the power supply board was NOT replaced. Tv works fine now. Netflix app still malfunctions from time to time but he said it was an app problem not the tv....netflix thing..i agree. i had to work through Vizio because the 90 day Target warranty was over. After 1yr my store (3yr) extended warranty will take over.

Reviews.Title: Great value!
Reviews.Author: DIYer
Reviews.Content: After researching TV's for several weeks, I stumbled onto this set a couple weeks ago and decided to pull the trigger over the Thanksgiving weekend. Beside some some crazy Black Friday pricing at Walmart (which I was too late to capitalize on as we opted not go out on Thanksgiving night and they were obviously sold out when we arrived the next morning), this was the best deal I could find and with no tax and free delivery, it was an easy choice to go with Amazon. After delivery yesterday (which was another great experience as the scheduled time slot was met and made planning easy), I installed the set and spent a hour or so getting everything set up. Overall, I am very impressed with all facets of this TV... great color and sound, along with fairly easy setup. I own several other brand TVs, but this is my first Vizio and will not be my last as you will not find a better value for a 60 inch Smart LED TV!Although I was able to get the internet configured and working via wireless, I am still having issues connecting with a wired connection directly to my router.I also installed a couple rear Polk speakers and attached them to the analog audio output, which adds some nice depth to the sound. But after seeing the recommended Vizio wireless sub/surround speaker set-up in the quick start guide, I may be returning the speakers and just going that route as it will only cost an additional $120 to have a center channel and sub.

Reviews.Title: best thing going
Reviews.Author: enean
Reviews.Content: I picked this tv up on b.f. and i can say this the the best out of all tvs i have ever owned... great price for over the top performance and quality... Vizio has set the bar very high for other tv manufactures...i got a good t.v. at a good price and did not over pay for a "name or brand"

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: M. Dominick
Reviews.Content: My husband and I bought this TV (amazingly) off Amazon during the Cyber Sale for $688. First off, we couldn't believe that we scored this TV for such an amazing deal! We don't make big purchases like this very often, so when we do we make sure to do our research to ensure that we are investing in something that will last and is of good quality. By the reviews on Amazon and description of the TV it sounded like a great choice for the price. Not to mention that my uncle has a Vizio and he really loves it. We got the TV today, it was too cold for the delivery man to test it for us, but when we eventually put it together and plugged it in it worked great! The stand was easy to assemble and feels very sturdy. Since it is a 60 inch TV, the largeness of it makes you wonder if it will fall when you are adjusting the TV to fit on a piece of furniture, but once it is set where you like it on a study piece of furniture it is fine and does not move when you walk, etc. I'll update though if we experience any problems with that. When we turned on the TV it was easy to connect to WiFi. There weren't any problems with setting it up. We ran out to get a HDMI cable so we could get the HD channels through our cable provider. We bought just a 12 dollar one and it worked extremely well!! Totally worth it to watch TV in HD. This TV has a great picture and is clear and crisp in HD. We are so happy that we bought this TV and are looking forward to enjoying it in the future. Thank you, Amazon!!

Reviews.Title: A true bargain.
Reviews.Author: Richard L. Carver
Reviews.Content: This product represents a sea change in big screen value. The Vizio E601-A3 instantly became the standard to beat against the other companies offerings. As you've read in other reviews the picture, the apps. the WIFI are good enough at any price level and are astounding at the sub 1K price point. This TV broke into Amazon's top 100 electronic sellers. amazing for  60" TV.There don't seem to be any fatal flaws to detract from the success of this introduction. Complaints have been limited to basically production vagaries any machine is subject to. I've had mine for a little over a week and have been watching a lot of TV, the only thing I have to report is a lip sync issue on one channel and I will chalk that up to  a transmission problem rather than a fault of the set.There's a great owners thread at the AVSforums with some great practical advice from the AV nerds that can help you get the most from your new TV.[...]I have to run, almost time for FOOTBALL!

Reviews.Title: As rated by others
Reviews.Author: Hope M. Bird "htb"
Reviews.Content: So far matched with Dish HD.  Love the channels some when you watch you have to use the  wide button so you get the full use of the screen.  Other than that easy to set up.  Good picture.  Looking forward to watching the superbowl in HD.

Reviews.Title: 19 Year Old
Reviews.Author: Carter
Reviews.Content: I purchase this product for my lazy 19 yr. old son. He loves this smart T.V. He is up almost all night watching movies or playing X-Box. Great picture for a good price. I recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: love it but ...
Reviews.Author: James Lettermail
Reviews.Content: This tv is great overall, the picture is amazing and how thin/slim the case is. I like just about everything about it but last night after owning for a couple months I finally mounted it the wall turned all the lights off and turned on a blu ray. It was a darker movie and anytime the screen had mostly all blacked out screen I noticed some decent clouding I never notice before. I cant seem to get it off my mind now, I doubt ill go through the hassle of repairing/replacing it and I live with it cause honestly if you dont watch a completely black screen in a pitch black room you may never notice, I turn on a small accent lamp and turned down the backlight but if your looking for it you will notice it, hopefully I can get my mind off it and start enjoying this big beautiful tv. Even with the clouding I freaking love this thing!

Reviews.Title: Lousy Panel with Lousy Support
Reviews.Author: Faisal Bahashwan
Reviews.Content: This panel when it first arrived was excellent for the price and size. 2 weeks in it started to develop unbearable clouds, those clouds are always there with or without signal, they are not noticeable where scenes with high brightness are shown, but with low lit scenes it's disastrous, very distracting.Called Vizio to tell them about it and they said that I'll have to take pictures, which I did. The whole process was very easy to do not very complicated. So I called again after I've uploaded the pictures they asked for and they asked me to take pictures not in a dim room and with a bright scene. If I did that it would be pointless as this issue is only visible in dim scenes, so I refused and called Amazon and requested a return.This issue is in ALL LCD TVs but the amount of clouding I've got on the panel was unacceptable, what's worse is their support.10 STARS for Amazon Support!

Reviews.Title: Son loves it
Reviews.Author: Rita Fox
Reviews.Content: Got this tv for my son for Xmas and he loves it. He wants a bigger one and put this one in his bedroom. He likes that he can get all his movies right there with a push of a button. Easy set up for him also.

Reviews.Title: Everything TV
Reviews.Author: Sheepfreak "WoolTales"
Reviews.Content: The TV is in a room with only WiFi so the fact that it's a smart TV is everything.  I can get my Hulu and Netflix.  I held out for the 120Hz.  Great price, too!

Reviews.Title: Good picture, sound disappointing
Reviews.Author: Nan Gilbert
Reviews.Content: The extra services this tv provides, such as direct connection to Netflix and Amazon, as well as clear picture, are plusses. However, the tinny quality of the sound is disappointing and somewhat annoying, and buying a sound bar for it would cost as much as the tv did! I would recommend it for someone who is looking for a smart tv at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Very Clear
Reviews.Author: Ms. Real "Keeping It Real"
Reviews.Content: I have never owned a Vizio. I was scared to find out if it was really clear or not. It is 2months old with a crystal clear picture. I can recommend this company for a Smart TV at least. I think it was priced nice. It was a house warming gift for my son. Oh and the customer service for this TV was awesome. The man walked me through the wi-fi connection patiently. The Tv instructions are on the TV screen instead of a paper book that use to come with TV's.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding TV...Great Delivery and setup service
Reviews.Author: john kelly
Reviews.Content: Outstanding TV and service as well as setup.....very pleased wsith the unit.....The Vizeo is a very strong brand and I would recommend it

Reviews.Title: Christmas Gift For Daughter
Reviews.Author: bocephus
Reviews.Content: Great TV for the price. She seems very pleased with it so far. She loves being able to the internet especially NetFlix.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value!
Reviews.Author: Luke
Reviews.Content: I used this television for one year before selling it due to a move; despite it's relatively light weight, the box was too large to fit in my car.  If that weren't a concern, I would happily have kept it; this Vizio represents arguably the best value in large TVs.PROS:-Excellent picture quality for an LCD display once calibrated; you won't do much better without investing significantly more money-Very slim and attractive bezel-Good motion-smoothing effect with interpolation enabled-Very low input lag with interpolation disabled -> GREAT FOR CONSOLE GAMINGCONS:-Only two HDMI inputs-Poor integrated speakers (in fairness, I've never heard integrated speakers that sound good)Make sure to check CNET's review for calibration settings, and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: My Teenage Daughter Loves this TV
Reviews.Author: Terrie Moulds
Reviews.Content: Purchased this TV for my daughter for Christmas.. She loves it.  The color resolution is clear, the sound is crisp and most of all, loves the fact that it is a smart TV.Based on her feedback, I would recommend this TV and Brand.

Reviews.Title: Love it.
Reviews.Author: Vyolet
Reviews.Content: This TV was very easy to set up and I am no techie. Great picture. Very nice for the price.

Reviews.Title: remote control or physical buttons wont work
Reviews.Author: rod
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tv on March 2013, the tv is great but,  in several occasions crashes. I disconnect it from the power and works again.Now, by surprise the remote or the physical buttons wont respond.  The picture still perfect but you cannot control anything, settings, volume, on or off, etc.  I have to disconnect it from the power to turn it off. Its useless.  Thank God I have a 2 year warranty on it. If I can get the cash back would try another brand.

Reviews.Title: Fits the bill
Reviews.Author: Heide Aguirre
Reviews.Content: Needed a tv to fit a limited space. This tv seemed to have the best bang for the buck. This tv had multiple HDMI inputs and WI-FI. Got the TV Labor Day weekend so had a fun weekend learning about it. Did adjust the the color. Wish the audio was better, seems a little low. Thats where it gets a 4-star rating. WI-FI was easy to set up. Mostly I use Netflix. 99% it works well. Bought the remote with QWERT keyboard on back from Amazon for $12. Bought the tv at Costco for extra warranty. I am a little-aholic, would recommend this tv.

Reviews.Title: disappointed
Reviews.Author: jeremy ian simms
Reviews.Content: The tv was fine but the WIFI apps didn't work so i had to return it.  I did get another Vizio though, a 40 Inch E series that works great.

Reviews.Title: Great tv for the price
Reviews.Author: Kachina D. Mcalexander "K. McAlexander"
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up and has a really good clear picture. I like to have Netflix on it. Also allows you to play youtube videos from your cell phone through its wireless access point.

Reviews.Title: because I read the reviews to base my decision
Reviews.Author: mwbaker25
Reviews.Content: Bought this 42 for my husband's birthday and we could be happier. I don't like the remote as we had to use our 70" tv remote to add the internet password, but once we got through that it was all cake. Beautiful picture, beautiful sound, perfect in every way.

Reviews.Title: okay
Reviews.Author: WFK "alwaysbill"
Reviews.Content: connections behind the tv are recessed and very difficult to attach HDMI cables.  Side connections are much better.  Wifi connection is a little weak and my amazon account doesn't work.  My Roku works just fine so I know it's not my wireless signal. Okay tv for the money

Reviews.Title: Great Christmas Present.  Great TV!
Reviews.Author: Donald W. Schultz
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews, and comparing with the competition, I was sure this Vizio HDTV was a very good deal but, because of some reviews, I was prepared to make adjustments to color, etc to get a perfect picture.  I was also a little concerned when the packaged arrived with damage to the outside.  Fortunately, there was no damage to the contents and the picture was perfect right out of the box.  Now, with the additional $200 discount from Amazon I have to rate this a great deal.  Of course 70 inches is a great size but IMHO it's never big enough! :-)BTW - Amazon delivered this big baby to our remote Idaho mountain retreat, in the middle a major snow storm!  That's dedication!!

Reviews.Title: 42inch TV
Reviews.Author: Brenda Tyler
Reviews.Content: I have a 24 inch Visio that I love also. They are great TV's. It's the right size for a cabinet that I had built.

Reviews.Title: SMART Features
Reviews.Author: Anthony Hubert
Reviews.Content: It was a good picture, the 32 inch was a tad small for our bedroom.  The USB video would just stop playing for no reason ever so often.  The SMART feature was the real problem.  It would not load a program 9 times out of ten (Amazon or Netflix), it would just get stuck, or it would take for ever to load, show a segment of the program and then pause to buffer and then get stuck.  Memory was cleared as suggested by tech support - no resolution.  All other systems in the house worked perfectly (Roku etc.). It looks like we will go for a non SMART TV and get another Roku.

Reviews.Title: This purchase was to replave the TV in our RV

Reviews.Title: Fabulous television

Reviews.Title: Great T.v

Reviews.Title: Keeping up with the changiing times.

Reviews.Title: Suprizingly satisfied

Reviews.Title: awesome TV

Reviews.Title: I love it!

Reviews.Title: This TV is awesome!

Reviews.Title: Poor poor backlight!!!
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: I got a sweet deal on this TV, but the LED backlight was uneven at the bottom. You couldn't really notice when there was a full color picture or completely dark. But when there was black along the bottom edge and part of the screen was lit, you could see where a few LEDs were shinning and washing out the black.It would get 5 stars if I had not had the defect. The picture looked great otherwise.Amazon return assistance is great. I actually got someone on the phone who understood what the problem was and tried a few things to help. They didn't ask me to restart my computer or reset my router.Just be sure to inspect when they do the white glove delivery. Refuse anything that isn't perfect. I made the mistake of letting the driver talk me into accepting the TV and getting it returned later. That meant I had to be home twice, have the second driver inspect everything, and let the massive TV and box sit in my living room for another week.

The screen was cracked so after hiring someone to install, I had to pay him anyway and then find the nearest store to return the damaged TV. The store employee almost did not take it because he said he needed the packing and outside box it was sent in. I showed him the mailing stickers on the box to show. That was how it was mailed. It was also left on my porch without me signing for it and with a picture of a TV showing it was soooo fortunate it wasn't stolen. the store clerk also said I should call you and request I sign for it. You have NO contact phone so again I had to wait for another to be mailed and stay home all day to make sure it was not stolen. How much easier to just go to a nearby store and purchase one to avoid ALL the inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: Milky, Flooded Quality -- How much is your time worth?
Reviews.Author: Sandy
Reviews.Content: My family and I are taking this back and ordering a higher-end from a different brand.  For $100-200 more, you can easily get a much better non-smart TV and a BluRay w/wifi or a Nintendo Wii to play Netflix/Amazon.I know this is only 720p and that it's a low model, but it shouldn't be this difficult to get a decent picture for 250 bucks.  Blacks are often gray, and in dark movie scenes, it's as if someone is shining a flashlight from the top & bottom of the screen.  My family has fiddled with all options (except "backlight"--see below), and though we managed to get an OK picture, there's a milky, light-flooded quality that just can't be overcome.  We also tried the calibration suggested by a previous 5-star review, but the picture actually seems worse than what we managed to get!BACKLIGHT OPTIONEven after turning "backlight control" from "off," the TV would not allow for adusting the backlight, which is frozen.  Even if I'm missing something here, it shouldn't be so difficult to figure out how to adjust this.  Some may call me tech illiterate (though I'd disagree).  But assuming that's true, if the whole purpose of not permitting us to adjust the backlight is so that the tech-illiterate won't accidentally distort the image, then the default should be such that the image is acceptable to us imbeciles.LOAD TIMEAnother minor flaw is that the load times are quite slow for apps and even for the monitor's boot-up.  Netflix sometimes takes 20 seconds, and it's hard to tell whether the app is actually loading or not.  TV boot-up time varies.  My advice: don't let this be the deciding factor.SOME PROSThe smart app buttons on the TV are convenient, but I attribute this more to the convenience of smart tvs as a whole and less to this particular incarnation.  The sharpness of the image is not bad.  My issues with the picture concern the light, not the sharpness.  Obviously, if you're looking for true HD, you should be looking for 1080 (so this is not a factor in my low rating).OVERALL--PAY MORE FOR SOMETHING BETTERThis TV has caused a lot of headache for a family that wasn't looking for perfection.  I'm giving it 2 stars not because it's unbearable but because I value my time, and it wasn't worth the time dealing with the picture.  It'd be OK in a dorm or if you want cheap smart tv functions for occasional wifi streaming.  If you're a TV expert, maybe you can figure out the calibrations quickly or point out the errors of my actions (which I would welcome!), but most of us aren't wanting a course on television functions. We just want a nice picture, which we should get for this price point.  My advice: upgrade.

Reviews.Title: E390i-A1 Review
Reviews.Author: Cygnus X-1
Reviews.Content: Not a bad TV but not a great TV. I bought this for my son for Xmas and I spent a lot of time setting it up and playing with it.I waited until it was less than $400 here on Amazon which is a decent price. Sometimes it's a lot higher than that and the TV is not worth it.Some good things:The picture is good, really sharp. The sound is OK. There are a ton of adjustments so you can spend a lot of time playing with it. There are plenty of inputs and you can actually give each source it's own custom name which is nice. Each source can also have it's own mode settings (example, Game Mode for the Wii U input). Setting up the ethernet connection was simple. I use a wire though, not wireless. The web apps are cool, once you get them to load. Youtube works great once it loads. The TV is ultra light so it's easy to setup or move.Some bad things:The web apps are slow to load and the TV quite often locks up. That's really annoying and you have to turn it off to reboot it. You can't upgrade the firmware manually, I guess it's done automatically. Once the apps load though they seem to work well. Also, mine had a weird effect where the screen would slowly brighten then dim then brighten then dim etc. I thought it was a defect but turning off the Smart Dimming feature solved it. That feature is defaulted to "ON" which doesn't make sense since it's annoying.I hope they update the firmware soon to make the apps load faster and quit locking up. I question whether I should have paid the extra for the Smart features and instead just went for a basic Samsung TV? Other than that, time will tell if this thing is reliable.

Reviews.Title: 39-inch - Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: William Dickerson
Reviews.Content: I bought some LG 42" LED TV about a year ago and returned it due to horrible sound quality and back-light bleed.  So in purchasing this TV, I was worried I might experience some of the same issues which seem to consistently plague LED's.  Not the case!  Couldn't be more pleased with the picture quality, and the sound quality for an LED TV is outstanding.  No need for a soundbar if you're in a normal sized living room.The smart TV interface is also great.  Before setting up the TV I had assumed we would continue using the XBox for our Netflix/Hulu/etc needs due to the speedy interface and controls.  No way.  Now the XBox only gets fired up for games.  I actually prefer the Vizio interface over the XBox 360's.Setting up the picture took some significant effort, as the picture was very washed out at first, the colors very dull. But now we got it to a place that makes this TV rival my previous CCFL LCD that I had for about 7 years and loved.  If I get the chance, I'll update this review with my settings.Couldn't be happier with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great TV while it lasts...
Reviews.Author: Wesley Davis "stellgod"
Reviews.Content: I researched this 60" for a long while, and eventually bought it on black friday from Walmart of 2012. Boy, that was a mistake. I was impressed, until it stopped working. The TV lasted 5 months until it was hit with the service bulletin outage. April 19th. It took Vizio over a month and 2 weeks to ship me a new one. So, I get my new TV on or around June 6th, and every thing is going great, until January 4th, and I have a green vertical line going through my TV, not every distracting, but I thought I should call Vizio however, and report the problem. Apparently, there's nothing they can do. My TV, which is new as of June, is out of warranty since I bought it in November of 2012. 2 TVs with manufacturer's defects within a year and 3 months. I was rather upset about it, but there's absolutely nothing I can do except warn other consumers over Vizio's HORRENDOUS quality. Google Vizio disposable TV if you want more information.tl;dr: Vizio quality bad.

Reviews.Content: I bought this tv for my dorm room and really loved it at first. Somebody else in the building near me had one and the signals tend to get mixed which made my volume go up or down or my netflix close out randomly but since I've had it home I've had none of those problems. I really really love all the things this tv can do and the picture is outstanding!! I would definitely buy this again if I needed to.

Reviews.Title: Great TV

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: M. Allen
Reviews.Content: I didn't buy this TV through Amazon, but at Target so my review is of the TV itself. It's a great TV, but here are a couple of recommendations. For the best picture, I would suggest setting the picture mode to "game", has the sharpest and brightest colors without washing out which the "vivid" setting seems to do. Also, set the color temperature to "computer". FYI, it takes about 20 seconds to connect to your cable box (may be the cable box and nothing to do with the TV) before the picture appears. The Twitter, Amazon and Facebook apps are pretty cool. I prefer Netflix through my Apple TV, so I can't comment on that app. Overall, once you get the picture/color settings adjusted to your liking, it's a great TV.

Reviews.Title: Great but the remore will drive you a littel crazy.
Reviews.Author: HB
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV for a reasonable price.  I have had it about a month now.  I'm not what you would call tech savvy and I was able to set this up fairly easily. I purchased the 29in version. I was worried as a film person about such a "small" size, but i must say I am content with it. The picture is good. It faces away from windows so I can't speak as to glare. I don't have cable. I havent in several years actually. So, I needed to be able to watch hulu and netflix with out my PS3 which is in storage in a different state. This tv does that very easily. There is even a netflix button (unnecessary but there none the less). The one issue I have with the TV is that the remote is not very easy to use. The buttons are hard to press and I honestly think that a QWERTY would be a very good addition and make set up easier. I never thought my WIFI pw was long until I had to use this remote to put it in and messed up a few times.

Reviews.Author: Gregory Paul Wike "Greg"
Reviews.Content: Bought this on Black Friday for $409.00. So glad I made this purchase. The picture quality is among the best that I've seen. I paired it with the Vizio S3821w-C0 sound bar for better base but the audio on the TV is great all by itself. I couldn't ask for a better picture when using it with my 1080 DirecTV receiver. Would definitely recommend Vizio to all of my friends. Why pay more!

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: Hank
Reviews.Content: Very good TV. Easy to set up.  Great picture!!  Great value for the price! Would recommend rhis TV to anyone looking for a new one.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: gamaven
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for five weeks and like it a lot.  It's my first LED so my only bases for comparison are what I see in stores or in other peoples' homes and what others say about their experience.  Comapared to my 42" LCD HD TV it starts up quicker and the smaller remote control is also simplr, but quite functional.  Picture quality is not as eye-popping as some other brands in the stores but that might be due to my incorrect calibration settings.  Even so, it is quite good enough for my taste.  The TV meets all of my needs and expectations -- and for a great price.

Reviews.Title: Amazing & Sharp
Reviews.Author: Lisa M. Moore "Symplymore"
Reviews.Content: Fits perfectly in my cabinet. The picture and sound is amazing. Love the features, especially Netflicks, and Facebook. I love my Vizio.

Reviews.Title: Vizio ... the best value out there!
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Natoli
Reviews.Content: This the fifth Vizio HD TV that I have bought.  For value there is no rival.  With TV, like so many other things, beauty is in the eye of the beholder.  I cannot say a bad word about my Vizio products ... no, they're not paying me to day this.

I made it work, but I was surprised by the existence of the issue. Probably my fault for not checking the specs well enough, but why would mounting points be non-standard?

Reviews.Title: Front facing speakers - good sound
Reviews.Author: Robert S
Reviews.Content: I needed a 29" TV that would fit into an entertainment unit so I originally bought an LG 29LN4510. However I couldn't get past the awful sound from the downward facing speakers when placed in a recess.  I just wanted voices to be clear but they were not despite tweaking the numerous audio settings available.  I bought the Vizio E291i-A1 because it had front facing speakers and these proved far superior - not a home theater but plenty of volume and crisp clear voice.  After tweaking settings on both I was also able to get a noticeably better picture on the Vizio in terms of color, contrast, and detail. I'm very pleased with the picture.  The LG does have a wider viewing angle but fine detail seems slightly soft - and it's just not as life-like.  I didn't originally care about smart TV features but I've found they're a big plus for the Vizio - the Netflix app is a pleasure to use. The Vizio has an unusual stand which tips the TV back slightly - perfect for me but  might not work well if the TV is placed above eye level.

Reviews.Title: Vizio TV

Reviews.Content: Bought this TV as a present for my Mother and she absolutely loves it. It was the perfect size and picture quality was perfect. Could not have asked for a better TV.

Reviews.Content: I think this is one of the best TV's that I have EVER seen! Beautiful picture!! Would recommend to everyone!!

I'm not a tv guru, but it is a good choice. I have an older 42" Vizio that is still going strong after 5 years. Although it sometimes requires turning it off and back on to illuminate the tv. Minor inconvenience, but it still works.

Reviews.Author: J. Steltz "J"
Reviews.Content: Pros: Decent selection of Apps.  Nice picture.  A couple useful shortcut buttons on the remote.Cons:  First unit came defective. Volume, channel up/down work intermittently on both the set and the remote.  Vesa placement is a problem.  The arms of my mount (probably most mounts?) cover some of the inputs and even the AC cord slot.  They are very close together to one another for some reason and have no consideration for getting access to the inputs.  This required a couple modifications to the mounting kit itself.  None of the mounting screws are included either,  For these reasons, I would not recommend this set if you plan to wall mount it.

Reviews.Content: I researched the large screen LED's and found, for the money, Vizio was the best buy. Amazon's pricing made it an even better deal, especially considering the $897.00 with 24 month interest free financing and free shipping. Delivery was ahead  of schedule and was handled in an excellent manner, setting up the TV to ensure it was working. We are very pleased with the TV's performance. The picture quality is excellent and audio is better than expected. We will add surround sound to improve the audio, but, as is, it is acceptable.

Reviews.Title: Caveat emptor! This TV looks nothing like the pictures shown!
Reviews.Author: Alexander Boudreau
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV a few days after Christmas. I was looking for a slightly bigger TV then the one I had and this one seemed perfect. Due to the pictures on the website I was lead to believe all the HDMI ports were all on the side and that it had a stereo audio out port for a 3.5 mm audio device (headphones or the cord similar to the end of headphones). As I opened the product and began to hook it up I noticed that the side of the TV looked nothing like what was pictured. Only one HDMI port was on the side, the other was on the bottom. Also there was no stereo audio out only an optical and a red and white left and right audio out. The TV you receive when you order this product looks like the pictures shown on the VIZIO E320-B0E 32-Inch model. I was not happy since I have computer speakers and a subwoofer that were now not compatible with this TV because they had a 3.5 mm cord and the TV does not have one as shown on the website. I called Amazon and they kindly shipped me a new one that came in 2 days. I was annoyed again to see that they had sent me the exact same model as the first one I received. Clearly VIZIO updated the model without updating their pictures of the device because if you look on the official website and the instruction manual that is given to you they do not match so beware. Other then that I really like the TV. The size is nice for my room, the picture is great and the Netflix ability is nice. Sound is not great, but I bought a VIZIO sound bar and connected it to the TV through the optical port and it sounds great. If you plan to buy this TV beware that the pictures look nothing like what is shown on the TV. If you want a more accurate picture of it look at the  VIZIO E320-B0E 32-Inch model because those pictures are what the TV you receive will look like!

The picture is now clear and so far the TV is working fine.
